I don't get why people go to Denny's. Ihop is way better then Denny's hands down. Denny's is like a last resort place to eat

Terrible Service. The food is the typical Denny's food, which is to say it's good. Loved the pancakes. We ate here because I had no idea that the place that we really wanted to go to required reservations, even for breakfast, and this was the only fall-back place in Madison that I could think of. Service was terrible.
The chocolate peanut butter pancakes were fantastic. My husband waited a  long time for his coffee. Two of the waitstaff said they would bring it but apparently forgot.
I dont consider this a coffee venue. This should be under family friendly inexpensive food.
Decent..but need another try. The service was better than I thought which was nice, but the yak burger was so so.. We need to go back again. The soup however was very tasty.

Had a yummy breakfast with two friends. We all give the food a thumbs up, but a down for the service. Poor service including bringing the wrong order for two out of three of us. Steak ranchero looked great and feasted good, the omelet was fresh but had the spinach missing. They have a few things to straighten out yet. But since food is good overall, will be going back to try the lunch menu for the biryani, kofte, other yummy looking dishes.  -----25 Oct, 2009----- Had a yummy breakfast with t...
Pleasant environment. Helpful staff. Delicious Dal soup. Delicious Norwegian salmon.
S-L-O-W. So understaffed that you wonder if you've been forgotten. If you can hang in there, the food is wonderful. Always worth the wait.

We went to a show at the Barrymore Theater over the weekend. We decided to try Dobhan since it was just a block away. The exterior of the restaurant is not particularly inviting, but the menu sounded tasty and reasonably priced. When we arrived there was a small line and a few open tables. While waiting for the hostess to seat us, what was most noticeable was the smell. It was a cross between south Asian spices and cleaning supplies: a little curry, a little chemical. It was not overwhelming but...
Yummy place.  It's comfortable, convenient and priced right.   We go weekly! !aa@szs@zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzXxxxxxxxxxxxxxcccc
A truly great burger.  I love the ability to build my own and it was perfectly cooked.  They also have great sides and refreshing cold beer.  What more could you need.

Excellent burgers, very good sides and a good beer selection make this a great place to grab a burger. Perhaps a bit pricey, but the quality makes it worth it. Get there early before an event at the Kohl Center, though. 90 min before a game, this place is packed solid w/people, One request of the owner: please make your tap pulls better illuminated. We really can't see which beers you have to offer!

Fan favorite and for a great reason-Dotty's burgers were juicy, full or flavor, and unique. With classic photos and posters from the 30's and beyond, they're a homey rustic flair that's inviting. What really made our experience, though was the service. Despite a busy Friday night, our server was...

I've been to a lot of burger places and this one is in my top five for sure. You can tell right from the first bite that it is fresh not frozen and hand made such good flavor to the meat very juicy. I won't leave Madison again with out stopping here for a burger again. If you want a great tasting burger you must stop by for one.

Good food, friendly service. I went there with a friend on a slow night, so our waiter was constantly stopping by to make sure we were enjoying our meal, though he didn't get to the point of being overbearing. The miso soup was very tasty, as was my chicken teryaki. I don't recall what my friend ordered, but she is a vegetarian and enjoyed their options. The layout was fairly open, or may have just seemed that way because there was only one other occupied table. Everything was clean and nicely d...

Not so much..... This is NOT real Japanese food. the rice is Chinese to start. i ordered the shrimp tempura don and the only pieces that had the traditional panko batter were the shrimp. the vegetables had a plain flour batter...all were soggy. the edamame was good (I did have to add salt) but who can go wrong with that? its frozen. The one thing i did appreciate was the one piece of taro root tempura. a nice twist.
Very authentic Japanese sushi restaurant. Large menu with lots of variety. Many cooked sushi options, as well as non-sushi dishes, for those who aren't into raw fish.
Very underwhelming. I had Udon noodles there. Probably the worst Udon I've had, and that's saying something. Plain, awful noodles. You're better off buying prefabricated Ramen.

Very disappointing.  I am home bound due to knee surgery and decided to call for some Japanese food. Edo in Park street is closer to hour house So I went for it.  I ordered a Shrimp Teriyaki Bento box. The shrimp was licking out of the brown back and made a mess in our kitchen floor. They need to work in packaging to-go orders.  The shrimp looks good and with the right colors but it was not properly clean at all. The black dirty poop veins still intact and horrible to see. I manage to find one t...

I have gone to Eagles crest for lunch a few times and decided to take my family, from out of town, one weekend. When we arrived, there was a sign on the front door saying that it was customer appreciation day. We bought a round of drinks and found the table to sit at. Other patients are going to the food line Which was set up at the pool table. But when my sister-in-law went to get a veggie plate, One of the female staff came from around the bar and slap the plate out of her hand and told us tha...

Madcity Marty. Can you say BBB "Big Boring Bland" The owner who normally cook lunch, never smiles. I like the BLT's if she gets the bacon off the grill before the fire alarm goes off. Same size BMFBurger's as Heathers in Rockdale but how hard is it to patty a half pound of Bla together and impress the inferior? I gave her a jug a BBQ Grill seasoning and she took it home! Beer specials do nothing for me I can drink at home. If I go out I want good food, atmosphere and personalities! Typical BAR F...
Service there is terrible. The bar tenders will sit and talk to their friends while you wait for service.
They have cheap drinks, big and strong shots. But it's really a dive!

Wow..... I was there tonight for the first time. A buddy who is a regular there recommended the spot. They had $1 bud lights and miller lights cans from 6-10. Well, their clock is a good 20 minutes fast and when I went up to purchase a couple more cans they told me that it was too late and they weren't selling $1 cans anymore. I looked at my phone and it was 15 minutes before 10 but whatever I thought maybe it was on their time. So we buy pitchers and I noticed everyone was still buying beers, w...
Burgers. Great spot for a cheap burger, beer, and fries.
Dinner. Great food. Enjoy the many TV screens
Great bar! They used to have a great fish fry too, but haven't been back for food in a while.

Great place to grab a bite to eat and enjoy a cold beer.  Typical but good bar type food.  Very popular neighborhood spot so the Echo is often quite crowded at happy hour.  We stop whenever we're in the area and thirsty for a beer.

3 Years of Chances. About three years ago I had a very bad dining experience at this Einstein. To their credit they made it right at the time but the location has not improved in quality or dependability. Over the last three years I have tried often to get "all day" items in the morning that are just not available. It takes too much time to get an order. The service is rarely friendly. I have been to excellent Einstein Bros shops. Pass this one by if you want quality product and service.

A little overpriced but tastes good. My complaint about this particular location is that it's the only place I know where six people (yes, six!) can be working on one order, will ask you to repeat it to them three times, will likely get i wrong anyway, and will take up a good 10 minutes of your time to get it ready (the first time). If you're in a hurry, go across the street to the Caribou in HyVee. It's not worth the wait.

Don't waste your time. I have to agree with Michael's post, except my experience was just lousy customer service. Manager was talking to one customer while I sat and waited for 3 minutes for Moe, Larry and Curly to take notice of me. All I wanted was a cup of coffee, I finally walked out the door after 5 minutes and sent them a pretty nasty survey. Don't hit this location, try the others, the Customer service is way better.

Perhaps the least clean restaurant in Madison. Plus, the lunch items other than reg. bagels are complete rip-offs.  -----17 Oct, 2013----- Perhaps the least clean restaurant in Madison. Plus, anything other than a regular bagel is a rip-off.

Poor service. I asked the girl to put cheese on my turkey-salsa-flat, and I didn't get cheese. I don't know whether it was a mistake or whether she didn't know how to enter "cheese" into the cash register or if she just doesn't care whether I'm happy or not. But I'm not happy.  There's 2 cash registers at this place, so I had to talk to another girl to pay for my food. She spoke softly and was difficult to understand.
Best pezole I've ever had. Chile rellanos will blow your mind!!

Overpriced, low quality Mexican. Steak tacos tasted like the cow was really, really old- bad meat. Veggie fajitas came with very few, overcooked vegetables and worse of all- the margaritas are weak. AVOID

Try the Pozole! Fantastic! I also had a lengua taco, chorizo taco, and lamb taco. Authentic, simple, and delicious. The chimichanga was great as well. This is the most authentic Mexican food in Madison.
Waitress would not let us try a taste of the posole. Food was mediocre and bland.
Probably the best Mexican I've had in Madison. Great selection, and everything is good. Really love the chorizo, and the fact you can get it on just about anything.

Catering Services Leave Something to be Desired. We catered Eldorado Grill for our recent wedding. The food itself was good but I would not recommend their catering services. The manager was slow respond to inquiries through out the entire process and it took forever to lock down a simple menu and price due to slow response. We never signed a contract, after myself requesting multiple time, which made me nervous they were not going to show the day of due to their aloofness. On the day of the eve...
Great menu and great specials! The chicken fried steak was the best I've had in Madison. The presentation of all of the dishes was top notch. Great experience every time.
Very nice atmosphere, but the service and quality of food for the price left something to be desired. I would probably look for a different venue next time I'm in Madison.

I have mixed feelings about Eldorado Grill. The flavors: sensational. The atmosphere: inviting. The portions: meh. The price: upscale. The service: mixed.  The two of us originally tried to visit Eldorado Grill on Saturday night. The hostess seemed very confused. Several patrons were standing near the hostess area complaining about the slow service. The hostess finally told us it would be a two hour wait and we decided to try another time. No big deal and the fact that they were busy is a good s...

Best after work happy hour place in Madison.. I have been going to El Dorado since they open their doors. From the first time I tasted their Margaritas on the rock with salt in the rim (house Margaritas) I have returned every Margarita I order in other places. Their Margaritas are fresh testing, the right amount of tart and alcohol, almost like a perfect thirst quencher. It is always the same for the past 10-15 years I have going there. The food is good as well. My wife and I like to go for thei...

Atmosphere fun for the kids. I hadn't been to Ella's Deli for years but had the chance to go 3 times this year with my great nephews and a friend's granddaughter . It fun for the kids but the food is lousy. I was there last night for the last time. I ordered a BBQ sandwich and fries, the BBQ was cold and the fries over cooked & cold. My friends granddaughter wanted the pasta and cheese sauce, and let's just say the title should be reversed, It was cheese sauce, if you can call it cheese, with a ...

Croutons...yummy!. I'm from Madison and have always loved Ella's Deli. I love anything with eggs, but what I really love at Ella's is their croutons that go on top of salads. I always order an extra side of those. My five year old grandson loves Ella's and his 18 month old brother hasn't gone yet, but will next summer.   We, of course, always ride the merry-go-round and eat ice cream before going home.   Birthdays are made very special at Ella's.

Skip this Gimmick. Ella's Deli is a neat place to go for ice cream once in a while, if you have a kid under age 11. The 1950s-era moving toys (some broken) and paper mache decorations (many covered in dust) are fun to look at, but the novelty wears thin pretty quickly. The duct-taped binder menus are filthy and the food only so-so. The service is hit-or-miss. I've had over-friendly, older, slightly creepy waiters that are probably ex-cons, high-schoolers that have no concept of basic manners, an...

Well past it's 'prime.' This place is old and tired. It needs revitalizing, and a thorough, top-to-bottom cleaning. The food here is...meh. It's just fine, but overpriced for the quality and smallish portion size. If not for the kitschy appeal to kids, I doubt this place would still be in business. Go here for the kids' sake if you wish, but beware because the decor may cause you to suffer having to come back (kids like it). Otherwise, stay away.

Ella's Deli, an iconic restaurant here in Madison. I've been visiting this particular location on and off over the last 20 years or so. More so when our kids, we're younger, and when we lived just a few blocks away. The carousel of course has always been the main attraction and highlight. Even now, when it's open for the season, I, and my now teen/s still take advantage of a little ride once around. Now about the inside atmosphere and food: yes, as others have commented the interior is a bit "gr...
Delicious!. Everything was absolutely delicious and the atmosphere was perfect.
Excellent wine list and fine tapas.
Food is good. Winelist is awesome  Service is good. I just hate seeing my parents neighbors hitting on each other. It's a pick up joint for old people

Great restaurant! Amazing food, great drinks, and cozy ambiance. Manager was very gracious and attentive to our table. And was very accommodating to special birthday surprise dessert. The food was amazing with every bite.
Tasty but pricey. "Nice wine list, great food. Awfully noisy in there though, hard to have a conversation  Good place to go for a special event.

A local hotel recommended Erin's Snug as being a great local place for dinner. Service was phenomenal when we were there. The food was all delicious--the sauce with the fried calamari was good as well as the all you can eat fried fish! Definitely recommend it to anyone!

Good draught selection. Bartender's recommendation of corn beef & cabbage spot on (at least to my taste)...I'll certainly be back...maybe for fish & chips. Salmon app lookedq yummy. Bar staff very attentive.

Great bangers & mash. We went to Erin Snugs around 5pm on a Friday and the parking lot was totally full, but we did not have to wait to get in. They have a pretty good selection of beers to choose from. We had fried pickle spears as an app--they also served warm bread with cinnamon butter that was very tasty. We had Guinness stew and bangers and mash. The stew was very good, but I really enjoyed the bangers and mash. The sausage had more of a subtle taste than most and the entree was made with a...
Nice place great food large portions best waitress ever
We took their double deck bus to the badger game. Was a blast. We stayed for dinner when we returned and had great food, but service was very slow.

These guys are liars- watch out!. Owned by the Espresso Royal company, a large Michigan based coffee chain with 21 shops. Each shop pretends to be a local/family run business. The coffee is brewed with too much water to coffee ratio and tastes thin and flavorless.
Spanish latte...mmm

These guys are liars- watch out!. Owned by the Espresso Royal company, a large Michigan based coffee chain with 21 shops. Each shop pretends to be a local/family run business. The coffee is brewed with too much water to coffee ratio and tastes thin and flavorless.

I stopped in to grab a cup of coffee to shade myself from the sun one day.  The place was not busy at al in comparison to places I walked by.  Seeing that there's nothing quite special from other coffee shops, I can see why.  The service was great, but the coffee was very weak.  I'm glad I had coconut flavoring in mine, otherwise it would've tasted watery.  I'm glad I wasn't in need of a caffeine fix.
Appetizer, salad etc come fAst but entree took a long time.  -----07 Jul, 2009----- Pricy but good steak.
Old fashioneds. Excellent old fashioneds. Salad bar not the greatest. Hearty meal, good service.
The chicken was raw!!!! Went with a party of 6 and 3 got the Raw Stuffed Chicken!!!! The boss gave us free round of drinks but the food was mediocre and VERY Undercooked. Proceed with caution.

Went for the Friday fish fry, and we all ordered the fried perch which is served family style. Good hot fried fish, and fries were ok. Soupy-like coleslaw. Definitely your old style supper club type atmosphere and food. It made my parents happy which is all that mattered really.
A little odd an bad parking but great coffee. Very strong.
Bad coffee. Bad air roasted coffee, bad service, dirty store and dirty customers. Gross.

What a delightful find in Madison. Great coffee, great staff, great attitudes... not to mention the good daily soup. This is a shabby little coffee shop where regulars hang out in a cozy atmosphere. Fair prices and great coffee and tea. Cash preferred, but they also do accept cards. Ahh the soup... think I have almost sampled all of them. From tomatoe to potato fennel to kale to ... u get the idea. Variety of hearty real artisan soups at $4 a cup - included a chunk of baguette bread too. Well do...

Breakfast lunch. Never had a bad breakfast or lunch there best fried potoatoes with onions bacon cheese burger alsome and the homade steak fries are too die for great food great cheap prices will return over and over again for breakfast or lunch and the homade soups are very highlt rated too good job fair oaks diner
Great Breakfast. Great breakfast at an honest price! But leave your plastic at home, cash only.
Great piece of Americana. A genuine greasy spoon diner. This is not fine dining so don't expect much and rejoice in the fact that this place is still around.
The food was subpar and the service was worse. Fairly certain our waitress was stoned.
The sign says "EAT" and that's exactly what you do. Good greasy spoon joint and friendly service too.
Bad coffee. The coffee is brewed with too much water to coffee ratio and tastes thin and flavorless.
Great coffee!. One of the best coffee houses in Madison.... I suggest to try the Chai-Charger (Chai tea with a few shots of expresso).  Yummy
This place is a true "cross roads" of spirit, EXCELLANT coffe and food that is really GOOD for you. If you want to know what/who Madison is all about, eat here!

I stopped in to grab a quick drink while studying one day, and firstly I was impressed with the service.  The barista was extremely friendly and chatty.  He arranged for my mango and banana smoothie to be ready as I found a seat.  Unfortunately, the smoothie wasn't as good as I'd hoped, since it tasted purely orange juice.  It wasn't worth the price.  My friend got a 7 layer bar, which was quite good.  I suppose I should've stuck to caffeinated drinks.

I don't know why, but sometimes I get a strong craving for terrible pizza, usually at 2am. Falbo's, which is open until 4am, does it for me most of the time. Greasy and chewy golden cheese, thick and bready crust. The $4.20 special is a nod to the hungry stoner with low quality standards in all of us.
If you are in Madison you must try Falbos

We ordered the slaughterhouse pizza and it was loaded with tons of meat. They definitely know how to top a pizza. The pizza was very good but I'd say it's just a bit overpriced. Overall, excellent and will order again.

I travel a lot & have eaten at other Famous Daves around USA, for some reason, IMO this is the best. The Brisket is smoky and never let's me down. Service is great, atmosphere is fun. They serve sans sauce and you have choice of 5 or 6 at the Table, as it should be, I am biased slightly as I used to eat at this location when it was Andy's (but was not BBQ).

I was excited to eat at Famous Dave's, I was so hungry but sadly disappointed. Their buttery corn on the cob was so watered down from being boiled that I am not sure it even had butter. Not only did both of my vegetables tasted frozen but my corn was soggy and deflated. The spicy beans suffered the same fate, weren't spicy and were hardly warm. My brisket held a weird taste. I left without leaving a dent on my dish. If you want to taste a home cooked meal, it's better if you stay home.

Madcity Marty. It's Dave's have been to the original several times in Hayward. They have there good days, but they are pretty consistantly good, the Wild rice soup, the ribs and Catfish Fingers and don't leave with out the Brownieeee,   I have atleast 6 bottles of their sauce in the pantry at all times that and the Broasted Chicken seasoning, the Steak n rib seasoning, the marinades all available at your favorite Menard's, sereiously..

Superb service. Carry-out- my husband enjoyed the pulled pork sandwich, and Mom loved famous Dave's cheeseburger .. wild rice s was a little too rich.. potato fries are excellent... the server held the door open as we exited. Extraordinary.

Best Fattening food in Madison. Lets face it, this restaurant does not specialize in dishes that are low calorie. But they have the best ribs in town in you feel like indulging yourself with a high caloric intake. The menu is what you want to see in a barbecue place, Beef, chicken and pork in multiple ways. The service has always been good for me not a problem for the past 20th years. It is almost always open and with plenty of parking spaces so you do not have to waste calories looking for your...

Kids Love it. I take my kids here once in a while, it is inexpensive and can be healthy if you order the right thing. Free breadsticks will fill you up and give you some good garlic breath for several hours :)
Best Crab Rangoon!!. They have the best crab rangoon and General Tsos Chicken!!! its was really delicious...my wife and I will definitely go back to this place.

Best strip-mall chinese in madison. I have been a fan of Flaming Wok since its early days and recently started eating there more frequently due to proximity. The food is much better than more expensive chinese restaurants.   The egg drop soup is one of the best in Madison. Our other favorites include the vegetable fried rice, fried tofu and mixed vegetables, and the little fried noodles for the soup are the best I've had. I think there is a touch of ginger in some of the brown sauces, which go...

Bland or just awful. The delivery takes forever, the food was bland, over priced and the rice was burnt. So yeah, not at all thrilled. Lets just hope I'm not sick by sunrise. My stomach already is feeling queasy

Very very good take out Chinese food. The wonton soup was very flavorful; the wontons themselves had more flavor and filling than I was expecting. Next was a roast pork eggroll, which was huge, crunchy and tasty. My entree was pork chow mein which was very good, even if light on the pork and heavy on the sauce. I also had some pork fried rice which was great, although nothing compared to the goodness over at great wall on Sherman. I think the best part of all this was that the whole load cost le...

One of the very few Chinese restaurants on the east side of town that delivers, and in my opinion the best. I always order the szechuan chicken and am always happy. Great taste, fresh ingredients. The crab rangoon is also good, compared to most others. Recommend the delivery or pick up. Tables in the establishment are few, and it's loud from the kitchen cooking.

Extremely disappointing. Never eat here. Paid $16 for a 1"x1" piece of pork shoulder, half of which was inedible fat. I was required to pay for it even if I wanted to order something else. A complete waste of time and money. I drove 5-1/2 hours to try this place after seeing it profiled on MN public TV. All I got was a blob of fat and a major attitude from the manager. Shame on them!

Cool place!. Loved Fresco! Can't wait to go back when weather is warm and we can sit outside and have dinner on the rooftop on State Street! Gnocchi was fantastic...may be best I've ever had. Caesar salad was average - dressing too much like mayo. My husband had salmon which was good. Cool place with great service! We'll go back for sure!
Food good/pricey. View great. Used to be a great place to go after a concert.
The only thing that rivaled my seafood pasta entree was the view. Really enjoyed Fresco & will be back...

You are paying for the view and expect to leave there hungry and w a pretty nice dent in your bank account. 1st of all we made reservations and we got there and table wasnt ready. Had to wait 30-45 mins before our table was ready. We went for restaurant week and to my surprise the entire table could only order from either the restaurant week menu or the regular menu so we as a table could not order from both we had to ALL pick which menu we were All going to order from. Portions of the food were...
You pay for the atmosphere/location. I had to send my steak back because it was undercooked which ive never had to do before. When they gave it back to me it was cold.
Craft of red wine, garlic bread, and stuffed artichoke hearts, need i say more, splendid!

Despite not really liking the place, I go occasionally because my daughter loves the private tea rooms and the kids shrimp hibachi. The sushi is not very good, except maybe one decent roll on the entire menu. Last time I went the tuna was gray and I couldn't eat the rolls at all. The crab had to be canned, despite the staff's assurances to the contrary. Usually the service is good though, although I have found exceptions to that.

Great place. I took the family for dinner. I love the tea rooms and the private hibatchi rooms. This is like no other place in Wisconsin. The atmosphere is amazing. The food however is not to the standard I would expect. The food is just OK. nothing special at all, the meat is not seasoned well enough and does not seem to be of the highest of quality.

Have meal, have fun!. I have been recently in this restaurant with my friend and kids, and we did like it a lot. The chef, if I am not mistaken his name is Izek, was amazing and the food was very well done. Stuff is nice and helpful to explain the flavors and make the choice you would not regret. Well known place for great food and fun that sparkles your night.

If the food wasn't good this 'restaurant' would be shut down. I called to voice a complaint regarding a take out order and was hung up on by an incompentent manager. Eventually another employee answered and was able to explain the mix up. Japanese restaurant? More like a dump of all dumps. A bucket was collecting water in a hallway with exposed ceiling. If this was where customers can see, I would hate to know what we are unable to see. If you're looking for a dive restaurant with disgruntled an...

Was once my favorite resturant!!!. Now let me say I just love the food at Ginza I always get the Teriyaki Fillet and kogane shrimp with fried rice my favorite, Yum. But the service and the run down restaurant has really made me never want to go back The wall paper is peeling and the paint is chipping the booths and menus were just filthy and sticky. Some times the hibachi grill is turned up to high and it burns the food and that's not good. But yesterday was by far my worst trip ever there was n...
We almost missed this great restaurant because there were no current reviews. We visited botanical gardens around the corner and decided to drive by. The pizza is not to be missed.

Glass Nickel's hand tossed pizza crust is always wonderful. We've enjoyed GN for years now. The regular crust is chewy and tender, with enough thickness to hold all the toppings without it being too bready of a pizza. You can request regular, thin, thick, cracker or gluten free also.  This last time we ordered 2 delivery pizzas; the Boaris Karloff, and the David. The David is the pizza of this month, January. Toppings are a Florentine base with artichokes, spinach and a touch of classic sauce to...

The place is cozy with an entrance on the front and back of the building. We sat close to the bar. Went in for dinner and started with two beers between my wife and I. We then ordered the Mac and cheese bites. They come in fried triangles of mac and cheese. They are great but end up getting really heavy by the end. We ordered an Acropolis salad which was very good; we did not even need to add dressing to it. After we got done with our appetizers we ordered a 10 inch deluxe pizza with vegan chees...

This is my favorite Glass Nickel Pizza location. I must admit, it took me a while to come around to Glass Nickels crust when I first moved to Madison, but I've developed quite a taste for their quirky flavor combinations (ESPECIALLY the pizza of the month). The Nickel Nuggets are tasty little puffs of dough coated with parmesan cheese, and should not be missed under ANY circumstances. I've tried both of their vegetarian sandwiches, and The Chelsea's Choice is AMAZING (I generally sub the raspber...

Extra Thin Crust or Thinnest Possible Crust, you decide. Pizza was great. Salad was fresh. Mozzarella Cheese Sticks were melting in mouth. Tossed Cheese Ravioli was interesting take on cheese Ravioli. Garlic bread was good and Shrimp and fries was a delicious combo. Much more beyond Pizzas, for sure.
Best pizza in Madison! I love "the Ranch" pizza. Can't wait to try the new ones!

Hello Reuben!. My husband and I ordered a Reuben pizza as well as the Thai chicken. I have never used the term "intense" to describe a pizza before, but that is the perfect word for it. It was very flavorful and worth the wait (took about an hour for delivery, but it was rush hour so....). We definitely will be ordering again!

Pretty great pizza, sometimes soggy crust. I am a particular fan of the cardiac arrest. I also am likely to eat their Hawaiian pizza, and I eat their Fetalicious pizza when I'm with vegetarians. It's all pretty good. The crust is moderately soggy sometimes, but other than that it's pretty great. People from NYC turn up their noses at Glass Nickel, though.

One of the best pizza place in madison  . We just love their pizza  .  Usually we order  Pollo diablo pizza .  I don't describe this much but i love this one , And want everyone to try this out ,  It's our fav the spicy ranch siracha sause and  tender chicken with red onions and bacan  with cheese and jalapenos . With thin crust  As I don't eat bacan we ordered it half chicken and half bacon .  The staff is too friendly.
Best pizza!. Had the deluxe pizza, it was amazing! fast and friendly service, and the meal wasn't too expensive. I will be back again, best pizza I've had!!

Decent Local Pizza Option. We got an order of fried ravioli to start. Those weren't bad, but seemed like they were just the frozen type. The cardiac arrest pizza, a good name for what is essentially a meat lovers, was better. There was plenty of meat to be sure, but not so much that it overwhelmed the pizza and made eating impossible. The crust was on the medium to thick side of the spectrum, which was a little too thick for me. I see now that we could have specified a thickness, so this must be...

Oily crust, sauce wanted. Stick with Roman.. I thought Glass Nickel was great the first time I tried Fetalicious, but a second experience changed my mind. We ordered a plain cheese that was disappointing. First, the cheese was like a sheet across the top of the pie instead of melty and gooey the way you want on a good pizza. Second, there wasn't nearly enough sauce. (Not even close.) Final nail in the coffin was the crust, which tasted like oil. If I wanted a cheese pizza of this poor quality, I...

Remember to order pizza. Opps! I forgot to. Glass Nickel has fantastic pizza. Not subs. My co-workers decided to order pizza today, I was thinking something a little healthier, so ordered a turkey sub. It's been awhile since I've ordered a sub from Glass Nickel. The bun was HUGE, and the meat and bread were both of poor quality. I'm not sure how it's possible that pizza as delicious as GN's can come from the same kitchen as this terrible sub.
We ordered polo diablo with bacon on half side n thin crust  Very nice service Seating space is quite small but the pizza is amazing  I recommend this place n specially polo diablo pizza to everyone.

Good food, great prices. Good food, nice range of menu items. Prices very reasonable. Serve a variety of breakfast foods, burgers, some sandwiches, lunch specials, fish on Fridays.  It's an independent business inside the DNR building.

A state employee, I had the chopped steak today (9-17-15), because I'd had it before in my own building next door, and it was great.  Unfortunately, I had to stop eating today's version, because it was pink throughout the center.  It is very unsafe to eat chopped meat that is not well done (grey).  This is and has been universally accepted for a very long time.I called and spoke to the manager.  Although he said I may have a refund (which I'll go in to get), instead of acknowledging the seri...
Andy is an awesome bartender for my hangover breakfast!

Decent Food. Sat at the bar and was happy with my french dip- clean presentation and flavors plus the skinny fries were great. Some good beers on tap. However, the bartender was unattentive and did not provide me with good service. 50-50 if I'll go back because of it- shame as the food was pretty good and I could have brought them more business.

Ew!. I went today with my spouse to try this place and to our surprise, there was a brunch buffet - which sounded absolutely incredible on paper...  ... but a complete disappointment in taste. The food was passable to say the most. The only part I enjoyed the most were the strawberries and waffles.  The service was horrible. We weren't even brought out waters - we had to ASK THE WAITER for water!

Nice. The hubs and I popped in unexpectedly while shopping at the mall. I ordered the Bacon, Tomato, Avacado Sandwich and the kettle chips...the sammie was GREAT but I didn't care for the seasoning on the chips. Overall it was pretty nice...nothing that Wowed me but I would go back to try dinner.

Solid Estabishment. The best thing about being in the Madison Wisconsin area are the brewpubs. Granite City only serves to ensure this fact of mine remains undisputed. The beer selection is good with a nice variety of choices of the typical styles so prevalent these days. The menu is varied and solid enough to satisfy almost any desire and our waitress Elizabeth ensured that if desired we could get what we wanted cooked the way we wished. i started things with the Bock, a well crafted brew with ...

Waste of time and money. We had to ask a server for water-after waiting awhile after being seated. We were handed the lunch menu and a September specials menu-I picked out something on the specials menu-husband picked out something on the lunch menu-server came back and said the thing I picked out (flatbread) was not served on Sundays and that actually they don't use the lunch menu on Sundays. Ok? Thanks for giving it to us. We the had to wait another 10 mins for the correct menu. When food fina...

This is the worst experience ever. The worker when we called was so rude. He hung up on us and was calling us horrible names. When we called back he said it was our fault. I would never recommend that someone order from them and I know that I will never ever ever call there again. I would give them a 0! Pick anywhere else or just go hungry because I would never support this company!

WORST PLACE TO ORDER FROM!!!!! i called to place an order for delivery and the man who answered yelled at me not in English and my friends in the bathroom were laughing and this man hung up on me. when i called back to to hopefully pay for my order he insulted me by calling me a retard and assumed i was making a prank phone call and was very rude. i don't care if this is a bustling college town and you hate your job, you never call someone a retard especially a paying customer! i would never rec...

When I placed my order, the guy acted as if I was inconveniencing him simply by being a customer-fine, it's not as if he was my waiter and I had to deal with him over the course of the meal, I was just placing an order for delivery. I ordered the teriyaki beef appetizers and the General Tso's chef's special (I asked them to make it extra spicy, as I usually do). The teriyaki beef looked like rehydrated beef jerky, and not the good kind-like the stuff you find at the dollar store. The beef wasn't...

Worst experience with a delivery EVER. I got a menu from them under my door at the dorms and wanted chinese, so I called. When I called to place an order the man on the phone was so rude that I just about cancelled my order right then and there. He quoted my order delivery time at 10-15 minutes. Im thinking how in the heck could they be here that fast? No way. The order took 1 hour, yes 1 hour to get here. When the man got here he asked what time we were quoted and freaked out when we said 10-15...
Worst service. Possibly the worst delivery service ever. I simply asked what was in a dish and the employee barked at me. never again!!!
Holy balls batman this place is great. Great atmosphere. Awesome service. Fun new beers. Fantastic food. Will definitely stop by again if we pass through Wisconsin. Love from Canada

Passing by on our way to Chicago and this place hit the spot! Service was fast and super friendly. Wide selection of beers. Highly recommend the Madtown Mountie Burger! SO GOOD. Will stop here again if ever in the area.
Awesome ambiance, pool tables, great music and good food. It's got a sports bar sort of feel to it with futbol and basketball games on TVs . Definitely coming back !!!

A group of 10 of us visited the Great Dane Brew Pub for a late lunch Saturday. What a great experience! Lucky for us, they were able to accommodate our group even though we had no reservations. (There are a lot of tables at the Great Dane.) Our waitress was friendly, knowledgeable, and patient (we had 3 children and a baby.)  There is an extensive selection of beverages available. The Emerald Island Stout was particularly smooth and creamy. The menu consists of a wide variety of pub foods such a...
The all American burger was one of the best burgers I have ever had!                                                                               Also do try the local wheat beer.
Dustin was wonderful! He remembered that I had water with no ice. Great food.
Great Food. Absolutely love the Mac & Cheese. Best ever! 5/5

On starter we had poutine with mashroom its was awesome I recommend this to all of you , do try this out , i  ordered cocktail  but I don't remember the name now 😓 but it was okkkies not so gud. 3d  we ordered the great dane pub wings   With buffalo sause , it was  also not too great dindt like it much,   Overall staff n place was gud poutine was outstanding but  wings n drinks not up to mark.

Needed more seasoning on the burgers. Poutine was phenomenal. Garlicy and cheesy. Our server sort of blew us off and paid very little attention to us. I'm guessing it was because he didn't expect a good tip out of us anyway because we are college aged.
I had a meeting in the bar and enjoyed the food beer and staff. The place was crowded but the staff was very helpful and accommodating. Great after work spot with awesome happy hour deals.
I have never had better donuts in my life!. This bakery is amazing. Every donut I've had has been very fresh and delicious. If you need a good donut, look nowhere else!

I am not from Madison however, I came across this place of all places Facebook. I came across a post in my feed of the places with the best donuts by states. I scrolled all the way down to Wisconsin only to find that the best doughnut in Wisconsin can be found in Madison. I drove here one day after work and noticed a few things the parking lot is small as it is shared with other surrounding businesses, you can smell the delicious doughnuts as soon as you walked in, and most importantly the perso...

Love, love, love these doughnuts! W/one exception...the apple fritter. In that case, love, love, love those apple fritters! The apple fritter, rabbi's delight (the chocolate w/raspberry filling), the cream filled maple frosted...mmm. l'd write more but I'm going to the Greenbush now!

Madtown classic that lives up to its reputation. Generous prices with generous flavor. No day is the same in terms if selection but you can't really go wrong- my personal favorites are the blueberry, Oreo, and Bavarian creme, but the selection spans from donuts to rolls, bear claws and more. A small store with a streamlined intention- simple and delicious!

Excellent donuts, and with their hours of 6AM to 3AM you don't have to get up early just to buy one.  The cake donuts are the old fashioned ones you remember from years ago with just the right amount of sugar, a true cake donut.  Selection was good but they were out of the fritters, but the donuts did not disappoint.

Expectations...?. I went to this place on the reviews here. Took my fiance and expected some authentic Italian. The atmosphere was nice. It was a relaxed setting with low lighting and Christmas lights on the ceiling. We were looking for some Tiramisu, and the server looked offended when we asked for that instead of a full dinner. When asked about the grappa, she didn't know a thing--she never had any. And then she looked at us like we were crazy when we asked for some coffee. The Tiramisu was a ...

Good Pizza. The menu is filled with Italian-American classics, but we came to Greenbush for the pizza. The garlic cheese bread was a good start and they don't skimp on the cheese. Despite the packed house on this Saturday night, it didn't take too long for our thin crust sausage, ham, and basil. The hot coppa ham was a nice choice instead of standard pepperoni and really all the toppings were fresh and delicious. The crust was thin, not crunchy but crisp, adding a little flavor without overwhelm...

Keep this on the DL. This is one of the best little places I have ever stumbled upon. Ive been to Capriotti's maybe a dozen times right next door and never knew this place existed. Me and my group ordered 3 different pizzas so we could sample the fares. I have to say this is hands down the best sausage in Madison. This is also maybe my new favorite pizza in Madison also. There are a couple rivals, but this is def a big competitor. With that being said, this place is kind of small and very cool a...

Spent $170 entertaining a good friend and business client here and at 8pm we were asked to leave by the woman in charge because we had been at our table too long. We were there for just over 2 hours and ordered a round of scotch and aperitifs, appetizers, 4 dinner entrees and a nice bottle of wine. No one was waiting to be seated. It was obnoxious and embarrassing! We will not be dining here again.

Very good little restaurant. Tried the handmade ravioli both cheese and short rib. Excellent. Great wine and beer selection. The cheese bread was also excellent. Definitely recommend it for a a fun casual dinner.
Go Atomic. Good coffee good music!
The general tsps tasted like it came out of a can

Above Average. Happy Wok's menu features the same familiar favorites that you will find at most American-style Chinese places. Their General Tso's chicken was a little spicier than the standard version of this dish, but in a good way, and the combination lo mein was also a winner. Overall, the food wasn't necessarily spectacular, but it was certainly above average. The interior is bright, clean, and more spacious than the typical Chinese place and left me wondering if something like a Burger Ki...

Great Daily Specials. Daily specials are always a reliable bet.  Food is not only reasonably priced, but you get a lot. To top it off, it comes fresh, fragrant and delicious.   Service is always super quickly and quite friendly.
Cheap Chinese food. Tastes good. I never ate at the actual location, just pickup. Family size fried rice can fill you up twice. Plus you get the fortune cookie :)
Good food and atmosphere, bad staff. Really good pizza, but not worth the rude, arrogance you get from a couple long time staff there.

I tried to like this place.. I tried really hard to like this place especially since it's 4 blocks from my house. I like the walnut burgers and their pizza is surprisingly good for a neighborhood bar. I loved the mixed crowd of people, young and old. I loved watching Packer's games there. I like going there on election night to watch the results come in. I really like the majority of the people that work there. I've just had too many weird interactions with the owner and the brunette haired 40-s...
If you're in madison and you're a vegetarian (or not!) you have to try their walnut burgers!! What it lacks in atmosphere it makes up for in food!

Not bad, great chips. I stopped into the Harmony for a burger for lunch this week. I ordered the cheddarburger with grilled onions and all the fixings. Tasty burger on a nice light and chewy bun. It was a little overdone and the meat wasn't well seasoned, but overall, a decent burger.  The best part of the meal was the house-made, fresh-fried chips with blue cheese dip. The chips were JUST done, so they had crispy edges and soft center and were almost like fries instead of chips. FANTASTIC. I'...

I'd say the food was mediocre. The Cheese curds were likely Sysco, and ours arrived still frozen in the middle. The ranch dressing was good. The walnut burger patty was OK, but I ordered it with Blue Cheese (assuming it would come with ACTUAL blue cheese, and got blue cheese dressing. Overall, I would likely return for cocktails, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.

Dear Harvest: Please get over yourself. Gnocchi was not meant to be deep-fried, even if you DO fill it with feta. The result is something that tastes like tater tots filled with feta. If you're going to put horseradish or hot peppers or whatever it is you put into the corn chowder, give your diners a heads-up. It was too hot spicy-hot for anyone at my table to eat. There exists no culinary universe where dill weed belongs on ice cream. It's just weird. And it's okay to ask a diner if s/he would ...
Really liked it! Pricey but was well worth it. The menu varies from what is posted but was very good.

Restaurant Week Hit. Our meal at Harvest started with the tempura chicken and the heirloom tomato soup. I wish the slaw had more tanginess and acidity, but tempura chicken was light and delicious. Chilled soups are generally not my cup, and while that didn't change here, Harvest's soup packed so much tomato flavor into every spoonful that it was easy to at least admire the craftsmanship. Both entrees (tender, braised short ribs and pork shoulder with corn bread) really hit it out of the park, es...

White tablecloth conceit. A place that tries to be as pretentious as the other one in town (le etoile) in being more taken with where the food comes from than how it tastes. A birthday and recruitment and lobbying hangout on the square and the prices reflect that. Head to get out under $100 for two and you would expect better and more imaginative food for those prices but the description of it is better than the taste.
Consistently good. I really appreciate the care taken to pay homage to what is in season, and the many vegetarian options that are always available. Harvest does great craft cocktails too!
Good food but took forever over 30 minutes for our meals

I went here for a drink with some friends and had an okay experience.  The place was like any other dive bar in the city.  They had some outdoor seating, which was probably the best part of the place.  However the service was really slow.  They seemed to be understaffed for the crowd.  After the patio closed, we were all uncomfortably pushed inside.  The music was a random mix of things and the bathrooms were a bit of a mess.  We were happy to drink our pitchers and get out of there.

MEH. Went for a soccer game. The atmosphere was fun and lively- the food was nothing too special. They did have a decent sized menu for a bar-- it was just average. Did not get a chance to try their specialty drinks and most people seemed to be enjoying those.

A beautiful night on State paired with good 'ol classic Americana fare. Hawk's has popular American  burgers and sandwich entrees, with a few unique twists, like their signature fries, strawberry soup, and a few if their their other specialties. The restaurant seemed a little darkly-lit, but the staff was kind and our food was ready in a reasonable  amount of time. My Swiss grilled cheese and cup of was good and filling, and made for a nice evening out with friends.

Overall a good experience. I had the Nocado Salad and my husband the BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich. I got the medium salad, and it was actually pretty huge, so I'm glad I didn't get the large. It had bacon bits, boiled egg, Gorgonzola cheese, turkey, carrots, apple, and a really delicious mustard yogurt dressing.  The pulled pork was excellent, but the fries just ok. They were kinda hard and lacked flavor.  The bartender was slow to acknowledge my husband, and it wasn't very busy at all.  They get a ...
One word; cafeteria. Avoid the grey, flavorless burgers (what, is this thing boiled?) and opt for the grilled cheddar cheese on wheat bread.

The only thing stranger than the service is the food. The burgers are tasteless and of a texture not normally associated with meat. The breakfast is scorched eggs served in a styrofoam take out box. If it is hot,it will actually melt the box. Thank you and have a nice day.
Fabulous food. I have eaten here numerous times & the food & service have been great!!
Not outstanding but pretty good. Service was fine.

The price is actually $15.99. The dis is very good however overpriced, in my opinion. I don't know how rare jackfruits are in town. The portion of the dish is definitely opposite to as far as its price considering its vegeterian.

I decided to stop by for a quick lunch with some friends the other day, and I have to say I was a little less than impressed.  For the simple food we ordered, it wasn't quick at all.  The server was actually a bit rude in seating and serving us.  He seemed very overworked.  All of the food was extremely overpriced and lacked much flavor.  I had the sampler, which came with two momos, dal, roti, and a samosa.  Firstly, the roti was pita bread.  The samosa wasn't thoroughly cooked and lacked any s...

Let me just start by saying this is a cash only restaurant. I don't have any problems with that, but it's good to know before you get there.   It's a fairly small restaurant on State Street with both indoor and outdoor seating. The food is Nepalese/Himalayan. There is a large number of vegetarian options and a smaller number of meat options. Prices are not bad, but portion sizes are slightly smaller than you might expect. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. The service was fine.  Our group of t...

Awesome. My family and I went to eat the dim sum on Sunday. It was great, finally, a place in Madison that served dim sum. Since it was our first time we ordered a lot...shrimp dumpling, pork shu mai, shrimp fried with taro, chinese vegetable with brown sauce, calamari, squid in curry, squid in brown sauce, shrimp balls are a little on the salty side, steamed bbq pork buns, and chicken and noodle stir fry dish. Everything was great, service, price and of course food. The only down side was that ...
Consin. RUDE!! Rude! RUDE!! Don't bother! Save yourself the disappointment!! The Owner could care less if any customer is happy or not!
Food fantistic. Pepper beef egg drop chicken chop suey alll great fried shrimp bread to thick below avg just not good breading but the shrimp was good quil and cooked perfected

Super Fast Delivery and Excellent Food. I am always surprised at how fast their delivery is. Even during the height of rush hour they are super fast. Delicious food (LOVE the governor's shrimp) and great service. What else can you ask for.
Typical American-Chinese corn-starch slop. Tasteless.
I don't expect much from IHOP, but you should expect even less from this location. Service is pretty bad.

Laughter and Language. Last week we ate diiner at IHOP on the east side. I was hungrey for breakrast at 8 in the evening. Even though it was the last hour of service for the day our waitress was attentive and excellent. The disappointment was that the hostess/night manager was talking loudly about a coworker in very abusive terms. She constantly dropped fbombs loud enough for the entire dining area to hear. I did not get the relaxing dinner I had hoped.

Is this all?. I tried IHOP for the first time when I was looking for breakfast before classes over at Truax, and I really wasn't all that impressed.  Selection was about half of what I could get at Perkins with a very narrow range of pancake options for a place calling itself "International House of Pancakes". The food wasn't bad, the service was prompt, but overall I just was wishing I went someplace else. As far as generic american family eateries go, we have much much better in this city.

Not my favorite place to go for breakfast, but have fond memories of visiting the downtown location at bartime. That was interesting! Anyway, yes, ihop is a sort of dive, and they pack you in like sardines. Their pancakes aren't my favorite... and neither are their omelets (Perkins up the street makes their pancakes nice and fluffy and has ihop beat on the omelets too). So this last time I ordered the Belgian waffle with berries and cream and it was to die for! The waffle was nice and tender, no...
Great salad too!. Good food, good people. Ian's takes care of the customers and employees, all with $3.75 slices of pizza. And don't forget to try their salad, best in town!

I have eaten too much Ian's. Ian's many a morning I wake up and you are there on my coffee table. How did you get there? I don't recall going, but it looks like i enjoyed it.   you have been there for me like an oasis on my stumble home from the bars so many times.   you are always delicious and so many choices.   Good pizza by the slice, perfect at 3am or a quick lunch
Like Sbarrro's but with more specialty pizza. I like Sbarrro style pizza (NY style) so i thought Ian's was good
This pizza by the slice is the best pizza in Madison for sure. It certaInly isn't anything like a traditional restaurant more like a mini cafeteria, but the pizza is delicious.

A small place with a big personality. Colorful and animated walls with unique and flavorful options. The classic Mac n' Cheese never disappoints and neither do their  other specialty slices. The restaurant itself is a bit small, so maneuvering around can be a little cumbersome, the staff has an excellent demeanor for service, and the food is more than filling.
Fast service and good food. It's hard to find a good slice of pizza around here but this place has got it!!

Selection is fantastic and every one I've tried so far has been a hit. So they've figured that part out. But the delivery is awful. I've had one take over 90 minutes, on another the driver got lost, and the last 2 pies arrived cold. I live 1/4 mile away, so I would think its not that challenging. Of course I could always throw on some jeans and get it myself, but on a Sunday night when I'm a couch potato in sweats I'm much more likely to dial for Chinese
This pizza is so good it'll make you wanna slap yo momma!
Sassed by Death Cab .... We were singing Weezer in here around noon about 6 years ago and some dudes hassled us. Turns out it was Death Cab For Cutie.
A Madison classic. So many great pizzas to try,. Very rarely have I been disappointed here, and I've been here a lot. Great location and a great atmosphere too.
Friendly atmosphere, outstanding waffles and great coffee. Cardamom latte was delicious!!

Great find. Did not know where to eat breakfast so I searched on uspoon. found this great place. got a double cheese breakfast sandwich and a salted caramel cappuccino. amazing coffee! probably should have got a different sandwich because was too much cheese at the time. great experience.
Truly excellent. The best breakfast bagel sandwich I've had in my life. If you're looking for a coffee shop I'm Madison, make it Indie.

This is a cafe buzzing with students. You find your own table. The coffee is good but more interestingly theres waffles on the menu. We tried the cranberry and walnut multigrain and we enjoyed the crispy exterior with a light interior. Walnuts were mixed in and toasty.

I tried out this little coffee shop for the first time the other day, and overall I'd have to say I was very pleased with the place.  Everyone on the staff was extremely friendly and made me feel welcome.  They suggested I try their cardamom spiced cinnamon ice coffee, which was absolutely scrumptious.  It wasn't overly sweet, yet filled with flavor.  For the price, you can't beat it.  It was also a quiet place to study and pick up desserts.  I'm sure I'll be back again.

Good meat. I generally purchase meat at Jacobsens and have for years. Always good quality. They have typical deli sides - cole slaw, salads, etc - all good, not great. The potato salad is the best here. Sometimes they offer a variety of hot deli foods. The mac and cheese gets good reviews. I never know when they will have the hot food. When they run out, they run out! They also sell elegant farmer baked goods which are wonderful. Jacobsens is a little expensive, but the the quality is there.

Insider. Very proud to be a employee at this store!!! I can very proudly & truthfully tell my customers that we offer nothing but the best to our customers. i work with great people who go out of there way to ensure customers that we appreciate there business and our products are put out fresh everyday and that we take a great deal of time making sure the products we put in our case- are products we would be proud to put on our on grill as well!!!!
Best Chicken Skewer in town, or even the county for that matter. Salad bar is always fresh. Love this place!

Horrible service, was lied to. Horrible service. Guy at the door asked me about a tip, and looked at his receipt to make sure when I said it was on the card. I decided to actually tip 15% even though the restaurant isn't even a mile away, and I'm regretting that now. I ordered Vegetable Chow Mein and they gave me a tin of steamed veggies that was mostly lettuce. I called to say they sent me the wrong thing and the woman who answered actually told me "Chow Mein does not come with noodles." So it...
So stupid! There was no food in the buffet and the food was nasty! What a waste of my time and money! I like china 1 buffet!
This place has adecent buffet but the take out is bland. The seasame chicken is like eating rubber sometimes and the fried rice is flavorless and greasy. If you want good "chinees" go to chang Jiang
Loooove It. Jamba saves my life on a regular basis. I love their options and especially their healthy choices. Always tastes great and goes pretty quick even if they're busy.
REVIEW. I once considered jamba a treat.now,i realize its an absolute necessity that is .....if you want your eyes to sparkle!!! please come to the east side.O.julius is just not my cup of tea.
A quick fix for fresh fruit juices. They also do bowls and amoothies with bunch of additions like ginseng, wheatgrass etc. our favourite is the simple orange apple ginger.

Great!. This place is just a hole-in-the-wall tiny establishment across the street from the Willy street co-op. A fantastic menu, casual, and a lot of fun. If you like Jamacian with a twist of American in a good way (not watered-down). You will love this place. Great for lunch.
The food the decent - not the best. Some meals are watered down and so have lost the true Jamaican aspect. Trust me, I'm Jamaican.

I went to Java Cat for the first time today. I walked in and noticed all of the cat decor. It was nice and a bit funky, but not overwhelming. I decided to try a pumpkin pie mocha. The service was speedy and the two youngsters behind the counter were very friendly. The mocha was perfect in flavor and temperature. I was able to sip it right away without burning myself. My friend and I sat for nearly four hours and chatted. There was always at least one other table free, so we didn't feel too bad a...

Normally I like Java Cat, but .... I don't know what was up today. Ordered sandwiches to go, and they were bagged, wrapped only in tissue squares so they leaked all over the place. I mean the squares that bakeries use to pick up individual items hygienically ... huh? Plus I ordered the chicken salad melt and got home to find it was, um, chicken of the sea, a.k.a. tuna. Good thing I actually like tuna and I'm not allergic.
Ruff. The "Just Coffee" they serve is just bad. The coffee shop looked old and run down. Not impressed.

Excellent place to relax. I miss having this place on a rough commute route, because it was always excellent for relaxing before or after a long day.  WiFi is strong, and there are plenty of power outlets for those of us who can't live long without our laptops. The coffee is made with care and the staff has a wonderful sense of humor. But what I always kept coming back for was the addition of gellato and chocolates.  Seriously, this is one of those places that feels "essentially Madison", and I ...
Amazing.. Just finished breakfast, SO GOOD! Some of the friendliest staff I've ever experienced! will definitely be going back!

Awesome food and atmosphere. Great service and a descent price tag all make this a place to return. I will be back soon and hope to make this a regular breakfast spot. My only complaint was that once our bill came the coffee service from our waitress stopped and we were cut off. I had to ask for more coffee. I guess they want you out once your done eating. No chatting allowed but still good.
Call for reservation. Food was good but we waited for over an hour on a Sunday am.
Madcity Marty. More Blue Hair's, nothing great, boring and bland, processed crap! Yer better off going down to the truck stop...

Super Sonic Quality. My first two meals at the Jet Room have been both excellent and enjoyable. The atmosphere, staff, and food all combine to create a memeorable dining experience. Breakfast and lunch are both fresh prepared and large in portion. Give this place more than just a fly by.

What a train wreck this particular Jimmy John's franchise is.... I can honestly state that this is the worst food experience in my entire life. Every time I felt that things could not get worse today, it did!  At 11:20 am Saturday October 19th, 2013, I went to the Jimmy Johns website, http://jimmyjohns.c..., and attempted to place an internet order for eight people, using their website. I kept being prompted to call the store, as internet orders were not being accepted at this time for that lo...

Wouldn't exactly call it "kid friendly." The last time I was there, there were no items specifically for kids on the menu, no kid-sized cups, and no booster seats. Overall, I would say Jimmy johns is better than other fast food options and even better than other sub restaurants (like silver mine, for example). Overall, I could take it or leave it though.
Good subs. Good sandwiches. Better than Milio's

This Jimmy Johns sucks. They wouldn't deliver to Clarion Hotel, which is a whopping TWO MILES from their location. The guy who answered the phone was extremely rude, and he said that "nobody" would deliver to our hotel, because it was a "dead zone" (whatever that means). He was full of it though, because the next place I called had no problem delivering to our location, despite being located further away. I think the workers at this location are just worthless and lazy and didn't feel like drivi...

All the staff were great servers except the redhead female server. She was incredibly rude and very unhelpful. I also heard she was somewhat of a veteran worker at Jordan's. News flash sweetheart, working in food service for en extended amount of time does not command you respect from customers unless you give respect and definitely does not guarantee you tips.
One of Madison's best kept secrets! Pub food, yes...but also some of the best dinner specials around. And the Friday fish fry is always great.

Tried their fish fry menu: walleye lemon bubba fish if i'm not mistaken,.. It was a very big portion for me but fortunately I had it shared with my friend so I could finish it. The food tasted good and the ambience was good enough as well..forgot to takethe picture.. 😞

I can't believe this place is still in business. I don't eat this food, but my family likes to sometimes. The few times we've driven over and gone through the drive through to bring chicken home the wait is so long. It's always dead, like a ghost town. They never seem to have anything ready for purchase, which is understandable if they get so few customers coming through, they fry it fresh, but still.... I don't understand. Maybe they get most of their business during the lunch hour? Don't recom...
Delicious. Moist and tender chicken, bold and flavorful curry.
Great meal

Used to be better. We went to see how the restaurant was in its new place, since the last time we've been there was quite a few years ago. What struck us as odd was the seating options: you either had choice of high chairs like if you were in a bar, or bent plywood chairs like in some school auditorium. We landed a high-chair option - they were small, tall and very uncomfortable. The three of us were put at the table that was just big enough for one person - maybe two if you only order a drink. ...

I had high expectations for this place after seeing the reviews, but I was very disappointed after visiting.  Firstly, we came in a big group (who made reservations and ordered ahead of time).  Still, we weren't seated or served in a timely manner.  The waiter for our table was extremely disrespectful and kept ignoring our orders.  I had to wait until the meal was almost over before he could even get us our drinks.  He brushed off our food orders as well.  It was very unprofessional.  The food i...

We ate at Kabul for lunch last Saturday. This was the first time we'd been there since it moved across the street and upstairs. We had a great experience.  The atmosphere was clean, simple, light, comfortable. We were greeted as we entered the restaurant by our waiter/the bartender who told us to take a seat. We picked a table by a window overlooking State Street. Our waiter brought us menus, water, and bread with a fantastic cilantro chutney. He told us if we wanted more to just let him know. T...
Yummmmmm...... Kato's Chicken is the food of the Gods. If there is anything that tastes better, I haven't eaten it. If places like Iraq and Gaza had Kato's Chicken, we would have world peace.

Delicious. We were the only people in the restaurant on a Tuesday night. The service was great and not overbearing. Good bread with lots of butter, and a nice beer selection. Both of the salads we ordered were fantastic. The entrees were top notch as well. Great presentation, nicely cooked, lots of flavor. The chocolate pudding cake was great too. The menu was fairly small, but they really did a nice job with the dishes that we had. I would definitely come back here. It's a unique spot with real...

I participated in a private event here, a rehearsal dinner. We had the dining room to ourselves. It was gracefully set without ostentation. The servers were warm, attentive, and efficient.   The food was terrific, classic American fare, perfectly prepared. We began with fresh sourdough bread, light and crusty. Salads were a very nice mix of greens with exactly the right vinaigrette. My table companions raved about the risotto -- someone even got up from our table and visited each of the other ...
Best chicken fingers in Madison!
The kk's food is nothing special but the overall atmosphere and bar scene at night is so much fun! definitely a UW favorite

Get the parillada combinacion if you like meat. For two normal adults the chica will do. get the bigger one for three-five adults.   also good are the juevos rancheros, chile rellenos, queso fundido and my adventurous friends say the menudo on saturday and sunday is good as well.   Don't get the burrito even though it's home of the famous burritio

Worst 'dining experience' I think I've ever had!  Begged three times for our drinks (and the food is salty!) before she finally brought it.  Asked a couple times for extra chips that finally came when we were leaving - but the salsa is what we were really hoping for - and it never came at all.  BUT the ultimate worse part?  We ordered this meat platter that comes on an open flame to the table - and ALL our food BURNED UP - I'm talking stinky smokey fire - right before our eyes!!  After waiting f...

We tried La Hacienda for lunch prior to the 4th of July weekend and I am now a fan. The hostess seated us immediately and then our waitress brought out the menus and a basket of chips and a bowl of salsa. The tortilla chips were fresh, hot, crunchy, and delicious. The salsa was a pico with tons of fresh flavors. It was a little too watery for my taste though. We used our chips to dredge out the chunks and were left with a lot of clear liquid afterwards. Our waitress offered to refill chips and s...
Donald and Cheryl. Absolutely horrible food. Lost our appetites after a few bites and left. Either there was no discernible flavor or a heavy chemical taste. Yuck.

Restaurant has great athmosphere, and server was excellent! Dishes had lot of flavour. Only negatives were that pork of their daily special was bit on dry side, and main course came while we we were still eating our appetizer. Prices were reasonable, we thought. Their pulled pork special was around $12. Would definately go again but ask for more time between starter and main course!
Terrible service, flavorless food and expensive. Don't waste your time.
The food is amazing and great service. There is nothing negative I can say about this place. Definitely a must try if you haven't eaten here.
This place is amazing. Very friendly staff and amazing authentic food. I will be recommending this place to everyone I know.
Not so great. Limited choices, no chimis or guacamole!?!

Amazing Curry, Crabby Employees. I loooove the food, but I always leave feeling like I paid too much to get such bad service even if the food was really delicious. I've been ignored many times when I have tried to go to the bar and order carry out and no one who has ever taken my order over the phone has thanked me and they always seem really irritated.
Great food. Staff was very accommodating on Friday night for us with a baby. Great atmosphere and fun people to watch. My son loved the friendly people.

Hmm. I completely agree that they usually sound irritated on the phone when I order carry out or delivery. Which makes me sad because I LOVE their food!.. Every once in a while I get someone when I call who sounds really friendly (tonight, for example!), but that's usually the exception.
I love coming here. I always have one curry or another. Today I tried the mango curry... OMG! This is fantastic. I'd share a pic, but it disappeared before I got a chance.
Try the mango curry. It's an explosion of spicy and sweet.
Http://www.llx-restaurant.com/ So yummy!
Just okay...nothing amazing.
Pho & Iced Coffee. The iced coffee is the best coffee based drink i've ever had. The pho is good too.

This restaurant is misleading. It NOT a thai restaurant it "suppose" to be a laos restaurant. Go ahead and look on their website. It stated it. Me and my family went there for some authenthic Laos dishes. Not thai dishes. Point blank this place is a joke when it come to dishing up real laotians dishes. I am full blood Laos. They making people out think that pad thai is khau mee, which actually is sweet and salty not sweet and sour. Plus the service lack charm that a laotians restaurant should ha...

My partner and I visited Lao Laan-Xang for a late lunch yesterday. We loved it. Southeast Asian is my favorite cuisine, and Lao-Laan-Xang did not disappoint.  It's a fairly small space and there were only two tables when we arrived @2:30. Our waitress was friendly and competent. She sat us at our table and gave us a few minutes to peruse the menu. We ordered a couple of beers and an appetizer plate and she warned us that it might take a little while for the drinks since she was under age. Howeve...

Not what it used to be. I can't put my finger on it but this place is not as good as it was before they changed their menu a few years back. I used to eat here weekly but now it's more like yearly. Do yourself a favor and drive the extra 10 miles to LaHacienda downtown.

Super bland. I will give them kudos for actually having fried ice cream on the menu. However, I would've preferred a smaller portion of it with better quality. The chips and salsa were great though, and they were super good about making sure they didnt stay empty.
We go here all the time for lunch it's pretty heavy on your gut but real good.
Mediocre Mexican food. Enjoyed the chips and salsa. Thumbs up for our friendly, attentive waiter. Another thumbs up for my tasty mango sangria.

First time here. I had the stuffed poblano. It was excellent - tons of cheese and a nice flavor. Husband had combo 17 and liked it as well. Chips & salsa were good. Premium margarita was perfect. Prices were very reasonable. We'll be back next time through Madison.
I grew up with the real Mexican food cooked by my Mexican Mama. I love Laredos. Whenever I am craving the authentic flavors of my childhood and I'm too lazy to make it myself, I go there.

Near Hilldale. Worst food ever.  The fact there only a couple of tables had anyone there eating should have been an indication.  Watery enchilada served with a dirty oven mitt. Mole sauce was watered down from a jar. Rice was instant without any seasoning, not even salt. Margarita was a sickly peach color and nearly frozen solid in the pitcher. Waiter was disinterested and when we complained did offer to remake the same disgusting item. We left after 2 bites and 2 sips. Another dinner on the...

This laredo's is the ONLY location that always has fabulous food! I don't like the university ave location, nor sister company: mi cosina, both of which have very soggy tacos & are slow to wait tables.

The food was like liquid crap, was actually some of the worst Mexican food I've ever had, no one who I went with finished their meal because everything was terrible. I had some tacos that were just dripping and slimy yet still bland and tasteless. I will never be back and can't imagine why anyone would go a second time, this was just awful

Favorite place to go to eat! Fast, inexpensive, and always delicious. Love this place and have been coming for years! If you like cheesy, then this is the Mexican restaurant for you! The servers are very kind and understanding also!
Fantastic Friday fish fry! Cod and Walleye are both delicious. Crispy fries, good coleslaw, great hashbrowns, friendly staff.
It's bar food but the staff are always friendly. It has a nice neighborhood feel to it. Veggie burger option for non carnivores.

ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! Where do I begin? The place is inviting on the ourside...I am not a scone lover because they are dry but am a LAZY JANE'S scone lover...they are more cake like and so DELISH, you won't be disappointed! The blueberry pancakes are loaded with blueberries and HUGE! Go on a day when your're not rushed and ENJOY the ambiance! !!
Loved it!. I love this place. Delicious, unique food. I loved having them call out my name to go pick up my sandwich. You have to try it at least once!

Omg REAL WHIPPING CREAM. Whenever I go here, I get a waffle with fruit and whipped cream. It's REAL fruit and REAL whipped cream. Like, the kind you mix with a mixer. It's so freaking good. I also recommend picking up a morning bun or 8 and some scones for the next day (or that afternoon). The servers are great and the atmosphere is like being at your mom's house. Go upstairs and stake out a couch. I love this place.

THe Best FOOD IN TOWN AND SERVICE AND COOKS!!!. I have eaten many times at Lazy Janes and the food is wonderful!!! THe quality of their food is Great!!!The service is fantastic and the cooks are great!!The food is fresh and fast little waiting!!!! All the dish for breakfast to lunch are wonderful..my daughter and I go there at least once a week it is our special treat!!!I hope Lazy Jane is around for a long long time!!!!!Christine Petersen

It was about 10am on Sunday and there was a line out the door, but it was worth it.  Not a huge scone fan, but the pumpkin chocolate chip was very good. Something for everyone, but maintains a home cooked meal feel.  Sunny side eggs were cooked perfectly.  I will recommend and go back.

Extremely Unhappy Customer. The food was horrible. I asked for a RARE burger, and when i got it, it was medium and charbroiled. The last thing i wanted was a BURNT burger! The bartender, Cindy - the owner's daughter, was snippy from the get go and when i asked for a new burger, she started slamming stuff around. She had a lousy attitude and it showed! When i asked to speak to the owner, they would not allow me to, which to me, really says what kind of place this is and what kind of people I'm de...
Great bar food. Awesome!
Whats better then a $5.00 large pizza?

Good spot for a nicer dinner. Lombardino's is a little on the pricey end for dinner in Madison, however the food is really good. It isn't your typical Italian "Olive Garden" type experience. This is more true to real Italian cooking (I lived in Northern Italy for a while, and it reminded me of the dishes I'd find there). Over all, a very nice place with good food. Make sure to call ahead during busy times as often they are booked up!

Heirloom Tomatoes Galore. It had been a while since we had been here. This time of year is an awesome time to go to Lombardino's. Why you ask. Heirloom Tomatoes! I think it was in every dish I had from the caprese anitpasta salad, soup, and Bucatini. Great night, with great service, good friends, and great food. We will be back probably next year in September.
Loved it - classic old world feeling with foodie infused - somehow it works! Plus an awesome classic martini.
