I've been to Lombardino's a few times for dinner, expecting it to be good and usually being disappointed. I've tried their 3-color salad, a number of their pizzas and pastas, and their eggplant parmagiana. This place is always packed which surprises me, given that the overall quality is mediocre at best. It seems to survive more on its reputation than the quality of its food. There are many substantially better pizza and pasta restaurants in Madison, so I would look elsewhere.

Had a wonderful birthday dinner and will definitely go back. The prosciutto bruschetta with house made ricotta and minted pea purée was absolutely outstanding. I also really enjoyed the spaghetti bolognese. Service was pretty good, just wish there was a gluten free option for pasta for my husband. I think they could partner with local RP's pasta for this and keep the integrity of the pasta dishes with no problem!
They have the best sandwiches.
Amazing breakfast, one of my favorites in Madison. Go and get the biscuits and gravy, you will not regret it.

I waited over 40 minutes for the disappointing quinoa/chickpea sandwich. The balsamic "gastrique" was overwhelming and texture of the patty was unappetizing. As far as the baked goods, I prefer the tiny Batch Bakery down the street.
One of the best breakfasts in Madison. Definitely the best baguette in town.
The Ham, Swiss and Red Pepper Quiche was amazing! The best cup I coffee I've had in Madison and the Almond Croissant was to die for.  I think I'll just sit here until it's time for lunch.

Cafe Brunch Experience. The food is extremely tasty and the ingredients are well sourced, but it is very important to remember that the food is cafe portioned and not that of some of the diners in Madison. Some prices were a bit higher than expected, though I could understand why and I accept this as a part of going for quality over quantity.  Biggest problem was the seating. While many may like the mismatched chairs and ambiance of the various wood tables, the spacing of all the different tab...
Great fish. We ate there on a Friday night and ordered the fish fry - haddock. It was excellent and so were all the sides. Will definitely return.

The food was better than I had expected. The bar gets a reputation for the douches that go there at night, but when I went ther for dinner the service and food were both better than expected. Decent overall

What a Letdown!. Extremely disappointed. Made reservations for 8, including a few of our out of town friends, the Wednesday before the Badgers Final Four basketball game. Received a call from the manager on Thursday stating that there was a "computer glitch" and that they could no longer accommodate for our reservations. Seeing as how the hostess had told us that the manager reserved most of the seating for his own personal reservations on Wednesday, we're thinking that he decided to invite a fe...
Most amazing lunch buffet. If your not sure about Indian food come check out the buffet. It's great and IMHO the best value. Love it.

The store front and decor are nothing to write home about, but don't let that deter you! The food was great and the service can't be beat. The waiters were very friendly and had an old fashioned class like putting the napkin on my lap or pooring my beer into the glass table-side that was very nice. You start your meal with an interesting cumin cracker-like bread that I've never had before (and I've been to a LOT of Indian restaurants) that you eat with the typical Indian condiments. For dinner I...
This restaurant is open now. The best food ever. great service.. I enjoy to go there every time.
Great authentic Indian food. Good service too.

My favorite Indian restaurant for lunch on the east side of Madison. Great buffet for those like myself, who can never decide what entree they want, and/or who tend to bug their accompanying partner for "just a little taste" of what's on their plate....you can choose a sampling of everything! My favorite here is the Chicken Tikka Masala. It is so good. The flavor is robust and rich. The dosa is amazing as well as the fried cauliflower. The naan, which they keep you well supplied with is amazing....

Meh. The food is okay. Buffet used to be a really good deal, but prices seem to have risen quite a bit over the last few years. Some dishes are quite good, others are on the greasy or bland side. I'm convinced the "mango" ice cream is just vanilla with orange food coloring. The real kicker, though, is the consistently horrible service. I mean TERRIBLE, and not in that they simply ignore you, but actually go out of their way to be rude.

Food was good. No doubt about it. I think this is the only restaurant in Madison where I enjoyed the south Indian delicacies.  However the service sucked. The waiter was rude. It took them 20 minutes to get naan on the table. And at the end he said 'from next time onwards tell us before hand that you are coming and how many naan would you eat'...

Pathetic food tastes like its stale. Found an insect in the Gulab Jamun dessert. Had food poisoning and threw up just 2 Mins after finishing my meal. To top that you have arrogant waiters and waitresses. I wonder how this place is even open with such horrible service and food. Visit at your own risk!! Wish I cud give a negative rating to this place. Terrible experience!!
Good food, crummy service. Go for the buffet for best case scenario dining.

We recently stopped at the Maharani Indian Restaurant to try their lunch buffet after the Saturday morning winter farmer's market. What a great find! It's on the same block as the Metropolitan Condominiums so parking can be a little tricky. However, the food is worth it. The selection was vast and everything was delicious. Salads, entrees, deserts, and they brought fresh naan to our table. The only thing that was less than perfect was when trying to pay our bill at the end of our meal. The hoste...
Fantastic Bar!. Very friendy staff and customers. Great beers, burgers and fried cheese curds.

Consistently delish. We are lucky enough to live right down the road from Manna, as its creative, flavorful and tasty dishes rarely disappoint. Practically anything you order will satisfy for breakfast, brunch, lunch or dinner. The coffee and baked goods are equally amazing!

Do not take a card :(. They make excellent bakery, their coffee, tea is not very good but their espresso is better & their food(although expensive) ok. When I had it I was not as impressed as I had hoped to be & it would be nice if there were some cheaper lunch options.  The main downside of Manna is that they do not take cards unless you spend $5. So if I am by myself and only wantonly tea or a pastry. I am usually forced to go somewhere else where I can pay with a card (Starbucks,Barriques,et...
Nice people. Great food.
Their quiche is The best! I had the sausage, mushroom, and feta quiche.
Very gluten free friendly. Awesome bakery items and a delicious cafe menu. They get a little flustered when busy but overall a superb breakfast spot. Try the iced chai tea!

Excellent. The line filled quickly behind us, but the service was fast and no one had to wait long for a table at 9:00 for brunch. Fast friendly service. A healthy, filling menu with great daily specials. I had the mushroon cheese fritatta. large tastey with chewy fresh portabella mushrooms. coffee was very good. A bit loud inside with all the hustle bustle and change of customers. You order at the grill and the food is brought to you table ala Culvers. Would go back again and wish I lived nearb...
GREAT drinks and food. Went to brunch at Marigold's after farmers market. Great menu, great drinks. The order system could be fixed up though- seemed to be inefficient.

Marigold Discriminates. Marigold's Potatoes and Pancakes are out of this world. But Sadly I refuse to take part and enjoy the food of a company that discriminates against those with disability. Owners John and Phillip are wonderful people and owners of other amazing restaurants such as Sardine and Gates and Brovi. I don't think they realize the unethical and illegal principles that are being practices at the Marigold Kitchen. I am sadly disappointed and outright appalled what has taken place and...

Really tasty, wish I'd found this my first day here rather than wasting time, money, and taste buds on the old fashioned. I'd prefer proper table service but if I ran a restaurant I'd do counter ordering too. Likely makes things move faster too.

I've had several friends highly recommend the Marigold Kitchen, so we decided to try it for lunch this week. We got there a little before noon and there was a line to the door. Ordering takes place a the counter and they have menus to peruse while you are waiting in line. The menu consists of breakfast items as well as sandwiches, salads, and soups for lunch. I decided on the Marigold Italian: Salami, Spicy Capicola ham, aioli, provolone, and frisée with a pickled vegetable relish on a toasted ...

Birthday at Mariner's Inn. My girlfriend and I celebrated my birthday by having dinner at the Matiner's Inn. We were the first customers of the day. Our waitress was courteous and attentive to our dining experience. The dining area was neat and pleasant and we had a nice view of the nearby lake. My girlfriend ordered steak and lobster tail while I had fish and shrimp. Our food was well prepared and very tasteful. Soup and salad was also served, along with wine and coffee. Our overall dining exp...

Huge disappointment. Went to Mariners for Mothers day brunch with a large party. The view was fantastic. Unfortunately nothing else was. The tables were so close together it was near impossible to get in and out of your seat without running into someone else. The food was okay, most of it was bought elsewhere and set out. Some items tasted as if they were on the buffet line for a long time despite the restaurant having just opened. When my son got the bill I couldn't believe what they were charg...
Overpriced with mediocre food. Not what it used to be

Service Good...Food $$ Value?. We have been here many times and find it convenient. The service is always very good and attentive. The food can be hit and miss depending on what you order. Old supper club feel, does have outdoor dining that is close to the lake.   For the price on drinks and food I do not see the value in the overall experience.

Since our family was visiting, we decided to all go to the Mariner's Inn for steak and seafood. It was dark when we visited, so we couldn't see the lake, but I can only imagine that the view is spectacular in the daytime.  There are multiple rooms, lots of wood, and I felt there was almost a supper-club vibe going on.  The servers were friendly and knowledgeable. Unlimited white and pumpernickel rolls were included. Soups and salads were very good and I liked that the salads include blue-cheese ...
Cannot understand why this consistently gets rated so highly. You could get similar quality at Applebee's.

Free Beer on your Birthday!!!. Went here for a few birthdays, and had a great experience while eating and drinking here. Service is great, fast, and friendly. If your looking for great burgers and free beer on your b-day, this is the place to go!!!
Nice bar stop. This is always a stop on my bar hop route. Its one of my favorite bar food places too. Good burgers and even free beer on your birthday (if you dont mind a ballon tied to your mug).

The Gritty is just a fun spot to grab a burger, down a couple of cold ones and watch the newly minted "legals" enjoy their birthday beers.  Spent time here when I was a student at UW-Madison and now go for a cold one every once in awhile.  Not the greatest food in Madison, but it's a fun spot with lots of cold beer.   Budget friendly too as this is a student hangout.

An old and comfortable favorite. I don't know about others, but personally I love the burgers and appetizers at The Gritty. It's tasty and has a decent variety, though there are plenty of places in Madison that have more refined and high quality food. But you don't eat at the Gritty because you want a gourmet meal, you eat there because you want to drink beer with friends and hang out on campus.  Don't try and act adventerous, just choose from the menu what you know you like and grab some chee...

Good pub food. Despite having a low approval rating on Urban Spoon, I really like this place. It is pub food, so if you are expecting something else you will be disappointed, but most of the food is really good. Not the best place to order a steak, but they have good ribs and the clam chowder is great. A way better choice than Chilies’ or Applebee’s for sure.

Great Food!. I really loved the signature "Shrimp O'Grady" appetizer- the "secret" sauce had a really nice kick to it. My friend had a specialty burger and cannot stop raving about it. I had the ranch wrap, which was fabulous. BIg portions of really great food. And our server was super nice and fun, which always adds to the experience! I would recommend it to anyone looking for an easy night out!
Ok..... A better option then the local Chili's. Nothing spectacular....may be good for kids early in the dinner hour.
Prime rib was the special but there was nothing special about it. Au gratin potatoes tastes like soap. Would not come back.
Never go here! A bunch of damn morons that can't get a simple order correct. Useless workers!
The expensive late night walk up window sucks and is unlike anything I've seen at any other McDonald's. it makes me not want to eat there even during the day.
Fantastic just like all the others

Updated review. This location has cleaned up its act. Fries are better tasting/fresher, and the accuracy has improved significantly since I last reviewed. Thanks!  -----01 Sep, 2009----- Check your bag before you leave. I get incorrect orders as often as I get the food I ordered when I use their drive thru. Don't leave the drive thru until you are sure you have what you ordered. Also, they need to change their frying oil more often. It definitely affects the flavor of the french fries.

Great martinis, desserts, and hookahs!. We go here often to enjoy the bellydancing on Fridays & Saturdays. The mediterranean pasta is filling and the portion is generous enough to share or take home for lunch the next day. The hookahs, martinis, and desserts are awesome!

Karaoke Bar!. I love this place, has great Mediterranean food, but with a kick and that is a separate karaoke bar on the other side of the place. I like this place a lot and highly recommended the double apple sheeshah.
Ok, it's not Cairo, Istanbul, or Beirut, but they have double apple sheesha and Stella (Artois), a hot male belly dancer and nice atmosphere. Yay!!

Outside look is deceiving. Ok...yes it is in the middle of a trailer park on the side of the beltline, but get over it. The bar has karaoke and is a bit of a dive but the Lounge "dining room" is awesome. Comfortable chairs, good food, and excellent drinks. Great for a laid-back group gathering. Belly dancing performers on Fridays and Saturdays with fire or swords sometimes-very cool. Try the double apple hookah.
Terrible owners! Will never go again!
Amazing food. Definitely reccommend Atkins plate! So cheap and delicious

Best in Madison. I love food and I love Madison, but this is the place I have gone to over and over again. Great food, warm atmosphere, incredibly fast service, and reasonable prices. After four years of loyally eating at Med Cafe, I don't know what I'll do after graduation. There's no place like it.
Extremely cheap (cash only kinda annoying) and you are always greeted like a regular when you walk in. Everything plate somehow tastes the same but if I had to recommend id say the akin plate.
Great. The hummus and pita is a simple delight and the service is friendly and fast. Cash only though!

Need to know: Cash only. Great filafel. Steady stream of people at lunch, but still plenty of tables for 1or2 people. The food comes out extremely quickly after you order. The staff is very friendly, too.

Decent Sandwiches. I stopped by Yola's for lunch recently and had a nice, if unspectacular sandwich. The Tuscan ham and cheese comes lightly toasted, with a little too much mayo for my tastes, but I liked it nonetheless. Simple, but fresh and good.  Service was friendly, not incredibly fast if you need a really quick lunch, but certainly not slow either. Yola's interior has the familiar coffeehouse look and, in regards to a previous review, the only religious items I saw were a couple of books ...

Delightful Cafe. Beautiful place with excellent menu choices, warm family atmosphere, and a passion for people. They bring the food out to you after you order, so you can sit down, relax, talk, or get to work on your computer with their free wi-fi.  Be sure to enjoy a waffle, or get yourself a triple shot of espresso!
Family recipe Belgian Waffles are worth the trip.

Waffle-icious. Being a west sider I have driven by Yola's Cafe hundreds of times, but this is my first visit. It is a very welcoming atmosphere with several seating options including barstools, upholstered high back chairs, and standard tables/chairs. There was a good sized crowd for a Friday morning @ 9:30, but no wait time to order. You place your order at the counter, but your food is brought to your table & in my case it wasn't more than two minutes before the very friendly employee brought ...

Wonderful place. We had cherry and raspberry coffee drinks, both of which were delicious. We went on open mic night. The turnout was not large but it was worth it. Wonderful talent to go with the wonderful drinks. It's in a bit of an odd location but that just adds to the charm. Stop in, and if you can plan on going during their open mic night, you will enjoy yourself.

Beautiful for a romantic date. My boyfriend surprised me for no reason to a date at this restaurant. Not only were there my favorite colored flowers waiting for me on the table (which I got to take home), we got seated in 'lovers lane' which is an area specifically set aside for couples. You are in your own little booth and can't see anyone and its very romantic. The food was so wonderful, we did the big night out deal. Everything tasted superb. They let you customize anything should you wanted ...

It's different but not the best. If you go just go for the cheese and dessert. The meat was good but all had to have the same cooking oil so all the meats tasted the same. And the waitress was awful, she hovered and pushed us to make decisions. She had a few things that she was obviously told to say by some script. Way too expensive for what it is. But the chess and chocolate was good and it was a different experience.
Over priced!

Will not go back. Melting pot is a unique experience....that you could do at home for 1/8 of the price. Don't waste your money. The portion sizes are tiny, and the quality of food you receive is less than satisfactory. We ordered the meal with the "better cut" of beef, as the waitress put it, yet it was chewy and not even worth eating.

I loved this place! The food was great, the staff were happy and friendly and the atmosphere was great. We had the four course meal and loved it! My favourite was the cheese fondue course. We had the cheddar cheese which was divine. For salad i had a caesar salad which was very good. For our entree we had The Classic and the the Pacific Rim plate and we shared them between us. All of the food was excellent!! For dessert we had the chocolate fondue and it just rounded the night off perfectly. As ...
Best Coffee in Madison. Mermaid Cafe is the best breakfast spot in the Atwood neighborhood. The sandwiches are great, and they have the best coffee and hot drinks in Madison.

Local food. Fair trade coffee locally roasted. Awesome atmosphere. Great part of the east madison community. Excellent soups and sandwiches. Breakfast and lunch all day. Fresh Made from scratch bakery everyday!
Welcome, wonderful place. Great place for a late breakfast on the weekend. Laid back atmosphere and staff was attentive and friendly.
Things to put in your mouth here: Oh Mighty Isis, The veggie Banh Mi, and that carrot soup! I've never left here unhappy. The staff is always super chill and friendly. I LOVE this place!

Big yummy fries, and I love that their burgers have both sweet and dill pickles slices! Also, I was surprised by how CLEAN and cute the 50s-style dining area is! I had mine to-go, but next time, I think I'll stay and eat-in :)
Custard Only. The custard is amazingly delicious. However, the burgers are overpriced and overcooked, as if they are made from frozen patties you get at the supermarket.
Overpriced, not that good. Maybe in the past, this place was better(?) but for now, just go to Culver's.
Prices are ridiculous but the custard is the best in town.
Good, but not Culver's. Michael's is good, but it's just not as creamy as Culver's.

I have to say groing up in Madison micheals is my favorite icecream place in the world and I have to all the states and 4 country's. Go there and you'll love it it's a little pricey but it is totally worth it. I recomend the turtle Sunday. Ps I'm 12

Small portions, over-priced, not that great. For $5 I expected a decent sized vanilla shake and what I recieved was tiny, too thin, and tasteless. The burger was also nothing to write home about. Heck, Culver's is better!
Bad coffee. Coffee is bitter, late good
The brownie is to die for!!!

The coffee didn't taste gud  We ordered lattee  and americano Other  coffee places are quite better than this place  First of all the place is allways crowded  No place for sitting  N the coffee to dindt taste gud enough I don't recommend this place to anybody  Their are other coffee shop in the area do try them

Every time I've visited this place, it's been a delight!  The staff is very welcoming and make me feel right at home.  Plus, they have a variety of baked goods and drinks to choose from.  I have had their chai energizer, which was extremely flavorful without being too sweet.  They also have free wifi and many tables and lounge chairs to relax in.  It's a perfect place to study.

Cheesecake makes me smile and so did Michelangelo's! I had a slice of Raspberry cheesecake (with a chocolate crust). It was creamy and full of flavor, a perfect way to liven up a Monday night. The place lived up to its name, as it was teeming with lots of art and fanciful designs. What made my night though was the friendliness of the staff- attentive, funny, and kind service took the cake on this trip.

A Willy Street Staple. Mickeys is Willy Street. Willy street is such a unique and often "strange" (in a good way) place. you walk down the street and no one bats a second glance at someone with green hair and a ferret on their shoulder. beautiful wierdness.   Mickeys embraces that wierdness and does it with some AWESOME food. its a great place very local, not a tourist trap at all. has a great vibe, live music every so often and just that grungy neighborhood spot that everyone loves.   But s...

Discovered Mickey's Tavern using Urbanspoon. The Sexy Chips were fresh, thin sliced potatoes fried crispy with white truffle oil and fresh grated parmesan cheese. 2 of us could not finish a small serving but we gave it our best shot. The Eggplant Panino was delicious, tasty grilled veges on a toasted baugette. This came with slaw and kettle chips which I did not eat as I kept wolfing down Sexy Fries. The coleslaw was crispy and not overdosed with mayo dressing. Delicious as described by the prev...

Love the food, but tonight I went out with a bunch of professionals from work and was treated poorly by a staff named Emma, later she said she was the manager and again was even more rude. I would never go again after being treated so poorly. We spent over a hundred dollars on food and drinks and tipped over 20%then she said they were done serving. Not even a minute after she refused to refill our drinks she filled two tables around us and they didn't even order food. Super sad that we would be ...

Neighborhood Gem. When we first moved to Madison, we were a little lost on where to go for breakfast. Small-batch, gluten-free vegan scones abound, but where could you just get some good ol' comfort food breakfast?  Mickey's to the rescue! I almost always get the scramble of the day, but really enjoy the eggs benedict. My husband is a big fan of the waffle. The potatoes that come with many of the breakfast options are awesome -- always crispy, and just the right amount of peppers.   We reall...

Rude Service - Mediocre Food. I went to Mickey's to meet up with a friend who lives in the neighborhood. We always drive by the bar but had never gone inside. We decided to go in for some dinner and wow was that the biggest mistake we made! We sat outside and after about 15 minutes of no one even asking us how we were or if we needed anything we went inside to the bar to get drinks and a dinner menu. After waiting patiently at the bar for someone to acknowledge us (the bar wasn't full by any mea...
All-around wonderful. Loved the food; loved the ambiance. A busy, noisy place where folks charge their batteries for the day with the best comfort food in Madison.

I decided to go to Mickie's from all of the reviews raving about the restaurant. I love my breakfast food and I've been to countless diners all up and down the east coast. Sadly, I can honestly say I am extremely disappointed in the quality of food served at this establishment. My eggs and coffee were average, the toast soggy, and the corned beef hash was grey, bitter, and had a metallic taste. Sure the prices were ok for breakfast food, but the quality is way below par. Sure I like nostalgia, b...
Place was not open on published hours.. Was gonna eat breakfast here but they were closed. so much for displayed hours
A Madison classic.  Great food, great portions, great prices. There's a reason there's always a line out the door. The breakfast is legendary.

Love this place. It's all about the Scrambler for me. A big pile o' breakfast food (eggs, cottage fries, cheese, gravy and corned beef w/some Sriracha for a kick!) w/a decent, but not great, cup o' Joe make this a great way to start a Badger football Saturday! It's priced very affordably, too. Gotta build a base so you can handle having a 'few' beers before and after the game. And Mickie's atmosphere only adds to the enjoyment. I've been here many times before, and will be back many more!
Disappointed on several occasions. Just poor quality.
Awful bread and bland sandwiches. Why do Madisonians come to Milios?
Better bread, better subs. Forget Subway eat fresher at Madison's original. Great food, good service.
Better subs elsewhere. You pay a lot of money here for a lot of bread (which is rather good, by the way) a single layer of meat and cheese, lots of lettuce and paper thin tomatoes. Not worth it.
Customer. Laura at Milo's is the best! Great Customer service!
Rotten service and rotten attitude. I normally like their subs but I can't support a business that treats customers like the bane of their existence. Boycott on principle.
Super quick and tasty! Perfect if you need a filling meal real fast
Great sandwiches! And excellent service!
Jimmy johns is better!!! Go the extra 3 blocks to get a true sub!!

Super professional quality. I go to this business park based sub shop every week. It has the owner there almost daily too. She seems to have a good handle on getting good workers too. Best subs, very fresh. Delivery and they have a DRIVE THRU in the back too. Love it.

Monday's is another local bar in downtown Madison.  Their drinks are very cheap and simple.  The bartender was really sweet and welcoming.  Even though the game was on, it was still relatively quiet.  It's one if the few places to go for a drink and chat.
Breakfast foods really good here. Huge menu, typical family rest.

Disappointment tonight. I have had many meals at Monona Garden and the experience has usually been great. The service is always friendly and the food delicious. I had a great disappointment tonight though. I took my parents and son out for dinner and ordered the Steak and Shrimp dinner which I usually get. The steak is usually thick and big enough for me to take half home to have for a second meal. When my meal arrived, however, the shrimp was perfect, as usual, but the paper thin piece of meat ...

Don't be fooled by the location and shabby yet funky interior. This is a good coffee house; thoroughly enjoyed my well made latte and my friend her tea. Though did not try the sweets they looked yummy. Whimsical colors, mismatched furnishings, the tattered couch...great little cafe to catch up with friends, study, tweet, or read.

Pretending to be local. The coffee shop was small and quaint. The barista was quite friendly. The price was very reasonable. The coffee was not local, it was roasted by Alterra. I don't understand why they don't support the local community. I asked the barista about this and she stated that she gets several complaints daily about not buying local but the owner would not change. Shame on them. Alterra is owned by the international company Mars- produces M&M's etc. The coffee was not as good as so...
The best latte I've had in years. Very unique atmosphere w/ open WI FI connection.

An colorful café in the heart of Willy street with a mind for being local and vegan. My cherry danish surpassed my expectations- warm, flaky, filling, and hit the spot!  I went in a little later as the shop was winding down, but the barista was very welcoming and patient as I took my time to decide what I wanted. Alongside the VERY comfortable couches, all the patrons seemed relaxed in their late day hangout. I'd definitely be up for coming back again and trying their other bakery items. Quick ...
Atmosphere and character. It has both!
Be ready for a nap. Delicious huge Pastys, if you eat a whole one at lunch be ready for a nap after you are done   so good

Yum on the Go & Stuffed Full. Their Pasty's are stuffed full! I'd stick with what's on the menu regularly for first timers like the beef and onions. I was definitely impressed by the amount they put in each pasty. It's not full of air like others can be. It's hot, ready and a great food to eat on the go.

I visited Teddywedgers for lunch on a recent weekday. It's a tiny store on a triangular corner with no seating right across from the capitol. However, if the weather cooperates there is plenty of seating outside on the square.   The menu consists of a variety of pasties. I was not familiar with pasties so I asked the cashier what they were. The cashier, who was friendly and congenial, showed me a 1/2 one which looked like a calzone and said the traditional ones are filled with meat and vegetable...

I like this place as a good and inexpensive breakfast on a Saturday morning. The pasties range from traditional, 'meat and potato' (w/veggies), to quasi-calzones (minus the tomato sauce), to breakfast pasties. I prefer the breakfast pasties most (w/egg, cheese and meats/veggies), and then the trad. ones for lunch. Very tasty, cheap, and filling...and the warm food really 'hits the spot' on cool mornings!
Best pot stickers I have eaten since California seafood noodle was too spicy to eat all but still very tasty pho noodles more on the bland side but fine

Convenient, but not great. Close to campus, but not too veggie friendly. I had what was supposed to be a veggie pho, but there were some unidentified meaty things. Also had a spring roll, but the noodles were too wide.
Nam's review. Walking distance from the Campus, great food, great people. If you have chance try their Stewed pork, you will fall in love with it. They also have the BEST Thai Ice Tea!!!
The shrimp and beef with fish sauce and sesame beef is really good. their Vietnamese sandwiches are really tasty too. And i love love their bubble teas.
We ordered take out and the food was delicious. The bubble teas are excellent. The service was great! I recommend it.
Reasonable prices friendly service and delicious food (granola, walnut tofu burgers and bread)
Great food!! The chef makes.... Great food!! The chef makes some great specials. The out side bar is open for the summer & live music is so fun.  We also like the Sunday brunch.
Nau-t-good food. Weak menu, inconsistant food. Drinks are way to expensive.

Outdoor dining/ wi fish fry. Perfect night to sit out on the patio, a little noisy with some drinking groups but still very enjoyable. Cheese curds came out perfect. Peel and eat shrimp was spicy and good. Grouper fish sandwich was light and flavorful. Haddock fish fry met expectations. Only thing would not order again was the pasta salad as the side, pretty plain and generic.  Staff was friendly and well intentioned, but it was busy so some things had to remind staff of, but not rude at all as...
Rude owners, indifferent staff, horrible greasy food

The Nauti-gal is a MAINSTAY and they STILL do it right. Great atmosphere, views (inside and out), super friendly and personable staff. The prices both higher and lower end are comparable and the value is super tasty. The ONLY place I have found 'Kraken' rum at and rightly so.

Best food outside of New Orleans!. The Fordem Ave location is the only one I have been to, but it is hands down my favorite place to get take-out, occasionally to eat in. The food is great. Red beans and rice with extra sausage, fried oysters cooked perfectly with a light cornmeal breading (po' boy or meal) are terrific, but my all time fav is the crayfish ettoufe - VERY HOT, but man, my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
Good food Bad Service. The East side location has much better service but West side has very low standards.
Overpriced for the portions they serve. Po Boys suck, and most of their dishes are bland. Dirty rice is good, but outside of that you'd be better off going to Lilliana's or Popeyes

So good! I had red beans and rice with double sausage and French bread and it was so so good. My only complaint would be that even with double sausage, they didn't give me very much sausage, but other than that, everything was great. Fast service, pretty cheap, inviting place. I would definitely go back again

Good food, worth a try. I stopped out today to give New Orleans Take Out a try, given some of the great reviews and length in business.  I stopped at the Fordem Location, which really looks like a hole in the wall, but that add's to the charm.   Procedure is to walk up and order at the counter. They have specials on the wall, but no menu posted, so if you don't know what you want, grab a take out menu at the counter and take a look. Everyone that I saw come in (about 6 people in between 11:3...
Horrible service...after 7 pm they are out of bread? Really? Lazy...3 years ago was wonderful. Had an awesome cook. Now....it's a waste of money. Sad they let this good restaurant go.

Real Deal Cajun/Creole. As a native of Louisiana and long-time resident of New Orleans, I have very high standards when it comes to Cajun and Creole food outside of the Bayou State. Bottom line: Could this local chef sell his food in the Big Easy?  The answer for New Orleans Take Out is a resounding “Yeah you right!” I’ve had the Oyster Po’Boy and the Shrimp Jambalaya. Both are authentic. A po’boy is a very simple sandwich, something this place understands. In this case, just perfect...

Two out of four isn't bad.. My boyfriend made the right choices, he got a small order of red beans and rice and small order of jambalya, both were excellent, well favored. Sometimes red beans and rice had a gritty texture. Not these. My roommate got the Mardi Gras Trio, which he said tasted okay, but definitely not enought to be considered a meal. I ordered the seafood gumbo, which was different than other gumbos I have had. The sauce was very dark and thin, I'm used to and prefer thicker roux b...

Disappointed by this place. Roommate and I each had sampler platters and didn't like a single thing. The red beans and rice was about the best item, and it wasn't very flavorful. Maybe I got it on a bad day, but I'm in no hurry to go back.

The kimchi soup is amazing if you like kimchi. Just be careful because it's served boiling in a hot rock bowl. The worst part is waiting 10 minutes for the soup to cool enough so as to avoid melting off the roof of your mouth. This soup is the perfect hangover cure...too bad they're closed on Sundays.
The bim bop with the over easy egg is extraordinary, along with the solid kim chi, dicon and potatoes, I will be back for more of this wonderful Korean mouth watering food.
The new location is nice. The galbi with lettuce wraps is my favorite. If you like spicy, try their jjigae. If not, I'd suggest the bibimbap. We've never had a bad dish here.

Great meal and someone who actually knows how to make a Manhattan.. With all of the great restaurants in Madison, it is hard to chose just one. So you have to pick wisely. A wise choice would be to head over to Nick's.  My wife and I decided to roll the dice and head to Nick's on a Saturday evening before the Steely Dan concert at the Overture Center. We got there a little early (around 5:30), thankfully, so it wasn't to busy when we got there but it did fill up quickly. I was surprised at the...

About once every six months, I get a MASSIVE craving for a vegetarian gyro from Nicks. I love EVERYTHING about this place. The interior is perfectly kitschy, the food is fantastic, and the pies .... oooooohhhhh the pies.
Good food, good portions, fast, cheap. I am addicted to Noodles.
Love Noodles & Company. Walk up to the top level for a view

Got wisconsin mac and cheese in reg size.. The size was too big for me, it's better to have someone to share it with u. The taste was okay tho, and the meatball made it better.. Awesome.. Affordable price, large portion, and good taste..

The outside looks like a small little shop, but the inside is teeming with space! After ordering on the first level, customers can venture to any on the three levels and take in lovely views of the Madison cityscape. A clean place, quirky layout, good service, and tasty food make for a meal well done! Personal favorites: Japanese Pan Noodles and Pad Thai

I've order takeout twice from this Noodles and Company. I've got the Pad Thai both times (it's one of my favorite foods!) and it was just okay. Not very flavorful and really kind of bland compared to other Pad Thai I've had in Madison.
Noodles is a great place for kids and take out.

Fast food noodle place with a wide variety on the menu. Ordered the Japanese pan noodles which were just alright. Beware that adding meat (ex. chicken) increases the price. Won't be running back, but it served it's purpose as a quick lunch.

Best Location. If you never want Noodles & Company, come to this location. They offer the best and cleanest service here. I've been to other ones all over town and even out of the area, but this one on the East side stands out.
Pros: fast, delicious!, reasonably priced, great service cons: iced tea tasted like sweaty socks

Our family's go-to fast food when, none of us want pizza, chinese, or burgers and such. There always seems to be something for everyone. Mac and cheese is awesome, but way too boring as a my main meal, i just steal a bite from the kids. They've now added a couple of jazzed up mac and cheese dishes to the menu that are worth a try. I've tasted the BBQ Pork Mac & Cheese, which was very good. I tend to choose my tried and true dishes, but trying to sample their other offerings. I have to say though...
Lots of Noodles. This place is usually packed, but a good standby when you don't know what to do for dinner.
Mac and cheese!!!. Sometimes I get this undeniable craving for their mac and cheese! Basic but so-o-o good.

This location has very friendly staff! They were very interactive and my food came out very fast! And of course it was delicious as well! Great place to stop for lunch!  -----02 Feb, 2014----- This location has very friendly staff! They asked were very interactive and my food came out very fast! And of course it was delicious as well! Great place to stop for lunch!

Service         3.5 Environment 4 Food.           3.5 Cost.            3.5 It's allways crowded and  full we were waiting to be seated nearly 1/2 hr . This is my 4 th time visit to old fashioned  3 times for dinner n 1 time for breakfast. We ordered cheese curd  with garlic sause and no 35 eggplant sandwiche Cheese curd were awsum  very tasty do sure try cheese curd over yere . Eggplant sandwiche was not that great i think the eggplant was not properly cooked. Last time we have tried for breakfa...
Fancy area, good bar food. The cheese curds are what bumped it up. The grilled cheese was good, but not the best. Unexpected style of bun for the pair of bratwursts.

BEST CHEESE CURDS ON EARTH. Great location right on the square, nice drinks (old fashioned's of course) always a wait for a table because it's so good. Love this Madison staple! For real tho, the curds. 🙌🏼
Great cheese curds the best in Wisconsin. The drinks are also great I would suggest the old fashioned it's the best I've ever had. We come here every time we are in Madison.

I went to the Old Fashioned for lunch this week. I had heard good things about it from friends and it did not disappoint. There were a variety of sandwiches and salads on the menu as well as sides, cheese-boards, and a number of entrees for dinner. I had the prime-rib sandwich with onion strings and my dining partner had the reuben and salad. The portions are huge, the prices are reasonable, and the flavors were all delicious! One unusual thing about lunch, was after they seat you at your table,...
1st time there and was pleased. Damien our waiter was the second best server we have ever had(1st was at cheesecake factory). Will definitely go back again

A great place for dinner. I go to the Olive Garden in other cities on occasion, but this one on the west side of Madison is above and beyond the others. I always have great service and they always keep the breadsticks coming! I love the never ending pasta bowl and cant get enough of that chicken and gnocchi soup! The west side olive garden has become a standard choice for my husband and I, we always leave happy and full :)

I recently went to olive garden on east towne blvd and found the apricot chicken quite good from a change of everything pasta there to excellent cooked chicken breasts with a tangy apricot sauce ( not over loaded ) and a side of asparagus and tomato was refreshing from like i said a boat load of unneeded pasta.

Okay. I pretty much got over Olive Gardens after I got out of college, but I still end up eating at them a few times a year, usually because they're inoffensive places for groups. There is always a ridiculous wait no matter when you go, most of the entrees look better on the menu than they taste, and it really isn't that much cheaper than more authentic and better local alternatives.  Still, I do like the soup, salad, and breadsticks lunch. I normally go with the zuppa toscana (the one with sau...

One of the few good places to go at this end of Madison. We were greeted by courteous staff and promptly given a table despite a sell out. We started by ordering the cheese fondue, and my god was it org*smic! Sad that it had got over. The wine went beautifully with the cheese fondue. The ravioli was a tad bit disappointing though; under cooked and a bit too sweet to my linking. Beautiful Ambience and aroma, will definitely come here again when i visit Madison next.

A great place for dinner .  I specially love the bread sticks and salad .  They are so fresh n yummy can have it any time . Last time we ordered  Chicken parmigiana and  garlic rosemary  chicken , they were not so tasty so if you r a big fan of spicy food i guess you will not like it .  So second time we tried Chicken scampi  it tastes like a lot of garlic flavor n chicken was grilled .  And meat balls with spegati  They were really yummy .  Service was pretty gud though it was crowded for dinne...

Opus is a classy alternative to a lot of the bars on state street that cater to the college crowd and is only a short walk from the state street area making it a great place to do drinks before or after a show at the overture, majestic, or bartell theater. They have a very creative drink selection including a section of their menu devoted to champagne cocktails and another for martinis and specialty drinks. The peanut butter martini was AMAZING and I will definitely be back for another.

Opus is our go-to venue for most any night of the week. Their menu is amazing, their service is exceptional, and their location is hard to beat. I recommend a Jealousy, Crostini, Crab Cakes, and a sushi roll on a warm Wednesday evening in the Summer.
Tempura vegetables, bruschetta, crab cakes, sour cream & onion dip, and tempura shrimp sushi. Excellent meal for 2.
Terrible service! Took 45 minutes to get a drink. Server refused to give happy hour special, even though it wasn't the cutoff time.
Excellent cocktails and service in a very nice, friendly atmosphere.                       A short, but well-chosen tap beer selection, as well as a comprehensive choice of liquors.

Breakfast food was amazing. Great service, very organized. Stopped in after a ski trip to get some breakfast, i had a amazing apple pancake. Omelets and pancakes are top notch. Only con sign that said no guns.....what about the second amendment...?
Had better food. The price vs portion is not good. Would not recommend. However the service was great.
Huge Omelettes. The omelettes here are gigantic and REALLY good. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait to get a table, but the food is worth the wait. Nice little spot.

They have the BEST blueberry pancakes I've ever had. They are melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Their omlettes are also fantastic, but be sure to arrive hungry because they're huge. It's always worth the wait.

The Dutch Delight. That's all you need to know. Best thing on the menu. Amazing Dutch pancake with fresh strawberries and bananas. I have no idea how they get strawberries that good....in Wisconsin....during the winter.

Great experience. Found this hidden gem on Urbanspoon. We really liked the atmosphere, quiet and intimate. All 4 of us really liked our meals. Our server recommended the Sea Bass which was amazing. The service was excellent. The majority of the menu is gluten free for those who require it. Would go again.
Great service. Great food. The restaurant is so cute inside and the patio seating is great in the summer!
Off the road gem. Hidden behind a grove of trees on a major city street, who would think there was such a place! Lovely menu and wine list, staff was so personable. Pricey but worth every penny.

Relaxing. Hidden gem is right, with emphasis on hidden. Otto's is tucked behind an office building on Mineral Point and I had probably driven by a hundred times before I noticed their sign. The interior layout is a bit odd with many different levels (it's a restored home), but seemed nice enough. We dined on the deck, which with the perfect weather and live music offered a relaxing atmosphere.  A fresh mini loaf of complementary bread started the meal off on a good note. The grilled prosciutto-...
The Sea Bass was amazing!  The charcuterie board was best in class!  Service and drinks were impeccable! Scallops were delicious.  We will visit again.
Best Chain Resturant in madison. I just love there salads there so cold and crispy and the bread they give you is awesome. I love the steaks all of them and the awesome blossom is great bar food.

Impressed!. We don't eat at Outback very often but last week we made our way over to the Outback on the far west side. It was late so by that time the restaurant was pretty much empty which was nice since we were able to have a nice, quiet dinner.  Our waiter was very nice and attentive. He provided us what we needed when we needed it. There was just some confusion about drink orders when we first sat down but once everything was clarified we were good to go.  The food was very good and my s...

Wonderful Prime Riib. I Love the prime rib ordered medium rare...I have had it to go also and it is still very good...we have had great service when we've eaten there and fast service for food to go...I've found their prime rib to be one of the best around...just wish they had lobster on their menu.
This has to be one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant. I Sat in the bar area for 15 minutes and nobody tried to help until I was leaving.  The restaurant was not even busy.

Wonderful prime rib. We enjoy the steaks and seafood, but the prime rib has become a favorite for me. A word of caution - if you order the prime rib rare, it will be quite rare. If you like it warm, order it medium rare. I am a fan of rare steaks, but at the Outback that means a very cool center which is a bit much for prime rib. The service is always friendly and professional and the physical plant is appealing. We try to go early or late to avoid the crowds and noise. We prefer the west side t...
Bad bad bad. Bad service small portions. food was alright but for how expensive it is i was not satisfied

Not interested in pleasing huge crowd of customers. I was not impressed with the manager, staff at all. We came to this restaurant with 9 of my family after my daughter graduated from college. We asked to be seated together and the manager said "well I will tell you that is not going to happen". We asked well could you at least put some tables together. Again he said "well I will tell you that is not going to happen". My family were all scattered at 3 different tables! The food was ordered and m...

OK, so maybe this place had a major turn around? I eat out 4 times a week because of my job and tonight I went with 3 co-workers and had wonderful meals and service. My grilled salmon and lobster tail was excellent and everyone else enjoyed their meal and service very much. Overall a great experience!. Oh, and the young lady that was offering samples was super sweet and even let us try a few things while we had our dinner. I am a VERY picky restaurant patron but I would definitely go back to thi...

Surprisingly Good. We went to this place looking for a good steak, but away from downtown. So going to a chain, it wasn't really expected. But this place really surprises. The steak is finished simply, letting the quality of the meat speak for itself without too much salt or over-seasoning.  The house salad was delicious (mustard vinagrette) and the seasonal vegetables were a fantastic mix (ask them to hold the butter).  I wouldn't recommend getting the seafood, it's a bit over-priced. But i...

Great Food. We stumbled across this place in Madison. I was a little leery of going into a hotel restaurant, but my apprehension was put to rest when I saw the menu. I had the duck, which was served over noodles. The food was astounding. I'm not entirely sure why this restaurant hasn't moved out of the hotel - as I'm sure they would be doing a lot better on their own.  This was a great meal and I would recommend this to anyone.

Impressive. We had intended to start with something else, but the waitress said the braised calamari was one of the chef's specialties, so we followed her lead. I have only ever had calamari in the common breaded and fried fashion, so this was certainly a change of pace. It was served in a broth with peppers, which didn't overwhelm the calamari but provided a really great range of flavors. The calamari itself was a little chewy, but we still liked the dish. My wife's strip was cooked perfectly a...

Love the sauces. I had a wonderful dinner here last night. I had the scallops with three fantastic dipping sauces. The choices of the sauces are extensive. It's great being able to try some from everyone at your table. The service was excellent. the dessert was presently beautifully and was a perfect portion size. I can't wait to go back.

The Sauce(s) is the Boss. Tried the Swordfish special May 29th. Not only was the fish cooked to perfection, but the sauces that the chef is known for paired wonderfully with the meal. We all tried each other's accompanying sauces, and they were all great. My wife ordered the salmon special, and the flavor and crust on the fish were exquisite. I would definitely go back.

Don't go there - Not worth the time and money. Total bill for one glass of water, very small caesar salad, 9" pepperoni pizza, and 18% mandatory tip and tax was $19.68. I complained about the tip and the fat manager waddled over and told me they had high tips because they don't pay the wait staff much over $2.00 - I told him that was not my problem. Service was not outstanding, pizza was burned black on bottom, and it was way too salty. I only had a small caesar and a glass of water. The servi...

Great Italian food a excellent location downtown. Worth the wait to sit in the patio in the summer and enjoy the beautiful view of Lake Monona. The porta salad (while I'm sure terrible for you) is delicious. Gluten free bread provides some sandwich options for those wih celiac or gluten sensitivities. Waiting patiently for gluten free pizza crust : )

The worst alfrefo pasta. Overcooked and the salsa was just taken out of the can. I was there with 3 people more and any of us could finish at less half of the plate.  Este ha sido uno de los peores restaurantes italianos que he visitado. No lo recomiendo, ni siquiera por la vista al lago.

Went there on a Sunday around 1:00. Drinks are good and cheap thanks to Happy hour. The service was terrible. We fealt like we were intruding even though we were customers. Food was below what it usually is.

We'd heard great things about Paisan's and the pizza did not disappoint. Crispy, thin crust which is always my favorite. Intense, delicious red sauce, full of herbs, tomatoes, bustling flavors. Ours was topped with sliced onions, banana peppers, sausage, and pepperoni. We went with the spicy cheese blend and it was velvety smooth and melded well with everything else. It was truly delicious and we devoured every bite.   We also ordered the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer. These did not compare ...

Yummy breads, sweet rolls, soups, sandwiches, coffee/latte, bagels. Can't complain! Even pretty tasty almond quinoa oatmeal! Funny story.... had an early doctors appointment and needed an acceptable healthy breakfast while out. Standing in line here at Panera, with a couple girls behind me. As I spot this particular oatmeal on the menu, felt a little excited/relived, and then hear one of the girls also spot it and say to her friend, "Who comes to Panera and orders that?? 'Giggle'". Well that wou...
Bring it to the UK. I love this place, when I visit Lisa in Madison, we go here, love the holiday bread.... please someone bring it to London and all over the UK!

Good Spot For A Quick Lunch. I was a little disappointed the last time I was here--they messed up my order, giving me a cold turkey sandwich instead of a grilled turkey panini. It was okay, but their warm sandwiches are much better. The soups are quite good here too.  The atmosphere isn't quite as warm and cozy as some other Panera restaurants I've been to, but it still clean and comfortable. It does get pretty busy during the lunch hour. Grade: B-
Love it, love it, love it!!! My favorite is the broccoli cheese soup and the chipotle chicken sandwich!!

Oops I meant sweet and zesty Vlassic pickle chip!  -----04 Oct, 2010----- I love how you can take loaves of bread home! I like to get their French baguette, slice it up, spread some garlic and herbs boursin cheese and to top it off with a sweet and zest basic pickle chip. Sounds disgusting but is phenomenal! It's great without the pickle too. But you have to at least give the pickle a go. I think it's better that way. I like the broccoli cheddar soup and most sandwiches from Panera!
Tasty. The soup and sandwiches are very good. I stop here regularily to buy bagels and bread. My only complaint is their cream cheese - not as good as other shops that make their own.

Tasty. Although not as good as it used to be back in the days when the meat was not sliced off early and held in a pan, this is still a pretty good spot to have a gryos. We often stop here after plays at the Overture Center. Remember not to go before the play as the garlic in the food will not be appreciated by the person sitting next to you!

This is the spot to go in Madison for a gyro! Just make sure that when you eat one you are prepared to get FUNKY, as they are covered in onions and garlic! I get a side of feta, and the fries bc that's how it's supposed to be done. And if you're hungover, this is the spot to go!

This location has AWFUL service. When I called, they were unfriendly on the phone and assumed I was a local when I gave my phone number (I'm not, thus they had it wrong). As a result, I waited more than an hour for my food. When I called to check, the took down my address and brought my order, unfortunately it was ice cold when it arrived. Will definitely be going elsewhere from now on.
Delicious wholsome Italian. Cant go wrong here. Just a great hearty italian restaurant with quality ingredients and a knack for creativity.   I'm a fan
Delish! The flavors in these dishes merry wonderfully together. I chose the pork tenderloin with polenta and the lentil soup.

Disappointing experience. My wife and I just came back from Osteria Papavero for Winter Restaurant Week 2014. We had already had a phenomenal meal earlier in the week at Sardine, but we figured we'd end the week by trying somewhere new. Most users from Urban Spoon, Yelp, Google, etc, seem to have nothing but great things to say about this establishment, so we figured worst case would have an enjoyable meal, best case we'd love it and make it a weekly favorite. The interior is fairly cozy and has...

We had dinner on a Wednesday night and we arrived to an empty house, so obviously we got good service. Nice quaint restaurant on a quiet street.   They had a specialty beer (a sour amber) from Italy on tap, which was a good choice. Their daily specials were an impressive listing, and we opted for the cheese stuffed poblano special appetizer along with the veggie trio. Both appetizers were great, with the poblano taking the cake.   For dinner, the boar pasta was the clear winner. Great flavor...

We tried lunch at Osteria Papavero this week. We arrived @11:45 and were told to pick our seats. There are about a dozen or so tables inside and a few outside as well. It was bright, clean, and smelled amazing. There were only a few customers there when we arrived so we chose a window table. Our waitress quickly brought us menus and told us the specials. They all sounded delectable. She returned after a few minutes to take our order. My dining companion ordered the lasagna which was one of the s...

A friend and I went for lunch and had a bad experience. The waitress overcharged us for our meal and would not acknowledge it. My friend ordered an item off the menu that cost $4.50. The waitress charged her $5.22, stating that with tax $5.22 was the correct amount. Obviously, the waitress didn't go too far in school because 5.5% sales tax on $4.50 is not .72 cents. She wouldn't believe us when we tried to correct her and she became very rude. Another person working there insisted that the food ...

The Finest .... Ever since my very young very drunk 20s, I have said, and continue to say, that the Paradise is the home of the finest fried mushrooms in all the land. Cheap, strong drinks and a slamming jukebox dont hurt either ... But honestly, The fried mushrooms. Put.Them.In.You.

Breakfast With a Capital B. My favorite spot for breakfast. "Family Restaurant" means that it is run by a family who work long, hard hours to make their customers TRULY feel "at home". You won't receive better, friendlier service anywhere - PERIOD. I love to hear Chef belly-laughing from the grill. What a great way to start the day!
Classic greasy spoon.
Fantastic. Super fast service. Delicious. Well priced. Would stop again.

I was on a business trip and found the Parkway restaurant on Urban Spoon. Despite the decor, the food was hot, quick, and delicious. My team and I had breakfast and we all were very happy with our food and we would all come back again!

BEST Gyro I Ever Had. I live out of state, and every time I am in the Madison, WI area I ALWAYS go here for a gyro. I have been eating at Parthenon since the early 2000's. Let me tell you, it's love at first bite, not to mention the outstanding service. You're probably thinking that Greek food so far North cannot be any good, but the gyros and fries and pitza are stellar; everything from the tender and savory lamb cooked daily on the spit to the soft yet flavorful pita bread. THOSE GYROS are to ...
I've had gyros from other places in Madison, but I keep coming back to the Parthenon. I don't think I'll stray again. When I want good souvlaki or gyros and I'm in Madison, here is where I'll go.

Delicious! These gyros are so good. The bread is just right... chewy, warm and tender. The perfectly seaoned gyro meat is accented so nicely with the rings of onions and tomato slices... and the tzaziki sauce on top..... perfect! I normally order the chicken-bob and that is amazing too. Really love sitting upstairs on the terrace when the weather is nice. So relaxing. Pretty view of the Capitol too.

This place is EVERYTHING! Great afternoon state street lunch, or good bar time drunk food. Ive only ever had the veggie gyro, spanakopita, veggie pizza, fries and baklava, but Ive NEVER been disappointed. The price is right, and the quality is always spot on whether its 2pm or 2am.
The first gyro I ever tried, and it totally spoiled me. Haven't been able to find a gyro like it since. Gyro, fries, and a lemonade is still my all time favorite Madison meal.
Exceptional margaritas! Always go 'on the rocks' with fresh fruit juice (orange and lime) instead of sweet and sour.
Great breakfast burrito. The blue corn pancakes are fantastic.

Not a good change - Pasqual's-Monroe. My family used to love the Pasqual's on Monroe Street (the new location). One walked in the door, ordered, filled your own drink, and seated yourself. Now, there is a host/hostess and wait staff. With this new change has come excessive wait times (and more costs). We were there a couple of days ago, when waited a long time for our drinks and chips, and then waited some more before we had the opportunity to order. In the meantime, parties seated after us, ord...

On a Friday night, lost the kids 15 minutes ago, still waiting for the check. It was painfully slow tonight and while the food was tasty it was a bit too salty from start to finish. Margaritas remain strong but at $9 a pop I would expect as much. I don't hate it I don't love it, 3 stars.
They ruined it... Now you wait for a server to take your order. Waited 5 minutes and watched people who arrived after me get served... This was my favorite place in town, will clear like vote next.

Consistently bad service, poorly managed.. I've been to Pedro's a handful of times, and it has steadily gone down hill every visit. Last visit was the last straw. Waited to be seated 20min though restaurant wasn't even 25% full. Asked for a table, owner sat us in a booth. Waiter took 7min to approach table, owner had to remind him. Took another 10min to get 4 WATERS. Ordered, waited 30min which is quite long for Mexican food. Waiter never brought tortilla shells with fajitas, I asked for them an...

I Know........... I know it's not authentic. I don't care. The food is decent, The service is prompt and good. The prices are fair. I have met friends for lunch, brought customers and dined her often with family. I have never been upset.  I REALLY WISH THEY WOULD REOPEN THEIR WEST SIDE LOCATION.
Not even close.... Not authentic in any way, shape, or form! Very disappointed but knew it would be hard to find GREAT Mexican food so far North.
To go order was wrong. Manager was rude and curt. Said he'd send coupon or something in the mail which we never received. Go to Laredos instead.
Unless you want to wait for 45 minutes for poorly prepared food, don't come here. Terribly understaffed and the food sucked. On a positive note, the waitress was very friendly
Absolutely wonderful! Gyros were light, not greasy like campus town. Super delicious!!
Best Donut I've Had in Madison.. This place is wonderful. There is such a huge variety of donuts and I am really excited to try out their dinner menu too. The prices are reasonable as well.
Dirty and scary. I think the other reviews are made up. Caution.

Oh Greg: If you want appleby's this isnt your place. it mom-and-pop all the way. Great humus platter, yummy donuts. They've even started an order while I've run an errand and it's ready to go when I get back.

Ok, let's just be honest here. The "decor" leaves much to be desired. But really, this is not why I stop at People's Bakery. It's those damn doughnuts (the French crullers to be specific). These guys make the most amazing doughnuts, the French cruller as you've now learned are my favorite. I can easily inhale 3 or 4 of these buggers at a time. They are perfectly light and and airy, and the glaze hugs the outside so perfectly, they just melt in your mouth. God I love 'em. I've also had the kibbe ...

OMG waited ten minutes for the server to get our drinks and food ordered..people literally right next to us just sat down and got served before us..kitchen is Extremely loud and some lady just whipped her titty out to feed her 2 year old..never again

Friendly service. I have always has a good experience at this Perkins. All the servers are friendly and knowledgable. I enjoy going for the potato pancakes. IHOP has frozen ones but the ones at Perkins aren't. Yummm!
Good burger and gyros... Server was really nice and friendly.  -----28 Feb, 2012----- Nice neighborhood bar and grill. God food and great service.

Madcity Marty. Well to be honest that Andy Roo Guy showed up again and added flavor to everything he touched but you still have to ask for it until they realize it needs to go on everything! There still getting use to flavor and being able to breathe in that place. No longer the smoke pit.. But try the burgers with the Andy Roo's BBQ Grill seasoning and the fries with the Cajun Garlic seasoning, You can't lose with Andy Roo's. Yeah I just made that up. Write that down...Butdon't forget to ask fo...
Pub is a little deceiving it's a bar. But the food is okay and the people are nice.
They tell you one price for drinks but charge another... If you order food and do not get it in 30 seconds they sell it to someone else. Both owners are ass hats do not go here terrible place!!!!!!

Great pizza!. Love PDR, have been ordering from here for years. The Spinach/Feta pizza is unbelievably good and the pizza is still awesome when delivered. The mozzarella sticks aren't good and never order a caesar salad for delivery - when I say it showed up as a hot soup, I'm not joking.
Just tastes like Grease. The pizza was way too greasy and had no flavor, Ians is way better.
Worst. Ordered online and never got my food.
Average pizza place. The price is right and the taste is fair. Nothing I'd line up for, but it's pretty quick and open late. Plenty of options to choose from.
Best.thing.ever.. This is, hands down, my favorite late night food. Like, ever. I order it at work, I eat it drunk, I eat it the night before a triathlon. It is perfect.
To the Max. Extremely mediocre. There are so many decent pizza places in Madison. This one just happens to rank near the bottom.
Try the Hawaiian pizza. Best Hawaiian pizza I've tried yet! Reheats well!

Husband placed an order for delivery. Considering we are just blocks away, the fact that we waited a long time didn't make much sense. I reluctantly tried a slice even though ive had less than stellar experiences before with them.  Of course, the pizza was highly disappointing. I believe he ordered the hand-tossed. Very bready... too much bread... doughy almost (you can see in one of the pics how thick the crust is). The cheese didn't seem to be best quality. As the pizza cooled, the cheese laye...
What?  I asked for oregano. They say they never carry oregano? You are not in Chicago anymore toto. If you want great pizza go to Chicago. Sweet home Chicago the pizza capital. Mmm good and tasty.

Surprisingly good. Laziness took hold last Saturday. We decided to stay in and watch the non-existent rapture from the relatively removed vantage point of the deck. And what better to eat on this occasion than pizza? Our default is Glass Nickel, but J was remembering fondly the days when his mom would order Pizza Pit. I haven't had Pizza Pit in about 7 years. We ordered the deluxe and it was FANTASTIC! The sausage had this wonderful spice, there were lots of toppings and the perfect amount of ch...
Pizza Extreme has the best Chicago-style pizza in Madison. Great crust and sauce. Great chicken drummies too!
Placed an order online, and it took 1.5 hours for it to be delivered. Then the pizza was tipped and smooshed in the box. Won't be ordering delivery from them ever again.
The food is decent for pub food. The cook is decent although deaf making communication hard And it also depends who you are and if the owner is there when it comes to portion size and extra effort.
A classic State St. tavern that hasn't changed in decades. Stiff drinks, good taps, local sports and a diverse crowd keep the crowds coming back week after week.

Dive bar. This off State Street bar has been around for ages and hasn't been updated since then! They claim to have the best burger in Madison and really don't have bragging rights here as their burger is below par - tasteless bun, small beef patty with a good sauce. Many spots in Madison serve much better burgers. BUT, the selection of beer is very good and mid-range expensive. With so many good pubs around, my trips to the Plaza Tavern are limited to once a decade or so.

First time, not last time. I finally made it to the Plaza Tavern for a Plazaburger; I was not disappointed. The burger, with grilled onions and cheddar cheese was great. The Plaza Tavern itself was a pleasant surprise, being more of a bar then a restaurant with lots of atmosphere and a few characters. the staff was very nice, and the service was GREAT. I will be going back for sure
It's a bar burger -- how high can your expectations really be?

Awful Awful Awful. Here's a pub that just doesn't live up to the dream. The place is decorated right, lots of flat-screens, tall ceiling covered with pennants and other memorabilia, simple seating that will survive many drunken guests... yet it just doesn't deliver.  For one thing, the TVs are the wrong aspect ratio. I know this is a food review but for a pub, watching football with all the players stretched vertically is just plain annoying. You'd think they'd fix it, but it's a problem on mu...

Cool atmosphere, but terrible service. Not sure if it was our server's first day on the job, but literally every table around us was complaining. Sooooo slow. Forgetful. Doesn't know what food is on the menu and grumpy. Terrible, terrible, terrible!
Craptastic. Bland uninspired food. If you find yourself hungry inside Pooleys, don't panic, relax, and wait til you can get to a fast food place.

Compressed chicken. Everything else but my main course was actually really good but i will never go back because the chicken breast in my pasta was obviously compressed chicken. Also my girlfriends meal was basically just stuffed cheese rolls that were inedible and i love cheese.

Froozen Food and dim lights to hide the dirt. My girlfriend ordered lasagna and I had chicken Parmesan. Hers was still frozen in the middle and mine was very cold. No really cooking here, just warming up. The place at first glance it a nice romantic atmosphere but if you look just a bit closer you'll see the mirror'd walls haven't been wiped down in ages. People have started to draw picture sin them. Waitress was definitely drunk or on drugs but still nice, just slow and never gave us refills. ...

Getting better. Went a few years ago for prom and the food was terrible. Went back on a first date and found it had greatly improved. First, the place itself was cleaner, so I was actually able to take my mind off of that and just enjoy myself. Second, more importantly the food tasted better. The bread was more flavorful and the salad tasted fresher. The salads are never great just increasingly improving. For the main course, I got shrimp and scallop scampi. It was delicious. It was still very h...

I expected more.. The service was great and the atmosphere was cozy, so I really wanted to like this place. The garlic bread was just like the frozen loaves I buy and throw in the oven at home. The tomato basil soup was good, but wasn't really special. I tried a bite of my husband's Porta Salad and that was quite good. I was really let down by my entree. I ordered the Chicken Tetrazzini and Lasagna Combination. The lasagna was really wet, with a lot of meat and not much cheese. It was also over ...

The saving grace of this restaurant is the food. I find the atmosphere tacky (many call it romantic but I don't see it) and I have had poor service and inattentive waiters on multiple visits. However, I think the food here is delicious. I would liken the selection to Olive Garden, but the food is much better and isn't processed and gross. The pricing is also similar to an Olive Garden. You start your meal with salad and unlimited bread with spicy hot tasting oil (yum!). The chicken and seafood t...

A classic. Potbelly turkey sandwiches are one of the staples of my diet. I come here for consistently great subs and fast service. If you like spicy, you absolutely have to try the hot peppers -- they're giardiniera peppers and they can't compare to anything else! I'm moving away from Madison soon and I'm literally going to buy the hot peppers in bulk (they sell them at Potbelly) and take them back to the east coast with me. Love love love this place and I will miss it!

Very "Madison". This Potbelly on State St feels like Madison in a nutshell: the architecture, the ambiance, the crowd, everything. Every time I've been there, live music has been performing in the corner with a guitar case open for tips. The subs are always amazing, and the seats are really uncomfortable...but it great! If you're just passing through Madison, make it a point to stop at Potbelly.
A quick bite stop for sandwiches quite close to campus and after nights out in the state street area. Service is friendly and quick and mushroom melts a good vegetarian option.
The grilled chicken and cheddar is one of my favorite hot subs ever. Also, the best hot peppers of any sandwich shop. Neat place, with occasional live music.

Always a wait here-longer wait then subway and not just because they toast their subs. They are delicious but pricey. In my hometown they would be willing to customize the sub. It wasn't possible to try with this particular one.

Terrible!. I came there twice, they overcharged me on EVERYTHING I ordered. When I argued, they refused to adjust the charge according to their advertised menu and said it was not their fault. Do not buy anything from them. They are not honest people.

The rating comes more for the chain than the specific outlet. Sandwiches are okay but pricey for similar options. Service is friendly but sometimes slower than expected for fast food. Broccoli cheese soup is a good option here.

My ffirst time eating lobster. I had the ultimate feast and the wife had the fire grilled salmon and coconut shrimp. Everything was fresh and the fish was flaky and delicious. Our bill was about 53$. Definitely worth coming back for. The lobster is wonderful Service was great as well.
Tiny tables. Almost always await. Service is subpar. Food always looked better on TV. Disappointing everytime.
Was very unhappy - the appatizer was a conglomeration of grease infused cheese and the main dish lacked tasty (and this for Lobster fest) - and at $40.00 I expect something other then paper napkins.

Wellllll..... if I'm craving crab legs, garlic biscuits or a shrimpwreck bloody mary this is the place to go. Generic seafood mostly smothered in garlic sauces so the seafood is beyond recognition. Not the best quality seafood, and I know this and remember this, but I still occasionally get a craving to eat here. Not sure why. Pretty much consistent in service which is good, food - fair, and long wait for a table.
Good burgers, but they got rid of the fried zucchini.
Good. It was fast when we were in a hurry to catch a movie plus you can get plenty of fries!!! mmmmm!

Stopped here with the fam, and since this was my "cheat day" I ordered the Black & Bleu burger, with a side of bottomless steak fries. That burger was fabulously tasty. Moist and tender grilled black Angus beef, grilled portobello mushrooms, caramelized onions, bleu cheese sauce AND bleu cheese crumbles.....perfect combo of flavors. It tasted so good, (and feeling stuffed already halfway through the burger) I was loving the flavors so much I managed to make the whole thing disappear. Fries were ...
Best sushi in Madison. Hands down the best sushi in Madison. From my experience also the most expensive but definitely worth it. The "asian slaw" is a great appetizer and the sushi is always fresh

Great time, and wonderful sushi!. My wife and I stopped in for a late dinner. The waitress had many tables, but took a moment to cover the basics with us and be sure we knew what we where getting into.  We had a lovely meal! We tryed a combo, and took off trying other plates as the waitress checked on us.  The cuts and quality of fish where all wonderful and very well displayed.

Will do Again!. We had a great night out. This has been on my list for some time. We have eaten at Sushi Muramoto at Hilldale and have always been pleased. We started with the potato salad....that right potato salad! It was awesome, Bacon, cucumbers, it was a perfect starter. We had two sushi plates Duck and Spicy Shrimp. Finished with Coconut Shrimp. This dish is not what you are thinking. It is not deep fired or tempura, it is in a spicy broth with tail on shrimp that melt in your mouth. It wa...

We went to Muramoto for lunch during the week last week. There was a decent crowd but it was not crowded. Our server as friendly and attentive, although not quite sure of the menu. My dining partner and I ordered the Chef's Choice and the Your Choice combo which includes a vegetable roll, a fish roll, and a inside out roll. The sushi rolls were all good, certainly not outstanding but for $10-$12 dollars per combo a decent value. The dinner menu had more options and sounded more appetizing. Altho...
Great sushi, great service, great cocktails. The menu changes often enough that you can always plan to try something new and amazing. I love this place.
I havent liked any of the entrees I've tried here except for the Tom yum spicy noodle soup which I do love.

Yummy. I went there a while back, I got the red curry dish. I swear it was the best thai red curry I've ever had, it had the best flavor, perfect amount of spice, absolutely delicious. The service was good, we sat outside, their outdoor area was really interesting and I really loved the entire experience.
