My only visit and experience was yesterday for take-out. Theres a decent sized bar and comfy stools you can sit at, or a few tables/ booths i think. Its a long and narrow space, but seems to work. I stopped in around 2:30 in the afternoon and it was super quiet in there. I ordered the vegetarian mango curry. When I got it home and opened it up I was srprised to see how liquidy and soupy it was, compared to any other mango curries I've had in the past from other restaurants. I was pleasantly surp...

We arrived at Rising Sun Deli around 12:30 on a weekday. A waitress greeted us a we walked in and told us to take a seat wherever we liked. We sat near the door. I would not recommend this on a cold Wisconsin day. Every time a customer came in or out a cold wind came with them.  We started with the kalapao and beef jerky. The jerky was sweet, tangy, chewy, not dry and utterly delicious. I could eat a plate of that. The kalapao is a sweet bun filled with pork and hard-boiled egg. It was rustic lo...

This is one of my favorite places to eat. The food is fresh and very tasty. The service is fast and accurate. The bad prt is that they do not take credit card, that sucks. They could make more clients that way.  I order the curry squash with shrimp last time and it was amazing.

Don't walk away, run.. Gee whiz. My self and two friends went to this Rocky's and were expecting the typical pizza quality from Rocky Rococo's. We opened the door and were warmly welcomed by an awful smell of unknown origin, most likely a combination of overflowing garbage and "used pizza." The slices each of us decided to eat must have been sitting under heater for at least a week judging by the state that they were in. A vast majority (60%) of the tables had overflowing trays of trash from pre...

We stayed at the Super 8 next door and ordered a pie to go. It was Valentines Day so it was pretty busy, it was good, typical Rocky's pizza. Not my favorite pizza as I don't like pizza so doughy. The place was pretty clean and staff was nice
Waiting and waiting and waiting. I've seriously sat twenty minutes plus waiting on a pepperoni slice. How can you run out of pepperoni pizza in Madison? It's like the most ordered pizza!!

Fantastic Pizza and great service. They have the best local beer taps and the have Two Hearted. I had a ceasar salad which was a traditional ceasar which no one does anymore. We had the Roman Candle and the Prodessional. Dough was perfect and the topping were fresh and well balanced. Love it.

Favorite Madison Pizza. Roman Candle is my favorite area pizza and a recent trip to this location only confirmed that. The crust is thin, though not crispy, the toppings are fresh, and the sauce has a nice seasoning that helps set this place apart. There are a lot of specialties to choose from or just make your own. You can't go wrong with Roman Candle.  The interior is similar to the Middleton location, though space is at a premium here. Service is friendly, prices are reasonable (higher than ...

LOOONG DELIVERY TIME!!!!. 1pizza ordered & my house is 1 min down the street which = 1 hour & 20 min delivery time. Ended up serving other food to the kids since it turned into nap time. A hour & 20 min for a pizza delivery down the street- come on! Wish I could say this was a isoloated issue, but its not. Mybe on site service is better?????

We had a coupon so decided to try out The Roman Candle Pizzeria. Upon entering we were told to sit where ever we wanted. The booths on the sides all have little table-tops which pull down from the walls to put the pizzas on over the tables themselves. For the center tables, they bring out stands to put the pizzas on. Our waiter promptly came by w/menus and asked for our drink order. We asked for a couple of minutes to peruse the menu and that began the rather slow response time.  When our server...
This is the location you want!. If you want the tasty tasty food they serve, this location is the Roman Candle you should be going to! The service at this one is actually good!
Solid pizza, over priced. $19 for a 12in.
This place is great, I eat here 3 times a week if that tells you anything...ribs, the cheef, and pizza are all some of the best!

Love Rosatti pizza. Delivery is reliable, and pizza always dependably good. Great thin crust. Crunchy and crispy in all the right places, and NOT floppy or doughy anywhere. My favorite specialty pizza is the Valentino (the sauce is a blend of their regular pizza sauce and bbq sauce, mmm....) topped with italian beef sausage, hot peppers (Oh yeah!) onions and tomatoes. All those toppings are blanketed with melted cheese. Heavenly. They cut their pizza into squares, if that matters to anyone, and ...
Best pizza ever! We recommend the Hawaiian.
Catering Order???. If your ordering from Rosati's for a large group you might want to think twice. Portions are small, food quality wasn't all there. While their pizza is good its kind of pricey!

Decent food, usually poor service. I've been ordering from Rosati's West since I moved to Madison. However, since they raised their prices, I don't feel like their meals are competitive anymore -- there's a lot of good other pizza joints around here. Also, their "customer service" is kinda crappy. Obviously, small mistakes happen - and they have multiple times before - (e.g. being charged for mayos that should have been included) but I never thought of writing a review up until tonight.   So, ...

Good Lunch from work. I really enjoy going here at least once a week for lunch to have the Italian Beef lunch special. It's very delicious, and since there is no Portillo's in Madison, this is as good as Italian Beef gets. Thumbs up!
Not for me. The website has all wrong pricing so bill was higher then expected even more depressing they didn't get our order right so we did eat much of it anyway.
Great Tom Yum soup. One of my favorite places in Madison. Quality is consistent and not overly pricey.

I'll be back. I went here for lunch a few days ago, and really enjoyed my Thai coffee, and one of the curries. It didn't look like a lot of food, but I was pleasantly full the rest of the afternoon. They have green papaya salad, which is next on my list!

Oldy but goody. We've been going to this restaurant for years. Oddly, we're not so much into Thai food - meaning main dishes. But ever since we started our first meal with appetizers years ago, we got hooked on those appetizers. We usually order two different appetizers per person, plus dessert at the end of the meal, and that is usually filling enough (but you won't get stuffed). We alternate out of the menu of a dozen or so appetizers, choosing different combinations every time we go there. Th...

Short Changed. Never go back to Sa Bai Thong as I went there with a friend some months ago an it was poor. The waitperson we had seemed annoyed we were there, it was a slow day and there was only one other table. My friend only had their version of Red curry not very good I had some but had eaten before picking her up so that was the only item we ordered. I was paying so gave wait staff a twenty for the one entree it came to about $9 I think. We sat and waited and waited. After fifteen minutes I...
Wonderful fresh food. Priced right. I would recommend this place.  -----27 Feb, 2013----- Wonderful fresh food.

Food was bland. The pho had no flavor at all. The service was disappointing. We had 5 different waitresses, which I do not like. How am I suppose to know who to tip? Doesn't matter though because none of them deserve a tip. We waited for over ten minutes after we finished eating for our check and no one gave it to us so we walked up to the front to pay. Never will I come to this place again. I should've just gone to the thai restaurant next door.

Great duck soup. Love Saigon noodles. Pleasant atmosphere, friendly service and reasonable prices. The duck soup is great and my go to favorite. Only down side is that it is very popular and often has a long line but I never have had to wait too long and it is certainly worth the wait. Wish they were open Mondays as that is my day off...I always forget they are closed and am really bummed.

I'm from Houston where Vietnamese noodle shops are simple, cheap and delicious. The food here was disappointing. I got the Bun, vermicelli with lemon grass beef. The beef didn't have a good lemongrass taste and was a strange shade of rust. The vermicelli and greens were alright but the seasoning was off. Too much vinegar? Not sure. The egg rolls were nice though.  It wasn't bad, just different and not to my tastes. I have to give thumbs down because if this was my first experience with Vietnam...

Loved It!. We were in town for a weekend family getaway and had not had Vietnamese since we had moved from Minneapolis. This was outstanding. The pho broth was spot on and the noodles were tender. The protein amount was a little shy than some places but the broth made up. Our children (3 and 8) asked to try it and they ended up becoming fans.  The service was wonderful as well as the atmosphere. We will be back when we are in town again.

We visited Saigon-Noodles on a wintry Sunday evening. As soon as we opened the door, the fresh spicy aromas delighted our noses. The restaurant was bright, open, and full of patrons. Our waitress brought us menus and seated us immediately.  Perusing the menu I encountered numerous dishes I wanted to try. We decided to try the Vietnamese Steamed Rice Rolls and I ordered the eye-round steak, flank-steak, and meatballs. Our waitress returned momentarily to take our order, and it was not long before...

Downhill. Went last night and it was very disappointing, as compared to past visits there. Service was lousy despite not being crowded. Never cleared plates from table. Never brought bread to table. Gouchos came around very infrequently. Food is downhill -- way too much seasoning. Parmesan pork and sausage too salty to even eat. Past experiences the food and service was good and worth the price. Last night very much not the case. All the more disappointing as we had brought friends who had never...

Lousy waitress. Ii fortunately we had a totally inept waitress with the initials KD. She took our drink order then left for good. I hailed the hostess to get it ten minutes later and a kind bus boy got us refills. Good thing she did remember the drinks she never filled on our bill. Would have been more understanding if it were busy but it wasn't. Otherwise the food was great and plentiful! Too bad a poor service delivery put a damper on our experience there.

Love the atmosphere. My husband and I go to Samba at least twice a year, he always chooses it as his birthday meal!. The restaurant itself is elegant and romantic, although on nights with live music the music can be quite loud. The first time or two I went to Samba I wasn't that impressed because I felt the meat was overcooked and dry, however, one day we happened to be off of work and we went earlier than usual and it was a completely different experience as the meat has not been kept in the wa...

We were given some type of steak that was so rare blood spilled all over my plate. I usually don't mind rare steak, so I took a bite of it.... It tasted bad. Like bad meat that would make you sick. My husband agreed. We both lost out appetite after that!

The format is the same as most every other Brazilian Steakhouse we've been to in the U.S. There is a set price which includes the buffet and all of the meats. Drinks and desserts if you choose to have them are extra.  We arrived fairly late on a Saturday evening. We had reservations and were seated immediately. Samba was busy but not crowded. Our waitress arrived shortly, brought a basket of yucca puffs filled with cheese, took our drink order, explained how it works, and then we headed toward t...

Dinner was yummy. However it arrived within 5 minutes of ordering. Caesar was really bland and awful and also arrived to quickly. I like to enjoy my meal and experience, this restaurant doesn't want to let you. The mcdonalds of gourmet

Disappointing. Went here for a new years eve dinner. the seafood dishes were fishy and one dish was a strange combination of cooked cabbage and seafood. Expected a higher caliber of food and service for the price.

Overrated. Not much on the menu that is affordable. Not many good choices. Wait time for food is horrible! My mother in law and Brother in law likes it. I hate it ! Will not come back unless things change! Needs to improve menu( Food choices,Wait time and Price!!!
My husband and I love love love this place.  Pretty setting, drinks are always interesting and the food is superb every time.   One of our favorites.

Might be my favorite restaurant ever.  In any country.  I can't say enough great things about Sardine.  We no longer live in Madison, but Sardine was a weekly favorite of ours and they never disappointed.  Everything is so darn amazing.  If they ever have the cassoulet--try it and your life will never be the same.  Great cocktails, fantastic wait staff, and the food is perfectly executed every time. We'll be back, Sardine.
No really my favorite place to eat (too much salt in the sauce) but quantity is worth it if hungry for something other then buffet.
Fire. Reminds me of panda express which Madison needs also

A neighborhood queer bar that loves it's straight patrons as much as it's not-so-straight ones. Their Sunday brunch is the perfect hangover cure (mostly because the 5 liquor mimosas will quickly have you hammered).
Love love love. Very friendly and inviting bar with good food too.
I have ordered from here twice, and both times it was absolutely awful... Tasteless ingredients + grotesquely old veggies = worst subs in Madison
Love the cheeseburgers here!!! Fresh meat, great buns. Fish fry is pretty good. Way better than average 'bar food'.

Best steak and fish. Stopped by on a recent cold night, got seated right away. We started with cocktails which were perfect and fun. I could make a meal of the cocktails and the salad dressing, but I digress. My husband had the filet - sizzling and perfect. I'm trying to watch calories so I went with the walleye, desperately wanted to have it deep fried, but went with broiled. Fabulous. Tasted like something right from Canadian waters. Brilliant. Even though we had no room, we went with an ice c...
Delicious steaks, my husband got the ribeye, I got the 8oz filet, both were cooked perfectly on a sizzling platter. Was worth the money, would recommend to a friend.
Old school supper club, lots of character. Relish tray at the tables, soup and salad included in steak options. Full bar. Best food steak ever! Ordered medium, was cooked perfectly

Still worth it!. I see a lot about the decline of the supper club, and I'll grant you that Smoky's long time, bread-and-butter clientele may be bellying up to the Afterlife Bar with Dino and Sinatra at this point... but.... They still do it right. Ambience? Check. Amusing bar flys? Check. Good service? Check. Great steak with a side of hash browns, which lets be honest is why you came, check, check, check! So don't discount the Grand Dame of Madison carnivore heaven. I really think you'll be ple...

This is a must do for us in Madison. Friendly crowd, staff and out of the movies atmosphere. Prepare to be fed HUGH portions of meat . The martinis are infamous and the bloody Mary's a meal. Love the old school place. On weekends the crowd isn't as old as other reviewers make it out.
Cozy atmosphere, friendly service and amazing food!
Food so good, we named our daughter Sophia.
Great food. Best french toast with raspberry sauce ever... and the side of potatoes - yum!!

I can't believe this is considered a "cafe". My daughter and I stopped 8:30 on a Sunday a.m. Did we miss a seating room? The place was crammed, no seating whatsoever. I saw some people chatting at their tables over dirty dishes, thinking, oh we'll get a table soon. Then realized, they weren't going anywhere anytime soon. Not long after, three more people piled in behind us, in a space where there already was no space.The smells were great, but part of enjoying a great meal is the surroundings. I...

This is a hole in a wall place - a small open kitchen, 2 small tables and 2 large tables, with a seating for about 20 packed. All ingredients are fresh and the food is freshly prepared in front of you! It is a communal seating. In other words, expect strangers to sit at your table and expect to sit at strangers' tables. If you are not into communal eating then go at a slow time when you can have a table for yourself, or get carryout. I like communal eating so it is fun to meet varied people duri...
Certainly one of the best Starbucks. Friendly helpful staff, who do it right and quickly.
One of the best locations I've ever been at. Beautiful view of Capitol & especially on Farmer's market Saturdays.
Usually crummy service. I love Starbucks. I love it so hard! However, I'd say I get cruddy service about 40% of the time at this one (so I gave it a down vote)
Waited five minutes in a mostly empty shop with six employees before walking out. No one made eye contact, let alone tried to take our order

Clean and polite. It's gotta be tough sometimes being a chain store in Madison. We have a huge amount of home grown eateries and we all seem to develop particular tastes and preferences the longer we live in this city on the isthmus. For the campus Starbucks, it has to go up against all of the other coffee houses Madison has had for years before their arrival. And at least in the case of this location, they are a decent offering.  Comfortable seating, good open areas, always polite staff (when I...

Nice location. Convenient for state street shopping or students on campus. Love that this location has an upstairs, plus and upstairs outside balcony for when the weather is nice. Nice little hideaway. I've only visited this location once, and was happy with my coffee.

Starbucks with a twist- all of your coffee favorites with a side of clean, earthy, and rustic flair (though can be seen as dimly lit). Lovely and colorful arrays line the counter with food, coffee, and accessories, and very friendly staff who know hoe to deliver under pressure. The best part is a quiet and cozy loft that is perfect for studying- stocked with chairs, a fireplace, fans, lots of outlets, and - wait for it- and whiteboard. Great compliment for a long night of studying. Drinks and fo...

Bad food. I placed an order for some plain chicken wings with barbecue sauce on the side. You know regular chicken wings always have bones, unless they state they are boneless. Well my order consist of deep fried grease balls consisting of some sort of horrible thick breading over a small piece of chicken white meat. No way you could get any food and safety inspector to agree that these were chicken wings. It's time to report this to the food and safety inspection department. My summary is that ...
Great experience. Loved the red brat. Great feel for local culture.

If you're planning on taking advantage of the night life aspect of this establishment, don't. I personally know of four people who have had their smartphones stolen from their purses or pockets while dancing and mingling. It's not necessarily the place's fault but it sure has kept me away.
Love this great local spot. Great food at great prices. Perfect for watching sports and drinking beer. Soft pretzels are awesome! :)

0 stars if I could. Manager is very rude. I have an eye condition and the only available table had a flood light (100+ watts equivalent) above it. My friend unscrewed the bulb and mgr. went off deep end and wanted to kick us out and just about had an aneurism. Considering an ADA lawsuit. Is it worth it?
Off the charts fries. Super fresh food, very polite, friendly, and professional owner.
Grest fair trade coffee. Nice and clean with great wi-fi access (high speed), try the orange cappuccino
Some of the best coffee in Madison!
For a quick cheap lunch when you have an urge for Asian type food, this place is really good.

I Enjoyed The Food Until ....... My husband and I are in our upper 50's and we had been going to the 88 Kitchen for some time, at least 4 or so. The food had always been very good, no complaints from us. Always left full and the staff had always been cheerful. One  day on our way out, I noticed their "County Health Score" sign hidden way in the back in a corner away from the cash register. It was in sight but you had to look for it. I about fell over when I saw the score, remind you this was a ...

Stopped for a quick meal & why not Chinese?. We ate there for the first time this summer. I love Chinese food but this place took the cake. I didn't enjoy the food. Didn't taste very good. Had the chick & broccoli. I would not recommend eating at this place. There were 3 of us & none of us cared for the food.
You leave this specific subway smelling like burned bread and stale cigarettes.

No good. I ate at Subway for breakfast the first time ever, and the food just wasn't good. It was fresh though.   My big complaint with this place was that there was a soft speaking girl behind the counter with difficulty pronouncing words. So, it makes it difficult to order food. Also, she wouldn't let me swap out coffee for a diet coke on the combo deal.
Decent sushi, okay prices, rude owners.
Defines mediocre.

Great experience overall. A small restaurant, with a little Japanese design. But service was extremely quick, probably because we were 2 of the 4 people in the place. My wife says the sushi wasn't the best she's ever had, but good for the price. The teriyaki beef plate looked as though it had been made by a professional Japanese chef. 4/5. Would take family there when they come to town.

I love this place. The prices are cheaper than any sit-down resturant but it's more of a fast food enviroment. While they're not McDonald prices they're still reasonable for a Japanese resturant. They have traditional Japanese bottled drinks as well as candy which I thought was different. The fact that they offer dine in and carry out is also extremely convenient and I recommend this place to everyone.
Takara is better, but this place is pretty cheap and the sushi was fresh, well made, and tasty. Fast, friendly service. Skip the tempura sweet potato.

Worst experience in a very very long time. Not for Indians, not Indian food and definitely not for those who understand respect, food, flavor and taste. When bottled Sparkling Water is the best dish on the table, you know you have a challenge.  Gobi Parantha was horrible. Masala Dosa and Sambar are two different dishes as they will be served 10 minutes apart ;) Coconut Chutney coimes straight from freezer. Mysore Dosa means chilli and some more chilli and some more and flavor, paste, dosa just ...

People seem to enjoy this for their buffets but that has meant we haven't been blown away when we have tried to order a la carte. Food is a tad on oilier and bolder side loaded with tomato puree. Prices are reasonable but a little bit at the cost of experience.

We have always had great food here. Unfortunately, the service does not match! The last time we tried to eat at Swagat we sat for 45 min before the waiter realized he never gave our food order to the kitchen. Did not want to wait the 30-40 minutes so we left. Previous experiences included 45-60 minute wait time. Will not return.

We ordered out from Swagat the other day with high expectations since we received many recommendations for the place.  However, it wasn't as good as I had hoped.  Overall, it seems like decent Indian American food.  The veg pakoras we started of with were fine, plus the naan was decent.  The chana masala was pretty tasty, however the aloo gobi had no salt or seasoning besides turmeric.  The chicken tikka masala was more butter than anything, making it a hit amongst the non-desis in the crowd.  M...
The first thing to notice is the Great ambience and Excellent service.   The food is really good, some dishes being better than what we get in India.   The best Indian restaurant in madison.

Burger. Walking into the Oakcrest is like being teleported to a town bar in northern Wisconsin. Friendly staff, definitely lots of regulars at the bar with a few tables of folks in the small dining area. I heard that Oakcrest has good burgers, so I tried the bacon cheese burger with a side of fries. The cheeseburger was solid, except that the bottom bun pretty much disintegrated due to the juiciness of the burger. Fresh, tasty meat with excellent bacon, and it's not too big (though they have a 3...
Burgers & Fish Fry. Has a good burger...great steak sandwich and one of the best fish frys in town!!! Great Lake Perch on Wednesdays and Fridays.

Go for the burgers. Although you probably won't expect much in terms of food when you walk in and look around this place (it looks like a small dive bar), the burgers are made from freshly ground beef from the butcher shop right across the street. They're juicy and delicious. Also get a side (or share several). The cheese curds and onion rings are some of the best I've had.
Horrible service, they messed my order in the drive thru and charged me for more than I received.
Its as expected with friendly service.

Nachos are far too dry to gulp down without a drink! The tacos are good, but then again the toppings are not nearly good enough. I would consider my $7-$9 gone waste, these guys need a complete overhaul!

Consistent Excellence. We have frequented The Taj many times over the past years, including taking guests. We have never had anything but excellent food and friendly competent service. We have eaten in Indian restaurants all over the world, and The Taj is at the top of our list of excellence.
It was my second time there for lunch the first time was good but the second time was super bad the food was dry and they have nothing left on the buffet I will never go back for the Buffett .
Wonderful Food!. I have been to many Indian Restaurants in Britain but when I went here the food was Great. Good Service Also!
Very poor ambiance and food selection and quality! Tried the buffet (pretty much everything). Naan and one mix veg was OK. Rest all tasted below decent.

OMG! There are so many Indian restaurants in madison wi and like i just said earlier! OMG! I usually eat a swagat (live closer it) but the last time i went there i had bad service multiple times in a row. (I was also forced to remove me bad review). Anyways I eat at taj a few times now and I am going tell all my friend to eat here instead of there now. Service is Insanely good. The Food is Amazing! (During Lunch and Dinner). Outside the building owners don't really do much to the building to its...
Food was great, but service was slow. Need to hire more employees

I have eaten at takara many times and it is my go to sushi place in the downtown Madison area, especially for lunch. I like takara because the service is generally good and the decor is good too, but the food is very satisfying and delicious. During the lunch period, you can choose 3 rolls for about $13 with a miso soup or a salad. The rice is always perfectly prepared and the fillings are excellent as well. They have some of the best California rolls I've had, and the crunchy tuna rolls are a f...
The sushi lunch special is a good value and I've always found the food here fresh and delicious.

Disappointed. Takara has always been consistently good but several times now, the chicken katsu has been inedible. Talked to the waitress but she did nothing about it. Not sure what's up but would only get sushi there if I go again.

Good sushi. Went to Takara's for their lunch special which was any 2 rolls for 9.50 or 3 for 12.25. We had 2 spicy california rolls, 1 crunchy shrimp, 1 spicy tempura and one tempura maki. We didn't get to try any raw sushi because my wife is pregnant at the moment. Also had shrimp tempura udon and chicken yaki udon. Everything thing was good including the miso soup and salad. The service was great and the food came out probably 15-20 minutes. Nice clean place, its a bit dark in there but that d...
Good sushi.. Takara is my standby sushi joint because they make good sushi for a good price. Great spicy tuna rolls, and everything else I have ordered has been good too.

Melt-in-your-mouth sashimi. Friend and I shared the #42 dinner combo tonight - 8 pieces of sashimi, 4 pieces of sushi and a California roll. With a salad, the total plus tip was only $15 per person. Prices are similar to other sushi restaurants, service is fast and friendly and the quality of the fish is reason to go back. Highly recommend the maguro (tuna) and sake (salmon).

My wife's favotite. Not only is the sushi and sashimi excellent, but they have a very good bar, which I have found hit and miss with many Japanese restaurants. We had a Margarita there that was better than our recent Mexican experience. Their special rolls and habachi selections are outstanding.
Best Sushi and Sashimi on the east side of Madison, WI. Great lunch specials. Specialty rolls are a good showcase of the surprisingly fresh ingredients, specially for Sushi in the Midwest.

I am sure the cook is not Japanese. Shumai was Microwaved . We make from the skin. Oyakodon is not even close to original. Egg is over cooked and we supposed to cook with Mirin and soi source and Suger salt etcetc... I am not professional cook but I am sure I can cook better than this place. I really hope people don't assumes this is a Japanese food I never go back again. Sorry.... But..... One of the worst .

Total letdown. They try hard to mimic Japanese cuisine but the dishes we ordered were totally off. Most likely not made by Japanese people. The proof is in the pudding. Avoid if you want honmono nipponshoku!

I like to order sushi from Takumi's for take out since they are close to home. Always pleased with the sushi. I won't say it's the best sushi I've had, but still good and convenient. A few seats at the bar/counter to have a cocktail if you wish, while wating for the sushi to be made. Still have yet to dine in.  Update: stopped by on a Sunday. They had a lunch special.  3 rolls for $13.95 + a salad or soup. I chose salad. Delicious dressing!
This place is my favorite spot in town for sushi and hibachi. It always feels like a secret place too, because its set away from the congested downtown restaurant scene.
NOT GOOD. STAY AWAY! WASTE OF $. Food was good, but it took them more than half hour to bring out the food. We were the only table there!
Quite a nice buffet for lunch, and some spicy options. Carrot dessert is excellent.

Another good lunch buffet. The lunch buffet here may be a bit smaller that some other Indian restaurants in the city, but it is well executed and full of flavor. I especially enjoyed the samosas and fish pakora... both were delicious and I made certain to go back for seconds.  Parking gets a little cramped because of the neighborhood location, but if the weather is halfway decent then a short walk from car to table will let you enjoy the lush tree-filled westside area. I hope to go back soon t...

Absolutely terrible.. I will never spend another dollar at this establishment after how I was treated today. I located Thai Basil's menu online to order dinner. I called the number on their website and a man answered. I told him I wanted to place an order for delivery. He asked me my address, which is about two miles from the restaurant. I placed my order and he told me it would arrive in 15 minutes to one hour.   I waited an hour and when my food still hadn't arrived, I called the restaurant....
I have never had anything but a positive experience with this place. The food has been great and the customer service has been great too! I love their food!

Love it. Quick, convenient and courteous take out service. Appetizers are great, try toon-tong or the egg rolls. Surprisingly large menu for a relatively small place. My family recommends the pan-nang (peanut based curry) and jungle curry. We are continuing to explore the offerings and enjoyed the number 45 crispy duck.
Pad Thai was okay, I've definitely had better. I would recommend the veggie egg rolls!
The Pad Z Ew is decent. I am disappointed that they have a sign in the window that says they deliver - but when you ask fir delivery they say they don't have it.

The Vedge burger was pretty good. I found myself needing more mayo on it, as it was just a little dry. The fried pickles we shared as an appetizer were EXCELLENT! I wish I had gone on a day when I didn't have to work after, because I would really have enjoyed also being able to have a beer. My only complaint is that it was pretty cold in there. I ate with my coat on. It is a small space, so I imagine keeping heat in is a bit of a challenge.

Fish Fry!. This place is bursting at the seams with character. Looooong wait - but it somehow goes very quickly. The staff are the best in town for dealing with insane crowds. Friendly, fast, they WORK! Food is 100% delicious - drinks are excellent - bartenders are hilarious - crowds are fun. Toby's is THE perfect way to round out the end of a long work week in getting the weekend started. And the only Supper Club in town that can compete with the traditional up nort' supper clubs in atmosphere ...

Its definitely for the locals!. Very odd way of being seated, you go up to the bar to check in (which takes 5 mins because the one bartender was helping 25 customers and getting them drinks). They give you a menu with about 15 choices on there to eat. We got the New York Strip special which was 12oz for 21.95. The steak had a bland flavor, they don't marinate it or anything. I have bought better steaks at local grocery stores. The food did come out at a decent amount of time. The whole setup is ...
Local flavor

Meh- totally odd way of ordering forcing you to hang out at the bar. Even after we got a table our food was slow in coming out. Salad was nothing but lettuce, highly recommended salmon was almost overdone & dry, hash browns with cheese was just a slice of American on top melted in the microwave. Not impressed at all.

Nothing Special. I have to say I was not impressed. The restaurant is outdated as is the menu. The steak grade I assume is somewhere between select and no roll. When I asked the owner he just replied it regular steak. I don't think he even know the degrees of steak grading. For the price I would expect at least a choice cut, but did not receive that. I think you would get a better steak at the local buffet.
Great cheesy bread sticks a must get with your pizza!!!
Best Rockefeller styled oysters I've had in a long time. And the late night menu is quite impressive being what it is, I definitely love coming back to this place.

Nope. Been here twice. bad experiences both times. slow service. didn't think the steaks were of very high quality. Bill nearly $200 for 3 with tip. no way.... not worth it. There are so many better places in madison, like the wonder bar or even Johnnys Italian

Too load - poor lighting. I have been there twice and can't say I'm impressed enough to be back. The food itself is terrific but the poor lighting and loudness of the resturant ruins any intamacy. I couldn't enjoy my visit. Try Ruth's Chris.

Am I a vegetarian who just gave a steakhouse four stars? Yes I am. Why? Well, there are roughly four things on the menu that I can actually eat, and two of them compete for the best of their kind in Madison. I would walk through miles of waist deep snow for the Tornados wedge salad, and I think the cheese curds on their late night menu rival the ones at the Old Fashioned. Their martini game is ON POINT, and they have a consistently solid port offering. If they do the rest of their menu as well a...

Love the ambience here. They serve a steakhouse quality steak (I love ribeyes), the service is generally good and they mix a good cocktail. So, as a steakhouse, it's a good bet. But I like this place for another reason...the late night menu. The cheese curds are excellent and they serve a good Coquille St. Jacques, but the star here is the steak sandwich. Served with a creamy horseradish sauce and grilled onions, just cut that sandwich in half, dip in the au jus and blissfully enjoy. Who knew bl...

Always Reliable Italian. I studied abroad in Italy years back, and we had a chef that cooked for us daily. The food at Tutto Pasta reminds me of these times. I've liked nearly everything I've had there, and many meals are easily enough for two. It's affordable and easily better than all the "fancy" Italian restaurants around town that are overpriced and outdated.
I went into this resturaunt skeptical based on past review but it was very good. Best Italian I have had in quite awhile. Pasta was al dente and the dish had good flavor.
Not a horrible place. Food.... Not a horrible place.  Food is ok  Service could be better.

Terrible.. I have eaten at Tutto's Pasta in Middleton before and have loved it so when my friends 17 birthday rolled around i suggested we go to the one on state street. We made a reservation for 10 and arrived at the restraunt and put in the basement. Our waitress took our drink orders and we were having a fine time. About 15 minutes later a larger group than us is sat. They got everything before us and left before we even had out food but not before there server broke a plate over one of the g...

Took my girlfriend here and won't be coming back. Hostess sat us in the bar area where the booths weren't even bolted to the floor and would move around. Paint was chipping off the walls and there was plenty of dust at our feet near the window. Service was nothing special, but did the job properly. Regarding the food, there are plenty of better Italian restaurants up near the Capitol that make more appetizing dishes than Tutto's. My penne with chicken, cranberries, & pistachios seemed like an in...
Cheerful staff, decent pizza and panini. You could do worse for chain pie. Don't miss the giant peanut butter cup dessert.
It's good for a chain. Price point is affordable. If I had the option to have a home style Chicago pie or an UNO it would always be home style. Still not bad for a chain...better than expected

The pizza is very blah. I had the deep dish and was nowhere near as deep is real Chicago deep dish. Crust kinda bland. Toppings seemed fresh so that was good. Sauce was so-so.  Overall I have to give thumbs down. It's okay but I was expecting better this close to Chicago.

So far, nothing good has happened. I am sitting at a nearly empty bar at 7:30 on a Friday evening. The lone bartender is way too busy with her mountain of dirty dishes and bar drinks ringing in to notice me in any rational sort of time. I order a Labatts draft which taste like soap. I have to ask for a menu. She eventually takes my order after I sit with my closed menu on the bar for an extended period of time. I of course order something that I mispronounce (Spinoccoli Pasta) and w/o missing a ...
Bad coffee. Cheap robusta coffee flavor- Not specialty coffee!
Bad coffee. Cheap robusta coffee flavor- Not specialty coffee!

Best Plate in Madison. This is by far the best Thai food in Madison, the been thread noodle with beef is to die for, along with the pad Thai with beef. I've never had a bad meal at this joint, and have been going for 15 years, the service is a bit lacking, but that is not what I go for. I kind of enjoy picking my own beer out of their cooler.

Easily the worst dining experience you will ever have.. My girlfriend and I decided to try this godforsaken place, since the reviews here on Urbanspoon were better than average, but much to our chagrin, this was the worst experience either of us had ever encountered. We went at 6:30 on a Monday night and we didn't expect it to be too busy, but we pulled in to an empty parking lot (and it stayed that way) and reluctantly decided to go in anyway. We opened the door to a frumpy middle-aged woman lo...

Food is good. Not the best Thai food in Madison but close to home and convenient for us to walk to on a nice day.  If your downtown don't be afraid to try., just know theService sucks so don't expect much there.

This place has phenomenal food, just know what you're getting into when you go. The service is generally apathetic, at best. The building is typical of your traditional "hole in the wall" places. There is no music, and there rarely other customers there, so it's kind of awkwardly quiet. The food, however, is worth overlooking these issues for. I've eaten there hundreds of times, but only had three dishes. The Seafood Curry Squash, Seafood Curry plate (with potatoes), and, my personal favorite, S...

Why is their score so high?. I love Thai food. I don't consider this Thai food. This place would fit best in the category of generic Asian junk food from the mall. Since I live on the same block, I have been here multiple times for convenience sake, and each time the food and service got worse. The rice is always mushy and barely warm. The portions are large and prices are low, but the dishes taste like they were flavored with Tabasco and sugar. The servers also give me the feeling that they cou...
Great Walleye and Cod dinners last Friday night. They even have the best coleslaw in town made in house I understand. Will be back again.

Went here for the 1st time on Friday to meet w/some friends who eat here occasionally. Had the cod fish fry dinner, which was decent. 3 good sized pieces in a tasty, non-greasy batter w/baked potato and cole slaw for $12. The baked potato was a bit dry and lifeless, and even butter and sour cream couldn't save it. But the fish and the cole slaw were pretty good. It's a creamy slaw, which isn't my favorite because it's usually too much 'creamy' and not enough 'slaw'. But this one was good. The be...

Hands down best fish fry in Madison. Get there early if you want to wait too much. You can enjoy drinks and popcorn while you wait, though. Friendly staff, good music. Doesn't look like much but man do they do they have the best fish and coleslaw around !
A humble neighborhood watering hole. This level burger can be had at any number of other places, but if you want easy, cheap, and an inimitable Wisconsin bar, look no further.
Burgers weren't as good as I remembered.
Hell ya! That's a burger. Flavortown! Real Wisconsin cheese. Burger melts in your mouth. Mmm Mmmmmm!

I was watchn the food channel and it showed The Village Bar on the burger bible belt-pretty close to home so me and a friend went to check it out. The bartender/cook (wish I got his name but I was on a mission) was super friendly and cooks a mean cheeseburger. It was AWESoME! Super juicy and cheesy-we'll definitely b back for more!
The Village has great food, good service, and the best prices.

Fun Times. I really like Vintage, their patio is awesome and their apple pie shots blow me away! Cool music selection and I really like their mac&cheese bites. A little cramped sometimes but there's seating if you can get it. Cool decor and overall atmosphere!

An odd duck. I got takeout from here and was pretty disappointed. While their scallion pancake was tasty, the rest was either average or below par. I ordered the roast duck with taro and was honestly shocked by the pieces of duck they gave me. It looked like someone had butchered this duck in the most haphazard way possible. I was able to identify a duck neck, the very bottom of a leg (they had chopped the leg bone into pieces which I've never seen before) and a fair amount of skin that was not ...
Great soups, home-made noodles

Had the Riblets appetizer. Too much bone not enough meat. Had the OxTail peanut noodles. OxTail was cold & tough. Could've been more tender & at least room temperature. Service was slow. Choose a table not a booth. Felt every move the person sitting beind me made.

What noodles should be. Have been going to Wah Kee for 20 years for soup - the noodles are made there and are sold and used by almost all of the other noodle places in town (that aren't some chain) and the homemade wontons, rich broth, and some added heat are soothing to the soul. The menu is big and the food is reliable if not inspired but there is no better ramen soup I have had in this country.

I friend and I tried Wah Kee for lunch recently. There are two rooms with many tables. We had to step into the second room to find the waiter to seat us. They were not very crowded. The waiter was very friendly. They have an extensive menu.  After perusing their menu, I decided to try one of their lunch specials: Szechuan Spicy Pork. My thinking was there were so many items on the menu, I would try one of the lunch specials which they would be expecting to sell many of and make well. I was disap...
$4 PBR? Plus tip?!?
Fun bar design, but I had to return a burger that was RED, not even pink, in the center. If you get a burger, cut into it before taking a bite!

Good fish fry, douchey bartenders aka MEATHEADS. I never see it mentioned but one of the better fish fry's in Madison, little salty, but otherwise good. Had a few other meals here as well and usually pretty decent. Some of the male Bartenders can be douchey at times but kind of fits the bar vibe.

I stopped by with some friends one Saturday night and was astounded by how many people were waiting to get in.  This place gets packed on weekends.  With three flours, each with a bar, there's plenty of room to have drinks and socialize.  On the top floor is dancing, however the music selection is a bit weak.  There are way too many young college kids for my liking, but I suppose that comes with a college town.  The drink specials are great, especially if you feel like reliving college days with...

Disappointed Customer. I would walk down the street and dine in at Sushi Express than come waste my money here.  We gave in tickets in which the waitress lost one and she did not receive her sushi until the rest of my group were receiving tabs.  The waitress did not refill waters and give us any attention. We had to ask for other waiters and waitress for more water and menus. Delivery sushi is good. Dine-in is not.

Good food bad service. Been coming to Wasabi for over 10 years for the great, authentic japanese food. Unfortunately they recently started hiring wait staff that doesn't know how to serve properly.   1. Gave us a dirty dish  2. Appetizers and entrees came all out of order 3. Forgot to put in an entree 4. Didn't put in our take out order until we were done eating even though we ordered it at the same time  Worst of all, they didn't acknowledge or apologize when we pointed out their mistake...

Good sushi, subpar entrees.. We ordered spicy tuna rolls, which were very good and quite reasonably priced. However, I ordered the hibachi chicken with vegetables, and the plate was very, very underwhelming. The portion was generous, and for $13.50, it should be. The vegetables were bland and the chicken had almost no flavor whatsoever. The hibachi chicken was almost watery. On the brighter side, our waitress was very attentive and very friendly. Maybe I just went on a bad day for food, but beca...

Great food, bad service. I wish there was an option to vote for something other than "like it" or "didn't like it." We've eaten at Wasabi for years, and the food is always excellent. I think it's telling that there are frequently TONS of Japanese people eating at Wasabi. Unfortunately, the service on a recent visit was really, really bad. It was one of three times in my life that I decided not to leave a tip. Water glasses sat empty, which I can forgive. Service was slow, even though the place w...
Yes!. Every time I've asked for Sushi recommendations, I've gotten excellent ones. Their service has never let me down, and the food is always excellent.
Artwork must have changed.... Coffee is awesome. Breakfast san which was blah. View and atmosphere are great!

Just when you think you know a town, you discover a new place like this that humbles you... acknowledging there is much more to be seen. The cafe was delightful, great view of lake through huge windows. Can't wait to return when to watch snowfall and sip my latte. Prices are similar not more expensive than any other coffee shop in town. Also serves sandwiches and salads - though I have not tried them yet. My trip was made memorable by the debut concert of a local singer (melissa simonson). Great...

Love this place. Come as a workspace, conversation place, gathering or just to enjoy drinks along the Lakefront. Quiet place original drinks and just plain enjoyable. I was afraid to review my secret hideout because I love it so much!
Super offensive artwork (religious mocking and drug associations)--I would never return here for that reason.
Don't go for lunch if you have a job!. Unapologetically slow service during weekday lunch. Salmon inedible with unidentified items along with undercooked rice. Sad.
Ok... Slow service but cool staff. chili was good. menu small, and a little out there for me... I'm a picky Eater so this is not a place I'd frequent!

Thumbs up for food thumbs down for service. The food is amazing but we had a very rude waitress! I asked if it was possible to have my sons carrots warmed. She rolled her eyes and me and replied with "they are not going to do that. I mean look at all these people it's just not going to happened" it was rude and disrespectful I asked politely knowing they could say no but was addressed like that. I was very taken back and said I was just asking. I then was given dirty looks the rest of our meal. ...

My friends and I went out to dinner here and we were pleasantly surprised with our night out.  First of all, the decor of the restaurant and bar is cozy and intimate.  The books along the wall makes the place feel like a home.  Our server was extremely sweet and patient with our order.  The food was reasonably priced, especially for the portions.  I had their speciality lemonade with tequila, and it was absolutely superb.  It was mixed well with a sprig of thyme.  My grilled cheese was huge, eac...

Ok, I occasionally tend to be verbose, or blunt, or obviously subtle (?) in conveying certain things about restaurants in reviews that I specifically choose to pen....   Weary Traveler Madison Wisconsin ----> if you don't outright adore it, or can't find some way to really really like it, then you need to reconsider your entire world view.  That's it.  Love.
Best Fast Food Value Menu Item. When I'm travelling on business and need to grab a quick lunch, the double stack with cheese is the fast food menu item of choice!
Tried the "new hot & juicy" burger. This is an improvement and the burgers are pretty tasty, as usual. Good if you need a good burger in a hurry.

Greasy diner style decor and set up- delicious breakfast foods. We got the spanikopita omelet and the bomblet skillet- both great and hugely filling even though the food wasn't overtly unhealthy like some breakfast places-i.e. swimming in butter or cheese. We'll definitely tell everyone to try it!

Total letdown! We had such high hopes for this place and the experience was beyond brutal! Was supposed to open at 11p and we waited and no one showed until 11:20. They had the wrong menus out so we had the letdown of not getting what we wanted. My wife's pancake came our raw in the middle, and the food was ok at best. Service was awful and the waitress wasn't friendly at all. Never going back.

We went for a late dinner after a concert. The sign said that they opened at 11 pm, the employees didn't even show up until 11:10. I had to send back my pancake because it was undercooked and batter was dripping out of it. The service was slow and not so friendly...

Super small space but the salade they do have is well used. A quirky atmosphere, very Willy streetesque. The restaurant is nestled between Ha Long bay and a tattoo shop so it is easy to be missed. My wife and I both ordered eggs and hash browns, and I ordered regular sausage while she preferred veggie sausage. We waited about 30 minutes for the food which was fine since we were quoted 45 minutes. When our food arrived there seemed to be some confusion because I had recurved tomatoes and no hash ...
Nice Eastside Bar. Great beer prices ($1.00 less for a Capital on tap vs. the West side (Middleton), lots of TVs to watch sports, big, open bar area.

I have many dietary restrictions and allergies. But i enjoy going out for coffee and tea. So I always pack food for myself when going to a coffeehouse as I know I wot be able to eat anything there. I was at zuzu with a friend we each ended up getting two coffees and two teas, enjoying the patio. My friend even got a pastry. I got hungry and took out my packed lunch. I was soon bullied by I assume the manager or owner about how inappropriate I was being by bringing my own food there and not buyin...
Not recommended. Paninis are pre-made and frozen. Tastes like a lean cuisine frozen dinner.

Once a year, it's ok. We got a Bucky coupon for 2 for 1 sandwich at Zuzu. It's a cheery place on a sunny spring day. We'd been there once before. I didn't have any strong recollections, negative or positive. I wasnt sure why we hadnt been back.  When I asked for my sandwich on whole grain bread, they said they tried offering that, but nobody wanted it. So, I had their pita gyro. It tasted good. For health reasons, and mine are no different than everybody's of any age, who has a cardiovascular s...

So close yet so far away... .... So close yet so far away...  From the street Zuzu's Cafe look colorful, warm and inviting. As you walk through the door you get a whole different impression.  While the interior is has the same vibrant color scheme I found myself less than impressed. Every counter, chair and table look worn and gives the impression that maintenance is not a priority for the owners.  I inquired about gluten free menu options and was looked at like I was from another planet. ...

Zu-who?. The coffee brewed was Alterra. Alterra is owned by the multinational corporation Mars- producer of M&M's. Why aren't they buying from a local roaster like Ancora or True? I just don't understand why they can't support local Madison businesses. Good service and good decor but I won't be going back until they switch beans.
Amazing!. I love the pepperoni and bacon thin crust. I order regularly and I have always had great service!

Average Pizza, Well Above-Average Prices. The pizza they serve is no better than Little Caesar's or Pizza Hut, yet you get the privilege of paying twice as much. If you dine-in, you can have some really flat soda, too!  Try harder, Day One.

Blah. Our first time ordering from this pizza place and we tried "the works". The name of the pizza couldn't be farther from the truth. The only thing I could taste were the onions. There were a few scattered mushrooms and I couldn't taste the any sausage or pepperoni. Those ingredients were scarce too. We won't be going back.
Great Pizza and Service!. Our Family is a big fan of Day One Pizza! The pizza is excellent and the service is top notch! Highly recommend the BBQ Chicken pizza.
I've always thought pizza was like sex, even if its bad its still better then not having it. I was wrong save yourself some cash and buy some cardboard ketchup and cheese and call it day one pizza.

Ample and Amazing. I was truly surprised at the size of my Barbacoa Burrito. It was warm, balanced, and very tasty. The chips were also warm and the mild salsa truly mild. The Salsa Verde had good heat and flavor. It was uniquely pleasurable and an excellent value. I would recommend the drive as worth it for the food and value.
HUGE portions. We tried it based on the reviews and the burrito could have fed our family of 5!! I got the mini burrito and couldn't even eat half of it. It was delicious though and worth the money.
Might be the best & most consistent. These guys do it right I think, the el pastor tacos,(corn shell, onion and cilantro) are my personal choice, but all have been good.
Shrimp Burito. It is a huge Burito with very large Shrimp, and fresh ingrediants

Solid food, if you can get past the rest.... I was at Pablo's yesterday with a friend for lunch. And truly, to be fair, I need to break my review into two parts. One for the food we received, and one for everything else.  The everything else receives a giant WTH.  We walked in and sat down, and were promptly provided with menus. I asked if there was a lunch menu. I was told that there wasn't. (A Mexican place without a lunch menu?) I followed up by asking if there was a lunch special. I was ...
Awful. I went on a tuesday night and found out they reuse rolls and the little butter cups
Jerry. We had the prime rib sandwich and it was great if you are hungry order this and you will be back every other Friday for this. Great food all the time.

Yum!. Their burgers are delicious but their specialty burgers are a bit over priced. It was the first place we tried when we moved here and we've been back many times since. Now I just stick to the basic burgers.

A Fun Place With Good Chow. The sports memorabilia on the walls, ceilings and rest rooms (the men's anyway) deserve a visit if you haven't been to the Rookie's before. But, the Rookie's offers much more. Salads are surprisingly good for a sports pub. Dressings aren't homemade but the greens and toppings are always fresh and tasty - the portions generous. The sandwiches too are good, not world-class, but uniformly satisfying. The daily specials are a bit of a mixed bag. Meat loaf on Tuesday, Wedn...

A very good stop to make. A very good sports bar that actually has good food too. On my stop I had the sloppy joe special. It came with 2 sloppy joes and fries. It was very good. My wife had the pulled pork sandwich that she liked very much. The pizza we saw at the table next to us looked very good, and judging by how fast it disappeared, tasted good too. Its more of a guy place then a couples place. But, if you are looking for somewhere to hang out with the guys, this place can not be beat.

Charming Setting. We opted against an appetizer, since meals included in-house bread (warm, slightly nutty, and delicious) and soup/salad (vegetable beef and chicken rice were both terrific on this fall evening). The cider roasted half chicken was nicely seasoned (hoped for more apple flavor, but it was fine without it), though the white breast meat was very dry (dark thigh meat was juicy). Same for the garlic mashed potatoes--flavorful, but very dry. The ribs were meaty and juicy, though I didn...

Disappointed. We ordered take out on a Sunday evening. When we got home, my cheeseburger had no cheese, but it did have very black burn marks in the bottom. My 3 year old had no kid order of french fries. But- we had paid for both. My husband's pot roast dinner was delicious. I guess if there is a next time, we would open and check everything before we drive home.

The food is terrible. Home cooked meals should have some sort of flavor. It's WAY overpriced and the staff is overworked. I'm not a cook by any means, but I'm confident I could make better macaroni and cheese. $40.00 later, lesson learned. :(

The food was outta this world delicious & the portions were HUGE! I had the macaroni & cheese & my boyfriend had the fork tender pot roast....Omg...so good! The restaurant is a converted old 1800's feedmill...quaint atmosphere. We are definitely going back....

Very disappointed. Pot pie was a small lof of bread with a little gravy poured over it. There was no taste to it and no chicken. Pork chops had a strange sweet and sour sauce over them and they weren't cooked all the way thru. The meal was very pricey for what we got -especially when it wasn't good. The mill itself is really nice. Just wish the food was good.
So delicious. Home made pasta, home made sour dough bread, home made salad dressing, everything fresh and delicious. Great martinis as well!

Friday Night Fish Fry at Angelo's. Seven of us total dined at Angelo's. Six oif the seven were first time diners at Angelo's. All of us enjoyed the dinner and service and the other six said they would be back, perhaps the next time at Monona. Expect we will do so in the next two weeks. April (our waitress) was superb. Looking forward to my next visit.

Nice cozy place to have a drink or two and some really good food. We've been back several times since moving to the area and have yet to have a bad experience with any of the servers or bartenders, even when we've had small children with us. The pizza is great, have had some of the pasta dishes that were very good as well. It's nice to have a little local place in McFarland, especially one with unique food and such friendly staff!

Madcity Marty. Now that they have Andy Roo's BBQ Grill seasoning it's worth stoppin' out for a burger or some terriaki wings. Ask Joe or anyone behind the bar but if you don't ask for the Andy Roo's ya might as well keep goin' cause it'll be just another boring bar burger... Breakfast now to on the weekends, blueberry p cakes anyone??
Madcity Marty. WHO WHERE? Lived here since 74 Who Where?

Terrible customer service. We used Chris for our wedding cake, and I'd never hire her for anything ever again. Once the contract was signed, her attitude turned ugly and even simple questions would set her off. For instance, she told me she would be dropping my cake off nearly 11 hours before we were to cut it (and said it was not to be refrigerated). When I asked her why so early (as did my venue) and asked if there would be concern that a cake would stay out that long uncovered and unrefrigera...
Madcity Marty. Unfortunately, the name says it all and who in their right mind would name it that? Skip the Crap and add some flavor! Mo BARFOOD!

Neat Little Place. It is what is it is: a small, local, tavern where regulars congregate, and outsiders are welcome as long as they are not obnoxious. You got 3 different customer types: the morning crowd of mostly retirees and veterans from open to about 4pm. The hardworkers getting together for a few beers after works till about 8pm or 9pm. Then the late night regulars - mostly all friends - from 10pm+ till close. It's not a restaurant and doesn't bill itself as one. The bar menu is decent wit...

Okay, the name is hysterical to me. The drinks are cheap and so is the food. We had four micro brews, a Bloody Mary, and two orders of cheese curds and it was under $20!! The cheese curds are great. It's a bar so the food is bar food but a good little find.
Amazing food, great prices, friendly staff! All around great experience. Kid friendly( what kid doesn't like a pb&j with French fries :))

Battered walleye was bland, hashbrowns were much better than last time (less greasey). Wife's shrimp was very good. Cooks need to go to owners other restaurant (Beach House) to learn how to prepare walleye!
I like this place, been here numerous times. My fav is definitely the AYCE ribs/chicken...huge portions and enough for 2-3 meals and super cheap!!

Madcity Marty. Lunch specials are good, Joy , the bartender is great. but you have to ask her for the Andy Roo's!! Otherwise, you guessed it, BARFOOD! Fish fry, well Blue hair, They ain't what they was 25 years ago.... That's why I go to D Days out in Cambridge, the closest GOOD FISH FRY, that' s not packed like Toby's...

Ever since moving to Wisconsin, we've been wanting to try the Supper Clubs which Wisconsin is known for. The Green Lantern surpassed my expectations.  The location is right on Lake Waubesa. There is a beautiful view out the window and after supper you can stroll down the pier and continue to admire the lake. The interior is divided into a pub area, the room with the window, and an extension below that. Lots of wood and lanterns -- it's cozy.  The hostess and especially our waitress were fun and ...
Awsome food. Extreamly fast service even with orders for 6+ ppl (usually 10 mins) and decent pricing. Totally worth a try!
Madcity Marty. Another processed off the Asian foods truck usual. Remember, Happy Wok delivers to McFarland now, enjoy..

Always busy. I don't quite understand the draw here, except the food is served quickly and the staff is nice. The food however is just okay. I guess if you like big portions, so so food, and a small bill, this is the place for you. With so many good places in the Madison area to choose from, I'd say skip this place.

Madcity Marty. More BHF. It's not Conrad's by any mean's! Boring and bland best discribes the food, but thanks to the Blue Hair smoking drunk's, they survive. The Thanksgiving and Mother's day Buffet Is the worst! You couldn't give me a meal from there...Have a nice day...

No favorite dishes. I went to the Maple Tree for Moher's Day and felt like I was eating in a church basement. I could not see the salad bar as it was dark and all there was to eat was some lettuce, sliced onions and cucumbers and a few bins of something white. I didn't want to get that close to find out. They had lots of different salad dressings and I heard later they even had croutons! Wow

Nothing terribly special. 1/2 rack of ribs special was tasty. Not too fatty or anything. It was decent value for the price.  Bloody Mary was a little "watery."   Overall, it was worth the stop, but nothing outstanding.
Sloppy, slow, and that about covers it

Great Experience. The Parkside Pube is an unbelievable establishment. The owner with the mullet is a fantastic host and the atmosphere is like nowhere else. $2 choo choo shots always get the party started and you're guaranteed to never miss the big NASCAR race on several of their flat screen tv's.   My only advice is to beware of the quarter machine. That thing is addicting, but it's about ready to pay big time!!!

Great burgers, the best fish in town on friday night with prices that are family friendly. Awesome place to watch the games especially on sundays, lots of fun with the fans. Generally fun place to be in mc farland

Madcity Marty. Lunch specials not bad, Ask for the Andy Roo's, Donna's a sweet heart, Close to the usual BARFOOD, except for the Andy Roo's Seasoning's. Thank God for the Andy Roo's saving restaurant's one at a time...
Madcity Marty. I'll say this oh chain in vain, you ain't what you we're 10 years ago. Stop spending so much on commercials and try putting some real meat on your za's!!!! Pasta? please STOP IT!
12 yrs eating experience sez go here now
Awesome food. Everything is great--burgers, pizzas, apps. The staff is awesome too. Nice place, very clean and lots of TVs.
Good. Nice bar area with nice tv's throughout. Should be a good atmosphere for football games on Saturday and Sunday. Decent pizza variety, I would say good but not the greatest.

Madcity Marty. Since 1974 it has been almost the same, Almost I say because some time in the late 80's early 90's they switched the sausage to something less spicy because some blue hair said something and they unfortunately obliged. Consistency, yes expansion 3 times from a counter for pick up only, when I smashed into a car parked out front with my 73 Lemans GT in oh 79 to the family friendly and now Sports Bar it is today. And the sports bar tender's name is Scott Scott, married the boss's da...
2 Piece Beer Batter Fish On Fridays. She makes the batter for her fish so they are made to order and not just taken out of the freezer and tossed into a deep fryer

Closed until further notice. Varsity Club closed as of August 31,2014. I believe there are new owners, but it is not open as of yet (October 14). Too bad - the group running it was awesome, and their menu was excellent. Very reasonable prices.
Thanks. For being a sport and accepting a coupon from across the state even though you were not running the special.
Cool place. The coffee wasn't as good as Ancora or Alterra but the coffee shop was decorated really cool.
Excellent Portabella Mushroom Sandwich!. Highly recommended!
I love their specialty coffee drinks, but their coffee has a tendancy to give me an upset stomach. But it tastes delicious!
Usually a nice chill atmosphere. Pretty weak attempt at a Mexican Hot Chocolate.

Coffee here is good and we drink it here as well have bought the ethiopian beans in smaller quantities. We havent had that much luck with wine we have purchased here but it could be a bit about preferences and tastes with the wine. They do stock a lovely wisconsin bleu cheese which we recommend.

Good coffee and tea. This is a nice place to stop and have coffee or tea, along with a pastry from Madison Sourdough Company. Walls of windows to let the sun shine in on the ample seating. There are also a few tables outside for nice days.
Good, like any of the Barrique's. Everything is pretty good. Location great...near the post office and library for a nice walk downtown Middleton. Fairly priced.

Poor Service. Went here yesterday afternoon, it had been a long day and was about to get longer...the service was poor, slow, and the girls seemed more interested in talking to one another than doing their job. The coffee was not good.   This is a place to avoid.

A Favorite. I love this place. I love the food, the comfortable, warm atmosphere, the unpretentiousness, the obvious pride the owners and staff take in the place. I've never been disappointed in their food or their service. Try any of the Albanian specialties - the lamb, dolmas, Albanian sausages, everything is wonderful.

Disastrous Experience. My wife and I went to Sofra for the first time, and it was a disaster from start to finish. We were not properly seated, the waitstaff was completely inattentive throughout the meal, and the food was extremely substandard. Frozen and pre-packaged ingredients, bland meals and very little for the price. What's worse, when asked if everything was ok with the meal, we said no. The hostess responded, "That's nice to hear," Two words of advice: Don't go.

Specials. I had never been there before, and I have four kids.  I was surprised at the fact that they were such a kid friendly place!  My kids are so picky on foods, but they loved their hummus for kids and some sort of Albanian Sausages.  I got a date and goat cheese salad which was so refreshing and unique! At the end of the meal our sweet waitress told us about these awesome specials that they have on Monday nights where with an adult entree, kids under 6 eat free! She also told us about ...
A nice place for grabbing some brunch. If you have a sweet tooth we recommend the banana and nutella crepes or the french toast that they do well.

Excellent breakfast. Had the Albanian skillet, my breakfast companion the Albanian breakfast. We were both very impressed. Albanian sausages were lean and tasty, the rest was fresh, tasty and well-prepared. The waitstaff was friendly and efficient. I'll be back, and putting Sofra's in my regular breakfast dining rotation! Price is reasonable, too, with breakfast options at $7-9, and most dinner entrees at $11-13. Very good!

Devoted volleyball player and drinker. Watch out the volleyball leagues are not beginner or even intermediate as advertised, but still a lot of fun. Good beer on tap, but a very limited menu. They do have a free taco bar during Packer games and sometimes a 5 $ Bloody Mary bar. In sum, it's a great townie bar.
I am a big fan. Fun atmosphere. Very good pub food. Tuesday jazz night. What is not to love?!
Great breakfasts, super friendly wait staff, excllent service.

Great food, friendly service. I ate here for the first time today, and was very happy with the fast 'n friendly service. I would recommend anyone to this place if they are looking for a small town friendly diner experience.
Hashbrowns are good. Waitress was friendly.

Service was friendly, atmosphere was pleasant, and the food arrived in a timely fashion for breakfast. But if the food that arrives is thoroughly mediocre and none better than what you could make for yourself at home -- then why eat out? If you're looking for store-bought sausage links, dessicated bacon, and eggs not cooked to order, then this place fits the bill.

Stumbled upon Rhubarb Week.... Oh man. So tasty. And SO cheap. The atmosphere was very relaxed, and the staff seemed to know most of the patrons. I got the C's Sporty Grill. Hash-browns, sauteed red onion, ham steak, cheddar cheese, & two eggs all layered together to form a mound of yumminess. And the homemade rhubarb jam was so delicious that my brother paid for 6 jars to go. Also, my mother's rhubarb scone was just the right amount of sweet and tart. They all kept commenting about how they had...
Always good service, always hot and quick food. Always tasty. Much better than typical takeout.

Bland Asian. Chin's has a wide ranging menu, featuring Thai, Chinese, and Japanese dishes. Based on my experience there, however, you might be better off going to a restaurant that specializes in just one cuisine. When you try to please everyone, no one will be happy. The food wasn't terrible, but it was pretty bland and didn't seem particularly fresh. The interior was spacious and clean. Service was friendly and fast. Prices were fairly cheap. Grade: C-
Good fast asian food. This is a step above typical asian fast food. I like the lettuce wraps and the salads.

Great!. Among the best Asian food I have eaten. The vegetable are always cooked perfectly and with good flavor. Everything I have ordered has been delicious. My wife always gets a couple of the desert bars for later.

I've been here several times. Each time I think it's going to be great. But each time is just okay. Chins may give you a lot of food but over 1/2 the plate is rice. Which is fine if you want a lot of rice and less of the dish you ordered. Also a couple times I've eaten there the meat is clearly double fried. There is nothing fresh about that. The service is always friendly and fast.

YUM. Clasen's has the best bakery around. The breads and sweets are worth the drive. Their Christmas selection is fantastic and reasonably priced. If you don't feel like doing the Christmas cookies this year, hit Clasen's.
We went here excited hoping to find multi grain nordic style breads. However these aren't exactly like that. However they have a good sourdough. The pastries though are a bit more american.

Burgers are simply awesome. Fresh never frozen and you won't leave hungry. First visit the staff was amazing, 2nd visit it seemed we were more of a burden. Its worth the trip of your sick of frozen burger paddies

Didn't expect to find much as I'm a vegetarian but the salads are incredible! Huge with lots of toppings and breadsticks! The management is very friendly. They also offer great entertainment quite often. 5 stars for atmosphere!

Good sandwiches. My mushroom & swiss burger was very good, juicy and about a third of a pound. Fries were standard. Hubby's shaved prime rib french dip was delicious with cheese and fried onion, and a "jus" that wasn't too salty. (I hate that.) The onion rings were standard thick cut rings that tasted like they may have been beer battered.
Always yummy!. I LO-O-OVE ice cream so this is a no-brainer for me. I also love variety and I never get bored here.

Ice cream time. I love cold stone. but just stick to bacics here. I always sucker myself into getting the new features like the funnel cake or things like that. and theyre all horrible. but the ice cream itself it just awesome. Its always a hit if you spend a little extra and get a cake for a party.

Not so good experience. I was here this past summer and the working admitted to making a batch of the frozen yogurt incorrectly but chose to serve it anyways. It was different color which is what prompt me to ask about it. The service is obnoxious from under-trained kids that don't really care. I was very surprised that an ice cream specialty store would service their product after knowingly making a mistake.

This place was foul. It wasn't clean, which made me squeamish when they spread the (melted) ice cream out on the marble slab (which I find to be a gross concept anyway). By the time she handed me my small cone, it was fully melted & required the cone to be turned upside down in a cup. It was full on ice cream soup. The cashier actually gave it to me & didn't even blink. I would never have served this or would certainly have been embarrassed to. When I asked if there was another ice cream place t...

The portions here are always huge but when i ask nicely they let me make a kids portion for a treat. I love that this is one of the few places where yellow sponge cake can be mixed into ice-cream which i do along with strawberries, thats my thing!
It's good, consistent and convenient - all the things you want from a chain. It has a warm and inviting interior with lots if healthy options!
Love me some Cosi! This location hits on all cylinders! Enjoy their freshly made breads, soups, sandwiches and warm inviting environment!

Okay. I had never even heard of the Cosi chain, which apparently has a coast to coast presence, before I found myself eating there earlier this week. It was pretty comparable to a Panera in fare, price, and atmosphere and our experience fell in the okay, not great range. The menu is a somewhat predictable mix of salads, sandwiches, and soups. We ordered two melts (gorgonzola steak and chicken parm) and a soup (chicken and pasta). The soup was fine, but it was actually our third choice--they sim...
Stale bread, stale cookie, tiny bag of chips and a soda for $13. Repeated peddling of Cosi card. Not good. I feel bad for the people who have to work here.  -----31 Mar, 2014----- Hmm.

Healthier options are found here amongst franchises. Our favorites are the tandoori chicken flatbread and the sweeter salad with cranberries and pecans. Wonderful that this can be done in the half sandwich half salad style. They also sell a nut mix which is good to carry for road trips.
Really expensive for what you get. The meat is microwaved and greasy. Would not recommend to anyone.

Custard king. There's a good chance that Culver's pumpkin-pecan concrete might keep me from ever leaving Wisconsin. Other favorites are the cappuccino- and mint-flavored custards, Black Forest, and vanilla concretes with hot fudge and marshmallow creme!
Great Bacon Butter Deluxe burger. Awesome food - have been going since they first opened July 1984!
Falbos is by far my favorite pizza place. They may not have the best service all of the time,but they make up for it with their great food. Leave tips and you great treated like kings. :)

Good pizza, run by idiots. We had our last meal at Falbo's tonight. We have a history with them of missing toppings, forgetting items and forgotten and/or misplaced orders. Tonight's wins the award due to the rude customer service. Tonight's carry out order was: 1) sent with the delivery guy, 2) item forgotten, but paid for and 3) when asked about missing item told, "Oh yeah, it's here if you want to get it. When I replied, "This is bullsh**! (In my defense, it wasn't the first time it's happene...

Broasted Chicken.... What's that? Had to try it and was NOT disappointed. Reminded me of the fried chicken my grandmother made back in TN. So flavorful and juicy! Grab some in the drive-thru if you are in a hurry. I am officially addicted.
Good food. The food here is good and the service is always friendly.

Hopefully stays around!. Eat here. I was working in the area for over a week, ate lunch here the first day with my crew, and we went back everyday after. The food, service, and prices make it exactly what you hope for in a local staple!
