I love this little Italian place!. Was back again and loved it again! Wide variety of fresh pasta and veggie salads, single serving pasta dishes or order a entire pan of lasagna!. Fresh baguettes and sweet treats to finish with. Did I mention I love this place?  -----24 Jun, 2009----- The sandwiches are fresh and delicious, but don't forget to try the soup. And the cannoli!

Stopped here during our lunch break. Both of us loved our subs. I got the Sicilian on asiago bread. Absolutely amazing!!!! Best bread I've ever had with a sub. Also got the grilled chicken pesto salad which was also very good. Prices are very cheap also. Can't wait to go back.
This location is very slow and has seen better days
Bar food. Fairly standard bar fare, but I always leave satisfied. The hody burger is great and they do a good job with quesadillas and most everything else.
Best desserts around. I love the 50's feel of the place. Always clean and neat. Just a bit too noisy during peak hours. fun to go there just for cream pie and coffee.

Good (with a few issues). The Hubbard is a good, consistent option - I've had the chipotle chicken salad at least twenty times. The waffle fries, white chicken chili, and most of the pies are also worth a stop.  There are, however, a few lemons - the asian salad is generic and the cakes taste like they've been frozen - probably because they were.   That said, most of the menu is very good and the prices aren't bad.

Just OK. Like most of Food Fight's restaurants, they're a little overrated and a lot impressed with themselves. I like the diner ambience, and I've had some good meals but never anything particularly creative or outstanding. Their pies are so-so. The crusts are limp and the fillings oversweetened. The last time I ate here the soup was so oversalted I couldn't eat it (to their credit, the manager deducted it from my bill). Bottom line - if someone else was dying to go here, I'd acquiesce, but I h...

WORRY ABOUT HEALTH FACTORS. We have eaten at the Hubbard St. Diner several years while attending the American Girl Benefit Sale. While I have been generally pleased with the food and they have great bakery items, the last time we were seated at the "bar" where we could see inside the kitchen. It didn't look clean and there were tons of greasy dust bunnies over the grill area where cooking was done. Since the advent of cooking shows featuring the importance of a clean kitchen and food safety I ha...

Wonderful Experience. I have been to this restaurant twice now, and both experiences were positive. I had a pattymelt for lunch that was very good. I returned for breakfast and ordered an omelette. The omelette was delicious, and the pie alone would make a trip here well worth it.

Food was nothing special. For all the likes, positive reviews, and awards on the wall, I'd expect better. I guess Madison doesn't have any decent Asian places. We even ordered items that were recommended, and the popular items. Not worth visiting.

I prefer panda express!. Disappointing!  I visited the resturant based on urbanspoon ratings. It will be the last time I go there.   I ordered cashew chicken and my gf ordered mangolian beef. The latter was ok but the 1st was bad.  Serivice was alright but one of the water glasses we were given had lipstick marks from a previous customer!!  Not a good experience.

Lamb!. I'd never had a Lamb Chinese dish, I tried the Governors Lamb at the Imperial Garden and it was delectable, tender, spicy, and made great leftovers, I will be going back for the Governors Beef-possibly for take out.

Must still be good. It’s not amazing that many restaurants last for long periods of time, was I thinking back to some very good Asian places I have been to over the years of travel and The Imperial Garden popped into my thoughts. I was working in Madison for several weeks back in 1987 and visited here many times I had the Imperial Shrimp on one of these visits and have remembered how good it was, so it’s not a surprise when I looked and it was still in business. If I am ever back in Madison ...

First of all, my review is only this high because of the egg roll.  The veggie egg roll was crispy and the inside moist and flavorful.  The rest of the dinner was not appetizing.  First of all, I went with a party and was upset to see that they barely ordered any vegetarian options.  One veggie lo me in was not enough.  The baby corn tasted like preservative water and the noodles were without flavor.  My friends had the garden chicken and the governor's chicken, and they felt that the dishes wer...

Good food, spotty service. My husband took me here on our first date and we've been back several times. I always order the parmesan NY Strip (he usually does too). In my experience it is always delicious and cooked properly. We wouldn't recommend the steak medallions though, they were overcooked and very dry. The focaccia bread and oil is so good, I have to stop myself from devouring it all. They also have one of my all-time favorite restaurant deserts, a rich chocolate cake with whipped cream a...

Terrible Attitude and Rude Service. We went without reservations after arriving late from out of town. No more than half the tables in the restaurant were filled. The hostess was snobby and asked if we had reservations and when we said we didn't, she said it would be a 25-30 minute wait. To say we were offended and insulted would be understated. We will not be back, ever. They need to work very hard on improving their attitudes and their attention to serving customers.

It's ok...I mean it was right next to my hotel and I was tired so I ambled over. I have to admit - the concept of an Italian steakhouse was a bit confounding (which one is it???). After asking the waitress which way I should go I went with steak with a side of pasta marinara. She also recommended the mushroom side (I figured I'd have leftovers for lunch).  After ordering the complementary salad and focaccia bread came out. The salad was fine but someone needs to tell Johnny the bread he's servin...
Had a very nice meal here recently with a group of four. Pasta and steak dishes were very good and wait staff was friendly, even on an evening when they were slammed with guests. Highly recommend.

This place is wonderful.  Stopped in for lunch while in the area shopping with the wife.  Appitizer ---- Sausage stuffed Mushrooms My dish -----  Monte Christo sandwich Wife's dish --- Lobster stuffed Mac-N-cheese  Dessert ---  On tap draft Craft beers  Amazing food, affordable prices, clean atmosphere, friendly service and the best food we've eaten in the area.  You just gained new customers.  See ya soon!

Great Place to take a special friend.. My lady friend and I enjoyed the great food and romantic atmosphere. Wonderful service. Excellent, well spiced and beautifully presented food makes this a good value for the money. Love the piano music over dinner. Might be hard for disabled people to get down the stairs, though.

Great Place to take a special friend.. My lady friend and I enjoyed the great food and romantic atmosphere. Wonderful service. Excellent, well spiced and beautifully presented food makes this a good value for the money. Love the piano music over dinner. Might be hard for disabled people to get down the stairs, though.
Horrible....food was so bad it could not be eaten. I will say our waitress was very nice and gave us nice service but the food was terrible.
My husband and I had a great dinner there last night. Lovely atmosphere and attentive service, but the food was the star. I had the delicious duck and my husband had the salmon special. Yum!

Special Place. I love this restaurant! - Especially enjoy the appetizer for two, with stuffed mushrooms, shrimp and a stuffed tart. This is a 'for sure' each time we go there.   The entree selection is good, and the specials are usually reliably good.   This is one place we recommend for that special 'date'.
Foods not fresh
Quick and clean

Nothing wrong with this particular mcdonalds but with fastfood theres only so much you can expect. On a really hot summer day the iced coffee with hazelnut can be a good drive through pickup though loaded on syrup.
Nicest McDonald's in the Madison area and I have never written a review for a McDonald'd before! Great, friendly service. But the food is still, well, McDonald's. Quick breakfast on the go here.

Nicest McDonalds in the whole world. Retro building design, clean, fast, and the nicest and most professional McDonalds staff you will ever find. I don't know why they are so nice, but it is a nice surprise. I don't generally eat McDonalds, but this is a nice place for a quick McDonalds breakfast.
Quick and clean

Friendly atmosphere, mediocre food. I wish the quality of the food was at par with the friendly atmosphere. The sandwich menu is extensive but we didn't find anything above mediocre after more than ten visits to this place. Worst of all is the fried walleye sandwich and/or entire walleye meal which was horribly over cooked on all three occasions we ordered it. You are much better of ordering the cod fish fry on Friday which is about the only item worth suggesting.

I have been to mid town pub several times. The bar is very close to my home. They have a very good selection of craft and micro brews. I have eaten here a few times over the years. None of the food stood out to me. Other than being typical bar food (fried and greasy). I also noticed the bar staff helping in the kitchen without washing hands on numerous occasions. Otherwise a very nice place to hang out with friends for a few drinks.

Love it!. The staff is always very friendly and the service is usually outstanding even on busy nights. The prices are fair and the atomosphere is nice - not too dark, the music isn't obnoxiously loud, etc. Try the prime rib sandwich! It's wonderful!
Blah sums it up. How does one get a "2 for 1" burger out "up to $5.75" when the cheapest ones they have are $8? What a sad, sad sales gimmick.   Food is average at best.
Blah. The Nitty Gritty in Middleton suffers from some horrible birthday-related disease that eroded the food and atmosphere into a sad, sad experience.
Not impressed. Overpriced. Overrated. Won't be back.

Service here is always mediocre which is strange because the service at the original Gritty is always wonderful. Today 18% gratuity was added to my bill without being asked if I agreed with this. There were only 5 in our party. We have come back a few times in the past because the food is similar to the original Gritty but after today we won't be back. I refused to continue to be forced to pay a good tip for mediocre service.

Time Stands Almost Still. I have been at the Nitty Gritty numerous times over the last 40 years, but I can honestly say I have never been there for a birthday. I have the usual Gritty Burger with Gritty Sauce and it has been consistent all through the years. It has become a little piece of history. The food and service are average, but still worth a visit if you have never been there before just to look at the history on the walls.

The new name for this restaurant is Taigu, under new management. This was a brilliantly simple dish, beef with handmade rice noodles in broth, the good stuff. The host/waiter was very friendly and steered me in the right direction on the menu.  This was a lunch visit but I'll come again and bring my family to try other dishes. I'm rating this fairly high on my first visit.

All Dressed Up And No Place To Go. I don't really understand the appeal of PF Chang's. You pay a few bucks more for food that isn't any better than a standard Chinese-American takeout spot (or in this case, food that is worse than takeout). Sure, the atmosphere here is better than you'll find at one of those other places, but the food on the plate is more important than the surroundings. I did enjoy the chicken lettuce wraps, which were light and refreshing. The pork potstickers, however, were ...

Consistent. Have always enjoyed the lightness of the menu at PF Changs. I am not a fan of food in a box that is swimming in MSG-laden sludge so stay clear of Mom and Pop Chinese take-out places. Just moved from Oklahoma City, where the hubs and I frequented our local Changs often...the Madison location seems seamless in the quality of food and service. We visited on our anniversary and were pleased with our experience. Always a good dinner and even if we encounter a problem the staff/management ...
Food straight from the frozen section of your local grocery store. Any dumpy fast food Chinese takeout place will beat P.F. Chang’s hands down. Worst Chinese food I have ever had.

Nothing special. I dined here once. Obviously no different from any other PF Chang's location. Would much rather visit Abuelos or Quaker Steak. I don't see the draw of this place. If you want Chinese food, order take out from the comfort of your home!

Good for groups and a franchise that known for serving a consistent quality of food. The lettuce chicken wraps are quite popular and so are the new tacos. We somehow tend to order a lot of appetizers and do a tapas kind of meal. This has a bunch of vegeterian options as well.
Super fast delivery. Nice delivery guys too

Worst customer service ever. We all know Papa Johns make great pizza. There's no question about that. But the Middleton location has the worst customer service I've ever encountered. And I've seen some terrible wait staff as a restaurant pro of 5 years. Travis who works at papa johns in Middleton in university ave, is condesending and flat out RUDE. and not even subtle about. Just blatantly disrespectful. There's a tone in his voice, that also lets you know he knows how rude he's being, and gets...

Tasty Alternative, But Should Be Cheaper. I haven't had a take and bake pizza in probably ten years, but I was pleased after giving Papa Murphy's a try. While they don't have as many options as some of the more creative local spots, they can at least match the national chains. It's fun to watch them put it together and nice to be able to control how it's cooked. The pizza itself was tasty, certainly better than frozen though it doesn't touch the best pizza places.  The price seemed too high too...

Horrible treatment by management. I used to love this place - I came here once every week or two for breakfast and to sit and write for an hour or two (I'm a grad student working on my thesis). The food is expensive (~$12 for two eggs, toast, bacon, coffee) and the coffee isn't great, but the atmosphere is nice and I didn't come all that often so it seemed like sort of a luxury. The staff also isn't particularly outgoing, though not downright rude... until today.   Today is Sunday, and I arriv...

Horridly overpriced, poor selection. My husband and I stopped in to the Prairie Cafe and Bakery on a Sunday morning to meet with family. In short, if my family had not already ordered and were waiting for their food, we would have left. My husband and I spent $8 getting two bagels with cream cheese and a juice to share. It shouldn't take that long to toast a bagel but we waited over 10 minutes for our bagels to even arrive.   We would have loved to try something else, but since the cafe only a...
I love this place! The quiche of the day is always excellent. I also love their health shake. We like to stop here for breakfast after a power walk through nearby Pheasant Branch Conservency.

I've been going to Prairie Cafe all my life. Honestly, I have no idea why I keep coming back. They have really good food, eggs were delicious. Although the service killed me. I was there with my friend one day, we had forty five minutes to eat before she had to go. At the cafe only three other groups of people were there who hadn't gotten their food. We ended up waiting forty five minutes for one dish of eggs, potatoes, and a bagel. The food was yummy, but I didn't have the best time, mostly bec...

Pancakes. Big, fluffy, and with just enough crispness on the outside to make it wonderful. I squeeze the orange slice over mine before applying butter and syrup!  -----27 Jul, 2010----- Neighborhood feel with amazing tastes. I tried the Prairie Cafe on a whim one Sunday morning ofter one of my many bouts of insomnia. It was a 3 am craving for espresso and pancakes that made me realize just how hard it is to find a delicious breakfast paired with good coffee (at least in a price range that doe...
Good atmosphere for a chain.... I typically like the non chain places best, best QSL has some good, friendly barkeeps, solid wings and plenty of TV space.

Great food!. Our server was loud, but awesome. Love the variety of other things on the menu since I am not a wing fan. The food was stellar, and portion sizes exceptional for the price. It is possible to eat healthy here!

Wingin it. Cool place to meet up with friends and they have some great wings. I tried the atomic challenge and was unsuccessful, but it was fun trying. My favorite wing here is the dusted chipotle. The buckeyes really aren't as spicy as they make them sound, you should give it a try. Another plus is that my son loves this place for all the cool things hanging from the ceiling. They have race cars hanging and whole bunch of cool stuff to look at.

Best wings in  USA# nice environment gud service   So we went on sunday and their was no rush  We were seated quickly We ordered stella artois Lube a rita Side car fries Breaded bonless bucket  with sause   Arizona ranch  Golden garlic  . Wings were awsum do try it  Fries were gud too The only thing i dindt like is the drink  lube a rita. Other than that i will definately recommend this place to all wings lover
Best wings USA!! 25+ sauces you can't go wrong.. Such great food and service too.. Love Bike Nite every Wednesday in the summer with live bands.

Fresh, Delicious Pies. I've eaten here a few times and left satisfied after each meal. The ingredients taste fresh and there are plenty to choose from. The crust is thin, though I wouldn't describe it as New York style. All in all, an excellent pie. As Zippy points out, however, the real gem on the menu is the roasted red pepper soup. Rich, thick, and with the right amount of spice, it makes for a great bite before the pizza. There isn't too much space inside, but it is comfortable enough and d...

Nice space, great pizza. The wide array of unique toppings is what really sets the Roman Candle apart. Their specialty pizzas are unique and delicious, but you can get quite creative with all of the crazy toppings and make a pizza that no one has ever seen before. I like the retro atmosphere of the downtown Middleton location.

Really enjoyed!!!. Being from the east coast, I tend to be a pizza snob, but I will say the Candle has a good pie going. I think the choice of toppings is great and will bring me back time and again to try various combos. I tried the caramelized onions and found them too tough and lacking true caramelizing. The service was good. The beer was great. overall, I recommend you try it.

Roman Candle has OK food. I wasn't thrilled about how many tortellinis I got for $12. The pizza is OK, not better than Villa Dolce. When I was there with a friend our waiter was a little rude. We got a tortellini to share, and some asparagus. And when we were done he said "Wow! You guys sure finished that up fast. I just dropped it off and came back...and it's all gone!" Well, he was actually gone for 10 minutes, and sharing one of their small dishes between the two of us, I think that was very ...
You can even have zuchini on your pizza! They have great specialty choices and you can always find a coupon. A bit pricey for pizza...
Everyone is so nice at this store. The deaf Barrista inspires me to learn more sign language.
Love the staff!. They remember my drink and they are so friendly.
Baristas are awesome!. They always make my drinks perfectly and quickly. And when I want to try something complicated- their game at making it!
The baristas make the Starbucks and these employees get it right every time
Its a typical starbucks but the baristas are friendly and enthusiastic and can draw a good shot of espresso for you and add ice cubes for me to make my Mericano kids temperature :)

Very clean, fast and friendly. The manager has my order by memory and is always saying hello to customers by first name which is really nice. Night staff is friendly and can always help me even late at night.

Dirty, Old School Service, and modern Prices. Clearly a beloved neighborhood greasy spoon, but the restaurant is filthy. The food is exactly what you'd expect for the looks of the establishment, homey, greasy, and fatty. The cost of the meals is completely inconsistent with the decor and "old school" motif. No credit cards accepted, so if you brave this place bring cash and some Lysol wipes for your table and silverware. Sad.....  -----17 Feb, 2015----- Dirty, Old School Service, and Midern P...

Good, filling breakfast. Three Sisters is a very down home, cozy breakfast joint with incredibly friendly wait staff and average, but delicious breakfast food. The omelette with hash-browns and toast was 8.75 and a decent helping. I also got one blueberry pancake which was pretty size-able and definitely delicious. (2.75 I believe) All in all, it is a great spot to start a saturday morning.

Overpriced and cash only. I am originally from Miami and working in a project in Wisconsin so I decided to get out of the ordinary and try something different the place was very nice and cozy. The food was not bad but I was they start you off with a small orange juice so if you want more get ready to pay for a refill. worst but not least the place needs an upgrade with there payment process. I'm lucky I had $20 otherwise I could not have been able to pay with my debit card  -----17 Jun, 2014--...
Tortilla Soup. The tortilla soup at Three Sisters is ama....zing! been 2 several counties all over the world and I still get the urge for it for lunch on Mondays.
Walked over there a couple times and food is decent but the restaurant is filthy and the service OK at best. Dirty carpet, torn seats, splattered walls and dusty. Won't be going back.
Great atmosphere. Had steak pizza and bottle of wine....all were very good. We were seated quickly, friendly waitress. Pzza crust thin and chewy EXCELLLENT...loved it
Ok.... The food was ok. The menu was really quite small and was pricey for the small portions.

Warm, cozy atmosphere... Celebrating my birthday with my S.O. and our foodie friends... Food was very tasty: antipasto, pizza and a bottle of valpolicella with gelato for dessert. Friendly server and owner came table-side to say hello. Very enjoyable and I will be back!

The gelatos here are delicious. Parking can be found in the streets behind the shop and in summers its a lively walk to come back to grab a treat. The pastas are good but of the dried variety and sandwiches are alright too.

We were at the ice arena in Middleton last night and wanted to eat Italian nearby, so we tried Villa Dolce. The desserts are in a case across from the hostess stand when you enter and they look amazing. There is both inside and outside seating. Several small rooms inside. The hostess greeted us and found us a table inside. Our waitress was friendly.  The menu consists of appetizers, pasta entrees, pizzas, salads, and calzones. Our group had the Shrimp and Scallops; Wild Mushroom Ravioli, Godfath...
Burgers. My sister has been going through chemo treatments and the first thing on her list to eat is your burgers. Thanks!!

Came here cause of high rating from urbanspoon also! I was very impressed. Even with a medium packed house we got our food very quick! I got the prime rib sandwich which was very good! My girlfriend got the bleu cheese bacon burger which she said was definitely in her top 5. Our friend from Louisiana got "the Rachael" very good service and food. Price was good to!

Friendly place, great burger. This place was awesome: Super friendly patrona and staff, chalkboard menus with the specials of the day above the bar and around the restaurant, wood panelling on most of the walls, the brewers game on TV, New Glarus on tap, outdoor seating if it had cooled down, the cook males the best burgers right in front of the bar, and the sides are a la carte so youbcan get Wisconsin cheese curds instead of fries if you'd like. I would recommend to anyone visiting the area in...

Just Okay. I had high expectations for a place known for great burgers, but Village Green left me a little disappointed. My bacon cheeseburger was fairly ho hum. Well cooked and juicy, but lacking in flavor beyond the bacon. The roast pork sandwich was better. Tender, juicy, and delicious--something I'd go back for. Pass on the spudsters (mashed potato bites)--dry and flavorless.  No problems with service and the prices are pretty cheap. Not much for atmosphere here.  Grade: B-

Went there because of the high ratings. Nothing special. Said they would cook burger to order (med rare), came well done. Not much flavor either. Service non existent-server more interested chatting with her friends or just staying out of site. Seems like it could be a great place for locals but I don't think I'd go back.
Always the best Italian food in town. Been going for years. food is always excellent!  -----24 Sep, 2014----- Italian Bread Pudding. So good!

Favorite. My husband and I have been repeatedly gone back time and again over the last decade to Vin Santos. It is one of our absolute top 5 favorite restaurants in Madison. Our introduction to their fabulous bread pudding was listening to moaning sounds (of ecstasy) from a couple sitting to the table next to ours. A must have item is their Fruitti de Mar.

Great food. My husband I went for a date nite. We wanted to try something different. We jumped on urban spoon and found Vin Santo. Excellent service, fantastic food big portions. We will definitely go back.

I had heard great things and so was disappointed with my meal here. I had the spinach fettuccini with chicken, mushrooms, sundried tomatoes, and a white wine cream sauce. I felt as though the chicken had an odd texture, actually making me wonder if it was pressed chicken. Spinach fettuccini was out of my comfort zone admittedly, but all in all the flavors of the dish were lacking and felt off. Our appetizers felt lacking in flavor as well, though it is early March and we ordered bruschetta. Serv...

Worst Meal Ever. $120 for pallid chicken piccata with mucusy lemon sauce, ravioli from Sam's club and a bottle of wine. Really? There is no reason to go to this restaurant,the decor is awful, the food awful and the prices awful. See review on Yelp for more detail.

Amazing salmon. Beautiful views and friendly service.  -----23 Mar, 2013----- We love The Buckhorn. I love the true "old time" supper club feel. The bar is one of the best in this area. Staff is amazing and the food is consistently good. For reservations on busy nights, ask for Shelly, she will do her best to get you a table. Can't wait till summer and some Prime Rib!

Don't go there!. Worst dining experience this year! My wife and I have been looking for something new and thought that a reasturant overlooking lake Koshkonong would provide a nice dining experience. It was an experience I will not return for ever again. The windows are so small you can t see the lake unless you are seated right in front of them, But if you are, beware the draft in winter! The whole reasturant is dark, dated and over priced. I can t believe we paid $80 for 2 to eat on paper plac...

Great Restaurant. Had a wonderful experience there Saturday night, I love the feel if an old time supper club and the food was amazing! Definitely going back staff was friendly and atmosphere was awesome.

The service is suburb but the food is canned and over priced. We ordered the "waitress' favorite" halibut special, homemade mushroom soup, and steak w/ mushrooms. The portions were tiny, mushrooms were from a can and priced $10+ well above what any comprable meal in the area would cost. Disappointed
Too expensive for what you get, food is mediocre. Staff was nice and friendly
Food is ok, if they can manage to actually give you what you ordered. Double check your order!
You get what you pay for. Low quality meat cuts left my Mongolian beef tough. I've tried them a couple of times, but consistantly sub par.

Very average food. There is a small bar/eating area in the front of the house and a large room in the back which appears to be an addition as it looks much newer than the bar area. Skip any of the specials as they don't taste like they are made from scratch. The prime rib and steaks are average and inexpensive. The food here is nothing to write home about, but it is adequate and the service is friendly. We've eaten here a few times and probably won't go back.

Best pizza in Wisconsin . . .NOT!. USA today reviewed Georgio's Pizza and declared it the best pizza in Wisconsin. WOW, not even close. Our pizza was very short on toppings at $2.00 per topping. Think there were 15 thin slices of pepperoni on our large pizza and maybe 2 small bits of bacon. The crust is not made in house, the red sauce has an off putting sweet taste to it and the entire pie is overloaded with tasteless cheese. Extremely disappointing as I've had it on my Urban Spoon wish list fo...
Fantastic food & staff!. The pizza here is THE BEST! Always made fresh and the owner and his staff are such nice people. Very welcoming and very very good!
Breakfast only. Most of the food served here is below par. Breakfast is adequate. The coffee is good and wait staff friendly. An okay place to meet friends for breakfast.

Real "Family". This fantastic family restaurant actually treats you like family. It's run by a family. The food is like family home cooking. The prices are reasonable. Service is very attentive, but not intrusive. And the food! I've eaten here at least 100 times and NEVER had a bad meal. Everything is homemade, fresh every day. Great all-you-can-eat fish fry (or bake), comes with fantastic clam chowder that's varies each time because it's homemade, no recipe I don't think. Sometimes it's very go...

Typical small town cafe. I love places like this for breakfast and lunch. Low prices, decent variety, fast service. Nothing special - just get you fed. You could switch this place around with any number of small town cafes and never notice a difference. I think they all even buy their cups and plates from the same supplier. Still - I'll be back again and again!
Love the delicious food and the great service!!! Natalie and Ek (the owners) always do a wonderful job. I love coming in knowing that I'm supporting a quality, family run business.

Meh. I have ordered from Paul Revere's a few times, as it is the only place that will deliver to my house. Every time I remind myself that I swore off ordering from them again, but usually alcohol convinces me that pizza is a necessity. Maybe it's the fact that it takes a few minutes to get to my place, but I've had seriously messed up orders and cold pizzas, etc. It's a last resort for me.

Good breakfast. The old building was very tiny - much more room in the new one. Breakfast here is very very good and fairly inexpensive. Service is fast and friendly. You can't go wrong if you stop here for a hearty breakfast. I have not had anything but breakfast here so can't comment on the rest of the menu.

Hi, my name is Jessica:) I waitress @ The Squeeze. I absolutly love my job! I worked for Deb back when I was in high school. Her food is great and the service is excellent;) Come in on Sunday and we'll talk some football:) Go Bears!!!!
New address. They tore down the quaint skinny old building, she's now located right behind where she was, on Front St., the old Empty Platters.

I have dined at Angelo's in Monona many times.  The food is good and the waitstaff is friendly and helpful.  You've got to try Angelo's White Pizza.  It is a family favorite. They don't take reservations, so be prepared to wait if they are very busy.

Got a corner table so were able to catch up on conversation that was lacking all week....food was delish, service was friendly and fast, Pat and his wife welcomed us as soon as we entered and when we left....cant complain about any of that!! One of our favorite spots to relax and unwind with great food and drink!
Food was great, service was fantastic. Overall this is the place to enjoy a great meal and hospitality. Dan was a great host. Always a friendly atmosphere to enjoy a nice evening.

Great food every time!  Friendly staff and owner!  Never have had a bad experience or a bad meal!  We usually have our daughter with us, wait staff will bring a small plate of veggies to the table for her to snack on before we place our dinner order.   The lasagna, pizza and baked pasta dishes are all excellent!  Never disappointed!
Great place, great food, great service.... highly recommend.  The mac and cheese is to die for and you can't go wrong with their pizza. Enjoy!

The desserts are also to die for (esp the 'sticky toffee pudding'). Can't say anything bad about this place, GREAT food, service, drinks and atmosphere. Worth the drive.

The "Dining" experience in Green County, WI. As you leave "The Dining Room" in Monticello, WI, you would ask yourself, as I regularly do, how many other places of exquisite, healthy dining one could find among the rolling hills of this country's rural habitats. Each experience at this restaurant is immensely satisfying, no matter what dish myself or my husband choose: delicate or robust meats, fresh ingredients, exceptional reduced sauces, combinations of flavors that surprise and delight the pa...

Worth A 100-200 Mile Round Trip. GO!  We did a two-week trip through southern Wisconsin in May 2012.  Only twice did we get into a fix with bad restaurants - a pathetic wreck of a diner in Whitewater (tasteless mush that "looked like it had been pre-eaten" added up to a bank robbery that netted the proprietors $38);  And a gruesome rendezvous with a "pizza" in Viroqua (next-day lab tests failed to ID the ingredients; possibly Velveeta or Kraft laminated "cheese" slices laid out on ceiling ...
Best chicken taco salads!!!

Great beer and an awesome view. The Wisconsin Union was the first college union in the country (and still one of the few) to sell beer. What's that say about UW priorities? ;-) The best place to drink in Madison, possibly in the state of Wisconsin. Inside The Rath is a Germanish beer hall. Dull lighting and their own Rathskeller Ale are the two main ingredient here. Nice on a cold winter day. But the staple of The Union is the terrace. Those unmistakable colorful chairs (we have a couple at home...
Nothing fancy but the food is good and is a nice spot for breakfast.
Best fish fry around. The best friday night fish fry around , not to mention awesome lunch spiecals and the best burgers in three counties

Not much going on in Mount Vernon except this place that had rave reviews about its Pizza I being a connoisseur of the crusted Goodness had to try it, introduced to new friends to its delectability, it is thick,  it is wholesome,  it is Hardy, it is tasty, one of the best pizzas I have tried, you're in the area you have to stop, Believe It or Not ran into two people that knew me and my company from McFarland,  nice to be known especially in a positive way....
Awesome burgers. They are huge. The grump chips are a must.

Food was ok, service lacking. We were in the area and decided to stop in for lunch. Waited about 15 minutes to be seated(not a problem). Bar service was very slow. Sat down at our table and waited over 20 minutes for server. I had to get up and ask the manager if we even had a server. Our waitress had passed our table a dozen times and not once stopped, until I got up. Food was ok, but not something I would go out of my way for. The manager should have stepped in because she knew we had been wai...

It's appropriately named.. We left Grumpy. Warning: the food was mediocre and extremely slow, and we were served spoiled red peppers. Why would a restaurant serve a Carl Buddig-like Corned Beef? The vegetarian chili was more like they just popped open a can of plain black beans. Very boring. The open-faced focaccia was flavorless. Any seasonings would have helped; salt, balsamic vinegar, pepper. As for their famous beer cheese soup, it was thin and left us asking, "where's the cheese?" Lastly, t...
Ordered the BLT Lover's BLT because it was different with the avocado, the avocados were awful! They were almost crunchy they were so unripe. Also, don't drink the water-yuck!
Food was pretty good. Big portions, I recommend sharing a meal and an appetizer. Theirs a pizzeria upstairs and pub style on the main level.
Excellent burgers reasonably priced! Try the roundabout burger with a cold Spotted Cow!
Good burgers at a reasonable price. The Rueben was just right too. Wait staff was friendly and helpful. A good bet if you find yourself in Mt. Horeb.
Not very clean, food not very good. Waitress was nice.
Ordered dinner three times, they were out of some key ingredient each time the waitress sent it to the kitchen. I left, no longer wondering why their parking lot is always empty.
Plenty of good food but it could use a good cleaning.

AWESOME!!. Great Scott's Pizza is the best pizza I've ever had. You can tell that he uses only the best quality and freshest ingredients. Unique pizza choices. Very clean, very friendly staff and worth every penny! Orders are almost always ready before the promised time!
Best In Town, Hands Down!. Without a doubt, Great Scott's is has the best Pizza in Mt. Horeb. Their service and food is way better than the pizza joint accross the street.

Best Pizza in Town!. Great Scott's has terrific pizza.... our family particularly likes the thin crust pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms and onions. Yummy!   Not only is the pizza the best around, it's always done in record time!! Thanks Scott!
Good pizza. We had the chicken bacon ranch pizza on thin crust and it was awesome. It consisted of plenty of chicken, bacon, onions and cheese over a white sauce. Very yummy!

If you have allergies of any sort (namely wheat), forget any authentic German dishes. Your choices will be limited to a simple steak, a piece of grilled chicken, or broiled fish. When I go to a Swiss/German restaurant, I expect to be fed the cuisine and have my allergies accommodated, especially for one that is so incredibly common. Furthermore, the chef's wife is herself celiac. An overall disappointing experience for any foodie with a gluten allergy/intolerance.

Change of ownership. Deiningers has been purchased by new owners and is now called Kristi's Restaurant. We are serving breakfast, lunch and dinner with expanded hours from the previous owner. Check out our website at www.kristisrestaurant.com

Fun Experience. A cool, clear, late July Tuesday with the streets of New Glarus practically to ourselves. After reading the menu on Kristi's website the night before, I knew we would have to try it. We had our lunch on the porch. Food and wine were delicious: Salmon Salad, Pulled Pork BBQ, and a fine Chardonnay. Highly recommend for the food and the experience.
Kristi's Resturant. New Glarus, Wi. AWESOME! Great food

The Best!. To say that the creations that Peter brings out of the kitchen are amazing, is an understatement! My personal favorite in town and Rhonda KICKS out the most amazing white chocolate martini! Tell her Renee' sent you and she'll make is JUST like mine!

The cover up of Jalapeno and Heat. Jalapeno in every dish does not make Authentic Mexican anything...Just a Yankee whitewashing....In Mexico, as an invited guest to ones home, "Mama" would delight you with all kinds of foods all with aromatics and textures and flavors...none to burn your mouth, by accident or otherwise.....As a matter of fact, there would be no Hot Sauce even offered as that wuold be an insult to Mama...! Maybe you try a Cuban Picadillo...This will teach you how to mix aromatics...
Fish fry. Friday Fish Fry was delicious with Fried Cod and Potato Cakes. Food was good. Service was good.

Flip Flops?. I've eaten at the Glarner Stube twice. My husband enjoyed the first time so we went back last week and I chose pork tenderloin schnitzel on a hoggie bun? It was DELICIOUS! We had our 1 1/2 year old son with us and everyone was very accommodating to him. I will definitely go back although not too often as it's a little pricey for us. However, I did notice all of the wait-staff wearing flip-flops. I wouldn't normally mind this if it were a barbecue or festival but flip-flops in a rest...

Hostess Issues. We love the food at this restaurant. Four of us drove over from Monroe to have dinner. We put our name on the wait list and waited and waited and waited in the bar area.. We asked about our place on the list and were told that we were coming up soon. Then we notice that many who came in after us were being seated even though they had the same sized parties. We asked the hostess (older, blonde, frizzy hair) and she acknowledged that she was seating others - no explanation why she ...
Not impressed. after the 10 minutes it took to place our drink orders & then the ten minutes it took to receive them, the fatty, chewy BTL came straight out of my mouth into a napkin.
Small place, great atmosphere, friendly staff, good food, should be listed as $$$ being food prices are closer to $15 to $35 range

We Love this Place!!!. We go two or three times a year. It's a bit out of the way for us but worth the trip.   The Veal Schnitzel it to die for, the soups are homemade and wonderful, and the roesti potato is beyond description. I could go on and on.   Not a place for nutrition nuts but I suggest you live a little. Have a great main course and a roesti and go back to granola in the morning. You'll be glad you did.
Best Sunday Brunch Ever!!!
Charming Staff and atmosphere. Our waitress was very friendly and the food was excellent. I would strongly recommend this slice of the old world to anyone. And I am not even Swiss!
Like the Sunday brunch. Had dinner here twice. Pretty good, not great. Will try again.

Pricey and average. We had lunch for 4 on a Saturday. A very average menu with some swiss dishes at a pretty high price for a lunch. Food quality was very average. I asked for more rolls and one in the basket had some reddish sauce on the bottom suggesting it may have come off someone's finished plate. Not much on the menu less than $13 and that for a burger and fries. Too bad as the decor is interesting as one might expect from an old hotel. Look elsewhere for a good meal.

We two couples all had their smorgasbord instead of choosing something off the menu. That was a mistake. The cream of spinach was okay, as was the green beans. The meats were subpar. Wienerschnitzel, roesli, fried chicken were pedestrian and only luke warm. Macaroni used cream but no cheese, fairly bland. $18 per person. I don't eat McDonald's but McDonalds definitely would have been better. Next time, order off the menu.

The customer service is awful and the food takes forever. I have been here twice now and each time I have waited over an hour and a half for our food. Both times we have gotten our drinks and never again been asked for a refill or more water. This has down right been the two worst dining experiences of my life. The owners are the servers and they have no issue talking about customers and being disrespectful. The business clearly doesn't need the business or the money.

Absolutely Fantastic!. I was completely blown away by this Pizzeria. Everything I experienced while I was there was nothing short of superb. The pizza was delicious, especially the crust. And the breadsticks, though we only got four, were breath-taking; I've never had better breadsticks. Additionally, the garlic butter and marinara dipping sauces were out of this world; by far the best dipping sauces I've ever had. The service was also fantastic, and the layout of the restaurant was very visuall...
Why is it you ALWAYS have to park to wait for drive thru service! It's not drive thru if you have to wait 5-10 minutes for them to cook your food. Worst burgerking anywhere.
Everyone lives Firefly and I agree with their reviews BUT the tables are often sticky and the men's bathroom shows signs of not being cleaned well or often enough. Kinda icky.

Firefly Coffeehouse Surge. We LOVE it! The Firefly makes Oregon a true home! Owners are super dynamos and have made a very positive impact in this community! Firefly Coffeehouse provides great opportunities for ambitious young people as well as the young at heart. While serving up some great brews and delicious treats, Firefly puts Oregon on the map for a most welcome "perk-me-up" excursion! Ponder the mysteries of "the Oregon triangle" whenever you visit, and check out Peaceful Heart across the...

Heart of the Community. The current owners have taken on and expanded the mission to make this coffee house the heart of the community--and it is.   This place has recently expanded to accommodate larger groups and has a terrific meeting room. It's a great choice!  The espresso-based drinks are excellent, as other reviewers have noted. I have found the brewed coffee somewhat lacking--it's often "out" and sometimes only lukewarm, but the range of coffees ACCURATELY described is terrific. The ...

Recently went there for a work-related meeting. The atmosphere is charming and pleasant, not to mention quiet. I had a soy Firefly Latte (orange mocha) and it was delicious! As long as shops like this exist, I have absolutely no use for Starbucks. An all-around wonderful experience!

Excellent coffee and sandwiches. House salad was perfect--served room temperature as it should be. Great place for seniors with dementia: simple menu, spacious room didn't cause hearing-aid sound problems, and the cute kid area made for perfect senior entertainment! Will come back!

Yum. We had the special pizza, which had sausage, peppers, onions, and mushrooms. It was really good. The crust was not thick, but not too thin either. If I had a complaint it would be that the mushrooms were canned and I prefer fresh. Otherwise it was delish!!
Best pub food in town.
Friday fish. Excellent fish fry!
Go for the fish fry!!!

Worth the scenic trip!. Let's just say reading reviews of Mulligans was right on target! Get there early or stand in line. The trip out to Mulligans was so beautiful on the back country roads. Only 15 minutes from Verona. So we get there @ 4:55, I was thinking, what in the world are we going so early? We were sat right away in a booth. Decent and tasteful decor, a bit loud but my husband said this is the way I want it. Our waitress, Sarah, was prompt and super sweet. She was new, couldn't even t...
They don't honor their coupons. They charge you a $1.00 to use their coupon for free bread sticks.
Yummyy <33333
Burgers are amazing as is the rest of the food
Cheese munchies nuff said
It's OK for bar food. I am a little suspect of the previous glowing review all the others in Oregon serve better food
Best chips and salsa around service is good sometimes slow. Have the chicken quesadilla or chimichanga can't go wrong with either
Had Señor Peppers for lunch and everything was perfect. Our waiter was very courteous, and the food and margaritas came super quick. We were stuffed.
Love the food and have always been happy with the service. I really wish their resturant was larger. It's too hard to get table sometimes. We mainly get take out there now.
Loved it!!. Great service. Great food. Will definitely come again!
They got my order wrong (twice!) and they serve fried rice with their meals instead of Spanish rice. Very strange.
Good, but now that we have a cousins i like that better.
Awesome!. Stopped off of I-90 based on reviews. Service was great, food was better and the views were wonderful. Will come back if ever in the area again!
Great Food & Service. We loved their chili. The rueben was great, as well as, the prime rib sandwich. We enjoyed the conversation with our server/bartender & her great service.
Lousy food. Tried it again...waited an hour plus to get 2 burgers...save the wait and go to McDonald's....at least you get a decent burger in reasonable time

Wonderful experience. Some friends and I went after snowboarding over at Cascade Mountain. Remi's is a lovely place with some incredibly friendly staff and patrons. The staff was very knowledgable and recommended some phenomenal food, all of which everyone enjoyed. We're all looking forward to going again soon. I would highly recommend Remi's.
Chili Cheese Dog. Amazing. Great Sweet Potatoes Fries
If you're in madison and you're a vegetarian (or not!) you have to try their walnut burgers!! What it lacks in atmosphere it makes up for in food!

Bad, bad, bad!. Could not have been worse. Best thing on the plate was the sour cream packet that came with the over-baked potato. Just looking at the plate you could tell they had no respect for the food or the customer.

Good times. Great Lake Bar. The bands, drinks, and atmosphere are good. The food is ok. Some of the waitresses could use a little more training on customer service but others are very friendly and helpful. The bartenders have always been helpful and upbeat.

Nice Place Easy atmosphere. Stopped here July 8th 2012. It wasn't as packed as I'd thought it would be. The band started outside and then the place filled up outside. We sat inside. One bartender, but he could keep up. Great prices for beverages. Friendly people and okay bar food. We will come back in a heart beat for a great HD ride and listen to a band. A Great ride from Verona, take Lodi-Springsfield Rd. Great views.
Fri. fish fry. Soggy breaded cod tonight. not what it use to be. we use to go there every week & loved it. Food & service has gone way downhill since these owners took over.
Love the eggs and walleye breakfast
Caramelized Onion Burger. Mouth watering at first site. The definition of a gourmet burger!
Good food, relaxing patio; what else could you ask for?

Location, Location Location. Food is as previously described - "upscale Culvers".  Better than average quick(er) food but don't go out of your way making a special visit for this place.  The Ice Cream had some interesting flavor choices and they were not skimping on portions.  And, the view on the deck is nice.
One of the best breakfast places I've ever eaten! Atmosphere is very busy and loud but the food was amazing!

Popular place without a well planned ordering system. Cafeteria style menu is high up and small print, so ordering is slow. Besides that, plenty of seating, great outside deck, and extras like a wine store, bakery, and gelato round out the offerings. I ordered to go, so I can't comment on table service, but cashier was very pleasant and my burger came out in a reasonable amount of time.

Great choice of craft beer and the hummus platter was delicious! My boyfriend and I were the only ones there at the time so we had the whole deck to ourselves! Will return and sit out on the deck soon!

Great Guys Day Out. We decided to make the trek from Madison to the Roxbury Tavern based on my eldest Son's suggestion. It was Cajun day and the food was amazing. We were greeted warmly and had home made cornbread as a starter. I had the bay scallops and they were cooked perfectly. My eldest son had the andouille sausage and the younger a burger. Both said the food was excellent. The home made potate chips were great and the atmosphere was condusive to good conversation. I am sure I will make th...

We'll be back!. We were a group of 5 and everyone raved about their meal! Sides & Sandwiches every night, Mexican & Pizza on Tuesday, Italian Wednesday, Fish Friday (half pound of Alaskan Pollock/homemade french fries/10.95), Cajun/Creole Saturday (I had their amazing Pork Tenderloin Medallions). Save room for their homemade desserts! Best ever ~ really!! Worth the short drive!!

Bad Service and Food. I have been to the Eagle Inn many times over the years. The service has always been slow, but at least it was polite, and the food is average, but decently priced. On my last visit, I went with my 5 year old daughter for dinner. We were treated like intruders, and had no business being there. The whole experience, the rudeness, the less than stellar food, the amount of time it took just to place an order all the way through FINALLY getting our check left a very sour taste i...

Breakfast and pies alright forget about anything else. I have been to eagle inn many times over the years and their breakfast and pies are the only thing worth getting. The breakfasts are way overpriced and nothing more than your average greasy spoon type meal. The pies are very good whith a large selection and normal priced. The lunch and dinner are low quality canned and packaged type food with no imagination. The decor of the resturant is boring get your breakfast to go.
Great local dining option. Fast and friendly service. Homemade desserts. No complaints here.
Somebody in the kitchen knows what they are doing. Best omelettes. Homemade breads, cinnamon rolls!

Not so great. My partner and I are new to the area and we like driving around and checking out what's available. We decided to eat lunch at the Eagle Inn as it's right next to the Sentry market we often use. Well, it was pretty bad. The food is average at best. If that's what you're use to then I guess you could call it comfort food. Ever hear of an herb or spice? Not here. We watched 5 tables get seated after us (a 2 top) and get service before us. 1 of the tables got there food and finished be...
Poor service and management. Dorothy's management and service is very poor. Waited over an hour for our food and it was cold!
Quality and service. Going straight down hill as company grows.

The original. This was the first Culver's ever built. I have visited many Culvers in many cities and I've decided that this location must add a special ingredient to their shakes and malts because they do it better than any other Culvers.

Dorf Huas review. Went to the Dorf Haus on Easter Sunday. The food was just ok. Some of the things on the Buffet were cold. In addition, we made 2 attempts to get glasses of water from a waitress and they all seemed to run around like chickens with their heads cut off. Upon trying to pay our bill no waitress could be found. When the owner asked if we had a waitress, I said barely. She took 5.00 off the bill. Still doesn't warrant a return to this place. old, old, old
German delight. Awesome german food and bier!

Had a mouth- watering feast on sat Dec 22nd, 2012- ribs & chicken that were heavenly- ribs falling off the bone & bbq sauce not too overpowering! The prime rib was cooked perfect & the wiener schnitzel was to die for! Soup & salad bar was so delicious & homemade fresh! Aabsolutely LOVE Dorf Haus & their family & service are second to none@ much prefer off the menu to the buffet for special German feast!

Top notch Friday fish fry. White, flaky haddock with light breading. German potato salad and cole slaw. Hot fritters with honey make an outstanding bread starter! Cozy, friendly laid- back supper club vibe!

What a great spot. Friendly folks, who shared stories and poured great drinks. Jim, the bartender, makes you feel like a regular even when it is your first visit. Rebecca gave us a tour and shared her family history. And the food was incredible. My wife demanded we come back her for her birthday. Wish granted.

Good fish fry. We ate at the Green Acres restaurant last night. Those that ordered the fish were very happy with their entrees; those that ordered steak at this steak house were very disappointed. My rib eye was all fat - I got about 2 bites of meat and left the rest as it was so dark at our table I couldn't tell the fat from the meat. The meat also tasted like it may have been tenderized, but not sure about that. The hash browns were fantastic and sadly the star of my meal as the salad bar was ...

Not Returning. New to area and family (who LOVE this place, btw) took me there. We waited an extremely LONG time to get a conference room-style table and chairs next to the "salad bar". I was seated next to some station where they light candles for the clarified butter so was high off of sulphur all night long! Ordered salmon and the salad bar...both extremely disappointing! Salmon was overcooked and poorly seasoned. The salad bar was just bagged iceburg lettuce. Will NOT be returning to this hy...

Coconut Cream Pie Better then my Mother-in-laws. WOW what a find! My wife and I were out for a drive and end up in Sauk City. It was about 5 pm but we had not had lunch so we stopped for a early supper.   Leystra's was the first restaurant we seen. It's building looks like a old farm house. The inside reminds me of the old time town dinner. A place where the locals go to eat, sit and enjoy the company. The wait staff was very friendly and welcoming. One thing, if you are a larger person head f...
Good food but awesome pie!. The pies here are worth the trip alone - from anywhere. Good basic down home cooking at amazing prices.

Good greasy spoon resturant. This is a great breakfast place the homemade bread french toast I think is the best thing on the menu. The pies are awsome too. The lunch and dinner could be better but on par with a greasy spoon type resturant. The decor is dated and old but in a good way. Only thing wrong is they close to early. Best place in sauk city by far.

The food was good. Nothing to write home about. The service was slow at first but they were busy. When we went to go pay we were told that Associated Bank cards do not work at their facility due to something on their register being to close to a fradulant account. The sign up front said they took mastercards; didn't say anything about associated bank cards. When we said that was all we had we were told to use the ATM at the gas station across the street. Thank goodness I had my checkbook with me...

Good diner type food.  Homemade pies  are fantastic.  Breakfasts are quite tasty.  Staff can handle a large group very professionally.  Not gourmet food by any means, but great comfort food in a nice old building with great wait staff and kitchen.

Good Food. I really like this place. We live in Mazomanie and this is the best place for Chinese food in the area. The veggies are always fresh and delicious. The shrimp fried rice always has lots of shrimp. Not just on top. Leftovers in my work fridge. Can't wait!
Good buffet at a good price.

Great food and value!. I have eaten at many Chinese restaurants and buffets (Madison has over 100!), and this is one of the best. They neglected to say on their website that there is a $1.00 senior discount, which makes it even sweeter. The cooks are long-experienced Chinese cooks, more like chefs, and not the usual trained locals. There were several items that were the best I have ever had, the peanut chicken, mushrooms and beef, sweet cream cheese puffs, and even the garlic bread (increasingly...

Very good for a small town asian resturant.. I have eaten here many times and find it always very good even the buffet. i get carry out mostly but have the buffet from time to time my only complaint about the buffet is it could be bigger and everytime ive had the buffet its always the same items which get boring i like to try new items on buffets before i would order them. I have ate at alot of asian resturants and I think this is one of the better ones.
Love it!! The service is great, while the subs are amazing!!!

No Home Runs Here. The Press Box might once have been neat, but it hasn't aged well. Dusty display cases, an ocean of tacky plastic flowers and faded, grimy AstroTurf bedeck this dim restaurant with booths straight out of the 80s.   The outdated decor could have been overlooked if the service hadn't been so poor and the food so mediocre. There was nothing exactly wrong with my $3.00 grilled cheese sandwich... it's just that I could have slapped a Kraft single on two pieces of bread at home, ac...

Good pub. Deaks is a good spot for a quick bite to eat and a libation or to spend time with friends. The menu is extensive for bar type food and quite tasty. Nice selection of standard tap beers and full bar.  UPDATE: Deaks now serves a good breakfast on Saturday and Sunday. They also have a Bloody Mary bar set up, but will make one for you if you prefer that. The hand cut fries are excellent!!

Fresh baked goods with a wide variety of cookies, donuts, bars, and kringle. I tried the pumpkin fry cakes, peanut squares, and sugar cookie. All were very good. I was a bit disappointed, though, that even though their website promises lots of Norwegian goodies I only found one available. I was told you have to special order everything else. I guess it's all about the expectations.

Outstanding. Fosdal Home Bakery creates the finest donuts, pastries, breads, cakes etc imaginable. I have been a customer for 10 years and have never been anything but impressed with the quality of food and the great service.

Rude rude rude. I have never experienced such rudeness. The women that work here must all hate their jobs. If you are not a local and know exactly what you want and where everything is you will be treated like crap at this establishment. Every time I go to this bakery the women are rude and they scoff at you. This was the last time I will ever give my business to Fosdals. The owner would do well to train it's employees in customer service skills. I have never had customer service this poor in my...

Will never go back. Every time I go to this place the workers are completely rude. I always say that I will never go back and after my visit this morning I am done and would not recommend this place to anybody. These people must hate their job.

YUM. Fosdal's has the best bakery goods in the area. The donuts, sweets, breads and rolls are baked daily and excellent. Although I don't think of this as a place to dine in, they do serve some fairly good sandwiches. If we eat here, we usually just have coffee and a donut. It's a good spot to meet friends for coffee when in Stoughton.
Food was disgusting a waitress kept staring at us overall notgood

Horrible. This place just can't seem to get it right. We were there with some out of state business associates for Friday night fish. The service was horrible, even with reservations. Half of us got our food and the rest waited so long that the rest of the party was done eating before they received their meals. Manager was either absent or did not care and food was not good, very fishy tasting. They were small portions and way overpriced. How embarrassing. Everytime it switches hands we try to g...
Their decent but not great. Place smells of mold

Used to be . . .. Halverson's used to be a great supper club with wonderful food and service, but not for the last couple of decades. We still stop every once in awhile, especially after we heard that it was back in the Halverson family, but it has not regained its former status as a great place to eat prime rib,steaks, etc. The food is expensive and average and the service is sometimes horrid, most of the time average. Last winter, the place closed up on our party of six at 10:00 on a Friday ni...

Worst service at a restaurant I've ever had. Had to wait 15 min even though we had a reservation. Then once seated it took 30min to get our drinks. It was a friend of ours birthday and she personally talked to the chef the day before about what she wanted for her birthday dinner. So the day of, we show up, birthday girl told the waitress the she was here and that cook will know what her dinner should be. Then 45 min later we got our food, and the birthday girl still didn't have hers. Then the wa...

More of a meat market. Jacobson Brothers is basically a meat market. They do have a selection of carry out deli things. The potato salad and mac and cheese are both excellent. They often are out of one thing or another which is annoying. They carry Elegant Farmer pies which are expensive, but excellent. The meat is always wonderful if expensive.
Breakfast!!. Good spot for breakfast for those of us who don't get up early enough to have breakfast out. Friendly staff, good coffee, and fresh eggs.

Great breakfast. My broccoli and swiss cheese omelet was delicious and pleasantly full of both. The hash browns were tender on the inside and crispy on the outside with a generous helping of onion and butter - delicious! Only two women working the entire dining area, one waiting tables, the other busing, so service was a little sparse but they did pretty well keeping up. Would definitely go back to this cute little place.

Just a notch above Mc Donald's. The food quality is poor. The Friday fish fry cod has good flavor but is as thin as a small perch fillet and is usually overcooked and tough. It is overpriced for the atmosphere. The restaurant smells of stale grease and old cigarette smoke. The owner is often moody. We used to eat here all the time but the grade of food has decreased and the prices increased. Don't expect to have your bacon anything but burnt crisp or undercooked. Poached eggs come in a dish full...

Last of the breakfast stops. Great place for an old fashioned traditional breakfast of classics and basics. Do not come here expecting some 4-5 star service and food, its not meant to be that kind of place and never was or will be. Its means for locals to come and become regulars and enjoy a basic breakfast and a great price. Yes its small and a little cramped but oh well, your not here for the night, just a meal, live with it.   I came here with my parents as my final breakfast in the state o...
Super affordable, and great home cooking. Don't miss the best club sandwich ever. And for b'fast, the garbage omelette--with everything, and covered with house-made chili. We love this place!

French????. No Idea why Urbanspoon has them listed as French. Their #1 speciality are the ribs, very smoky and would give any BBQ lover "moist mouth." Maybe it's because they have Mussels on the Appetizer menu, in Stoughton that would almost make it a French place. Always good food and they do have specials, I have had seared Ahi Tuna, that was comparable to big city. They do not serve generous portions of fish is my only complaint. They sold me on the Redfish special one time that had maybe the...

Good eats!. This small, friendly spot has some very good food ( I especially like the gyros plate) and good beer and wine selection. Their daily specials are usually quite good, and my husband enjoys the gumbo and pulled pork sandwiches. Can get busy on the weekends.

Things went downhill fast. In retrospect, there were red flags galore that should've prompted us to turn around and walk out, namely: the dusty, fake flowers in the window, the decor that was reminiscent of a nursing home cafeteria, and the fact that there was only one other table occupied on a Saturday evening at 7:30pm. We could've taken these hints, but decided to take a chance to see what Laz Bistro was all about.   Then the menus arrived.  And the confusion mounted.  Laz Bistro sugges...

Very nice food and atmosphere. I really enjoy the features they have. It changes up the menu and offers me a variety to choose from. My favorite items are the spanokapita and usually any fish fare they offer:)  They have a good selection of wines and craft beers to choose from. It really is a great place to share with friends or on your own.

Consistantly good. For a chain, the Pizza Hut in Stoughton WI serves very good pizza. We have eaten here many times and find it to be one of the best Pizza Huts in the area. I don't know why it is so much better than the Janesville Pizza Hut on Milton Avenue, but it is. Staff is friendly and the food is served quickly.
Not a pizza place, this is a bar. The barkeep seemed friendly and directed us to another place (Cinema Cafe).

Great place!!!. If you are ever in this area, you must stop in here. I've lived in Stoughton for 10 years, and this place is always my go to. While not the truly "authentic" Mexican their food is top notch. I regularly sample bits from carts and restaurants in Madison, and comparatively this place is on par when in comes to Mexican food. I've sampled many Mexican stops in the Southern Wisconsin region, and they are in the top 5.  This place is family owned and Caesar, the main guy here, is very...

The Best Mexican Restaurant in Stoughton. Actually it is pretty good, even if the only Mex place in the Norwegian descendant populated Stoughton. They have really large cheese filled Chile Rellenos which is a personal barometer.

Awful. Living right down the way from this restaurant it is always tempting to just " go down to the patio" and have a quick bite after working around the house all day. every time we do, I wish we hadn't . you can only get the bar menu on the patio, that's okay. But a Reuben shouldn't be Karl buddig thin sliced yuck on crappy bread and when you ask for no thousand island on the sandwich , it should not be on the sandwich. the haystack onion rings for an appetizer shouldn't be served with the en...
The food is good bar food, but the music on Friday is absolutely terrible! It ruined the evening.
User reviews. BEST FISH FRY THAT I HAVE EVER TASTED! GREAT SERVICE!

Awesome Down Home Hospitality. I love going to Sugar and Spice Eatery in Stoughton. They have incredible home cooked meals that will delight those young picky eaters and for those of us with a few years hangin on us; the food will bring back memories of hanging out with the family at the dinner table (memories of days gone by; in this hustle and bustle world we now live in today). This small family run business is so friendly and outgoing; I have never felt so welcomed anywhere. They know your n...

Incredibly rude service. I ate here with my family and dealt with what I assume is the owner. The treatment I received was horrible to say the least.  What a complete disappointment, I will never eat here again.
Yummy!. Wonderful breakfasts. Delicious home style foods.

Best pizza around!. I'm not sure we would have ever tried Anna's if not for the other great reviews on here and on other sites, but we decided to try it and were blown away. I think the sauce is what makes it - there's a sweetness to it, and maybe a hint of basil, and not polluted with garlic like some others who try to pack too much "gourmet" into a pizza and end up overwhelming the palate. Anna's is all tried-and-true ingredients, perfected over years of sticking with what tastes best. You can...

Great pizza - call ahead. Anna makes the best pizza in Sun Prairie and one of the best in the Madison area. We've been going there since they opened and have never been disappointed with great "mom and pop pizza place" type pizza. One piece of advice, call ahead and order your pizza even if you are eating in. They don't have a lot of oven space and it can take some time to get your pizza. I would also say skip the garlic and cheese bread.

Needs Work. My overall experience with Anna's was pretty poor. My first attempt to go to Anna's I waited until about 4:20 and the store still hadn't opened. A few weeks later I went back and the parking lot was packed we waited in line for twenty minutes before we could order. The entire time the overworked Anna was waiting on people, taking phone orders, and taking orders at the counter as well as taking payments. While Anna was rushing around there were at least two to three people just leani...

Something missing?. Apparently the day I took my family of 4 out to eat at Anna's, it just happened to be the day they were fresh out of pizza sauce, cheese, seasoning, and sausage. I can only guess this was the case, as my extremely overpriced 18 inch pizza had no sauce to speak of, no cheese to speak of, and worst of all it averaged 1 or 2 pieces of sausage per piece if you were lucky. The bottom line is, this was the WORST pizza I ever attempted to eat in my life, so bad in fact I didnt want ...

Yum. I grew up in the Chicago area, and Anna's is 1 of 2 places in town that has 'real' pizza. (Sal's being the other). An extra large pie, just under $20 is a bargain, Real crust, delicious sauce and the place is always friendly.   Down sides, the mushrooms aren't fresh (so we do without when we order here) and from time to time there is a slight inconsistency, but we order almost once a week, definitley once a month, so we've eaten a LOT of their pies, almost always extremely happy.  It ap...

Delicious and Exceeds Sun Prairie Standards. Many of the restaurants in Sun Prairie are not worth the money or the time. I moved to the area in part because I could walk to many local establishments. Sadly, almost all have proven beyond disappointing. I drive into Madison or even to Milwaukee for a good meal, but Atlantis Taverna is the EXCEPTION! I have eaten in the restaurant and had take out many times and every meal was delicious. Great for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. Kind service and...
So awesome!

Updated review. Still like/love the food but it's over priced and I am always hungry. We haven't been in as much because if this. The fries are great but they are so stingy with the amount that you get. I got 14 fries with my recent take out order. I also ordered extra meat and it looked just like regular meat for extra $$.

Very happy. We traveled from Watertown to try this place out, mainly because of our love for Greek food. The flaming cheese was good for an appetizer, but when we go back, we will get the falafels......the best I have ever had!! My wife got the 3 meat combo and was very impressed with the portions, price, and most of all flavor! Even the rice pilaf and green beans were great. The gyro meat was some of the best we had ever tasted. I ordered the Morroccan chicken and it was great, just enough spic...

Hands down the best gyros in the area. The owner grows some ingredients herself and you can tell. My only complaint is their hours. They open late during the week so I can't take people there for lunch.
Cheap, fast, and awsome. This is what you think of when you think chineese. I will returnany many time

Good food.. This is a great spot for good, quick take out Chinese food. We have eaten here numerous times and have never been disappointed with our order. They always get everything right too which is a huge bonus. Highly recommend for a quick, inexpensive, plentiful dinner.

An interesting experience. Let me start by saying that I'm not sure how to explain this place.  Growing up Catholic, our parish CYO (Catholic Youth Organization) had its own room in the gym basement. We had rock posters on the wall of musicians who were popular at the time that our parish priests wouldn't find offensive. We had a dartboard, and a turntable, cranking out one Rush, Genesis, Yes, and CSNY song after the other. We had shag, self-adhesive carpet tiles coating the walls, and big bea...
Best chicken wings!

Consultant. I love What's Brewin in Sun Prairie. As I sit here, enjoying their wonderful coffee, I am noticing the large number of folks entering - joining their friends. I frequently meet with different individuals and groups and always suggest What's Brewin as the meeting location. It is quiet enough to have a discussion with others and yet lively enough to be interesting. The location, just off of Hwy 19 is perfect and parking is always available. The folks are friendly and professional. The ...
Don't waste your time or money. Would not recommend. Owner was rude, food below average, slow service and horrible hours.

FANTASTIC!. What's Brew'N has great food, great coffee, and a huge variety! This is by far the best coffee shop I have ever been too! I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a new place to try! The staff are exceptionally friendly and make you feel at home! Thanks Whats Brew'N in Sun Prairie!
Good food!. I only ordered food to go, but i was pleasantly pleased with the service and yummy food. can't wait to dine in! :-)

Not the same. I used to go to What's Brew'n and it was great - food and people. The last few times I have been there it's just not the same. Food is not as good, people are not as friendly and service is SLOW! Disappointing!
Biscuits and Gravy Breakfast. Excellent gravy with fresh homemade biscuits.
Great breakfast and very cheap. The pie is pretty good too but the meatloaf is "bizarre." We usually order breakfast for dinner. Service is good too.
Great!!. We eat there quite a bit. The food is always great. Servers are a hoot!

Different in a good way. Great "different" pizza. Service is good and the price is reasonable. If you're looking for standard "mom & pop" type pizza, this isn't the place but if you want something different, it's awesome. June 2014 update: They remodeled. The food is still great but now the atmosphere is good too. They even added a real bar!

Everything I've Tried Has Been Excellent. I've ordered 1/2 of the specialty pies off the menu and everything has been exceedingly good. I would not be afraid to recommend GN to anyone who alleges to like pizza.

Top Quality at 1:30am. I had the priveledge some years ago now to have one of the first Glass Nickel pizzas delivered in Madison. Now living in Sun Prairie I am thankful that there is one just down the way. My daughter and her friend had a yen for pizza last Friday evening and we ordered one at 1:30 am. I was amazed at the quality of the pizza, speed of deliverey, and friendlines of the driver. I have worked the wee hours of food service and at least one of these usully suffers. The pizza was pe...

Some of the best pizza in the area. They also have really great chicken. The service was also great. They forgot some of our items because of a mistake in house, but they rapidly corrected it and brought us the rest of our order almost immediately. It is one of my favorite places to eat!
Cold food, really slow service.

Disappointing and Substandard for Food Fight Restaurants. If you are like me and you enjoy cooking good food and eating at Food Fight restaurants, you will be terribly disappointed in Market Street. It does not live up to the name and reputation of other Food Fight restaurants. Cakes and pies are standards, so if you just want a piece of pie and coffee, then you will not be disappointed. If however, you want consistent food with good flavor and interesting menu options, go elsewhere. I strongly ...

Fabulous!. As a California transplant was looking for a local place that served local food...this was the first place I found! The food is great! Always a pleaser, even for my picky in-laws! Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert are all top-notch...have dined more than I can count and still haven't tried anything that wasn't great!
Food was good and so was the pie! Coming back for sure!!!
I guess others like it.. Standard Food Fight type restaurant. Overpriced "weird" food. Meatloaf should be just that. Meat. I think it had more chopped up veggies in it than beef.

I work in Sun Prairie and decided to stop in for lunch. I chose the salad bar option, which boasted a vegetarian soup (veggie lentil) and a non-vegetarian option (veggie beef).   I started with a salad. The spring greens were wilted and brown/slimy in areas. I had to pick through them for a while to get a decent amount of fresh greens. The rest of the toppings were ok.
