The biggest issue by far occurred when I took a bite of the veggie lentil soup. I am a 17 year vegetarian and could tell as so...
Double check your order. I'm not exaggerating when I say they forget something in my order 50% the time I use the drive thru. Not sure why I keep trying.

Protein Yes but Not Like This. We recently wanted Chinese food for dinner but did not wish to go out. My Daughter suggested we try Panda Garden. We ordered our food and it arrived in a reasonable time. It was slightly more expensive than our ususal trip to Chang Jeng but not enough to be a bad choice.  The problem was the rice. It was rice and some kind of small white worms. I am sure this is not common but once is enough for me.
Take out!. Decent Americanized Chinese food paired with warm friendly service.
Decent pizza. Not as good as Anna's but still great pizza. If you grew up in the Madison area and love Pizza Pit, the Sun Prairie one will make you happy.
I have a problem with being charged $33.00 for a small specialty pizza and a medium pizza with one topping. When asking for a breakdown of cost, kid on phone could not provide it for us.

Early Morning Awesomeness. The Prairie Diner offers up and excellent traditional diner breakfast and an equitable price. The quiche is amazing and the waitresses are friendly and welcoming. You do not have to be a regular to be made to feel like one.

I'm not sure what all the rave reviews for this place are about. Some of the food was decent like the bacon deluxe omelette; but the service was slow and the waffle was served cold. Also, when I originally ordered the quiche Lorraine I was told it would be another 10 minutes before it would be done, but there was a piece of the veggie quiche available, so I ordered the veggie quiche and we still waited almost 30 minutes to get our food!!!! You should never have to wait that long at a diner!! If ...

Been here a few times Everytime the service was extremely slow friendly wait staff but I should not have to wait 45 minutes after putting my order in for a cold omelette with Kraft cheese slices on top especially in a half full restaurant. Will not go back again there are other places just las cost effective with much better food.
Friday October 17 Starting at 5:30AM FREE Breakfast for the first 106 People. $3.00 breakfast until 9.   Courtesy Q106.3 radio station and Sir Hobo's!
Good food for a low price. :)
It is now re-opened after the fire they had last year, great food still!
It's closed, due to fire.
Absolutely love this place breakfast all day and fantastic omelettes service was okay both times I went not great but not terrible. Quick, reasonable price, and great food
1/2 hour in the drive through and still not there yet... Don't ever go here!!!

Awesome service!! The team was very efficient and capable. They all were having a good time working with each other and the food came out extremely quick! It was nice seeing people enjoy what they do and providing great service!
Customer. Never had a problem with there products. Very good and nice price
You really need to watch your product!! Bought buns and 2 loaves of bread and all had mold.

Daly's - We'll be back again. 5/3/2013, Agree with the previous posting, this is not JBs Italian Grill. We were seated promptly as soon as there was an open table. Even though it was busy, the service was great. The food was very good and the blue cheese dressing was exceptional. Ample portions. The price is comparable with other restaurants in the area.

Great Place!. Had dinner there last night and I just wanted to say that it's hard to find food this good at prices like this around here. I know a few places that make all homemade food with culinary ability but they're all a 20 minute drive. The ribs here were amazing. I mean amazing, and it's not even labeled as a barbeque place. My friend had the jerk chicken sandwich and she let me take a bite. Also amazing. Great food, great atmosphere. Definitely worth checking out
I love this place! Homemade food great prices and fast service! 4.5 out of 5. Give this place a shot and if there is something you don't like they will make it right.
Prime rib sandwich and wings were great. Jerk chicken was not the best. Overall good service and food.

Yum!. Stopped in at around 8:00 on a Friday. There were more people in the bar than the dining area at that point so there were plenty of open tables. Our server seemed to be very busy, but he was very nice and was happy to answer any questions about the menu. I ordered the Jerk Pork Hoagie with Sweet Potato Fries. It came with a cup of pineapple salsa and a few pickle slices. The sandwich was excellent. The pork was tender and quite spicy. The pineapple salsa and pickles helped cool it down and...
Decent fish fry, nice waiters, decent bar area. Nothing bad, but nothing great either.

Love it!. I love coming to the Fifth Quarter. It's owned by a former Verona fire fighter, and I love being able to support his business. We go every week, and see the same great servers every time. They are very friendly and down to earth. The food is also great and very reasonably priced. I love it!

One of my favorites. Offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner, there's hardly a time I can think of that I wouldn't want to go to 5th Q. The outdoor patio in the spring and fall is a wonderful place to sip some lemonade and munch some fries. Close to downtown Verona, the view is more than just highway. There's trees, and the soft sounds of nature.   Sunday morning breakfast is almost a regular staple for me and the family. Prices are perfect for the food, and the quality is always above par. Even...
Very expensive for what you get. The place seems to cater to the regulars. My family and I felt very out of place there because of the unfriendly vibe. Definitely won't return or recommend.

Avanti Italian Restaurant Verona WI. After driving by this restaurant several times I decided it was time to give it a try. Surprisingly, they take reservations. We had dinner reservations for 6pm. We showed up early and consumed a beverage at the bar (do not order mixed drinks as they are way too expensive considering the low quality ingredients used). Upon entering, this eatery appears in poor condition with a very low quality set-up. While the bar is decent(all wood), low-quality tables are s...
Good food and good service. The portions are huge!

It's ok every now and then. The food is hit and miss, heavy on the salt and garlic here. We used to go there alot, but not so much any more. Disappointed that the menu and quality of the steaks aren't better.
New owners!! We had prompt service with very short wait for food,drinks and service. Food was very good. Dessert was awesome too.

We had good food. Avanti's was busy on the Saturday night we went there. I had BBQ ribs and french onion soup. Both were really good. DH had the spaghetti and meatballs which were very good. His house salad was better than the average restaurant dinner salad. Overall we were pleased. About the steaks. We didn't try them but they seemed high priced. The special was the ribeye which was still $22. Too much for my wallet.

Great bang for your buck! Excellent service! Great food! I like their crab meat rangoons and sesame chicken. I used to order mongolian beef a lot from other places. Chang Jiang does it differently and makes it very spicy! Too spicy for me! I found out that if you want a non spicy mongolian beef, get the beef and broccoli dish. They have so much to choose from their menu, it's not even funny! If you can't find it on the menu, they'll make it anyway.
I think the menu is over priced and the portions very small. In addition they did not have hot tea! How many Chinese restaurants would not provide tea? Forget it.

Surprisingly good. I am Asian, and I sometimes crave Americanized Chinese food. When I do, I go here. It's got solid American-Chinese food for affordable prices. I love their sesame noodles, and I sometimes get different varieties of chicken. My roommate is a deeply picky person (mostly a meat and potatoes girl), and she likes their food.

For the most part I think Culvers is overrated regionally. They tend to be on the bland side when it comes to the burgers. I love their frozen Custard. I don't hate the food. It's just ok. It feels like something is missing.
Disappointing fried food. Nothing special...cheese curds, chicken strips & fries - all over cooked. I can make better from frozen at home. Nice waitress, great TV's to watch the game at though.
Great local place. Always a great experience. Staff is great with great food. Excellent for a football game.

I've been here for a fish fry several times because the location is convenient. The food was delicious. Both cod and shrimp dishes were good. There is plenty of space. This place is pretty much hopping at night and during games.
Our waitress was awful. She was too busy talking to friends so our service sucked. If not for that we might have liked it.

Dishonesty for profit. I waited 45 minutes after the time they told me to be there.I believe they knew there was going to be an extra long wait time,but didn't want to give me an hour long wait time because I would have said I'll go somewhere else. Half of the order set on the table so half of it was cold when I got home. I stopped going there three years ago because of poor quality of the food, I thought I'd give them another chance. Two big strikes you're permanently OUT.

Frequent customer- Delish!. I am a frequent customer of D- city. The food is always fresh and tastes great. The owners are very friendly on the phone when ordering pick-up and also are always nice when I arrive.  I have never had one meal that I didn't like. Highly recommend for a decent chinese american meal :)
Good Takeout. Dragon City is a pretty standard Chinese takeout spot with generous portions and good food. I'd certainly order from them again. The staff is friendly and the service was swift.

Ok, but not great - service was not good. When we visited the restaurant, we placed our order, paid for it, and only then were we told that we couldn't eat there as they were closing. My wife and toddler son came into the restaurant with me so I think it was obvious we were planning to stay and eat there before we ordered. Had we known they were closing, we would have appreciated knowing so we could choose to eat elsewhere. The people seemed a little grouchy, too.

Once again I was disappointed with Dragon City. They got the order wrong, were rude and the food was cold. We used to order more often but the food quality has gone down and the food lacks flavor. I listened to my husband place the order. When he got back from picking it up, no crab rangoon. When he called them back to report the error, she argued with him saying he didn't order it. How rude!

Bus Tour Lunch. I was part of a group of 42 headed to Epic for a tour. We stopped at Grays for lunch. We were packed into a room off the main dining area which was totally inadequate for the size of the group. We were served a salad bar which seemed very small for such a large group. It looked like they had set up for a family gathering rather than a whole bus full of people. Not much experience dealing with a crowd was my conclusion.

Great House. Gray's Tied House brews their own soda and beer. That alone is enough for me to love this place, but during a recent stay in Verona I stopped in with some other new associates and encounter beer battered cheese curds then a Pulled Pork sandwich. The cheese curds literally melted in my mouth and were by far the most incredible thing I've ever had. The Pulled Pork, though not North Carolina style, was sweet, smoky, tender, and just darn good. For those who enjoy good crafted soda, try...

Okay. I've heard mostly mixed reviews about Gray's, so maybe my experiences have been boosted by low expectations. That said, I've been twice now and have found their burgers to be pretty good. They may not find their way into my top five burgers in town list, but both the house burger and the ultimate bacon cheeseburger were above average. Not overly juicy, but plenty of flavor. I'd go with the fries over the house made chips or sweet potato fries. For wheat beer fans, I'd recommend their raspb...
Some of the best cheese curds in the area. Good food and good beer. Service can be a little slow sometimes but the curds are worth it.

I had the Ahi Tuna Salad with the tuna steak rare. Fantastic and healthy. The tuna was cooked perfectly and the wasabi dressing accented it wonderfully. This salad is so yummy I can't bring myself to try something else.

Friendly, local, fair trade!. Love Tuvalu! A lovely, friendly coffee shop. Delicious drinks (I love the chai, my son loves the fruit smoothies), yummy sandwiches, and great desserts. Lots of local and fair trade art for sale. Comfy couches and a train table for the kiddos!
Nice place. Nice coffee shop in downtown Verona. Nice sitting areas and a cool little boutique shop of local arts to browse while waiting for your coffee.

Please! Keep Your Politics to Yourself!. Keep your politics to yourself? I was looking for a place to go in Verona to just sit, read the paper, have a cup of coffee and chill with the locals. I thought I had found it at Tuvalu. Nice atmosphere, otherwise friendly people,...it seemed just perfect. Until last Sunday when I noticed a woman on the corner of Main and Verona Ave with a sign telling people to sign the petition to recall the Governor at a table set up in Tuvalu. Really? So,in I went an...

Reason Enough to Move to Verona. If I lived near Madison, Tuvalu would be my home away from home, and I'd want to marry the barista! When I asked about gluten-free meals, she told me they were out, but proceeded to make me a hummus plate without bulgar, and replaced the bread with baked potato chips without me even asking! Delicious food, good coffee, great music. I can ignore the recall petitions and just enjoy the coffee!   Thank you!
Tuvalu is great! It's business and kid friendly, serves wonderful, healthy high quality food, coffee & smoothies. It's also a great place to buy locally made art.

For some reason I crave the #13 (turkey sub) often. When I'm sick, don't know what to eat or don't feel like I can really eat anything, milio's does the trick. These guys are always nice and they're a lot faster than most competitors. I have never gotten any ingredients on my sandwich that wasn't fresh.

Disappointed. First impression,typical small town bar and grill,friendly staff. 2nd impression: we were seated in a side room with light provided by large harsh fluorescent light. 3rd impression: because of the lighting it was hard not to notice a stain extending from ceiling to a light fixture . 4th impression: we ordered a burger,fish,2 chicken sandwiches and a Bocca bean burger,cheese curds and onion rings .  The last to items were the high point of the meal and they were so/so. 5th impr...
Good place for game days! Good drink deals, good food, good staff.
If you are staying at the Holiday inn Express in Verona - you can walk right across the street for pub and grub...lovely

Nice Place. Monte's is across the street from the hotel I was staying at for Epic training and I found it to be a nice locals place. I think that regardless of who you are, at Monte's you are local. The menu is typical for a small neighborhood pub and one can see the attention put into each dish. I've not had much, aside from the Monte Burger which was tasty, but I will try and see if I can sample lots more. For me this place is great because of the beer selection. Way too many places like this ...

Staying at Holiday Inn Express and wanting something close? Give this place a try. After being in town for Epic training for about 2 weeks total and trying at least a dozen different restaurants, this place is near the top of our group's list. The staff is great, drinks are good, and surpisingly, the food is also really good. Burgers to chicken quesadillas were all very good.

Great brunch!. I've been wanting to try the reboot of this Pasqual's location ever since seeing the renovations beginning a few months back. Finally stopped by for brunch on a Saturday morning and I wasn't disappointed. Seems like the service needs to work out a few kinks, but nothing notably wrong. The food seems to be essentially the same tasty fare you can find at the other Pasqual's locations, with several unique additions. The breakfast quesadilla was stuffed with fillings and delicious. Th...

Comfortable. This is a small cozy bar, a little out dated but it is everything you would want in a country bar. Nice people, nice service, inexpensive eats and has beautiful scenery. I'd highly recommend it if you want to escape the craziness of inner Madison. You can pop in have a beer and some laughs.

Woah. I was stunned by the poor service at this place. We had heard good things from some friends who like to stop by when they ride the Military Ridge State Trail, and thought we'd give it a try. Everything about the place, other than the pretty location, was so-so at best. I'd suggest the Grumpy Troll in Mount Horeb, or the Great Dane in Madison if you're looking for a good burger. Unless you like cheap beer, bar food and a heavy dose of 'tough' bikers who get so rowdy that you can't appreciat...
Just like any other Subway! I think there are other sandwich shops out there. But this'll do.

Charming Atmosphere, Good Food, Odd Company. For a light lunch and a cozy spot to knit, you couldn't ask for a better place! I was just there for the lunch part, and had the Sow Caprese sandwich. I could have wished for a little more flavor overall, but the cheese was nicely toasted, the bread was delicious and the tomatoes were spot on-- neither raw and cold nor overdone and soggy. I adored the lemon pesto dressing on my greens, which were so fresh they could have just been picked. Finally, the...

Cozy & Friendly. This yarn shop/cafe is nestled in a cozy old victorian-style house. They serve an amazing array of scrumptious goodies, as well as a range of coffees and teas usually found only in specialty shops in large cities. The staff is unbelievably friendly and helpful, and the customers who sit at tables knitting and chatting are also welcoming. It feels like you've always known these people.
This place is awesome! With a wonderful and knowledgable staff, great food and drink selection, and nice rooms to work in, The Sow's Ear is set apart from many other local coffee shops.
What a find. Staff is the best, food is lovely.

Wonderful Wonderful. I love the Sow's Ear. The staff are uniformly kind, helpful, friendly. I'm a knitter and their yarns are wonderful and they are the only knit store in town that lets you use their swift to wrap your own yarn! An example of their friendly openness. Sometimes craft stores can be kind of snooty to newcomers and this is absolutely NOT the case here. It is literally the nicest, best craft store I've ever visited. And on top of that the goodies, pies, coffee and lovely healthy lun...

Best Chinese. This is honestly one of the best Chinese restaurants in the Dane County area, especially for "buffet" type dining. The food is always fresh and hot, there are several typical selections along with their own specialties that they rotate on the buffet. Fantastic tempura-like shrimp, great lo mein, even crab legs in the evening buffet. All food is hot and fresh (which is not always the case at these buffets) and so much cheaper than the comparable Madison Chinese restaurants. It is no...

My choice. While the China Woc seems like a franchise, it's not. A west side staple for many years. The cooks respond to your requests. The buffet is good but, you may request your favorite, the way you like it, whether it's on the menu or not. Portions are large. The prices are great!  Try the buffet and sample several dishes.
Good Vanilla Latte. They make a very good vanilla latte, my wife's addicted to them. Friendly staff, nice place to hang out at if you are in the only Waunakee in the world.
Great people working there! Yummy sandwiches. Would like them to have dark roast everyday it is so good.
Wish they had later hours. Would be a great evening hangout for couples and families with coffee and ice cream.
Great local pub with really good bartenders. Good cheeseburgers, good drink specials on Thursday nights and DJ Saturday nights.
Nothing like a Nugget Burger!!. Great place for a Burger!!
Really low prices, i love to bike here with my friends
Yuck!. I recommend going to Burger King across the street. It doesn't matter what you want to eat, the food will be fresher there.
Always good service. We have always had fast, friendly service here. They are also adept at handling large carryout orders accurately, which is more than I can say for some other Pizza Hut locations.
Not a big fan. Thought the food was sub-par, the atmosphere was old and the entire place left a lot to be desired. Don't be fooled by the nice exterior... keep driving!

Special event place. I have been to many meetings here where food is an after thought. Area folks hold family celebrations here. As a restaurant, this spot is below average. I would not go out of my way to have a meal here as the food is not as good as the food I prepare at home. Skip it!
5, 5 dollar, 5 dollar footlongs are great!

Food Allergy Response from the Manager of the RodeSide. Thanks for the compliments on the food. It's amazing how many people suffer from different food allergies. We are able to accomodate most food allergies. Let us know next time you stop in and we'll take care of that for you. Hope to see you again soon. Pete

Good food - allergy alert. Stopped at the rodeside grill with a friend tonite. The service was awesome and the rodeside burger was great - better than what I expected, very great bacon cheeseburger with a litle kick of BBQ sauce. But sadly I have to say a FOOD ALLERGY ALERT to people that have a FISH allergy. The burger came with fried onion rings/strings and I got the fries. I have an allergy to fish including anything fried in the same deep fryer/oil that had fish cooked to and/or utensils use...

I Would Come Back, Next Trip!. Traveling from Tomah back to Chicago. Looked for a non-chain eatery where I would pay for the food after I ate it. Close to the highway.  Saw this place on Urbanspoon with respectable scores. I stopped, had the house salad, a cup of chili, and some apple pie. Ok, the pie was a wildcard for me and was delicious! House salad was fresh. Chili was good too. Service was fast and friendly. Easy place to like. Other lunch diners looked likethey were enjoying themselves....

On our way through Madison I looked for a place that served breakfast near the interstate and decided to give this a try. We are ever so glad we did. My husband raved about the restaurant for about half an hour after we left. Here's the breakdown:  Food: Delicious and had variety of items that aren't just the same thing you get everywhere else. I had the stuffed French toast, which was French toast filled with a mascarpone/cream cheese mixture; I chose the strawberry topping. Loved it. I would ...
Yup...it's food. It wasn't anything special...just food that I ate...not memorable...The decor and environment could be spruced up...very outdated. Lots of fried/heavy food.
Best around. This is the best bakery in the 35 min vicinity. there are some better, but you need to go to Madiosn or Milwuakee.
Great baked goods, deli foods. The brocolli slaw is a must have
Burnt FFs. The waitress was fine. The person who sat us was rude. Left plenty full. Way too crowded and loud.

Disappointed... We tried this place 4 times....first time, they were new, so the poor service and over-done food were overlooked. Came back again, had a good waitress, and the food was pretty decent- steak was done right, and full of flavor. Third time, good waitress but the food WAS NOT. They had a "busy weekend" the owner said, so they were out of things...including baked potatoes after they let us order them. The "petite" filet was the size of an EGG. The owner didn't even try to make it righ...
Best Chinese in the area

Worth the exploration of their fresh menu options. My wife has had difficulty with any Chinese or Psuedo chinese restaurant for years - developed serious headaches afterwards. When we had the chance to gobble a plate or two of the FRESH - MADE chinese during their lunch special time. Well, needless to say our mouths sang Hallelujah and our tastebuds joined in the chorus! It is about time that complexity of chinese dishes are savoured. My wife orders the Sesame chicken and I recommend the cashew ...

Dive in. This is the definition of a dive bar. Im not saying i dont like this place but its a real dive. If you go in and stay you may find there are some good times to be had here though. This is like the backwoods version of Cheers's. Its small and everyone really does know everyone.

Who goes here?. If there was an expiration date for renovations this place would be toxic. Ok that sounds mean, but its true. Do people really sit and home getting excited to go to Jane's hoping to have a fun time?  Here's a thought for Jane's. Do some work to the inside, hire a couple hot bartenders and have a re-opening. I bet you would triple your customers. Maybe even start making burgers or wings?

Done just right. The burger here is on the verge of being what I call a slider. To me a slider is a greasy burger that slides right down and is insanely greasy. The bun is toased and the cheese is great. If you order bacon on it, you will not be let down. It is real bacon. Not some pre-cooked weird tasting microwave bacon. I think Jims is better than Wedl's/Armstrong. The sole reason being that I can eat this burger year round with out getting sick of it. Sorry Wedl's, but your burger is the McR...
Home of the swampwater. Ive never ate here, but have drank enough here to kill a horse a few times over. Theres ususally a decent crowd on the weekends and the drink prices are just right.

The slipery slider. I have been going here for over 20 years. Nothing beats a Beckers, um Armstrong’s....wait Petersons whoops....Wedl’s burger. Yes this place has changed names more times than a serial killer. I have to say this is maybe my favorite slider of all times though. That is one thing they have down pat and perfect. The old joke about this place is that the burger gets smaller every year and the price goes up, well idk if there’s any truth to that but I surely don’t care. I ju...

The immediate area surrounding Wisconsin's I-94 corridor between Milwaukee and Madison has become known colloquially as the Burger Belt, rich with destinations and hamburger varieties that range from succulent to strange, dependent on your viewpoint as an outsider.  At the intersection of Racine and Center in the small town of Jefferson stands the 8x8 shack now known as Wedl's, the latest incarnation of what was once formerly known as both Becker's and Armstrong's at times during the last centur...

Why not?. Yeah its a chain, but its a good chain. The guy that runs it a heck of a nice dude too. He actually cares about the food. Just ask him about his ingredients and he will tell ya. I'd take this anyday over pizza hut or dominoes.

Extreme fine dining. I think the other bloggers has gotten this place totally wrong. This is not a hole in the wall at all. It’s a culinary masterpiece of excellence here. All the food is disgusting, bland, outdated and horrible. This is just a way of us Jeffersonians screwing with you. If we see you’re an outsider you get the sticky gross menu filled with crappy food. I've lived around Jefferson for over 20 years now. I hope someday I will no longer be an outsider and get the real menu, bec...

Mobile review by Mike Janu.... Mobile review by Mike January 27, 2014 My wife and me attended this place to eat. Wow is what so delicious The place was clean and nice the ice tea was very old and had a metallic flavour. I wish I always go there.

My Mother and attended this place to eat. Wow is what comes to mind. The ice tea was very old and had a metallic flavor, the perch was flavorless and not hot, the vegetables were old and nasty, the rolls come individually wrapped like twinkies, the 20 piece shrimp dinner was gross and the baked potato was dry and less than appetizing to the pallet. Oh almost forgot the wonderfully gelatinous cocktail sauce for the shrimp. It was so hardened the shrimp couldn't pierce the skin! Gross do not waste...
Quite possibly the worst meal I have ever had. Definitely a place to avoid unless you like inedible meals.

Ruined my Mother's Day. Sat for an hour with juice and coffee, only ordered eggs & crepes. Finally left without getting our food, which they told us was ready as we were paying for our juice coffee. No one on the floor managing....really bad ....we'll never go back!!!!
Tue pizza place. Tuesdays are half price pizza days. good pizza good beer here. This is the place in Jefferson to have a few beers and get a pizza.

Fun place, big beers decent Greman food. I like a nice German restaurant as much as the next person. Essen Haus fits the mold. Big beers, Good food, Live polka   Fun place to drink and eat. just don't break a boot, that's expensive.

Mixed. The beef vegetable soup starter was delicious, as was the pretzel (said the German I was with). Mains were both disappointing. Very greasy schnitzel and spaetzle and my german's pork chops were dry. Service good though. Has a nice patio for a beer, but no real raddler (the house made is really a white beer). I can't drink 2l of beer to get the boot. The carrot salad was terrifying - what's with all the caroway?
No service. We went there on a weeknight, hardly anyone in the place. We were seated, got water and pretzels, then ignored for 30 minutes. We finally left.

Excellent for German beer, beer boots, soft pretzels and Gemütlichkeit, this is a fun place to drink with a group of friends. But dining has been an up and down experience at this restaurant. It was decent many years ago, then it went really bad for awhile. Recently, the dining had gotten much better. Maybe it still is, but last night I had the cod fish fry (I know, fish fry at a German place? But I heard it was good there, so I decided to try it), and it was really bad. Dry, old, lifeless and ...

Let me begin by saying "German food has never been my favorite." This did nothing to change that. It's not bad, I just think it tends to be bland.  We went to Essen Haus fairly early on Saturday night. There was a good-sized crowd. It's a party atmosphere with music and beverages. The decor is dark wood and feels a bit dated. Our waitress was fun, friendly, and a sheer delight. She was definitely the high-light of our visit.  There is a decent selection of German beers on tap. I started with the...

I always look forward to dining at Natt Spil. The fact that they have retained the same core group of employees says a lot about their business integrity and does not go unnoticed. Always great food, drinks, service, and ambience.

Outstanding Cuisine!. After having several individuals recommend this restaurant to me, I finally had the opportunity, or should I say the pleasure, of going. Everything was delicious! Most restaurants that try to capture an international palate of flavors fail to do so accurately, but Nat Spil is definitely an exception. Everything from the microbrews, to the apps, snacks, and wood-fired-oven pizza was delicious. The atmosphere is dark, but comfortable and cozy. I would highly recommend this es...
Real tasty food and great drinks but it helps to either know the staff or the specials really well or it'll break your wallet in two and then throw it in the lake.

Space. The only downside to Natt Spil is the lack of space. On the other hand, that is what gives it much of the charm.  Great food - some amazing drinks - and we have always had good service... in fact, it's impressive the crowds their servers can tackle while keeping a pleasant attitude.   Interesting music selection in the later hours, as well.

Fun, interesting place. It's got a good vibe. Friendly service, good food and drinks at a fair price.  I like the Dim Sum (esp the Shu Mai dumplings), the pizzas and of course the 3 cup chicken. Very tasty. This place really shines in nice weather with the front windows open.
Awesome! Place has amazing Greek food.

Best gyros in Madison. Hands down the best gyros in Madison. The muhammara (red pepper & walnut dip) is also excellent. I have been here several times and always recommend it for someone looking for good Greek food in the city.
Falafel, gyro meat, tzatsiki, and everything else was amazing. Will definitely go back.

It's my favorite place for Greek food! And it always reminds me of being in Greece. The gyros are tasty, the fries are hot and crispy, the tzatziki is delicious and their hummus is amazing! When it's crowded, the staff can be rushed, but when it's less crowded, they're amazingly nice. Their busiest time is brunch on the weekends, because they have tasty omelettes. But lunch and dinner are my favorite!
Never return. Some items on the plate were very, very salty. The portion was a sampler size. The waiter was hurrying to get us out as soon as we finished. Will not recommend.

A coffee and chocolate lover's heaven.. Delicious looking desserts, all sorts of chocolates. We had a slice of flourless chocolate cake which was excellent in small quantities. Two of us couldn't finish it because it was just too much sugar. The coffee, on the other hand, was fabulous! I ordered a decaf mocha latte with sugar free almond syrup and I am still thinking about it's perfection a few weeks later. Creamy, smooth, and just the right combination of flavors. Mmmm. . .  I loved being abl...

CHOCOLATE HEAVEN. I am a lover of all things chocolate particularly good chocolate. This this little ode to chocolate has it all;excellent chocolate from all over the world, baked chocolate treats (heavenly), hand dipped chocolate fruits, and cocoa that is to die for, many versions. I have had good local chocolate in N.Y. and Belgium and this place is the real deal and worth a trip from Madison. I can't tell you how good this little place makes me feel. Good dark chocolate, cocoa with real cream...

Good Place to Meet. One of few great places in Mt. Horeb to meet someone for business or to catch up. The plain coffee was a little bitter, but lattes are always great. The quiches are excellent and caramel/chocolate popcorn concoctions are delicious! Nice little setting and very kind staff.

Tea Time. After putting all feelings of masculinity aside, I decided to cozy up to a cup of caramel green tea and a apricot brandy tea cake. Both were excellent. Great spot for a quick snack, chocolate, or coffee.
Very nice. I love going here for coffee and their delicious desserts. The staff is very friendly and this place really makes my day, good way to start off the day.

Bistro 101 is absolutely amazing. I have yet to orser sinthunf on the menu that was not delicious. Steaks are great, and the seafood is amoung the best in the Madison area. The bar us well stocked and reasonably priced. It is a small restrunt with one exceptional chief, so the wait is a little longe on busy evenings. My advice: Order your food, cozy up to the bar and enjoy the interesting and friendly patrons of thus classy joint while you wait for your assuredly perfect meal.

DELICIOUS!. We loved Bistro 101! The service was exceptional as well as the food. There were many delicious choices served up in a cozy warm environment. Mount Horeb may seem a little off the beaten path, but Bistro 101 makes it worth the effort!

LOVE IT!. Who knew such energy, food, wine and good times were to be found in Mt. Horeb? Been here 4 times and always great food and great service. Was really glad to hear they cater and that you can use the fireplace room for a party of 18-20.

Service Review. My wife and I had reservations for 7:00 on Saturday, February 13. We arrived 5 minutes early & were shown to the bar where we waited for 10 minutes while our table was readied. The restaurant was fairly busy but there was no wait to get in. We were led to our table by the hostess and perused the menu while waiting for our waiter or waitress. After 30 minutes of no one even stopping by to say they were busy but would be with us as soon as they could, we left. The hostess thanked u...

Well worth the trip to Mount Horeb. I've been eating at Bistro 101 since they opened, about two years ago. I have a friend that likes to try new places and for the most part, we don't return to many of them. But anyhow...like many new, small, independent restaurants, Bistro 101 had their bumps in the road and issues to work on. I'm so happy to write that they have worked out their issues and while I always thought they were good, now they're even better. They bring in fresh fish, awesome steaks,...

Glasses where scummy asked for new glasses and got the same scum on glasses. Waitress blamed it on madison water. First and last time I will go there. Had to go to gas station after we ate to get a drink (already ordered food)
They have great food and good service

This chain has lowered its quality.. I used to love Chili's for its wide selection of quality choices. Now it seems to have stripped down its menu to focus on Mexican food and plainer dishes. The food also seems to have dropped in quality; for example, the last time I ordered a country fried steak from Chili's, the meat was so rubbery and stringy, it felt like I was eating ground up lungs or something. I literally couldn't cut through part of it-- I picked up my meat and the connecting gristle w...

Unenthused. Not sure what's going on, but I used to enjoy eating here. Quality was just not up to snuff. I ordered the Santa Fe Chicken salad. The salad itself was fine, but could have been more chilled, it really didn't taste cold, although the chicken tasted freshly grilled and was good. But the plate was warm having just been washed. Maybe I'm just picky but a cold salad should come on a chilled plate, otherwise the lettuce starts to become wilty. My son's fried chicken strips and fries didn'...

Chili's at Westgate Mall is the worst.. We waited 5 minutes to be seated. Not so bad. 20 minutes later we were still waiting for a waitress and despite trying to wave someone down, we had to leave to go somewhere else.
If you've been to one Chili's... Same food. Usually a clean, welcoming environment at this location. Adequate seating and typically well staffed.
Best suited for middle-aged white folk who want inoffensive bland Mexican food and a nice atmosphere.

DISGUSTING. I have eaten here twice - once for a friend's birthday and another time for lunch (giving it a second chance). Both times, the food I ordered could barely be considered Mexican.  It was appalling the way they put together their food is grotesque and like child's play. It was horrible and I will NEVER be returning.
Food plenty of it. A little like a franchise tex-mex Service was slow.

We headed over to this restaurant after exciting Badger game hoping to sit down at a nice table. Even though we had a party of 8 they wouldn't let us make a reservation. They told us we could get a table in 30 mins and took our name and we waited in the bar area. After 45 mins we went to hostess area to check on the table and they still we not wanted to seat us. So we had to eat in bar area- food was ok, but don't order Verde soup unless you can handle sucking on Habaneros for your favorite past...

Dissopinted  Nice ambience  Service was not gud Even after ordering drinks  Our server didn't told us about the drinks  offer of the day After we asked her is thier any offer for drinks  today  then she opened her mouth Even before finishing  dinner came for the check  Though the drinks  margarita were nice  The fries n sause were superb   And enchiladas were ok  mexcian food is quite better in other restaurants than yere Do go yere for drinks n ask them about the offers. N do try the spicy frie...

Amazing bacon cheeseburger!. Okay, does a place like Fleming's really need a review? I have never had a bad meal or poor service here. Both are always top notch. The filet mignon is my second favorite in town, the salmon is fresh, I love the creme brulee, etc. But we finally tried the bar special - the Prime burger with cheese and bacon. I don't even really like burgers and very rarely order them, but here it is three days later and I'm still thinking about that burger! It comes with 2 giant, ...
Highly overated. Staff was snooty, steaks were average, atmosphere was cold. Not that special of a place for the price. We were disappointed with our steaks and will probably not go back.

Nice experience. I was very skeptical of Fleming's since it is a nationwide chain owned by the same conglomerate that runs the Outback Steakhouse chain, but we had a gift card, so we decided to give it a try. We went on a Friday evening, and the restaurant was fairly busy, but not packed. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They definitely go out of the way to make you feel special and pampered, but it seemed a bit over the top.  The wine list was impressive and the bread was a delicious ...

Soso. I give Fleming's 7 out of 10. It's a nice and modern atmosphere with a great wait service. The food is quite good, but not excellent. I of course had a steak as an entree, it was done just how I asked and seasoned perfectly. I feel it wasn't of the highest of high in quality beef though. Tasted like a typical cut I would get at a grocer. Not that grocer meat is bad; it's that grocer meat isn't of the highest quality. Flemings does not promote to be a second rate steakhouse, but the one ste...

Very poor planning. Last night we brought a group of 15 people for a surprise dinner for a friend starting their own business. The restaurant had plenty of advanced notice as the reservation went in at least a week prior. I have been to Flemings before at a table for two and although I find their prices to be a bit presumptuous, I felt that I was also paying for the excellent service. Our reservations where for 7:00. They had assigned 3 servers to our table. It was 8:45 before they took our food...

Don't waste your time. Stopped by this weekend. The bartenders know ABSOLUELY NOTHING about the beer they serve and have an attitude about it. After waiting for half an hour for two burgers (ordered medium, served well) and an order of fries, the food was a huge disappointment. Small hockey pucks on a huge "tosated" bun. And by "toasted" I mean I had to tear off most of the hard inedible parts. If your looking for a good tap beer selection and friendly service visit the Malt House or Old Fashion...
It's just a bar. But a damn fine bar. Outstanding burger, perfectly cooked. Very knowledgeable bartender who knew his way around a staggering array of beers. Impressive range of craft brews.

Not sure - I walked out.. I went to Eddies on a Wednesday at about 12:30 and sat down at the bar. There were about 6 people at the bar and 3 or 4 open tables so definitely not swamped.  I sat there for 15 minutes with a closed menu in my hand signalling I was ready to order. The owner or waitress never asked me for my order or even asked if I wanted anything to drink. Despite walking right by my 6 or 7 times. Finally I had to place the menu down on the bar in front of me and walk out.

Rude staff. I am new to Sun Prairie and like to support local businesses but I won't be going back to Eddie's. Like other reviewers here I am also flabbergasted by the rudeness of the staff. I tried Eddie's twice and both times no one acknowledge that I was even in the room. The second time was with an out of town guest, we were two of about 6 people total in the place, the bartender looked at us a few times but never acknowledged us or asked us if we wanted anything. Interesting post from anoth...

Will not go back. Sign out front drew us in listing shrimp dinner. It was not on special. Same price as menu price. Extremely understaffed and staff had no sense of urgency. There were six in our party. They brought out one burger 45 mins after ordering. 0 mins later a shrimp dinner came out. 10 more minutes went by and the final 4 shrimp dinners came out. My husband waited at the bar for over ten mins to order a beer. Then let's talk about the noise. The acoustics are awful. So loud you can't h...

If I could put 0 stars I would. This place is awful. My friend and I ordered from here through Mr. Delivery. We waited about an hour and a half for our order. Once it finally came my food was wrong. I ordered chicken and I got steak, I can't eat beef. On top of that the food was so bland and awful. We tried to call the restaurant 3 times to complain about my wrong order and the lady who kept answering didn't speak english at all and just kept yelling chimichanga at me and saying ok. In the end w...

Friendly staff, excellent authentic tacos. The Pastor (marinated pork) Taco is w/out a doubt the best $2 you can spend in a restaurant in Madison. Only $2! Since the above review I've been back several times, sampling other items on the menu. Consistent good quality and very tasty  food at a very good price. Good service, too. Yeah, I'm diggin' Taqueria Guadalajara.

This was by far one of the tastiest meals I've had in Madison.  It's a small restaurant, but you can find it by the crowds at meal times.  I had the vegetarian huaraches, which had all the toppings plus grilled veggies.  I could've down without the broccoli and carrots-the masa was tasty enough.  The horchata was very fresh and sweet.  It was the best one I've ever had.  For the price, it was extremely cheap and filling.  I'll have to come back again!
Will definitely be returning here to try other dishes! Had the Enchiladas de Mole and it was great! Tiny restaurant but really enjoyed the food and can't wait to go back.

Very authentic Mexican food, and absolutely tasty. The beef chalupas are to die for! I'm so glad they rebuilt after the fire. This place never disappoints; although small and inconspicuous, the food and service is top notch.

A comfortable atmosphere for studying or just grabbing lunch with a friend. Order food and drinks at the bar and then seat yourself. The library has bar, lounge, and table seating. They feature an all-American menu. I had a basic burger (tomato, lettuce, onion and pickle spear on the side) with fries and an iced tea, and my bill was $9. The fries were great and burger was average. Next time, I'll be sure to ask for cheese since it's not included on the burger. Overall, I'd definitely come back t...

Great food and beer. I have eaten here many times, both at lunch and during the evening. I have enjoyed most everything I have been served. I find the menu to be more innovative than other local pubs. Try the Texas Burger, the Pesto Chicken, the Buffalo Wrap or the turkey sandwich. As a lover of microbrew beer, I find their rapidly rotating beer lineup to be fantastic. I remember choices from New Glarus, Ale Asylum, Capital, Lake Louie, North Coast, Anchor, Lagunitas, Three Floyds and Lakefront....
Nice atmosphere, but not much more than a coffee shop. Uninspired beer selection. Didn't care for the burger or fries.

I stopped in the other night for a quick drink.  It's a quaint bar with plenty of outdoor seating to choose from.  Inside, the ambiance was nice, as there were plenty of tables by the fire place.  The bartender was nice and very fast.  The specials were extremely cheap.  It's a good place to grab a quick beer.  I'll definitely be back to grab a cup of coffee.

One is left with the impression no one who works there really wants to be there. Indifferent service. Only passable attempts at trendy tapas. A standout dish: the grilled artichoke hearts. I love well executed tapas. This was not it.
Owner charged with rape. Http://host.madison.com/wsj/news/local/crime_and_courts/downtown-bar-owner-charged-with-sexual-assault/article_ca7bd7ab-0760-5d5f-81e4-07ba70483009.html

Sadly dissapointed...main problem, duck breast obviously cut while undercooked and then thrown in a saute pan or on flattop to finish quickly...made duck very chewy and over cooked, could have been good but rushed food and ended up serving a sloppily cooked dish. Sorry guys but I won't be returning after spending 15 dollars on something I didn't like and then getting charged for it anyways.

So-so food and atmosphere. This restaurant needs to work on its identity - is it a college bar or a high end restaurant??We were in town from Racine, and walking down State St when we saw Icon. We love Spanish food and frequently eat at Olde Madrid in Racine. We made a reservation for 9pm (Sat night). When we arrived, we were seated at a table in the bar area even though there were plenty of tables in the quieter dining area. The place became very loud with people at the bar shouting and laughin...
Small plates, good wine. Half off glasses on Wednesday!  Try the charcuterria & quesos. Fun atmosphere, aspiring to old Hollywood. Pulling it off in a Madison sort of way.

Awesome!. My boyfriend and I eat here almost once a week. Everything is delicious. Cant beat the sauce! And the fact that you can buy it is amazing. Smokey Jon's BBQ sauce is the only BBQ sauce in my opinion. The staff is always nice and helpful. And I have seen the owner Jon in the restaurant numerous times and have even spoken with him. I always suggest this restaurant to anyone I can.

Good ribs not true competition style.. Brisket sandwich is goog if you add the sauce but was disappointed that brisket was chopped like NC style pork. It was moist but liked real smoke or spice flavor without the addition of sauce. As a certified bbq judge it was good but not award winning. Good cue should be enhanced by the sauce not drowned in it.. As a judge a sure give away was too much sauce was covering something up. Worth stopping in if you are near the airport. Did not live up to all the...
Great Food!. Ate here today, the food was great, great customer service and didn't wait long to get our food. A++++ BBQ Sauce!!

Not my choice for BBQ. The 6 of us sampled it all and with some small argument this is the orfer from best to worst: Chicken Pulled Pork Ribs Brisket With our group not recommending the Ribs or Brisket.  As far as sides go: Baked Beans Potato Salad Cole Slaw Pasta Salad Mac & Cheese Corn Not recommending anything below the Cole Slaw. The corn was especially disliked BTW for its excessive garlic.  In general, most of the things not recommended were in that category because they were bland. Everyt...

Very tasty. I don't know how "authentic" the BBQ is because I'm not a BBQ judge, nor do I care since I didn't grow up in a place where BBQ is worshipped. I just know that their Saucy Q sandwich, their spicy corn and their brisket taste really good. This is where I go when I want good BBQ on the north side of town.

Amazing food experience. -=Expected=- To be wowed with locally-sourced seasonal menu  -=What we got=- *Awesome locally-sourced seasonal food start to finish *Awesome service *Romantic atmosphere, perfect for a couple celebrating  -=Disappointing=- That I can't eat here every day.  -=Surprising=- How un-stuffy such a polished restaurant can be.  -=Overall=- Pick a date, then celebrate life with awesome food here.  "Ausuma pauwa! Awesome power!" ~Mr Sparkle S08E22
Beautiful restaurant, excellent food and perfect service. Visited from out of town and was very impressed.
Birthday present. Always a very special treat to have a dinner at L'Etoile. The staff is so good, explaining the different wines and meals. Pricey but you get what you pay for. I shall return.

Great experience. I don't know who was serving the night the reviewer said the servers were snobby, but they were outstandingly friendly,professional and helpful. We had a great dining experience and the food was awesome, fresh and different. I am a picky eater and send back or don't eat food that is not well presented and that was not the case this time. I would go back to this restaurant and recommend it to anyone visiting Madison.

Not Happy with the New 7-Course Tasting Menu. Bring Back My Old L'Etoile!. I have always given L'Etoile 5 stars, until now. You can go to many restaurants in Madison for fine dining, but L'Etoile was the only place in Madison to go for a dining experience. Six or seven FULL courses spread out over 2 and a half hours. Waiters and Waitresses who explained the farm to table detail of each course you were eating. If you are a foodie, L'Etoile WAS different. My disappointment has come with the new ta...
Good was good not great. Service terrible. Wrong meal delivered. Worse part was we had to wait 15 mins in line to pay bill.
Great breakfast place! Food is delicious (I'd recommend the omelettes) and prices are reasonable.

Quiet, light and casual. Surprisingly gourmet fare!. Hands down: BEST VEGAN TOFU SCRAMBLE EVER!!!!  Let me catch me breath...I'm a little light headed from the explosion of flavors that just occurred in my mouth! I think the secret to the sauce is soy, but oh. my. goodness! Perfectly roasted potatoes(crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, seasoned well) accompanied a cubed scramble( I was expecting crumbles?). The sauce was brown (soy?) which surprised me, but goodness was it delicious! A ...
They advertise vegan options, which are severly limited when you look st the menu. I'll eat elsewhere

We had breakfast at the Sunroom Cafe this past Friday. We had tried going a couple of times previously and there was always a long wait, so we were excited to actually get in.  The restaurant is on the 2nd floor at the top of a set of stairs. The stairway up could definitely use some freshening up -- new paint, some cleaning. But once you enter the Cafe everything was clean and quaint. Great pictures of the American Flag adorn the walls.  We ordered at the counter where the menu was written on a...
Nice little place. Nice place to sit and enjoy a morning coffee or tea with delicious baked goods from Madison Sourdough. Live music some evenings.
Tinshack Smokehouse Burger. Northstar Bison grilled and topped with smoked and carmelized onions, tomato, green peppercorn aioli, bacon, mixed greens and Wisconsin Muenster on a roll.

Delicious burgers and a menu that will please the Vegan/Vegetarian crowd.  Generous portions.  Lots of craft beer to choose from.  The desserts looked scrumptious, but I was already bursting at the seams, so I took a pass.  There WILL be a "next time" so I plan on leaving some room!  Drawback:  they accept cash or checks only, so plan accordingly.
I like this place, but I don't love it. Good food every time I go, but I don't ever beg people to go here. Im never disappointed, but Im also never overwhelmed.

It's pretty dang good. I will agree with one of the reviewers. Everything is excellent but for some reason I'm not dying to go back. The beer and food is great but somethings a bit non invitational. Maybe it's the parking or too many seats and its cramped inside. I will return but I wish it was a place I could see myself at more often.   On a different note very kid friendly on a Sunday night and my family had a very comfortable and well served dinner.

My husband and I stopped at Alchemy on our way down to Rockton for our friends wedding. We always try to find an interesting place to eat when traveling... And this establishment did not disappoint!!  We sat at the bar since we were kind of in a hurry and the bartender gave us excellent recommendations and superb service. The fact that even the bartender was well versed on their menu and gave us so much attention speaks volumes about the staff.  We both had bloody marys that were delicious. They...

Good food, horrible service. Food was good, however the woman taking our order was very rude. She wouldn't explain the difference between a regular and little burger ( how do I know it's a double burger), she was very rude when talking to us, then proceeded to talk to her coworkers about us when we were still standing there waiting. She has a pierced lip and long brown hair. None of them wear name tags probably for this reason. Stay away from her!
Great food for a great price with a hilarious working staff!!!
The fries were good but If you are not willing to cook a burger medium you should get out of the burger business

There is no great burger with out fresh cut fries that are fried correctly, and this place has it. I think its a strange world we live in that its not normal to get fresh fries, but they got em. Did I mention the burgers are pretty good. You dont need all the condimendts with this burger. A real burger just needs cheese and good fries. They may be a little pricey, but if you want good things you gota pay for good things.

Good fries, decent burger. Five Guys is obviously fresh in their ingredients, and it's a credit to a place that goes national in scale. But I doubt we'll be seeing a "Best of Madison" award any time soon just because of the massively popular burger scene we have here and in Wisconsin as a whole. This doesn't mean they're bad, just that you should know what you'll have when going in.  Prices are higher than standard fast food, but the fries are superb in all ways. Burger patties were tasty and ...

What a disappointment. This place has a great location, but isn't capitalizing on it. Food was mediocre, the atmosphere was ok but unclean. There was dirt hanging from the ceiling and the vents were caked with years of collected dust. The worst was the salt shaker had something black in it. :-/
Best Pizza in Waunakee. Not that they face a lot of solid competitors, but in my book, Doughboy's Pizza is at the top of the heap when it comes to pizza in Waunakee
By far the best THIN crust pizza in the Madison area!
Doughboys is an excellent family restaurant with a great atmosphere nice staff members and great food. If you enjoy great pizza and a good time go to doughboys,.
Great pizza, a little $$

Poor service. Great pizza but really bad service. Examples: Very difficult to place an order for delivery. The phone rings 5 times and then hangs up on you. I've tried both phone numbers numerious times and never got through during normal business hours. Also, multiple times I tried going there on weekends only to find them closed. Website says they're open weekends. Rookies.
Delicious bagels and friendly service!

The food is good, but their attitude is the worst. I waited in line for a while, but when it was my turn they were rude and abrupt. Seriously?! Then I waited and waited and waited. I watched my hot sand which getting cold on the counter while they made everyone else's order instead of finishing mine. Then they barked out the knickname of the sand which at me repeatedly because they had failed to ask my name and didn't know who to call for. No patience for customers. I won't go back.
Worst Lunch Ever. Just had the worst lunch ever. The Istanbul bagel sandwich had enough salt for a month. Warning !!! Gotham Bagel has terrible food. Do not eat there.

It's been a couple of years since I visited Gotham, and today stopped in and got a toasted pumpernickel with cream cheese and lox. They gave me a nice spicy pickle on top of the wrapped bagel. Nice touch, i liked. Plenty of cream cheese, and the bagel itself didn't disappoint. Still my favorite place here in town for bagels, although there are still other options I have yet to try. But hold up.... $6 for this bagel, cream cheese and lox?? And..... hello??? There's not even any red onion or tomat...

Always perfect. Best bagels in Madison. Almost as good as bagels you get in New York. Owners are always friendly. I always get the same thing; a bacon egg and cheese sandwich on an everything bagel and I would highly recommend it.
Does not accept credit cards! Why would any modern business do this? It's a major inconvenience for customers. This is just part of the cost of doing business. Deal with it.

Ordered take out based on reviews. I ordered take out from this placed based on reviews from Urban Spoon and it was TERRIBLE! We ordered two different types of Pad Thai (Shrimp & Chicken; spicy levels of 2 & 3) and it was the most disgusting food we have ever had! Not to mention there were only 2 shrimp in a quart of their Pad Thai. Do NOT waste your money here...get takeout from Ha Long Bay down the street.
Tasty unique dishes. The flavor of the curry sauces is the best. Nice interior and friendly staff.

Yum!. Really just a great restaurant. Curry dishes made w/ real thick coconut cream, not rehydrated pucks. Spring rolls made w/ veggies grown right outside the restaurant! The homemade hot sauce is something special.

Pretty good Thai food but a little tangy. They may use a little more lime but then it may be just that night we got our food but am willing to go back and try more and see if it's like back home!  -----10 Dec, 2014----- Thai Sweet Sticky Rice with Mango (Khao Neeo Mamuang). My favorite Thai dessert! It's better when it's fresh but still good just the same!

Great Smelt. We drove 45 minutes through rain and rush hour darkness to get here, but were not disappointed. Service was not slow for us at all. We had two great beers and our soup before we knew it. Great homemade chips and french onion dip and a locally made pretzel with great dips came next. Smelt fry was great! Very lightly breaded as advertised (nothing like the pre breaded frozen kind) and great tartar sauce. Pizza had great thin crust. We would definitely come back again for many reasons.

Took my parents for a good WI fish fry and we were not disappointed. Despite a 1.25 hour wait at 5 pm for our party of seven! The only negative we have to offer was inconsistencies in the pour of draft beer between bartenders - 2/3 full versus full. Otherwise the beer selection was fantastic, the fish was perfectly breaded, and I love that they try to source their food with sustainable options if not local ones. Our service was fantastic. They kept us apprised of our wait and were very attentive...
Great bar.  Good selection of beer.  Food was pretty good, not a standout.  Had the prime rib which was above average.   Place could use an update in the dining area.
I enjoyed the Reuben, and the food here is pretty good, but I come here for the beer. The selection is excellent, and they often get hard-to-find beers on tap.
I LOVE this place. They always have something interesting on tap, and the food is really good. Its nice for some Sunday afternoon beers and lunch, or for dinner with drinks after.
Pizza. I love the philly pizza and it's always hot and fresh.

I did not like the pizza at all. It was my first delivery. One 14 inch pie took over an hour to deliver. The extra cheese was midding, the pie was cold. The sausage was so minimal I thought I needed new glasses. I called to complain the next day. The young guy Brandon said he was the new manager, however he would have to ask the old manager Chelsea if I can have a hot thus time replacement pie. Ten minutes later Brandon phoned my house. He said Chelsea said no pie free of charge and definitely n...
Excellent all around. Loved the beer, lived the good, loved the service!

Mixed Bag. My wife and I ate here Wednesday 6 November. We were seated right away. The ambiance is bright, fairly noisy and bustling, more a bar/cafe than fine restaurant. Our waiter was attentive without being intrusive. Their beer list was beyond belief, heavy on Belgian brews, especially. I've been a "beer hunter" for decades and have never seen such a high percentage of brews which I didn't recognize, even at the Brickskeller in D.C. Just for the beer, I could have stayed forever. My wife ...

The Parmesan and truffle frites were amazing and the night's aioli was refreshing and unique. I had the steak, cooked perfectly, and my husband had the duck which was also nicely done. I will remember and go back for the deviled eggs, which had a kick and were wonderful with the avocado purée. Great beer! Go early and have a beer so you can take a table just before the rush starts.

V Burger!. This was my first time back at Brasserie V since the big expansion last year and I had a great experience. The place was far too cramped before, so the expansion, which seems to have doubled the space, has really helped with that. The bar offerings were somewhat overwhelming, but props to the bartender for helping select a perfect Belgian brew. The star of the meal was the summer version of the V Burger. Light, crispy greens, a sweet tomato jam, and a juicy patty added up to one of th...

Our favorite place to eat while visiting Madison from Milwaukee.  This was my 3rd visit and I was surprised to see that there was s 45 minute wait for a table on a Saturday afternoon (4:30pm). There was a spot at the bar that was perfect. Have not been disappointed yet.

Here for restaurant week and the four of us ordered the surf and turf. Our party included a couple going out for the first time after having a baby, and my fiancé and I who are expecting soon. I ordered the $10 extra upgrade ny strip with my meal, everyone else got the tenderloin. The clam chowder to start was good. When the steaks came, they were all cooked well done. The table ordered 2 medium rares and 2 mediums, so this was a problem. We sent back the steaks (the pregnant lady ate hers as s...

Horrible food and service.. My wife and I are generally not the type of people to complain, but I have to be honest - the experience we had at Captain Bill's was pretty horrible and we wanted to make future potential customers aware of it. We've been to Mariner's and Nau-Ti-Gal, the other restaurants owned by the company, and thought we'd give Captain Bill's a shot since we like the other two. It was our first time there and to be perfectly honest it will definitely be our last.  I don't know ...

Jim. Was there on 2/28/2015 order a kansas steak and got a t bone came and told me they would get me the right one after about 10 min they brought me a new one but it was rare not med rare to med like i ordered so we boxed it up went to pay . We talk to the manager after we asked to . He said the first steak was right one but we had got a free steak told us to cook it a little more. His customer service was terrible . thank for not making come back again.

Went there for dinner 6/22/16. Food was good but service was not. Food was not worth enduring the poor service. Didn't see much of our waiter, he never cleared dishes, never offered us a second drink, never refilled water and took forever to get our check. Hostess dropped off folks at tables and then disappeared. As we left we saw her sitting and messing with her cell phone. There were 2 hostesses, why weren't they helping out if waitstaff was overwhelmed?  But must say, having been a waitress f...

Always a special experience at Captain Bill's!  My friends put their boat in the water & saw the docks were in so we tied off and stopped in for Happy Hour!  Got to love Thursdays with Happy Hour All Night Long!  Great service, Great Food, Great Times!  We will be back!  Thank you for starting the summer off right!  Looking forward to the music series.....
Fantastic crepes! I had the maple-glazed ham, brie, and spinach crepe with a fried egg on top. Perfect! This is a really nice little spot!

Good Mornings. When I come to Madison, it's usually to see friends and to sneak in some R&R. So the fact that Bradbury's possesses the power to make me wake up early each morning while on vacation should speak louder than any written words. A large press and a savory crepe and I just veg out to the world for about an hour as I gaze through the 180° viewpoint. Bradbury's is TRUE morning bliss.

Their crepes make a great light meal, inexpensive for the quality of ingredients. The staff is always hip and moderately attractive or better, if a bit pretentious. Espresso and coffee is greatness. One of the best coffee drink places in town for social or study.
What a quaint & tasty place to eat. Crepes & French press were wonderful. Seating is limited & cramped but don't let that deter you!
I had the ham, gouda, egg crepe. Spectacular is all i can say. Quaint little spot right ofd the square. Worth the cost ($10 for crepe and coffee).
GREAT. Neat place great foid

Hit and Miss. We started with the cheese curds, which were fantastic. The oysters Rockefeller were over cooked and had too much filling. The main meals were unremarkable. The beignets were too dense. I really like the atmosphere of the place. However, I don't intend to return.

Just say no to the food, but go hear the jazz Tuesday nights. God... Really? WI Cajun... Just say no. Bad service. Food was cold and unappetizing. The two young girls got their main courses before us, although we were there and placed our orders long before them. Salmon overcooked and cold. How nice! Worst $100. spent ever. Just say no to the food. The jazz was great and the drinks, well- they were drinks...Lol

Over booked over crowded. I have been to liliana's in fitchberg twice. the food is excellent. however, both times they grossly overbooked and we ended up waiting 45 minutes or more despite having reservations. this evening I intended to have a romantic evening with my wife only to find them again overbooked! when we arrived they had more than ten people all who had reservations crammed like sardines in the hallway outside the men's toilet. when I walked up to the hostess podium they had just beg...

The service and ambiance were okay.  The etouffee was really bad, It had a strong vinegar like taste with no heat. My wife's seared scallops and risotto was so-so. The lobster mac and cheese was supposedly good.
Always good. Good fresh bagels, and they do a great job on their sandwiches, especially for the price. I usually get the lox.
Bagels Forever!. Bagels forever, exactly! I love them.

Came here for the great reviews. BUT - service was awful (felt like the counterman was doing us a favor by taking out order), bagels were hard, and no place to sit. Price was good, and plenty of parking, but won't be coming back.
EXCELLENT!!. I love this place. The breakfast sandwiches are just over $2 and WELL worth it. Plus they are served all day!
This Madison institution offers tasty sandwiches and coffee if you want something more exciting than a baker's dozen to bring home. What, you're too good for a baker's dozen?

What can I say, I love Peet's. Better coffee than harbucks handsdown. Get an iced caramel latte and sit on the terrace. You won't be disappointed. Especially if you ask for whole milk. The hot version's pretty tasty too!!! The only downside here is the relatively inept baristas who sometimes don't make things right.

Don't confuse with the one downtown. Sushi Muramoto in Hilldale is the best sushi restaurant in town, hands down, although we did have a rather disappointing sushi combo number 1 this week.  Don't confuse it with Muramoto downtown that used to be quite good but was embarrassingly awful when we took my Korean in- laws there a year ago.

I love getting maki sushi from here. It's a little expensive, but the rolls are delicious and freshly made to order. They're also very appealing to the eye. It takes a while for them to finish your order, but it's well worth it!
Love sushi but I have dinner with friend rolls are loss . Server seems like not in a good mood .  It's really expensive . Same price I can eat much more in other restaurant :(

We ate at Sushi Muramota before attending a movie at the Sundance Theater. The location is literally across the street from the theater. The restaurant was packed but they were able to seat us at the bar. I really enjoyed the ambiance of the bar. Beautiful stone wall; warm colors, busy but not loud. Fun place to be with lots of people coming and going.  The drink menu includes numerous sakes including a tasting flight. After the flight, our server/bartender recommended a different bottle of sake...

I stopped by for lunch and was impressed by the crowd.  The place was packed, a great sign that restaurant was worth waiting for.  Our waitress was really sweet and accommodating, recommending specials and even offering us something complementary due to the wait.  For $10, I had the 3 roll lunch special.  The scallion roll was fantastic with the masago mayo inside.  The radish roll was fresh and a nice complement to it, and the salmon roll was a classic.  We had complementary green tea and edama...

Fast Food..... Well I normally don't review fast food, but this is as good as it gets for fast food. I am not ashamed as a self proclaimed foodie to say that I like Sonic. The dogs and fries here are just plain good. I like Sonic even more than Culver's I think.
Fast and Tasty. I ate there and immediately forgot about the McDonalds and the Burger Kings of the world. Yes, local is good but if you want good fast food, this is an excellent option.
Good carhops. Kimball is a good carhop.
Sonic. I'm sorry I enjoyed their chili dog. I try to be a good Madison citizen and eat local, but I slipped up this time.

One of my few fast food choices. There was nothing extreme about the quality of Sonic that puts it before sit-down burger places, but it is surviving as one of the few remaining fast food places I go to.  Service was prompt and polite, and there's a nice selection of choices on the menu. I'm much more likely to try this place when it's warmer in the Madison area, as this setup is not well suited for winter.
Dump. This place seems to be frequented by inbred hillbilly types so I would stay as far away as possible from this dive....I don't think it's been properly cleaned since the 40's

Great Food, Great Setting, Great Staff and Great Prices!!. Mojo's is a great place to eat! Mojo's has great, affordable food, in a great setting. The inside includes several large flatscreen tv's, two bars (one upstairs that includes a dance floor and a DJ on the weekends, and the downstairs bar which is decorated in awesome Wisconsin sports memorobilia.) Also, Mojo's includes wonderful outdoor dining and the staff were more than accommodating to all of my request. Mojo's food, especially their ...
Great food and service. This is the best bar food i've ever had and the variety is endless. Will continue to return

Mojos Really ????????. This place is a dump. Food from dumpster . I bet you did not hear that. I just hope no one spends any time at that place. To get back too food from dumpster he was busted taking buns out of dumpster of a local store. If that not bad what is..
One of the best spots to drink and relax outside on their deck or patio on the northside of Madison, WI.
Rude manager and disgusting bathrooms!!. Save your money and go somewhere decent.
Great experience. Just stopped in for the first time to get done desserts from the front display. Atmosphere seemed nice, as well as the employees. Will probably return for a meal in the future. 4/5
Just alright. Don't know if we hit this place at a bad time or what , but the food was so so and the staff was just not into it.
Miel. So perfect; I'd get one every day if I could

Third visit , food is excellent , certainly a pleasure to eat. Receptionist needs to find a different job,our ten guests waited in the area for waiting, the receptionist asks the women if they wanted coffee, OK. We go to the table with the receptionist as our guide, the grandmother ,my wife define seats , I ask "Where should I sit? ", receptionist "On your ass" . My immediate reply " You must be divorced" , to which she says "Yes" .  Service is as important to return visits as the food.  ...
Wonderful. This place always delivers superb food but I am always left wanting more.  The portion sizes are just too small for the price, but the food is quite delicious.
Disappointed. I really wanted to like this restaurant. The waitstaff were nice, but it took over an hour for us to get our food and the restaurant was not busy. The food was ok, not worth the wait.
This place is a gem! Marinara sauce is the best I have ever had! White pizza is phenomenal and their tapenade fantastic. Decor is nice, but the food is the thing you go there for.

Very Nice. I had lunch at Oliva, and it was a wonderful surprise. the staff were very friendly and quite helpful. I oredered a pasta dish and it was very tasty. The pasta was celarly homemade. I cannot wait to return for dinner to sample more of the menu. The bread that they bring to your table was delicious.

We liked it.. We had chicken and lamb kabobs and both loved our meal. The kabobs and rice were wonderful. The service was good and the place has a nice feel. I would like to try pasta next time but it will be hard not to go with the kabobs again.

I am mother of 2 little boys and hardly get time to write areview but my experience with this restaurant 3 weeks back was so horrible that it forced me to express my feelings and let others know about this hideousplace. AL right- admitted food is good and that is the reason we went to this restaurant first place but is it kids friendly -NO NO !! Customer  service- Horrible!!  Reached restaurant close to 5 PM - ordered appetizers. My husband , 2.5 year old and myself -were really hungry. I will n...
!Favorite!. J'adore La Baguette! This place is the most delicious european style bakery in Madison. The goat cheese quiche, chocolate croissant, tarte aux fruites, and almond croissant are AMAZING!
A real treat. Two words; Raisin Brioche. you're welcome.

Get. The. Quiche. It is, by far, the best quiche I have ever had in my life*. I am an eastsider and, if I am on the west side, 90% of the time, I am stopping at La Baguette on my way home. It's worth going to anytime you are nearby. They have some regular quiche flavors (like chevre, à jambon, asparagus) and they also mix it up every now and then, (salmon, mushrooms, spinach) which I like.   The pastries: If you want a cupcake, go to a cupcake shop. The flavors are sophisticated and (what I e...
The goat cheese quiche is the most perfect quiche I have ever had!! Still have a cherry and almond tart to sample, but I wanted to type this up while I was still on a quiche high!

I saw the menu on Zomato but when we arrived, I did not see it. Nonetheless, since the quiche was recommended and that was in the showcase, that is what we ordered. I ordered ham and cheese quiche with an almondine pastry for later. My husband ordered a spinach and mushroom quiche and apple turnover. We thoroughly enjoyed the quiche - but be prepared, it is rich. As a previous reviewer mentioned, the pastries weren't the typical American sugar bomb but if you like flakey, buttery pastry with a h...
Almost exactly like Parthanon but cheaper and without the headache of parking on State st. Great gyros, tasty fresh fries, what more could you want.

Best Gyros in Madison, Try It and You Will Agree. Located in the Westport Shell Station near Skipper Buds, Athens Gyros is owned and operating by Gus Kyriakopoulos, who managed Parthenon Gyros on State Street for many years. Don't let the location fool you, inside is the best gyros eatery in Madison. The secret is definitely getting out, as lunch crowd continues to grow. Make the drive out to Westport and try it for yourself.  Beside gyros, you can get other standard Grek fare, like souvlaki a...
