The worst place ever. Ok i tried this place 3 times and they have messed up my order, forgot where i live, and still come over when i canceled the order. monkeys can run a better business!!!

Very good gyros on the way home from work. Similar to Parthenon but you don't have to go all the way downtown and pay for parking. The setting is best for carry out. These are probably the 2nd best gyros in town, but a very close 2nd. No need to call ahead, it take some 3 minutes... only complaint is that sometimes they don't scrape the gyro meat upon arrival.

Done just right here. This is def one of the better pies in the mad city, It is def not "the" best, but pretty good. The topping are great and the taste from the wood fire is great, but the pizza itself is super hard to eat. Its so thin (yet not crispy) that you need to almost roll the slice like a pizza roll. If you just grab the crust and pick it up, everything slides right off. If they could fix this problem it would def tie for my top 3 in Madison. If you come here, just order a pizza for yo...

Pizza brutta makes the new age 9" higher quality pizzas. they are done very well, although i would recommend eating in at the place over ordering out. the quality doesnt show though when they arent hot and fresh. id stop in if i was around that part of town, but i might not go out of my way for them. i'd give them an A

Had a great lunch here. Large portions and a cornucopia of smells and tastes on the plate made this a wonderful sensory experience. The pizzas added cooked in a large pizza oven that gives the store is ambiance. Maybe my new favorite lunch spot.
Super cool place. Personal size brick oven pizzas with great sauce and tons of options. Had the margarita pizza and it was fantastic. A bit pricey, but worth it.

Love this place!! Cozy and comfy atmosphere. Wood fire ovens working in the back, delicious pizzas that taste like fresh ingredients! Such a treat. Here's a pizza that I can easily enjoy sans a multitude of toppings, although I'm certainly not opposed to that! But seriously, this tender and chewy pizza crust, topped with a tomato sauce that tastes so fresh and real, can stand on its own. The addition of their house made mozzarella is so luscious, it just takes it over the top. My favorites thus ...
Birthday lunch. Went here for a free birthday lunch with my sister, both the food and the service was amazing!! Can't wait to go back with my whole family!

Decent Food, Bad Policies. Tried HuHot on Junction Rd. for the 1ST TIME today and THE ONLY TIME. It wasn't that the food wasn't good, it was quite tasty. However, I'm not a big eater. I finished half my plate and I was full. To my DISGUST, I couldn't take the remainder of my one and only helping home to enjoy later. REALLY?? I did pay $10 for the meal, I wasn't gluttonous. I wasn't on my 3rd or 4th plate and demanding to get a leftover dish. What a waste of good food! I will discourage anyone an...

Enjoy the Experience. The unique element of the HuHot experience--putting together your own ingredients and sauces--can also make each plate hit or miss. Still the food is generally good (not bad, not great, but decent), especially if you know what you're doing, and I enjoy the experience. It's a good spot for families and larger groups too. Service is fine. The cost is fairly typical for what is essentially all-you-can-eat buffet dining. The interior is clean, colorful, but chain bland (if you...
Good food, entertaining and good for groups but alittle irritating they won't separate checks. Also gratuity is a little high on groups for having to serve yourself...

LOVE Hu Hot. Great Buffet, GREAT selection of unique sauces. Enjoy experimenting with the great selection of ingredients. Love the staff, not to leave out the cooks. Great job all of you. Cannot wait to see you next week.

I thought this place was pretty awesome. Good value for the money and the burritos are delicious. Sometimes it seems like Madison's view of Mexican is that it's bland, tasteless and cheap. Living in San Antonio made me realize that doesn't have to be the case. Panchero's takes me back there.

Tried it - not likely to return.. We were excited to see another fast-food Mexican restaurant open closer to town and decided to give Panchero's next to Super Target a try. The DH ordered the barbacoa burrito and I, the veggie Burrito Bowl. At first, we were commenting on how good everything tasted. Then after the 5th bite, we started to comment on how each ingredients seemed to be watered down (apparent, as the burrito was leaking and falling apart), the corn seemed to be canned and the DH was ...

This is a franchise restaurant but works great for a quick fix. Staff is friendly and location is close to grocery stores and supermarts so easy to stop in for a convenient bite.  The wraps are made on demand using a pizza like press. Our go to order here is a cheese quesedilla with sweet corn salsa, pico de gallo and jalapenos. The salsas on the side are hot and flavorful and the sour cream is a cooling dip for the quesedilla.
Best ever. This is by far the best food I ever ate and crave it ofton. Love the crab ragoons.

Bleah. The Marco Polo beef was way oversalted and had a weird gritty texture, the beef (which was supposed to be tenderloin) was overcooked and tough, the egg rolls were soggy, and the cold sesame noodles were only half-cooked (although they tasted good if you didn't mind the semi-crunchy noodles). Never again.

Disappointed. I recently moved to the area and was looking for some great food near my house. The service was very friendly. I ordered the Orange Beef, and while the sauce was very tasty, I was disappointed in the beef itself. It was very chewy and even difficult to cut with a knife. I am hoping that it was just an off day and that if I give them around shot it will be much better.

Our favorite Chinese restaurant. Tom's Red Pepper is a Madison gem!   Tom and his wife, Sho, bring an authentic taste of Taiwan to every dish they offer. Their Hot and Sour soup, dumplings, and Kung Pao Chicken are the best we have ever had in the U.S..  The only drawback is that the restaurant is very small and there are only 3 tables. Best for take-out.
Above average bar food. Good Wisconsin perch on Fish Fry Friday. Potato pancakes crisp but doughy inside. Good brisket they cook themselves. I'd come back!

Another Fabulous Experience. Enjoyed a fabulous and unique dinner on Carp's patio last night with my folks who are visiting from AZ.. We always try to take them to some local restaurant that provides quality and value.... and they love visiting Carp each summer because he goes out of his way to come up with some unique and beautifully presented appetizers that are special. Highly recommend if you are looking for a casual and comfortable place to relax!

Enjoyed our Beautiflly prepared Palette of Apps!. Although we don't get down to Carp's too often.... I'd have to say that it's our GO-TO place when we visit Lake Mills. If you want some great food and drink, and unique atmosphere... then this is the place for you. We took our folks from Arizona down for the brisket one night, and returned with them on a Sunday afternoon to enjoy a palette of specially prepared appetizers that were to die for! The friendly bartender/server, Tex, made us feel so w...

Good Food Here. I really like this place. Me and a work buddy stopped here for lunch and had the wings. We tried 4 different kinds, but the Cajun wings were def my favorite. The owner was behind the bar and was telling me how good his brisket is. I will be stopping over next week to check that out while were still in town!  I went back, I had the brisket, the brisket rocked! I also had the South Carolina wings. Now I have a new favorite wing here.  As a side note, I assume that Mindy lady mu...

On the downhill. This place frustrates me, cool building/location, but they could not be more inconsistent when it comes to their food.   2 years ago I had one the best Ruebens I have EVER had, have tried it 3 time since, and ... all were just ok. The menu is the same as it been for years now, with the same heavy emphasis on brisket, which at times can be very good and.... pico di gallo (not gayo !!?), which is pretty nondescript, in a bad way and kind of a strange "standard" side. Their Is ve...
Cookies!
Great service...great food...and clean.

I work in Oregon & eat lunch here a lot. Great subs, great service, very clean. Gets a little crowded during school year as its close to high school, rarely have to order to go though. Always good service and food, the pulled pork with slaw this summer was a hit. The bbq beef was a miss.
Welllll.... could use better service... but yummy food

Good food but no toast and lousy service. I went on a saturday and it was great, except for the toast and the hash browns. I came back on Sunday and it was worse. The toast is good but they have a hard time figuring out how to make toast, no lie. I only got one piece. When I asked for the other one, it literally took 20 minutes to the other one, which I only got a half of because my server dropped the other half. I had to remind the server twice to get that one piece and was told their toaster w...

Superb Brunch/Delicious Coffee/Fantastic Service. Had brunch at Ironworks this past Sunday and it was possibly the best breakfast I've had in Madison to date. The coffee was fantastic, the Pastrami, Onion, Pepper, and Gruyere chesse scramble I had was absolutely delicious, and although I ordered the potatoes (awesome), I tasted the fruit side and wow! simply delectable. Even though I'd like to keep this place under wraps, it's too good not to share. These kids are awesome at what they do!

Good Chain. I rank this along side places such as Olive Garden. Its good but not great. just right in the middle. When you walk in it has a show case for meat. The meat has good marbleazation, but i don't think their meat is the highest of quality. ive always gotten it cooked to perfection, but it just doesn't taste like a top quality beef. As far as chains go, this is quite a good chain. Its not a Beninihana or Ruth Cris, but its moderately priced and the food i give a 7 out of 10.

Good cheap meal!. If you want to eat until you can"t eat another bite for around $15 this is the place to go. Obviously the steaks arent the highest quality but are good enough and the ribs are great!!!
Love it here!!!! I wouldn't rank it $$$. More like $$. I get steak for $12. And I'm always stuffed after I eat here!! Oh and the besttt margaritas!!!
Love the food and atmosphere! Worst service I have ever had. Bummer too because I love this place, but it is painful to enjoy when there are a million waitstaff on yet no urgency in helping you.
Love their steak. When I'm in the mood for steak, this is the place to go. It is melt-in-your-mouth tender and juicy just way I like!

Upscale food (and prices) for a visitor center at Wright's Taliesin east. Each in my group of four all liked what they ordered (club sandwich, quiche, salmon chef salad) and the wait staff was friendly. All proceeds go to support the upkeep of this iconic F.L. Wright property so I was happy to help out.

Disappointed again. This is the third time I've given this establishment a try and yet again it disappointed me. I order a thin crust pepperoni pizza Extra crispy. Yet when I pick up a slice the bottom isn't even a crispy golden brown. I had to cook the pizza an additional 10 Minutes longer! Definitely will not be back.

Great food. A come as you are atmosphere with friendly staff. I'm not much of a hamburger lover, but the Spanky's Gourmet burger is a favorite of mine. The pizzas might be a bit more expensive than other pizza places, but there are more toppings & better quality, so it's well worth it. Definitely recommend it, good flavor and value. To top it off, it's a small town business, not a chain, they give back to the community.
Great pizza for the price.Tasted good when it was hot tasted good the next day for lunch.
I have NEVER been disappointed! I love the food & the service whether it's dine in or delivery!

NOT Impressed!. Ordered the "Seafood" Alfredo and the regular Alfredo.  The "Seafood" Alfredo should be listed on the menu as "CRAB" Alfredo since that is the ONLY seafood in it. Both of them were extremely dry (major lack of sauce) and the regular one had NO flavor; had to add a ton of salt.  For the price (and flavor), it would be worth driving to another town; I know their sauce is homemade! The portion size is definitely not worth the price either. Decided to order from there because of t...
Extremely inattentive and rude waitstaff. Food was decent if a bit overpriced. Seriously considering not coming back on account of the poor service.
Fell well fed and welcome!. Great coffee, great food, great service, comfortable atmosphere! You should give it a try!  Especially the salmon pesto omelette!!!(Which deserves A++++)!!!!

GLUTEN-FREE UNFRIENDLY. BEWARE!!! Take it from a customer with a child who has biopsy-confirmed celiac disease -- the cupcakes displayed as "gluten-free" are NOT GLUTEN-FREE. A post-vomit phone message with a reasonable request to speak to a manager about this was ignored.

Interesting spot. We enjoyed the food, service and quirky decor of the Daisy Cafe. Highly recommend the turkey, bacon and avocado sandwich which is served on sour dough bread and lightly grilled. In a word, YUM, Breakfasts are pretty tasty too.

Sweet dude.... If you want to impress a crowd with dessert and show off, this would be a place to that with. It is a little pricey, but you get what you pay for. They have a huge variety of fresh flavors that you wont find anywhere and the presentation is fantastic. This is hands down the best cup cakes in madtown. The customer service seemed fine to me (boo hoo nathan).

Dinner. The food here is mediocre at best. My daughter's basic burger came with mayo on the bun which the menu didn't say. The taco salad was just okay but my husband ate it. My other daughter ordered the two mini beef burgers which ended up being breakfast sausage patties (isn't that usually pork?). I had the prime steak which was two-thirds fat and gristle. The shrimp was good and the salad bar was good. When asked how the food was, I responded it was disappointing. The owner copped an attitud...

It Sucks. Gus's Diner Ate there a few times. The first time not to bad, but after that it really sucked, I think they need to shut there doors and go back to Albania or where ever they came from. all the resturauts that I had food that was albaian really sucked.

Not impressed. We hit Gus's Diner for lunch on a Sunday, but ended up ordering breakfast as the menu isn't all that exciting. My companion ordered a breakfast skillet (hash and eggs) and enjoyed it. I couldn't believe the huge portion he was served. I ordered the waffles with pork sausage and found the waffle pretty good, but the pork sausage almost inedible. The diner itself is cute - a 50's theme - but that's not enough to draw me back as the food isn't all that good, even by diner food standa...

Will go back!. My bf & i just finished a hardy breakfast at gus'! everyone was so friendly, the food was quick and very good. great portions without being ridiculous and good prices. the decor was so cute!
They do breakfast decent enough but fall short in other meals. My lemonade tasted like chemicals once as well  I neat  50's style place to conversate.

Always leave this restaurant with a bad feeling. I'm a foodie and I don't mind paying higher prices if the food and wine is extraordinary. But it is just an average steak and potato restaurant with lots of butter. The atmosphere is nice but very loud unless you reserve a table in one of the corner rooms. The servers were very professional, however.

Has Ruth's Chris Changed?. Last night four of us went to dinner. We were disappointed by the lack of good service, as we've dined at different Ruth's Chris Restaurants for 20 years or more. The Sarasota, Florida location took a while to seat us (no one else was waiting and it was 5:30). Our waiter was very, very slow--hate when you have to look for the waiter to flag him down, which we did three times. The steaks (we had the filets) were disappointing, obviously there has been a change in them, ...

Ribeye!. The sides and appetizers were nothing special, but the ribeye was delicious! Cooked perfect at a medium rare, hot, melt in your mouth. Pricey, but next time wouldn't waste my money on too many extra but just the steak. That is definitely worth going back for.

Sent back 2 out of 3 steaks and had horrible service. 1.5/5 stars  I've been to Ruth's Chris around the country at least 20 times and had some incredible steaks at several, but none in the last decade. That record will stand unchanged, as I have no plans to go back to one because Ruth's Chris has stopped buying quality meat and no longer cares about service.  The first time I visited the Middleton RC, I sent back my ribeye as it was slightly overcooked and tasteless, worse than a steak from ...

It is Restaurant Week in Madison which has happened twice a year for the past several years. I made reservations for dinner with my two adult children to enjoy a nice “swanky” dinner together. What a mistake. I have been to this restaurant several times in the past but its been a couple years so thought I would give it a try. I wish I hadn’t…  Reservation was for 6:15 - not seated until 6:45.  Waited 20 minutes to get a glass of wine. Server Bonnie never brought it - bar manager, Bret, d...

Chill Place. Been a couple of times with friends. Once for dinner and the food was good, we shared the queso dip and it was awesome. I had the reuben sandwich and I really liked it. Then another time we were there on a Friday night and it was packed. We managed to get a booth and stayed their the whole time since a waitress will bring you your drinks. Music was fun, lots of oldies, and the crowd seemed cool. I'd go back.
Good food. Burgers are great and the homemade nachos are yummy too. Mixed drinks leave something to be desired. On Sundays they have $3 screwdrivers and well you get what you pay for.
Things have changed. Since last October there have been some significant changes at Chaser's Bar & Grill. It's time to give them another shot & update the reviews.
Quality food at a reasonable price.

RecentPurchase. Just had a chef salad for lunch. It was probably the worst salad I've ever had. While the turkey and ham were fine, the 2 paper thin slices of cucumber were and one slice of tomato (cut in half) were laughable. On top of that, the bowl was full of old wilted lettuce, some of which was brown. I had to throw half the salad away. It was truly gross!
Amazing

BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!. Let me just say for starters, I have never had a bad meal at Laredo’s and neither has anyone I have gone with.  The customer service has always been excellent. They pay you the proper amount of attention without being annoying and your food is always out quickly and hot.  Tonight was an exceptional experience though, with our waiter Juan. I have a few standard dishes that I like to order and did so. I then decided that I wanted to be a little adventurous and try o...

Delicious food and service. My husband and I inquired about a Mexican restaurant close to our hotel and was directed to Laredos. We were very pleased at the tasty food and excellent service. The house marqueritas were also good. We will be driving back from Waukesha county for a repeat.
Not all that great in general...

We tried Laredo's for supper last night. We arrived a little after 6:00 pm. There were a few full tables but it was mostly empty. Tile floors, wooden tables and benches, lots of color, it looks like a fairly standard Mexican restaurant.  The hostess seated us and gave us menus and our waiter was over shortly with chips and salsa. We were in a hurry, (although we didn't state that) and so while he was there we ordered our dinners at the same time we ordered our drinks. The chips were excellent --...
Go for the Pad Thai. BEST Pad Thai I've ever had!
Not it. I have been looking for a good Thai restaurant ever since I moved to Madison a year ago. The search continues.
The house special fried rice was great, more food than I could eat in one sitting. Price was reasonable and we got a free dessert. What's not to love?

Yum. First of all, anyone who's written a negative review of this place is nuts. We love their food! The freshness factor is the biggest draw for me - the flavors are amazing and anyone who is a foodie would certainly be able to tell that their food is made with raw, fresh ingredients and love. If you can't appreciate that, go somewhere else. If you haven't tried it, GO! If you've tried it and you don't like it I'd check how many preservatives you eat in a day during your normal food intake...pe...

My partner and I stopped at Thai Noodles after a movie at the AMC Fitchburg 18 recently. Thai Noodles is located in a strip mall. When we arrived, there was no-one else in the store, but throughout our visit we noticed several patrons ordering take-out. The restaurant is airy and light. Our hostess/waitress was friendly, seated us promptly and provided us with menus. Southeast Asian is my favorite cuisine so after perusing the menu I was excited to try it. We ordered egg-rolls, pho and drunken n...
Affordable, good pizza! The soup was good too!
Chipotle Bleu and Sautéed Onion Burger is out of this world. Chicken Cordon Bleu is HUGE and delicious. I love this place!
Good bar food and more. The burgers are big & juicy. The onion rings are fat and delicious. The Caesar salad was even good. Now open for breakfast on Sunday mornings.
Good hand tossed pizza. Lanes needed to be polished.
Uninspiring. Just did not do it for me. Going back to the Village Green
Best burger in area,excellent service.

Great bar food at a good price. This is a small sports bar less than 5 minutes north of Middleton on Hwy 12. We carry out from here all the time. The burgers are huge and juicy (my favorite is the mushroom swiss), the nachos are awesome and the onion rings are fat and delicious (although I recommend eating those before they spend time steaming in a carryout container). And the prices are great!

Owner is rude and they over cook their burgere. Ordered 5 burgers. They were all burned and 2 burgers were wrong. Called and they said it was my error when I ordered. The owner yelled at me and told me if I wasnt happy to never come back. I went in to get my money back and she called the police on me. Not a good business. She said her burgers are always like that and if I don't like it I can leave.  Super rude and not the way to run a business.  In the end the lady that took my order over the ...

Bad food and mediocre service = poor experience. Let me start out by saying normally I like T.G.I. Friday's, and am even a Give Me More Stripes member with them to earn points and rewards. I haven't been to Fridays for a little over a year before this trip and I usually frequent the Middleton location. We have loved it and were never disappointed there. I wish that were the case at this location, but it wasn't. Let me start out by saying the service was awful, it had to be almost 20 minutes from...

Constantly disappointing. Went to TGI Fridays again after having a poor meal a couple years ago at this same location. Nothing has changed. Both my son and I ordered the All-American Stacked Burger. We were asked "some pink or no pink." We both ordered "some pink." We both received they greyest and driest hamburger we've ever had. The fries had been sitting too long before served as well. My wife ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken. It was also dry and tasteless. Her Macaroni and cheese side wa...
Younger lady that us half heatedly recommended something before rolling her eyes at my wifes request for water. Bartender was nice. Waitress was nice. Food was good but overpriced.

Good, but expensive. Fromagination is one of those places I wish I could afford to go to lunch at everyday. they have great sandwiches, AMAZING cheese samples, and yes I try everyone before I order, Sorry I'm not sorry. It's a great little cheese shop that has some cute gifts too. Don't get the soups though not that good, sandwiches are WAYYYYYY better

Great sandwiches. I get sandwiches from here about once a week. Their signature turkey (turkey, brie, cranberry relish, lettuce, wheat bread) is fantastic, and the roast beef and chicken with blue cheese are quite good as well. Other sandwiches are a little hit or miss, but most are tasty. Don't get sandwiches out of the display case -- they've been sitting out all day, but the staff (which is more experienced at cheese than lunches and seems to have a high turnover) will give you one anyway. St...

A nice cheese shop and some good selections for gifting. The cheeses are good and variety is mostly local wisconsin and prices are on higher side. They have selection of sandwiches for lunch and we have tried the veggileta which was decent. You can also try a sampling of cheeses with nuts and potters crackers for lunch.

DO NOT ORDER FOR DELIVERY. The food is great....the delivery is TERRIBLE!!! I ordered my food online at 5:15pm and was told my delivery would take an hour and that it would be delivered at 6:15pm....a bit of a long wait but hey its was a saturday night. At 6:45pm my food still wasn't delivered so I called the restaurant. The person answering the phone was incredibly rude and said they would call the driver and then call me back. Big Surprise they never called me back. My food was finally deliver...

Horrible Restaurant. I read some good reviews of this restaurant before and led my family for a lunch there in the summer. We ordered some traditional Sichuan dishes.  We tasted the sliced beef too spicy and weird. Finally we realized the beef was actually rotten and they put so much spice to cover the horrible smell of the rotten beef. This experience made my kids never go to a Chinese restaurant in Madison region any more. I hate this restaurant. It ruined our great impression on the mid-west...

Pleasant surprise. From the outside, Fugu looks like a typical cheap Chinese restaurant. It's easy to overlook. I finally tried it out with my girlfriend and was deeply impressed. We both saw familiar dishes we could have ordered, but we decided to be adventurous and try two that were new to us:  - Pork Hoot with Vegetables in Spicy Sauce (#H6) - Sliced Fish with Black Curded Bean and Pepper (#126)  We didn't know what "hoot" was, so we asked. The waitress explained that it refers to the me...

We stopped by with a big group the other day and were promptly seated and served.  We ordered a lot of food, which came out as it was ready.  For starters, we had veggie and pork dumplings and Dan Dan noodles, which were just okay.  However, the main course was far better.  My friends got the smoked duck and pad Thai, which they really liked.  Another friend and I split the twice fried fish, which was excellently seasoned.  I had the spicy fried shrimp, which was excellent.  It was my favorite d...

We walked in and were greeted promptly by a hostess who took us to our table and gave us the menus to peruse. There are a lot of options including your typical American Chinese like Mongolian Beef or Orange Chicken as well as more exotic dishes like tripe, ox-tail, kidney, or intestine. When our waitress returned we ordered sake as well as 'Steamed White Meat Chicken with Chili Oil Sauce', 'Three Threads Salad', 'Sliced Lamb with Black Pepper', and 'Sauteed Baby Octopus with Pickled Pepper'.   T...

Amazing lunch experience. I have lived in Fort for years, but this is the first time I went to Paddy's. Definitely was missing out! The food was INCREDIBLE. Especially the cheese curds.... Wow. The service was very friendly. The only downside was the table we sat down at was extremely dirty, and no one offered to wipe it off. The rest of the place looked pretty clean from what I could tell, though. I absolutely cannot wait to go back. It's such a cute little place.

Best place Fort has to offer. This isn't your typical small town place. Great food, which is a twist of pub food, Irish fare, fresh salads and chef specialties created by Chef James. Atmosphere is great and has a good proper Irish Pub feel, great wise ass bar tenders and live music most Saturdays. Beer selection is great with a revolving tap selection of IPAs and other local craft and imports. If you're looking some something good, fun and different you need to check this place out.
Great place to stop for lunch and the food was delicious , fresh , and friendly service! Awesome!

My favorite restaurant/bar. I've been there several times and the food was great, but the most memorable experience was when my guy and I went there for valentines day. We didn't make reservation and the place was packed, but we still got a table within 15 min. They had a steak special that night and it was cooked perfectly, probably the best steak I've ordered at a restaurant in a long time. I've always been a huge fan of their food, and I applaud the cook for the consistently awesome food. The...

Stopped here while riding with a friend. Had the Scotch Egg as an appetizer (one of the best I've had). My buddy had the Reuben with sweet potato fries. I had the James Burger with sweet potato fries. Both absolutely awesome. Service was fabulous - very friendly and helpful. Bill for the 4 of us was $33. Definitely 10/10 - highly recommend. Great menu!

I've been to Ha Long Bay several times both for lunch and dinner. It is always reliable and all dishes I've had have been decent. The vegetarian/tofu dishes have been amazing but at the times when I've ordered a chicken dish, the chicken has been a bit dry. Its always extremely popular and you often need to wait for 30-60 minutes. While the place is very good, it is slightly overrated and there are many other Thai places in Madison that are just as good.

We had take out from Ha Long Bay after awhile of anticipation.  It was definitely worth it!  We had rice, tofu pad Thai, chicken curry, spring rolls, curry wantons, and crab wontons.  The wontons were crisp and stuffed with a fair amount of filling.  They were flavorful as well.  The pad Thai was good, though I'm not the biggest fan of the dish in general.  The spring rolls were a bit bland, but that's natural to the dish.  The curry wasn't too bad, though it was a bit watery.  It was good overa...

I love Vietnamese food and Ha Long Bay does not disappoint. I've been there for both lunch and dinner and enjoyed it every time. They serve Vietnamese, Thai, and Laotian cuisine. Get there early or expect to wait. We got there at 11:45 on a weekday. I am not getting when I tell you that people were flocking there. It sits on a corner and people were heading there from every direction and several of them were literally running.   I've had the pork egg rolls, curry puffs, spring rolls, papaya sala...

Always great. Staff is always friendly and fast. The petitions are always huge and the prices are small compared to what you get. I love this place and could eat here everyday. It helps that we are so close to the restaurant. My favorite dish is the HK1 but I like to switch it up and get Tum Yum soup or fried rice once in a while. This time I wanted comfort food so I got the fried rice.
Friendly staff, great food. Enjoyed the pad Thai and the spring rolls. My daughter really liked the wonton soup and my son enjoyed the chicken dumplings

Food?. This resturant has problems. They try to make an above average greasy spoon type menu but can not pull it off. The breakfasts are drowned in oil and the dinner are drowned in gravy. They have recently added a outdoor grill but can not get that right either. I ordered pork ribs from their grill first the ribs were not even trimmed, second they were cooked like a steak and were tuff, and third the cook must have mixxed up the rub seasoning for a brine because they were saltier than anything...
Good Food. Black Hawk Family Restaurant has good food with large portions at a very reasonable price.

Lets be real, this is a family style restaurant in small town Wisconsin. If you are looking for larger portions and lower prices, this is the place to visit. It is not fine dining and that is what you should be expecting. The other reviews have painted a bad image of this restaurant, as I feel that it is good food for the price. Yes, it is a 'greasy-spoon' of sorts, but the overall food quality and courteous demeanor of the staff and owner, far outweigh the very few negatives that arise.

Microwave is head chef. The daily special was the ribs , so i thought good fresh ribs. I wasnt so lucky. I got them and the ribs and the plate were hot but the BBQ was ice cold. The ribs smelled like oil and were rubber. I asked the waitress when the ribs were cooked and she said last night. I asked if they were in a warmer or put in the fridge and microwaved. She said microwaved. I told her to take them back and bring me a burger. I heard her tell the cook that i didnt like them because they we...

Tonight, Monday Sept. 21 my wife and I both had the rheuben sandwich.  The meat tasted awful, like it was way too old or too long frozen.  Should have sent it back but didn't.  We have had rheuben sandwiches in a lot of places but this was BY FAR the worst  we have ever had.  Will not be going back to this place.
An okay sandwich. Typical sub type sandwich fair. Nothing special, but fast and pretty tasty. C+
Chick-alami on wheat! (chicken salad plus salami) no mustard, no oil.

Nice Sandwich Chain. I've eaten at a few Potbelly shops and have always left happy. They're not reinventing the wheel here, but the sandwiches are quite tasty. The loaded baked potato soup I had here was also good--piping hot, thick, and creamy.  The interior is nice, cozy, and thankfully separated from the mall food court. Prices are reasonable. Grade: B

A good option for a quick bite when shopping at west towne mall. Tried the new banh mi with srirach mayo and it packs a little bit of heat. Mushroom melt is on of our favs and the potbelly pickles are really good and can be bought on their own by the jar. The staff here is cheerful and the customer of the month can be a interesting local or a celebrity as a joke!

Came here with my friend and tried their pizza sandwich and it tasted good.. The italian sauce gave nice taste to the sandwich.. They were nice and gave me a suggestion for the sauce. Nice place with nice food...Will consider to eat there again..

BE AWARE. I'm a regular customer to this place but I'm going to have to stop coming here for lunch because every time I come here they rip me off. The food is good, service could get way better, but they really need to make sure that they charging the prices that are on the menu boards. Third time catching them charging me with prices way higher then what is posted.Customer be aware if you eat here that you not getting ripped off.
Excellent food!. I stop by here before work once a week for a chicken burrito. Always excellent and filling and super reasonable prices. Definitely the best Mexican on-the-go joint in town!
The best place around for mexican food!! My co-workers and I go there every Friday for lunch. Staff and food is great!
This is the best fast food resturant out there! Spicy pork tacos are my favorite. Cant forget to get the special habanero topping!

Was a huge fan of this place. My favorite is the steak tacos. Seriously cant get enough. Unfortunately I wanted to share this with my family. Came in for a large to go order of about 9 menu items. Waited in line for 15 mins. When we finally got to order the man told me because we had a big order we would have to wait for every one else in line to finish before we could order. They lost a frequent customer and a large order. It was clear to me that the person behind the counter didn't care about ...

Good Mexican Resturant. I have eaten here many times and like it. I mostly get a burrito but have tryed other items and all are good. Nothing fancy just good normal mexican food and its in a mexican grocery so you can shop while your waiting for your food.
Great enchiladas and salsas!
It is by far the best that I have tried.these folks are the real deal! I keep trying new things from the menu and Ive never been disappointed. Very authentic. Please try them out!
Great service, good food and good menu. I'm a regular and haven't had a bad meal yet. Awesome margaritas too
OK mexican. This is an OK place. the decor is pretty cool and the food is actually pretty decent. Their website says they deliver too. I may have to check that out.

RON'S Favorite. We eat at El Patron's on a regular basis. We are seldom disappointed with our meal. (Nobody is perfect all the time) the owner Jorge, knows I like my steak almost raw, RARE. I had my favorite "Steak San Jose" today. I have to express that this was the most delicious and enjoyable steak I have ever eaten ANYWHERE!   Most cooks wherever I go, must believe they are doing me a favor when they overcook a steak I ordered RARE . It's very difficult to get someone to just "sun tan" a s...

Been to Jac's quattro, never been disappointed. Last time split a black bean burger (1st one) and a turkey sandwich dressed with a dried cranberry mayo with my friend Kelli and we both loved them. Black bean burger was done perfectly, seared on outside and tender inside. The cranberry mayo made the turkey sandwich one of the best I've ever eaten. Our waiter Joey knew when to stop by and see how we were doing without interrupting our conversation, an art in itself. We enjoyed ourselves for nearly...

HORRIBLE customer service from a MANAGER!. 6 studious working women went into a BAR for a sophisticated brunch. 6 women walked out with a bad taste in their mouth, and it wasn't from the food.  My friend organized a Sunday brunch with the girls; she really wanted to go and has had good food there in the past. I recommended we go to Bluephies, they were offering a Veterans Day special, my friend insisted jacs. She made a reservation for 6 on Sunday at 11am. We were sat in the middle of the fair...

Nice place. Went there after my daughters graduation from UW. Had to wait a while since we had 7 in our party. Once we got in, the service was great, the food was great and they even had a gluten free cake for my daughter. Definitely would go back, they even have a great selection of beers on tap and in bottles
Phenomenal food and service. I'm a bit of a burger snob and Jacs serves the best burgers in Madison.

Aside from having really tasty food, Jac's is a spot where its easy to take people with special dietary needs. They're GREAT for Vegans, Vegetarians, and Gluten Free people (whether they have gluten intolerance, or simply choose to eliminate it). I can honestly say I've not had a bad meal at Jac's and the staff is always friendly and super knowledgeable about the menu.

HORRIBLE Customer Service. My family of 12 dined there and the bill was supposed to be split on 2 cards. Well turns out they charged 1 card the entire bill. We called two days later to correct the problem and the manager was very unapologetic, as if we were bothering her with more work!!!! When we called then next day, since the problem was still not fixed, she was very condescending in asking if I knew how a debit card worked? I have never been talked to so rudely from a customer service employ...
Horrible service!!!. Food was fine, but service was so......slow. Definitely not worth the time or money!!!
I wanted to like this place but, in the end, it's flaws were too numerous to overcome: Bad service, unpalatable food and inflated prices. Stay away.
It's ok. I would say it's a little pricey for the foot you're getting... I been there twice now and the service is always great.

Very little food for the price. This was my first time there. Service was not the fastest when it came to food, or refills. My meal I paid 14.95 for and it was not even worth the price. My goodness I can pay 6.99-7.99 at other restaurants and get more food for my money with the same quality. Also who decides to put out specials for the day list 3-4 items but does not even write down the prices on the board or even put the specials on a menu with the prices. I would have loved to try your special...
Cold food. I have tried this place three time and have always received cold food.
It just didn't taste that fresh to me. Every time I go to chipotle or qdoba it's always great. This place isn't bad I mean I still ate everything just probably won't be going back anytime soon.
Not nearly as tasty as Qdoba or Chipotle.

The Sun Prairie location is always clean and friendly. The food is always great but what sets the one in Sun Prairie apart from other chain restaurants is the staff. I always feel like I'm at a real restaurant and not just some place with some teenage kids working. I pay attention to the employees at most places I go and I've noticed they are always diligent about putting on clean gloves before they handle your food. They also look at you and speak loud and clear when asking what you want. The g...
Food was good. Very inexpensive and lots of variety.
Food was good but very sweet. no prices on menu, bill was pricey. For the price you pay... you should receive a little more food
Fusion food?? More like confusion. The owner was a absolute jerk! I will never come here again.
New Seoul is 100x better than k pepper
Tasty but expensive. Thought the food was really tasty.....but slightly over priced for what you got.

One of the earlier korean restaurants in madison. Seating is minimal and be warned that their timings have them close quite early for dinner. However food is unique and good. Vegeterians have some good options as well. The bibimbap is good and always comes with a couple of side appetizers which are always delicious. The kimchee is lovely.

Great Panini's. We go there 1 to 3 times a week for lunch. It is close to our office, they are nice and greet us with our waters with lemons everytime! We like the pizza, panini sandwiches are awesome, haven't had a bad thing.

Great Place, Hands Down!. I completely have to disagree with the last post/review. I've been to Legends Sports Bar a couple of times and it has been fantastic. The food is really good. If you're looking for some great Pizza, this is your place. I've also personally has the "beef medallions" and they were very good. They actually cooked them just to my liking as many places cannot. All in all it's a great place to watch your favorite sporting event, eat some great food, and not break the bank! Tr...

Not good!. The atmosphere was a very weird mix. Looks like a sports bar but the owner and staff were like a bad movie about a euorpean mob run place. And the food was not anything to talk about. The beef medalions were good but the salad was a joke, and the pizza was drab. The wait staff appeared to be chosen for their looks, not their smarts. If you want to check out the staff, it might be worth just to see it. Wow.

Terrible service, avoid. The worst service ive ever had. I went with friends on a Thurs night and it was dead, but still took 20min for a server to come take our orders. She was rude and after the first round she disappeared and we never saw her again. We then had to go up to the bar ourselves to close tabs and buy more drinks. They over charged me by $37, when I noticed two days later I called and asked for the manager but he was "busy". So, they took my info and said he was going to call me ba...

Don't let the location fool you (it's in a gas station), these are seriously good gyros. Owned and run by Gus (duh), whose family own Athens gyros, a legendary eatery on State Street. They offer other food, but the gyros are so fantastic that I've never tried anything else!

Visited because of a good review, and my experience was pretty bad. Pitas were tough, reheated. Souuvlaki was dry and reheated. Tzatziki was made with sour cream, or some low quality yogurt, was very runny, and no hint of garlic. Souvlaki was left on the skewer and added to the sandwich (!), it was a mess. I'm not biased about the gas station location, it was just bad food, and it wasn't cheap. Won't be visiting again.

Authentic Neopolitan Pizza but a few kinks. I never went to this place in its old location, but since it arrived at Hilldale I have been at least 6 times. Having eaten Neopolitan pizza in Naples, this is authentic, with the salty, chewy crust I remember and love. And I love the little bit of char on the bottom of the crust from the wood fired oven. However, American pizza it ain't. The amount of toppings is not what we are used to here - it is fair to say that they are sparse. Therefore, I alway...
Celebrated birthday dinner for our first visit. Food was excellent. Wait staff was knowledgable and helpful. Get marguerita pizza and ensalida salad. Can't wait to return!

Let me say I like it with some hesitation. The food was fresh and good, but nothing that special. Salad was crisp and the parm flakes were crisp and nutty. The pizza however was OK, had slightly better ones at Pizza Brutta. The carbonara was well prepared, do recommend it over pizza. The dessert was the best part of the entire experience; gelatto afogatto and hazelnut chocolate truffle that will surprise you. Good waitstaff and service. Atmosphere at Hilldale is not stellar but with big windows ...

Neapolitan Done Right. Porta Alba's pizzas are classic and simple, but not simple in flavor. The maialina pizza comes with what is essentially the equivalent of ham, sausage, and pepperoni, while the margherita features fresh basil and mozzarella--all ingredients first rate. The crust is thin and floppy, though more of the burnt flavor came through than I would have liked. Still, these pizzas were top notch and absolutely delicious.  The space is lined with massive windows that allow for some p...

Reasonable, needs some adjusting. I had never tried the previous location, but I had heard good things about it; accordingly, I was pleased to hear it was opening close to our home. Went yesterday with a party of 7, including my two children. Pluses: enjoyed the lunchtime feel, not too crowded but not empty either. Appetizers were very tasty, with high-quality ingredients, albeit short on bread to eat them with. Pizza entrees took a surprisingly long time to arrive (they claim their high-tempera...

Was great once. I recently visited BWW for a late lunch. My order was dry and terribly over salted. The service was poor and we were not even offered a drink refill when there were four staffers standing around watching baseball.
Not so great atmosphere..lots of kids, good wings though
Plenty of seating. Usually really loud. Good wings.

Underwhelming. I've typically been underwhelmed by Buffalo Wild Wings restaurants in the past and a visit to Fitchburg didn't change that opinion. For a place that specializes in wings, BWW's wing are really only average--nothing special or particularly unique about them. They certainly aren't bad and I don't complain when friends want to go here, but I expect more from a wings place. They do offer plenty of sauce options, which is nice for groups with diverging tastes.  This location is very l...
Friendly courteous staff and the service is quite quick except crowded game days. Only once when we were sitting in patio did we have to wait too long for food.
We always  have spicy garlic and Buffalo sause wings   Both with bone n without  Both of them taste awsum  Do try this  if you love spicy chicken

Restrooms remodeled-safe to go again. They have finally remodeled the restrooms-Yay-no longer a reason to avoid the place. Not the best, but far from the worst food, good for the price, and they appreciate your business. Are also expanding and updating the "old" sunroom on eastside of dining room. Will be quite nice when finished.
We just love going here. They make you feel as if you were having a home cooked meal. Love having breakfast for dinner.

Delicious. We went to Bonfyre for my birthday and had a great experience. I ordered the ribs and herb chicken combo as I love ribs and the herb chicken was recommended to me by a coworker. I will definitely order ribs next time I'm at Bonfyre, they were amazing! The chicken was also good, very tender and moist, but it seemed lackluster compared to how great the ribs were. My husband ordered a pork chop that was covered in gouda cheese and bacon. I am normally not a fan of pork chops and never or...

Good service, decent food, poor seating. Went in on Saturday around 1:30 pm for a late lunch. It wasn't busy, but we were seated in the far NE corner by the window and unfortunately, the waitstaff station. My chair was 2 inches from a steady stream of servers who visited the station for water pitchers, plates, glassware, and a computer to ring up bills. The disruption of having my chair occasionally bumped and the relentless clattering of dinnerware being retrieved spoiled the entire experience....

Horrendous service, mediocre food.. Openly mocking your vegetarian guests as a server is a stupid move. ESPECIALLY when your food is just marginal. On a slow Sunday night, I feel like its reasonable to expect good food, and decent service (and I got cold soup and snark). I wont be back.

I like that the Bonfyre Grill is in a different part of town. I like that it can accommodate a lot of diners. It has multiple dining areas which have different feels. I like that it has outdoor seating available. I like the ambiance and it smells so good when you walk in. There were a lot of things to like about Bonfyre Grill, I just wish I liked it more.  Although it appears there is a lot of parking available, we actually had a tough time finding a spot. Maybe that should have been my first cl...

Rightly voted one of the best in Madison for American cuisine. Place has a rustic and elegant charm to it. We went by the staff's recommendation and ordered calamari and steak. Calamari had a pleasant  sweatness to it. Steak was perfectly cooked and was soothing for the body in the brute Wisconsin cold. Absolutely loved the food !!!
Great good- if you're on a health kick. Great food- small portions and very healthy (which I appreciate when trying to drop a few LBs). Will def go back!

Horrible Service. First of all, the Green Owl is a super cute cafe. However, our order got lost, and it took 45 minutes for us to get our food after we ordered it. Several tables that came in after us were served before us. I complain to our waitress that the food was taking too long, and she did not even apologize. Then, when our food actually came, it was cold. We were very upset, and we asked to speak the manager. The assistant manager came up to us and asked us what was wrong, like it wasn't...

Poor Service. I can't really say what I think of the food here, to be honest. We were never served. It was mine and my bf's first visit to the cafe, which we were very excited about- finding an all vegetarian restaurant. Our excitment quickly dwindled after the poor service we received- or lack of service, I should say. I purchased a Groupon, as we love trying new places often or finding new places to take friends. We went in around 8:30PM, the place wasn't too busy at all. It took a few minutes...

I eat here REALLY often. I really like the Crabby cake po' boy, and the Jackfruit Quesadilla, although the times I've ordered the special I've been pleasantly surprised as well. I keep this place in my wheelhouse for when I'm going out with Gluten Free friends, or for when members of my family (we are all vegetarian) come into town. I was thrilled the last time I was in to see that they've begun selling Tapuat Kombucha too (its my FAVORITE, especially the Atlantis flavor).

I've been exploring vegan and vegetarian food and places. I really liked the raw tacos here and plan to try more. My only complaint was the stuffy air inside so we sat outside, which I wouldn't want to do unless beautiful out.
This is the place. This location of Qudoba has become a regular location for me to eat. The food is pretty much the same as every other location, whats difference is the service. These guys rock!

Delicious, varied, efficient. Mia Za's has all the variety you could ever want in an Italian restaurant, matched with unheard of efficiency. Mix and match salad ad-ins, pasta ingredients or panini and pizza toppings. My favorite combo is a half-panini (pesto-mayo, tomato, chicken breast and feta) with tomato bisque soup. The tomato bisque soup is incredible!! Orders are always done right and done quickly. Incredible desserts, especially the cheesecake! I don't get into Madison very often, but wh...
Kind of like a non-chain Olive Garden. The food is tasty, and quick. Tons of menu options, and lots of custom dishes available. Prices are fair.

Horrible Staff!. From the moment we walked in, we had slow, rude service! When I complained about the pizza, being 45 minutes late, the bartender snapped at me, then, told me to talk to man in charge. ...he ended up tossing the pizza on to the table next to my friend, who ordered it , rudely. The owner came over and asked us what was wrong , by demanding how much pizza we ate....! (There Was 1 Piece gone) Wrong Pizza, By The way! Another lady, (manager) was trying to buy us off with a free shot....
I loved it it was so satisfying! I do wish they had coke instead of pepsi cause pepsi blows but the people and environment is to die for.

Lack of security and service. My friend and I had our coats stolen last night and the staff of Lazy Oaf was very unresponsive to the crime. Some unknown guy just walked in and stole coats. They told us not to call the police because the owner was drunk and it was his day off. Then they did not cop our meals for two hour wait as they observed a blurry video. This was a very horrible experience. The security is lacking. I will not be going back.

This has to be one of the most ranchet places in Madison.  I went in there with some friends, giving them another chance.  The last time, someone stole my coat and I was confronted with the meanest bartender in the world.  Managers were drunk and bartenders were drunk.  This time, the manager was drunk again, and service was horrible.  A very horrible experience.

This business is selling product at the farmer's market in Oconomowoc that they are representing as gluten free. A closer reading of the label (tiny print at the bottom!) says that it may contain wheat. Not illegal, but wrong in my opinion at a farmer's market which I hold to a higher standard, right or wrong. Talked to the owner...he was rude, dismissive and woefully uninformed. Suggest you avoid the restaurant and the farmer's market.

Drinks & Such on Friday, 4/1/2015. I could not get waited on at the bar for my life. I was totally confused by bartenders. I finally moved so that I was not behind the taps. I eventually got a beer but I was totally disappointed in his knowledge of beers AND his lack of the gift of gab. When you go to an Irish bar, you expect the bartender to be able to carry on a good conversation, especially if you are alone,  I had the Mac and cheese and totally loved it! Just needed a better bartender.

Pleasant experiance. Two baby-boomers (wife and I) and our grandaughter went late afternoon after the ballet. Had read the reviews but they were completely off the mark, Place was very busy for a Saturday late afternoon with moderate outside temperatures..Got seated right away and quick waiter service. Asked for suggestion of IIPA (local and excellant) and of course a Spotted Cow. Grandaugher had choc milk and got refills.. We had the brisket, ruben, and chicken skewers.. All very well prepared ...

Been here numerous times, and have been very pleased almost every time. Good beer selection served in proper glassware, very good appetizers and good breakfasts/dinners. The only complaint I had was one very rude bartender (large, dark-haired man that worked the late weekend shift upstairs). I hope for the bar's sake that they've long since fired that d-bag. But that isolated incident hasn't stopped me from coming back, and I'll be back again.

Came in for lunch on a Friday. Was very crowded. So I expected the food to be very good. The menu had a nice selection of sandwiches and soups and salads. I got the Reuben sandwich with homemade chips. The food was delicious! Service was not ideal. They were very slow to get more water and the check and did not provide me with a napkin until I asked. It seemed like the wait staff was fairly new and under the direction of a manager who was a little overwhelmed. Would go back. Was a very tasty mea...

I tried Coopers Tavern for lunch recently. It has a warm, cozy, and inviting atmosphere. My waiter greeted me quickly upon entering an ushered me to a table. The tables are a mite close together. I'm not overweight, but I did have to rotate to slide in past the next table. My waiter was friendly and knowledgeable. I perused the quite decent beer listing while waiting for my dining companion.  There was a number of interesting items on the menu. I was intrigued by the appetizers: beer cheese pret...

Food was good. Service not great. Lunch for 2. Brought out wrong order. No sorry. Nothing taken off bill. In fact was charged full dinner price for a luck special. Had to get that corrected as well. One person eats while the other has to wait for their corrected order. Can understand mistakes happen. But not apologizing for the mistakes and not correcting the price. Skip it.

Great Craft Beers. Sprechers have a wide variety of craft beers. The Abby Triple is a great super premium done in a Belgium style. The food is above average and there is a wide selection of appetizers and specials. The service was friendly and fun. The happy hour is great. There is a huge outdoor patio that looks like a resort. I'll be returning in the spring for that.
Service sucked, food sucked bathroom was nice.

Stop in the Middleton one around 11:30am first one here and service was slow, my drink sat empty for 17 mins even after she walked by 8 times (yes I counted) food was below average only good thing about this place is the root beer it was very tasty. I won't be going to any of these locations for food but I'll continue to buy ther root beer. Also the staff does tend to use harsh and foul language closer to the kitchen be mindful if you have children

This place was terrible. Service was slow and miss informed is of what was really on our food. The management was extremely rude and you can tell they don't care much for the customers or the employees. I will never visit again.

Bad... First of all, it took 45 minutes to get nachos for our appetizer. Then they brought out our dinner like 5 minutes after. Great planning.. I got the Mac n cheese with pulled pork. The Mac n cheese had ZERO flavor. I don't even know if there was any cheese sauce on it. They advertised it as a sauce that had a ton of cheese in it. Then I tried the pulled pork on top of it. Once again no flavor at all. There wasn't any BBQ sauce on it either? Very bland. So I tried the 3 sauces on the table. ...

Disappointing meal. We waited over 40 minutes for our food. Two of our orders were incorrect, and all of our food had clearly been sitting prior to its delivery to our table because the meat was drying out or lukewarm at best. It was not a busy night; the service was poor.

Not worth it. Smoky Jon's in town is where the bar is set at. Brickhouse doesn't hold a candle. Ribs were somewhat tough, fatty - not even close to falling off the bone. Brisket ok, not tender enough though. Cornbread had zero flavor. Beans were somewhat watery, but otherwise good. Mac n' cheese ok. Sauces not bad.

The management is now emphasizing quality and service, especially when a new BBQ place is opening up nearby. As a cook there, I'd like to say that all the food is prepared as fresh as possible, all the meats are nicely smoked, and we strive to make sure orders get done well. Most people that have bad experiences there don't realize how big the place really is; we have 3 floors and 2 patios, compared to our kitchen, so it may not look super busy but the kitchen can be. Overall, the new menu and s...

We tried Brickhouse BBQ for dinner this past weekend. What stood out was that this is a three story restaurant and the top floor includes an outdoor eating patio. With three stories, Brickhouse can accommodate a lot of patrons. We were there on a Friday night around dinner time. It was not particularly busy. All of that space made it seem almost empty. We opted to eat outside, on the third floor patio, where you can look down on the street and across to the surrounding buildings.  Our waitress w...
Great Pizza!. Loved the pizza and the cheesy bread (Candle Sticks). Will def be going back!
I go almost every Friday for their Mac and cheese. It's really unlike any Mac and cheese you can find at any other restaurant. Nice, quiet, pleasant place to eat.
Pestoral pizza is great. Top notch toppings.
This location is awful. 76 minutes to get food and everything is microwaved. So not worth the money. Go to the Koi, have a beer and have them cook a frozen pizza for $6.

This place is quite frankly a joke. There pies are overpriced, but good. The staff seemed to have no idea of specials and our food came out at different times. The atmosphere was weird and the decor looked as if an amateur did it. The only recommendation I would say is "Take Out." And don't forget your coupons!!

Best cupcakes in town. Hands down. Many gluten free and vegan options, made fresh (unlike some frozen competitors), and they donate the leftovers at night. My faves - latte or salted caramel (FILLED with handmade salty goodness.) My only complaint...closed Mondays, so plan your fix accordingly.

Gem of a Bakery. -=Expected=- Great cupcakes  -=What we got=- *Great cupcakes with unique local ingredients *Cute shop *Vegan cupcakes!  -=Disappointing=- You never know what they'll bake, so there won't be enough for you to get dozens of cupcakes of the kind you want. But try a bunch and take a half-dozen home. Price is high @$3.  -=Surprising=- Vegan options and beer batter cupcakes - doesn't sound delcious but is. The frostings are delicately flavored, and you won't get a sugar overl...
Great cupcakes! The cinnamon roll cupcake was really unique and delicious. Nice, helpful staff. Cute shop in the heart of downtown Middleton.
Maple Bacon cupcakes are excellent.

Try the Brookies - just leave two for me!. The staff at Bloom Bake Shop alone are a great reason to visit - warm, personable, and top notch! But the delicious small batch baked goodies are just as good, if not better. (It's a tie really.) Bloom has both regular and vegan treats - I like 'em both. The Brookies (a cookie brownie hybrid) are to die for but the oatmeal raisin cookies and cookie whoopies are a close second. Possibly Bloom Bake Shop makes the best ginger spice cookie in town too. CRAZ...
Great lunch options. Had the reuben w/chips and pickle. Love their chocolate shoppe ice cream too
Good food. Great service. Cheese soup everything a cheese head would want. We came in after 2:20 on a weekday. Place was dead but food was prompt and fresh. Nice place for lunch.

Has potential but not there. Managing and a self proclaimed foodie, Coach's has potential but just can't get there. I've seen improvements since they've opened but am always disappointed in the experience. The food quality is mediocre, prices and portions are average (at best) but at least they've scaled back the menu. I agree with most other reviewers regarding service - it gets the job done but nothing extraordinary.  They need to focus on fewer menu items, better quality and better service....

I think they had a few kinks to work out when they first opened. Food and service is improved . Great deep fried green beans. Pulled pork sandwiches. Havent tried the steaks or burgers yet. Pizza okay. Nachos pretty good. Fun trivia on Thursday nights. Nice atmosphere. I'll go back.

The place has improved their menu and there is at least one waitress that knows what she is doing. I think they are trying to get better at customer service. I recommend going at lunch time vs. supper if you want good service, but it can depend highly on which waitress you get. The food is better than when they first opened. It is still just a little restaurant in a little town so don't go there expecting the taste of the world. It is a good place to go that is close to home if you don't feel li...
Very friendly. The whitti is a good veggie sandwich option. The mac-n-cheese is way creamy cheesy! Also a nice little beer selection, taps and bottles.

Food is consistently average except for the meatloaf sandwich, which will rock three, maybe four of your socks off. Beer is quite good, with seasonal shifts done tastefully. Great place to watch local sports (read: the best team in the NFL) as they have great gameday specials.

Great Pub Food. The Big Sky burger was nice--thick and juicy with tangy, Kansas City style barbecue sauce and a bun that could hold it all together. All in all, one of the better burgers I've had in Madison, though I haven't been to nearly enough places to crown a favorite in that category. The baked mac and cheese was also good, though the best part was the pulled pork layered underneath the macaroni (tender with a nice kick of heat).  The interior is undergoing a little remodeling, but the co...

Mixed Review. Went there for Dinner on 3/31/14 There were out of three of their brews which was dissapointing. But, the burgers were surprisingly good. I have the Nothwoods Burger (the special of the day). Wife had the Home Grown Burger and they were better than expected (we were expecting basic bar style burgers) but they had really good flavor to them. The beer and the waiter were both good, will try again soon.

Perfect place to go in a group. I like the selection of beer and the fact that the staff are knowledgeable about them. The food is hit or miss. I had the Reuben, but I felt like they didn't add enough sauerkraut and had too much meat. But then I tried the Homegrown Burger some time later and it was amazing. Either way, the food isn't bad and it isn't too loud that you can't have a conversation with the people you came with.

Bar staff is not the friendliest.  They complain about the workplace quite a bit and although we got menus quickly we weren't greeted at all.  $8.75 cheese curds!?  Meh.  All around not awesome.  Everyone here hates their job.

Best fresh fish in Madison!. I have been buying fresh fish at the Seafood Center for many years. Several of their shops have closed and I don't understand why as they are the best in the area. The selection and freshness of the fish are top notch. The pre-cooked food is always good and cooked to order for carry out. You might want to call ahead for the prepared food as it can be a wait if they are busy. It would be great if they could add a few tables, but space is very limited and this is prima...

Excellent Service and Food. (Middleton Location) I have always driven past the place, and never checked it out. I really wish I would have decided to go in sooner. The location is really clean and, and the atmosphere is very friendly inside. You know a place has great service when you are asked by multiple people behind the counter if you have been helped. I just ordered take-out, but I noticed one of the workers sharing recipes and cooking advice with someone buying fish. They had a wide selec...
Such a great selection of fresh fish! Friendly staff are always willing to help with suggestions. The fish fry is fantastic as well!

Best Fish & Chips I Know. I've been shopping with and eating takeout from the Seafood Center for quite a few years now, and I'm still astonished at just how few people know about this wonderful place! It's an excellent fish seller that is constantly doing what it can to make sure that it brings to Madison the best fish for the best price it can, and knows the value of buying local and who to ship in from.  As this shop is primarily for the purchase of seafood to cook yourself, you need to know t...
Salads, subs. The pasta salads are pretty tasty and I like the friendly service folks. Cool little italian deli.
This is what I imagine heaven is like! Salted carmel brownies, chocolate cork and fruit galettes!
My granddaughter and her friends visit Batch every Friday after school and they all love it.  What a great place for young people to hang out at.  These East Side girls are very lucky.

Do NOT go here if you are in a hurry! Honestly, I frequent coffee shops and have never had to wait so long for a latte--when it's not even busy. The service stinks. Ive been there three times now (I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt), and all three times they have forgotten to start toasting my bagel. This means that after waiting ten minutes for my drink, I have to wait another give for my food. The coffee itself is good but not worth the wait! As far as I'm concerned, three strikes-...
AUTHENTIC! Delicious and very affordable!! We will go back.
Best in Madison IMO! I highly recommend gorditas, quesadilla, tamale, or the pozole!

Not good...at all. I am not sure where all of the positive reviews have come from. Our experience was less than terrible and that is a compliment. The food was void of flavor, the hot sauce was mild, and the cheese that was sprinkled on all of the dishes was frozen! Yes, I am telling the truth about the cheese. We will never be back and hope to spare others the same waste of time ad money by posting this review.

Not good...at all. I am not sure where all of the positive reviews have come from. Our experience was less than terrible and that is a compliment. The food was void of flavor, the hot sauce was mild, and the cheese that was sprinkled on all of the dishes was frozen! Yes, I am telling the truth about the cheese. We will never be back and hope to spare others the same waste of time ad money by posting this review.
Tips at Los Gemelos. FYI the counter people at Los Gemelos on odana road don't get the tips you put in the tip jar. The owner takes them. Two workers have been fired for taking them.
Authentic, delicious and super fast. These burritos don't skimp on the meat
I love the burritos! Yum! Que Rico son esos burritos!
This is a perfect example of what Mexican food (in the US) should be. Everything is a spectacular quality. High quality dining without the a high price of you traditional sit down restaurant.

Well its fast and beats taco bell. this doesent have the quality such as chipotle or qudoba. It somehow has the same price though. Its a little run down and the service is not very proffesional. but hey, its a burrito!

Delightfull Dining Experience. I was in Madison a few weeks ago on business, I decided to have dinner at the Longhorn Steakhouse around 7:00 pm on a Sunday evening, I was greeted  & seated without a wait, my server introduced him self as Jeff & asked if I would like a beverage, I ordered a cocktail and it was served promptly, he explained the specials and then gave me enough time to decide on my choices. I ordered Flo's Filet, the loaded baked potato, a diner salad with Caesar dressing and...

Disappointed. There with husband and a couple of girlfriends 2 weeks ago. Two of us had specialty martinis, both shakers leaked and made a sticky mess on the table. I ordered rib-eye, I don't believe what I got was rib-eye, it had very little marbling, and was quite thin. It tasted okay. Nothing special. The waiter, while he WAS nice, kept trying to up-sell me from the 12 oz. to the 15 oz. bone-in. He was very persistent, but I refuse to pay $3. more for bone!  There were "Sweet potato bites" ...

Extremely friendly and attentive staff with amazing food that has a genuine taste.   We were told "thank you for coming" by 4 separate employees as we left for the night.   I'd recommend the Longhorn Steaksauce because it is created right at your table on a hot plate using fresh rosemary, garlic, orange peel and their own signature sauce.   Will definitely go again.

Meh. Frequented this place many-a-times while living in Oklahoma City...recently visited this location in Madison for my Mother-In-Laws birthday...with less than pleasing results. I ordered the Blackend Salmon over Cheddar Grits...as featured on the menu insert. Since I dislike blackening I asked for it plainly grilled, which they did for me...only, my fish was raw in the middle! I was pretty upset since my mother had ordered the exact same thing and hers was perfectly cooked. I had to flag down...

TERRIBLE MANAGEMENT. Not a smile on the managers face. Very grumpy for such a young guy. One of the bartenders say his name is Cal? For being in a management position someone should have him go back into training and relearn how to be a customer service manager-not a pleasant place to work I bet with him not being able to smile at all not even at his staff!!  Dissapointed In Madison!
Love the Godiva Mocha. What else can I say Godiva Mocha!! YUM
RUDE service. Owner is.... RUDE service. Person who helped me was sarcastic and mean. Never go there.
Great Food, Poor Service. The food is unique and delicious, but the staff forgot about our order and were unapologetic about the very long wait for our food.

I will be back. Many, many times.. My first time eating Peruvian. Simple straight forward yet wonderfully sharp and bright flavors.  Every single ingredient was perfectly cooked. Every bite completely satisfying. I loved eating at Inca Heritage, 15 min ago, and I am already plotting my next visit.

Best in Madison!. I loved the warm atmosphere at night. Best steak I have ever had, great service and a variety of drinks. My husband asked e to marry him here so I have great memories as well. We have been here dozens of times and never had a bad experience.

Fantastic meal. We love this restaurant. Not only was the food incredible (try the shrimp wrapped in bacon), but the ambiance is perfect. The wine selections are good, and the four of us had a great dinner.   What a nice discovery! Karen & Fred

The steak is very good, but the service was subpar. We walk in and no one acknowledges us. The manager, minutes later comes by, ignores us and seats guests that come in after us. The waitress clearly did not want to be there and had a rude attitude. There's lots of other choices in Madison with staff that actually is happy to have customers as guests.

Took my wife and mother in-law to Wonder Bar Steakhouse tonight. For $53 per person this should be a good steak and good service, but it's not. One of our steak was raw when ordered medium. Showed the manager the raw steak and he he said "we make mistakes" and didn't apologize or offer to do anything besides "we can throw it back on the grill if you like." We told him it was a very expensive mistake. The server was new and told us she didn't know the differences between Ribeye, Kansas, or New Yo...
Awesome service, awesome food. Highly recommend for special occasions or romantic dinner! Personal service that is very tentative. Great atmoshphere!

Best tacos and chimis in madison. I was for lunch at the taco shop two weeks ago, and eat a chimichanga, best food ever try and since then i have been every week at the taco shop my favorite place in mad town,  fresh food every day, eat healthy is my goal. thanks taco shop5.  beni

Don't Waste Your Money. I made the mistake of taking this places advice and ordering online. I was quoted 45 minutes for delivery of a taco and chimichanga. After an hour and 15 minutes, the food finally arrived.  The "crispy" taco was anything but and luke warm on top of it. Not one crunch from the entire shell. And the meat was nearly flavorless. The chimichanga was the same, warm, soggy, and just as tasteless. Even with sour cream, there was virtually no flavor. Even the refried beans, whic...

PIECE OF JUNK. DO NOT EAT AT THE TACO SHOP.  My girlfriend and I made a delivery order at The Taco Shop. When the driver showed up he let me know that he forgot the salsa. Upon opening up our meals we also noticed they forgot the chicken in our chicken burrito, it's only the main ingredient.. After calling the Taco Shop the manager told us he would deliver another or credit us a burrito. Today we called to get a burrito after ordering delivery we get a call back letting us know that they would...

Tasteless ground beef in a store-bought shell. Worse than taco-bell fare. On the bright side it's not very greasy, but considering the only reason you'd dare enter is to soak up some alcohol late-night, I suppose that's not even a plus.

Yummy smothered burritos!!. I have eaten here a few times, and their smothered burritos and chimis are hands down the best in town! Their shredded beef is also amazing...I highly recommend checking them out!

Solid lunch, but ultimately, not memorable.. I went in to the Lakeview Bakery and Deli for the $7.50 lunch box and was generally satisfied, but the food was lacking flavor. I ordered the meatball sub, which was solid, but nothing special. The sub came with potato salad that had eggs, celery, and red onions, but it was definitely missing some flavorful elements. The potato salad was bland and could have been greatly improved with some salt, pepper, and some scallions. The meal was topped off with...

I've been here only a few times. This establishment is in close proximity to where I work occasionally, and i have stopped for the purpose of 1. Something hot to drink 2. To buy a bakery item to fix a sweet craving 3. For a quick lunch. I'll touch on #1 first. My coffee shop of choice was under renovation, and it was 7:30 a.m., and effing cold. I needed something hot to drink and to hold. I stopped in to Lakeview in hopes to buy a hot chocolate or something along those lines, but no, nothing lik...
Best sandwiches! Love the Arti Melt! Fantastic soups! One of my favorite lunch spots.

I stopped there with a friend for the first time today for brunch. We arrived at around 11:00 a.m. and it was packed. We waited in line for about five minutes, placed our order, and a table opened up just in time for us to sit down. My latte was ready after a few minutes. I got the large Coconut Crema latte and it was very good, though could have been a tad hotter. The coconut was a good mild flavor and didn't overpower the latte. It took about fifteen minutes for our food to come out. It looked...

Poor Customer Service. I walked in yesterday and saw 15 - 20 people sipping coffee and eating snacks. The counter person looked at me and said "we're closed." I looked at my watch and it was 3:31. How did she even know what I wanted? If they are still open for the customers sitting down, then how hard would it be to grab a muffin for me or pour me a cup of to go coffee??? :( I will never be back.
Wonderful. This place is delicious and friendly...would come back again and again if I lived in town

Like the food & the friendly staff.  It would be nice if they would stay open till 5 or 6pm. It's also a bit pricey to go every day like Manna on Sherman Ave.  I try to go once a week if I can afford it. They are so popular that they should have more space.
