Or take reservations so you'd be guaranteed a spot instead of having to leave right away-Lack of enough tables.  I would give them higher ratings if the problems would be addressed.

Can't You Hear Me Yell-a? Stella?!!. It's too bad Stella's shut down the restaurant part of their business (no more sandwiches--back to breads, pastries, and other typical bakery fare now), but at least I can still get a fresh, hot loaf of their spicy cheese bread at the market (and eat half of it while walking the square). It's just so good.

More than just a bakery!. Fast service. Friendly people. Incredible breads and pastries muffins and empanadas. They have a breakfast and lunch menu. I haven't tried their breakfast menu yet but they make an absolutely incredible Ruben sandwich. If you go to get one ask for Sean and have him make it. There is just something about how he makes it that is just mind blowing. They also have a stand at the Saturday farmers market at the capitol at the state street corner. I've become a cheese bread ad...

Most excellent!. I've never had anything that was just "okay" here. The breads, muffins, sandwiches - everything on the menu is fantastic. Although way off the main drag, I make the effort to grab something here when I am close. The muffins and bread freeze well so grab some to take home. You won't be sorry you went a few miles out of your way.

Yummo!. I have yet to eat anything from Stella's that was just meh. The chicken bacon ranch is to DIE for (focaccia with a salty/crusty outside and fluffy inside layered with perfectly crispy bacon, quality chicken and cheddar, and fresh-tasting veg) and the breakfast sandwich is amazing on the spicy cheese bread. Snag yourself a bag of day old and you are in business. I find myself there at least once a week even though it's not on a main drag.

Fast and good. The Concourse Hotel Bar shares a kitchen with the Dayton Street Grill. This bar food is beautifully prepared, high quality, and served quickly. We often are in a hurry before a fun class at MATC and hit this place for a good and quick bite to eat. One of the hamburgers features a couple of thick slices of good quality bacon and is a hit every time. It costs $12.00, but is worth the price. If you are in the area and in a hurry, you won't be disappointed with this spot.
Bowling Alley food - I give it a C-

Can't say enough good things about the place. Great food, service and prices with a north woods feel. Best fish fry and seafood! Free fish and wings Sunday mornings! Friends travel from Milwaukee just to eat here.  -----28 Jul, 2013----- Can't say enough good things anout the place. Great food, service and prices with a north woods feel. Best fish fry and seafood! Free fish and wings Sunday mornings! Friends travel from Milwaukee just to eat here.

Cool Place. The sunday bloody bar is pretty good. You basically just get a bloody with all the fixings plus a basket with wings and whatever else the owner feels like throwing in that day. The friday fish fry is pretty good too. The bluegill is pretty darn good. If you have never been, its a good place to check out.

Fish Fry. A wide selection of types of fish and side dishes. A said bar is included but save room for the main course.  -----16 May, 2015----- Fish fry! Wisconsin style.. Most Friday nights in Wisconsin you can find a fish fry just about anywhere. But really good fish fry are few and far between. The Aztalan inn is one of those outstanding examples of a really good fish fry! Like other reviews have stated this is a small town / country restraint and bar. Don't expect a high end atmosphere but...
Found a treasure. Fantastic food.. Prime rib and fish fry were great. Will definitely go again if in the area!

I have just come home from the BEST Fish Fry I have ever had!! If you are looking for some "high brow" place with loads of ambiance... This is NOT the place for you. But, if you are looking for the BEST fish fry in Jefferson County...you will love it! We went on a busy Friday. We waited about 15 minutes for a table. At the bar, which was loaded with "locals", I had a martini, which was good and my husband ordered a beer from a good selection of tap & bottle beers. The bartenders were friendly an...
Charming diner with solid breakfasts. Friendly staff. Stop in!
It's open and going strong!. A nice family run diner, with a good small town vibe. Vanilla phosphate, MMMMMMMM!
Madcity Marty. It's a dinner, typical food, typical taste, nothin' orgasmic....

OK, Not Great. The delicious bakery goods, cool atmosphere and the chalkboards in each booth make Schuberts charming... but alas, the food doesn't follow through. I can see that the chef is trying to be unique in his menu choices, but some of these things just don't combine well, at least the way he or she is doing it. I had a burger, on top of which was piled hash browns, egg and bacon. Cool idea, but this tower of brunch was impossible to bite into, it was so big and messy. I ended up deconstr...

Stay away. Sunday bfast w/ 4 failed in table service, bizarre menu options, quality of food, and billing. "Corn beef" hash made of uncooked potato and cubed mystery meat. Veggie omelet contained one piece (!) each of zucchini and mushroom. The rest was potato! Every toast request was wrong. No coffee refills. Server gone. Cashier twice overcharged to our credit card, once by $400 then by $5... and got cranky when we asked a third time for an accurate charge. It took 10 minutes to pay our bill wi...

I just find myself there unintentionally; so cheap and filling. I feel like I probably get a year's worth of MSG in about four visits, and they only use styrofoam plates/takeaway... But I will probably end up there sometime soon, you know.

Should be called mystery express.... This is the 3rd time I've eaten their take-out at different times throughout the day. The food is OK, but all three times your options is to point at the food bin you want. Even, asking what something is seems to befuddle the servers since they barely speak English.   For example, today I went in and thought I was asking for Beef and Ginger written on the sign/tag. When I asked for "beef and ginger" she plopped it on my Styrofoam clam-shell. In Chinese, she...
Their chef is extremely good at cooking beef. So order anything with beef. you cannot get wrong

It's a Chinese combo restaurant in a basement. You get two or three entrees on a bed of rice or lo mein served in a styrofoam container. It doesn't sound glamorous, and it isn't, but man is it good. Always tons of options with tons of flavor. The bean sprouts are a personal favorite. There's nothing quite as satisfying as walking out of QQs with a pound of delicious Asian food.

Terrible customer service!. Upon recommendations from a friend, I walked in on a Saturday evening, there was one customer ahead of me that got his order taken. The cashier was VERY rude, proceeded to ignore me while waiting for this customers order to be filled, she then spoke around with other workers, and proceeded to sip her water. Then she explained that another girl would help me, which never happened. I had to wait 15 minutes before getting my order filled by a different guy. There were to...
Above average Chinese food! This was our first Chinese food experience in Madison, WI, and the food was exceptional. Highly recommend going.

I like it! Just tried Tai's for the first time. I went at 11:30am for lunch. A couple other folks were eating there and a bunch of people ordered take out, but my food was ready in only a few minutes. I tried the sushi lunch special, 2 rolls plus salad or soup, for $7.50. The sushi was fresh and tasty. Nothing too fancy, but it was a good value. I'll be back to try some other parts of the menu.
I was extremely pleased. Service was so so but we got our food in good time w amazing flavors. I plan on going back asap!

LOVE Tai's!!! We are always very happy with our usual orders, as well as everything else we've tried! They even made a special order for my father-in-law, who hadn't eaten Chinese food in over 20 years due to a bad experience. He was very satisfied! Thanks for the great food!

Probably the Best Chinese Restaurant in Madison. I've eaten here about 20 times in the past year and have always had an excellent meal. I love spicy food and they will oblige when I ask for it to be extra spicy. I usually order the Tai's Spicy Chicken, which has a slightly sweet, tangy, garlicy sauce, with thin strips of crispy, slightly breaded chicken (not the goopy, spongy blobs that one sometimes finds with General Tso's chicken), with plentiful vegetables and excellent, fresh white rice. I ...

Any Port in a Storm. Chose Francesca's because I was able to get a reservation the night before Valentines Day. atmosphere surpassed the food. Consensus at my table was the food was mediocre. No complaints. But, not likely to return for the exceptional food. Would return, if I couldn't get a table elsewhere. Prices on high end of reasonable. That said, we all had pasta dishes. Maybe others are better.
Excellent food and service! Just as good as Francesca's in Chicago!

Really Good. Nice place. Clean. Good bar with a nice selection of beer, wine, and liquor. Ordered the scallops with a balsamic reduction and artichokes and they were excellent. The scallops were cooked just right and everything had great flavor. The other people in our group enjoyed their meals as well. Our whole group felt that we had great food at fair prices for the area.

I usually enjoy the Francesca chain, however this one left me in disappointment.  The restaurant was beautiful and the service was superb, but unfortunately the food was not.  I ordered a Quattro stagioni pizza without prosciutto, substituting the meat with spinach.  I repeated the order back many times and double checked at the restaurant.  However, the pizza I got was far from it.  I got the wrong pizza entirely with spinach and prosciutto.  Plus there was blue cheese in it, which I despise.  ...

We visited Francesca's al Lago on a cold Wisconsin Friday night. I'm not a big pasta eater, so I don't usually think of Italian food, but we wanted someplace close and it had opening on OpenTable so we decided to try it. I'm so glad we did!  We were seated promptly. There were a number of patrons,but it was not crowded by any means. It's a nice airy and open environment. They have a number of prints on the walls, but they had put holiday ribbons on each of them which I did find vaguely puzzling....
Awesome! Go for the pickle plate and deviled eggs

Meh.  I had heard good things and was excited to try this place.  Really crowded on a Saturday night, waited hours (even though we had reservations; tables sat uncleared for a long time, service was slow). Once we finally got seated, the food was good.  I'd rather pay a little more & go next door to L'Toile where the service & food are better.

Went for dinner.  We started with a bead basket which came with three kinds of bread including a pepper jack polenta bread and two kinds of butter. A very good start to our meal. I ordered a pub burger and my wife ordered BBQ shrimp. My burger was great, it came on an English muffin which only added to the flavor. My wife on the other hand got her food and saw that it was prawns not shrimp so we felt it was slightly misrepresented but still ate it. All in all it was a good meal. Would definitely...

I went to Graze last weekend for brunch, and now I'm convinced that this is definitely one of the best restaurants in Madison.  Everything I tried there was cooked to perfection and flavorful.  Firstly, their brunch menu had a variety of savory and sweet, making it a little difficult to choose from.  However, a friend of mine decided to share with me on two dishes.  The eggs Benedict came with giant pieces of ham, hash downs, and salad.  The egg was poached perfectly and the salad was a light co...

Looking for delicious food, delicious drinks, excellent service? Graze has it all!  We just moved to Madison recently and have been checking out lots of restaurants. Graze was one of the best and most fun experiences we have had so far. We arrived @6:30 on a Tuesday night. They were busy but were able to get us right in.  Things were looking up right away as we perused the cocktail menu. We love unique cocktails. For example, they had one called: Sweater Weather which includes cardamom cognac, m...
Cool relaxed vibe, great tap list. Nice bar and cool little seating areas too. Very quirky... I like it!
Best!. This lil spot is one of Madison's best kept secrets. Excellent taps, Great whiskey selection, a rotating selection of great win(e)s, and Death's Door Gin!
The Mason is such a great place, I've featured it in the first episode of my new web series, BEER PEOPLE, "Mason, Up, Mason Down," now available on You Tube.

Bad coffee. Bad air roasted coffee, cool location. They keep their coffee in freezers in zip-lock bags. This destroys the coffee quality. In addition, they only roast once a week, so their coffee is never fresh. I don't think these guys have a clue.

So I was heading to work a different way and thought I should stop at evp instead of starbucks. I was robbed of $8.00! All I ordered was a Chai Tea and pastry. The chai was warm milk with a hint of chai - apparently the ratio of chai mix to milk is a mystery to EVP. The pastry - stale and overcooked. This was a danish that could be had at a real bakery for a buck. Again - these two items were $8.00 without tip!!! I don't understand how they can charge so much for such poor quality. Oh - and c...

Bad food for the price. So there are cheaper italian to be delivered in Madison, however, found this new restaurant on Campus Foods, and thought I would give it a try. Thought we would spend a bit more, and therefore get better food... that was a wrong assumption!  We ordered three pasta meals. All three the noodles were either under or over cooked.   The first dish was cheese and chicken. It seemed to be sparse on the chick, probably used less than 3/4 of a chick breast.  Second dish was ...

DO NOT ORDER FROM THEM!. I placed an order at 3pm, I called at 4:30pm that same day to ask where my order was.  A man who barely spoke English informed me "it will be deliver after 5. We take break from 4 to 5."  When I indicated that I had ordered at 3, he said he would give me a discount, but my order wouldn't be delivered until after 5.   I am not sure if their good is good or not, but I will never find out, as I cancelled the order and will never order from them again.

Good, friendly quick service and great pho. Needed a quick lunch this week and decided to try Pho Nam - it was not a disappointment. The waitress was very friendly an the pho was tasty and beansprouts, basil and lime good and fresh - will be definitely going back again. The only downside was they were cash only - but that won't keep me from coming back.
I think this was the worst Vietnamese meal I've ever eaten. The vermicelli and meat were totally flavourless and the noodles were greasy. And we were the only customer s there. I won't be going back.
The chicken in the pho chicken is really tough. It's not hard to make chicken tender . Broth is good but I won't come back .

Will not be going back.. First time we ate there I thought it was pretty good. Time after time the quality kept going down. This last time will definitely be my last. Ordered some chicken wings to find out they were boiled before they were deep fried. Not to mention the chicken was raw inside. Owner was embarrassed and offered us another appetizer, I said no. I can see why they hardly have customers when we stop by for pho, not to mention they don't have "FISH" sauce which is a staple in South E...
Great prices for food and beer. Chicken pho was super flavorful and I only added chili paste for spice. Nice friendly atmosphere. Great cheap eats choice.
Hubby and I went there last Saturday night. Great atmosphere, good food and lovely waitstaff. We both enjoyed our meals and are taking another couple back with us tonight.

Eye-Opening Experience. After the departure of Frank Cimino several years ago, and turning over his ownership of an amazing Pizza destination to an inexperinced, lazy new owner that ran it into the ground, it seemed like the citizen's of Waunakee's were in a position where they would have to settle once more for mediocre pizza and Italian food within the 13,000 people village. However out of the ashes of Cimino's came Zoe's Pizza! Zoe's combines quality ingredients, and inspired twists to their ...

We stopped in at Zoe's during a visit to Waunakee. What a treat! The pizza was DELICIOUS, the staff very friendly, and the prices quite reasonable. The focus is on carryout/delivery but there's some indoor seating too. We had the Zoe's White and it was just fantastic. Looks like we'll need to find more reasons to get out to Waunakee!

YUM!~. My husband and I are total pizza critics. We have been all over the state and tried many many pizzas. I stumbled on Zoe's when in town to visit a friend. So I went in to order a take and bake. They were so accommodating, made our pizza a 1/2 and 1/2. We thought it was FANTASTIC!! The staff was super friendly and nice. The pizza was loaded with excellent toppings. It was a thin crust and so delicious! We are looking forward to going to Zoe's again and again! Congrats Waunakee on your class...

Cheap, Clean & Delicious!!!. This is one of the more authentic Mexican places I've found in the Midwest. The servers are very friendly and food comes out quick, even during busy periods. I really appreciate the addition of family recipes on the menu.  Prices are as low as anywhere in town. This is also certainly one of the cleanest establishments on State.
Cheap, friendly, not at all fancy, and open late. From lunch to drunchies I LOVE this place!

Found this place on accident but sooooo glad we did. Very quick and polite service. About 8 tables and small counter but a excellent menu. Probably the best pastor near I ever had and the chicken toastada was amazing. See the pictures of the self made combo plate if the pastor gordita, chicken toastada and steak taco. Seriously if you are on state street in Madison you Must go here. We will be back.
Great food and service! We enjoyed our visit and will be back. Vegetarian tacos were great.
I was underwhelmed. Had heard really good things about this place. It was sold to me as authentic Mexican food, which it was, but lacked the quality flavor of so many other places I've tried.

Finally a place that's open late that serves fresh food. Their is a lot of variety of food you can put on a Pita. You can go healthy or not so healthy. The staff was pleasant and it was a fun time to be their. Also they had super clean bathrooms always a plus.
Had the gyro and will come back for more!
Chips and Queso. Order chips and queso. Yummy!

Not a good experience.. I am a taco fanatic. I've always said that I've never met a taco that I didn't like. Unfortunatly, Panchero's proved me wrong! I got some tacos to go but by the time I got to my car they had leaked through the bag and I ended up eating them in my car. I'm not sure what they were filled with (grease? water?) but they were just abosolutly soaked with something. It was gross and very messy. On top of that my queso was room temp at best, lumpy, and had a bunch of grease or so...

Wanted a refund, don't go!!!. We were driving around the west side of Madison after doing some shopping, and decided to try something new for dinner. We had never been to Pancheros before, nor had we heard anything good or bad about it. We love burritos, and frequent Chipotle and Qdoba, so we thought why not try Panchero's? It is absolutely the worst thing we have ever tried!!! It was about 6:30 pm on a Sunday and there was no one else in the place, no one, just two employees who were watching w...

Couldn't tell you how the food is since it's going on two hours now since we placed our order and the delivery guy hasn't shown. Called 30 minutes ago and they said he's got a couple of orders. We need to rethink our delivery strategy if it takes 2 hours! Not pleased.
Great big portions @ a very good price..delicious!!

Used to be the best!!. When I first moved to Madison, I fell in love with Orient House. The food was good, the prices were great, the portions were large and the delivery was quick. When they changed owners the food became inconsistent and the delivery became consistently TERRIBLE. I waited almost 2 hours for my order once, and then they were rude when I called to ask them to just cancel the order (they told me to just keep waiting, as they only had 1 delivery driver). Sad to say it but I've had...

Went in around 9 P.M. for dinner. Only one family was in the restaurant and usually we message if we see that but we decided to try anyway. Ordered a small bowl of sweet and sour soup, spring rolls, general tso chicken, vegetable fried rice, and mixed vegetables. The soup and allowing rolls came out first. My wife had one spoonful of soup and decided rather than not enjoy the rest of the meal it would be better to just not have it. The spring rolls were cold on the inside and probably the greasi...
The owner, Patrick, is a very friendly guy and is really a character. The best coffee in Madison can be found right here hands down!

Good enough. I cant say I was blown away by the cupcake. It had a TON of frosting and the frosting itself had a nice texture with a good flavor to it. The cake part it self was a bit dry though. The cupcakes here are no better than anything you can get in a grocery store, the difference is that it is decorated better and comes in a cool box.

Overall it's really not worth it. The cake is dry and has the same taste as something out of a box. The frosting is really good - a super sweet old fashioned buttercream. The customer service is awful (3 store visits and a catering order). The idea is darling, the shop smells like love, and to take the kids for an outing is really fun. Spending that much money for a dry (but beautifully decorated) cupcake isn't worth it, but the wow effect of those cupcakes at a party is enough to tip the scale ...
The frosting is a disgusting heap of sugar which kills the flavor of the cake batter.

The store looks beautiful and clean. It smells delicious and the cupcakes are displayed enticingly. However, they fail to deliver. The frosting is way to sugary sweet and overpowers anything else. The cake part isn't anything special and I could make better with a box mix. $3.25 is a lot to spend on one small snack that you get once you scrape off the mountain of frosting. I tried GiGi's 3 times before reviewing to be fair and did not enjoy it any of those times.

Very unimpressed! The customer service was sorely lacking. The cupcake wasn't even as good as a box mix, didn't think that could even be possible. The cakes lacked flavor and the proportion of frosting was overdone, not to mention the buttercream is way too sugary. Eating at the shop you are given the cupcake inside a styrofoam dish, which makes it quite the challenge to eat.

Good spot for a nice dinner. The Coachman's has a nice menu and the food is well prepared. The wait, hostess and bar staff are friendly and the operation runs smoothly when very busy. There is a brunch on Sunday that is reasonable but nothing fancy. The Friday night fish fry is very good as is the prime rib on Saturday night. The old fashioned salad bar has something for everyone. Summer is their busy season with the golf resort in full swing. This is a great place to stop for a grasshopper or o...

Authentic. I love this place! simple and delicious authentic Mexican at its best. Delicious tacos, tortas, etc. at really good prices. The service isn't spectacular, but the taste and quality makes up for it.
Quick, friendly service. Pretty tasty tortas. Won't go out of my way to come back, but would like to try a few of their other dishes.

Disappointing. Disappointing dinner. Waited 30 minutes for our order without bread, small salad anything but our wine. When the food did arrive, the food was lukewarm, small portions for entrée prices. Won't return.

Great dinner. Really enjoy dinner here. Very knowledgeable staff. I had rabbit boudin blanc which was excellent, as was the pancetta. Good wine selection as well. Dining room is very attractive and confortable.

Early Valentine's Day dinner here tonight - the stars of the night were the housemade salumi plate, the braised pork belly, and the affogato dessert in addition to some beautifully presented craft cocktails (nice work Mr Dahl!).  Fun to watch the entire staff pitch in and help all over and everyone was quite friendly. Downside was a super cold night and a table by the door, as well as the fact that I arrived hungry so the 2.25 hour experience was a little much on this night. Wouldn't hesitate to...

Consistently impressive food, and interesting cocktails. Nostrano is my go to if I want a nice night out. Good for dates if you want to up the sexxxy, and good for girls night if you want an excuse to nosh on some finery.

We visited Nostrano on a recent Friday night. I don't understand why this place doesn't have a line waiting at the door. It was fantastic!  We were seated promptly. The decor is clean, comfortable, and tasteful. There was a beautiful bottle display we admired from across the room. Our server was fun, knowledgeable, and seemed to really enjoy her job.  I started with the Jackman Punch which was not only delicious but fun to look at. It included bright red ice-cubes made with hibiscus tea. For an ...
Awesome Restaurant. Great Chinese restaurant. Kelly is also a terrific server! Everything is fresh and tastes great!

Some vegetarian options!. I am new to town and always seeking vegetarian/vegan options. The food was ready very quickly and tasted great! We have the vegetable chow mein and the mixed vegetables with garlic sauce.

Yummmmmmy!. First time visit to the neighborhood restaurant for a sit down meal.  Ordered, hot and sour soup, which I sort of use a reference point for whether I like the food. It was great, lots of goodies in it and had a brown color which was different. I think this soup, since it varies widely from place to place, must be up to the chefs personal recipe. This also had a nice mild heat at the end...which I certainly look forward too, since it does have hot in the name.  Moving on...the wait...

I have had the food fromhere a few times and as always it is wonderful!! A little pricey but all chinese is so worth the money!! Have tried just about everything on the menu and it is all delicous!! Kudos to you!!

Madcity Marty. O know the owners and the previous ones to, hard to make it out there in the off season, "Softball" and the outragous taxs! Good friday fish fry buffet, Gary's a retired marine, the kids future B Ball at 6' 7"ish, good place for receptions, banquets, reunions, Sweet taters rule, They have no choice but to raise the prices to help with the lovely taxs. still worth it with the 4 different choices of fish ,smelt to, cheesy taters, full salad bar, ho made soups, worth the drive...
May have decent bar food but the service is awful! If you wanna go to a place with rude, bitchy staff it's the place to go!

Loved it!. One random weeknight my husband and I decided to give Buck & Honey's a try and we are glad we did. My husband ordered the walleye and while I don't eat seafood he insisted I try a bite because they thought it was one of the best walleye he's ever had (and he pretty orders it every time he can!). I also thought it was quite good. I had the ribs with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese, all of which was delicious. I would definitely go back!

Not returning. I've tried the Hot Comby and the fish tacos and because I wasn't impressed with either, I went with the burger on my last visit. The burger was cooked medium but all I could taste was charcoal. I tried more ketchup and mustard to improve the burger... but three strikes and I'm out. At $12 for the burger lunch I'd expect much much more.

Bad experience, food was overpriced And barely warm, small portions, tables too close together.  My husband's fish was lukewarm and mushy.  If the food had been hot and maybe a little more food for the price, or we had gone with the specials others rave about, our experience would have been better.  We walked away 70.00 lighter and very disappointed.

Let's start with the ambiance at Buck and Honey's. It's beautiful. Both inside and out. Indoors is modern, bright, wooden, airy. The restrooms are clean and smell fresh. The outdoor patio is filled w/flowers, plenty of tables with both gazebo and umbrella options for shade. It's a welcoming space.  As far as the service goes, it's a little more mixed. The hostess was friendly, seated us immediately, and brought us waters and menus. Then we waited. We waited to the point when we were just about t...
Great food. My wife and I went in for a dinner before we were tired of going top the same place. The server was friendly and accommodated all of our needs. I would dedicatedly go back.

3 strikes and you're out!. The coffee shop is located in a small strip mall hidden behind the main road. They roast on location and serve pour-overs of their coffee. The coffee doesn't taste as good as Barriques, Ancora or Alterra. When I was there last there were no other customers in the building. I purchased drip coffee and pour-over coffee. The pour-over was not done correctly and the coffee was cold. I thought it was cool that they sold whole bean coffee in cans but I won't be going back to...

TRUE Coffee. I have enjoyed the fresh roasted coffee as bothas an in-house endeavor and have cans of their beans to enjoy at work as well. I've always found their staff, especially the morning crew(s) attentive, friendly, and efficient with their service. Definitely worth a stop!

A coffee shop where you can hang out and get some work done with good coffee. Baristas are friendly and quite knowledgeable. More importantly it is an on-site roastery. You will get good advice on picking a coffee of choice based on your palate. They will recommend a good origion and roast intensity for your liking as well as provide whole beans or fresh ground coffee to suit your brewing methods grind size.  One of my favorite coffees here are the brazilian and the ethiopian. You can start a re...

Best tacos in Madison. You guys do it right. Great and creative Tacos served like they do in Texas. Closest thing you can get to the real deal.   Big fan.   Beer is cold staff is friendly and accomodating. I am a repeat customer and will be for a long time

Terrific Tex Tubbs. Upon the recommendation of several friends I made my first visit to Tex Tubbs Taco Palace on a Tuesday night, arriving a little before 6pm, while happy hour was still in play. They have a selection of 30 craft beers so I asked my waiter for a suggestion for a good Pale Ale and he suggested  Dale's Pale Ale which turned out to be a great choice. He asked if I wanted to start out with some tortilla chips to go along with the Salsa Bar and who can go to a good mexican restauran...

The trick here is to order as simply as possible. Their salsa bar and queso dip is delicious, as are their crispy beef tacos. Anything else I've ordered has been disappointing, but the aforementioned items keep me coming back. Good service too, very friendly.

We had a coupon for Tex Tubb's Taco Palace so we decided to check it out. We'd never been to the Atwater area. It was quirky with lots of unique stores, interesting architecture, and a fun young vibe. Tex Tubb's fit in perfectly.  It was pretty crowded, but with only two of use, we are able to get right in. Our coupon got us chips and a small bowl of queso and a small bowl of guacamole. The guacamole has a lot of pico de gallo mixed in. Both were tasty. The chips however were primarily broken li...
Consistently good.  Vegetarian friendly, good drinks.  I usually get dishes with sweet potatoes.  Portions are huge, salsa bar is nice for groups with mixed heat preferences.

Avoid, unfortunately. I've had 2 meals here, both not good. First one, worst one: got their Tap Haus $9 burger, asked for it to be cooked with NO PINK (well done). Had to get it to go. Opened it up to eat, guess what? Tons of pink all through the burger! Tummy ache, only 1/3 was edible. Either the waitress didn't bother to tell the cook, or the cook can't cook a well done burger. Tipped 'em too, second mistake.  Second meal, last sunday, tried their vaunted Pot Roast. Meat arrived cold, and onl...
Burger was awesome

Good experience. Sat at the bar and ordered a burger. Perfectly cooked meat, the pretzel bun was fantastic, topics were good too. Very good burger. Also ordered the zucchini fries, which were outrageously good. Good selection of beers from the Capital Brewery. Nice atmosphere.

Poor choice. Friday night diasaster. Too many tables packed in the bar area, COLD, slow service. We had been drinking Winter Skal and we're then informed they were out and would be switching to Oktoberfest. Really in Jan.?? Now the food. Soup with no taste, cold fries with the dry pulled pork and a badly deep fried piece of haddock. I love supporting independent owned places but this will not be one of them.

Won't be back. We, 6 in our party total, went to the Tap Haus after the Badger game this last Saturday. None of us will ever be going back. First, let me say that waiting for a table or service after a home game at ANY Madison restaurant is completely expected. Not one of us went there with the expectation of getting in and getting out. Our poor waitress was getting rocked and we had nothing but empathy for her, being a table of past service industry workers, ourselves. I can handle long waits, ...

Friday night fish. We visited Klassik Tavern for the first time on 10/28/11 and it was wonderful! The bartender made our drinks perfectly, the staff was prompt and courtesy, and the food was outstanding. We had 3 couples, one person had a steak and it was prepared perfectly. The rest of us had various fish and each meal was awesome! I would definitely recommend this place for a great evening. The only thing that I didn't like is the fact that they didn't remodel from the old Cozee Inn, it was li...

Good food and walking distance to the Epic hotel. Would I go there regularly if I lived here? Probably not, but if you just need a meal and don't want to shuttle it'll do. But likely to try somewhere else tomorrow.

Klassic Verona. Would NOT go back.  3 of us went to the Klassic for fish on friday the 20th of May. There were 2 big posters that read Happy hour 4-6. We were there at 5. Asked what was included in the Happy Hour and they said oh Friday was not included. (There was nothing on the posters indicating that it did not include fridays) this was thing 1. The next problem was we ordered and the cole slaw was frozen. No apologies for this except a snide remark of "well at least it is cold". The servic...

LOVE IT. We have been fans of the KlassiK since back in the Cozee Inn days.New ownership kept the best and improved the rest. The service is always friendly and fast, bartenders are the best in town (anyone who can make a Manhatten like my dad used to is the best in my book). Part of the charm is the feeling like you're walking back into a supper club from years ago- THANK YOU for keeping the old bar stools!

3rd time I've been to a great Dane , worst food, mediocre service, too loud of music, bartender was an ahole, great Dane Madison east not even close to the one in Wausau, brewpub that doesn't teach it's workers about the beer they serve, better in this town
Best mac and cheese in town.

Train Your Servers. Servers really should know the beer a little bit--If your job is slinging beers at a place operated by a *brewery* you should know the difference between a pilsner and a hefe-weizen.

Twist my arm.... We hadn't been to the east side location before, so we stopped in to check it out. We intended on just staying for one beer and leaving. They were pretty busy and didn't have seating at the bar, but we ended up finding a booth nearby. We didn't come in the door by the hostess, so we weren't really sure if it was okay to take the booth since we didn't plan on eating, but our server said she'd let the host know and she just happened to leave a couple of menus just in case we decid...

I stopped in one day to grab a late night snack with friends, however I was surprised to see how packed it was on a week night.  Their brews were cheap and tasty, though their good was okay.  I got the pouting, which lacked the most important part-gravy.  My friend's pretzel was redeeming as far as the food was concerned.  My friend liked their brats, though the other one wasn't so crazy about the Mac and cheese.  I think it's a great place for brews.  I suppose we'll have to stick to different ...

Fabulous Dinners. Wow this is a hidden gem for dinner. We have frequented Olde Town for breakfast & lunch since it opened, but they recently started offering gourmet style dinners on Thursday, Friday & Saturday nights. In my opinion, it's right up there with the very popular, very crowded 1855 restaurant right next door. Nearly their entire regular menu is available on these nights in addition to their delicious new entrees. They offer Salmon, Walleye, Surf & Turf, Deep Fried Haddock, & much mor...
Good but........ Prices are ridiculous! Very overpriced in my opinion.
I live in this area and its a great place if you're looking for respite off the bike trail - alittle pricey but you get large portions and nice atmosphere.
Love it!. Great food, jonhsons brothers coffee, great bakery, nice atmosfhere , nice service just on main street cottage grove
Wow. I'm very impressed, the food was outstanding!

Great Date. My husband and I recently came to 43 North to celebrate my birthday, and we were headed to an event at the Overture Center later. We had made a reservation, since it was a Saturday night, so we were seated immediately, which is always nice.  After briefly looking over the menu, we ordered drinks, and the stuffed dates to start, since we have a hard time passing them up when ever we see them on a menu. The pesto that accompanied them was light and fresh, and the hazel nuts were deli...

Outstanding Duck. Just about everything on the menu is available in a small or large portion, so we opted to share a bunch of small portion items for a tapas style meal. I don't know that I've had rutabaga before, but the rutabaga soup was earthy, somewhat sweet, somewhat bitter, and something I'd try again. The duck came next and was outstanding. It was perfectly prepared--crisp skin, pink and juicy center, and a touch of salt--and was balanced nicely with the sweeter elements on the plate (swe...

Perfect evening. Girlfriend and I decided to give this place a try and we will be back. Had the salmon which was delicious. Atmosphere was nice and to top off the evening went to the musical Chicago at Overture.......perfect evening.

We were sitting at our table waiting for our food when I said to my husband in incredulity, "Did they just carry a giant wilted head of lettuce out to that table?" We were staring when our food arrived and it turned out WE had also ordered a giant wilted head of lettuce, in the form of the grilled Caesar salad. They grill. An entire. Uncut. Head. Of. Romaine. And dress it and bring it to your table, with poached egg and fried onion shreds. There's a reason nobody else does salad this way: becaus...

A group of six of us visited 43 North recently. It was around 7 pm on a week night. We had reservations but we didn't need them as there were very few patrons.  We weren't quite ready to order when our waiter came by to take our drink order, and he seemed mildly put out by that. He seemed put off the rest of the evening. The drink menu consisted of a variety of wines, beers, and some unique cocktails. The dinner menu was not large, but contained multiple intriguing items that we don't see on man...

I wish Merchant was bigger and multiplied. Its a bar with a big city feel. Great vibe. Fun place to go out to for the "yupster" crowd (yep is a thing) great craft cocktails. Great lounge. Good food (had one wierd fish dish with orange that should be scrapped, everything else has been Awesome) a model for young lux new age craft food scene emerging in Madison. Its a staple on my weekend bar crawl
Very cool place. A tiny bit hipster but I thought it was great.

We went there last night (Friday) at 6pm with no reservations. We were told by the hostess that its graduation weekend and they were booked but if we still wanted to wait and eat it would be about and hour to an hour and a half. We said that's fine we would get drinks so I gave her my cell to text us when table was ready. So we grabbed some drinks. We came back around about an hour and a half 730pm to check how much longer. She said your 2nd on the list but tables weren't moving as quickly as th...

I went here for brunch and was very impressed with the decor of the place as well as the lovely service.  Our waitress was really sweet and helpful in deciding what to order.  I stuck with the egg and cheese croissant with salad and my friend had the brioche French toast.  Everything was excellent, but I thought it was a bit overpriced.  I suppose we were paying for the location and the contemporary atmosphere.  It's a cute place, and next time I'll be back for drinks!
Delicious food along with great cocktails. Laid back atmosphere with quirky and entertaining descriptions of the craft cocktails. Definitely recommend
How do you mess up bruschetta in August? Answer: cook the tomatoes until soggy and soak the bread in grease then toast it. Terrible food on this lovely rooftop setting!

I have been there a few times now and at least 2 of the times I had to get up and leave because the service inside is awful. We sat at our table for a good 15 min and no one ever came. We had tried to find someone to help us and no one was to be found they are more worried about the customers eating outside. The food is ok but as far as service not good I've never had to leave a restaurant more than once for bad service.
I loved their combination fajitas - Best I ever had. Service was fair / OK but overall I would definitely be back.

NO Complaints.... We eat here about 9-10 times a year...I have no complaints. I've never experienced the bad service others complain about. The food is good, reasonable and there are nightly drink specials, we can have a meal and a few cocktails without going broke. I love the chips and salsa, carnitas/steak tacos, chili rellenos, combination platters, Mexican Specialties...etc...all very good, served hot. In the winter it can be a little cool in the restaurant, so I wear a sweater, in the summe...

Not Just Terrible Service...No Service. We went to the restaurant on Friday evening around 6:30 and were promptly seated by the hostess. We were seated in the back area and were told a waiter would be right with us. After waiting 10-15 minutes with no service (no drinks, no chips, no waiter) my husband and I got up and left. Did I mention there were only 5ish occupied tables in the whole restaurant? During the 15 minutes we sat our table a waiter came to the table behind us 3 separate times to s...

The menu had salsa between its plastic pages, as if it was doing double duty as a placemat. The refried beans ran like water, the enchilada sauce tasted like Ragu and honestly my meal did not taste homemade, anyone remember Swanson TV dinners? Sorry to say not even good enough. The service was very good though. So I'm giving the place a 2 because of that only. I won't go back.
Good Ole Capn's. This has been my favorite destinations for prime rib since I can remember. I think that since the owner has gone, it has started to decline. It's always sad to see this happen.
Great place to watch the game!. Tons of TV's, great service, best burgers in town, and awesome beer selection. I'll keep coming back!

Nice gathering spot. More a sports bar than a steak house, the Capn's is a good place for residents of Fort Atkinson to meet and enjoy a meal. The place was crowded last Sunday evening. The food coming out of the kitchen all looked very good. I would suggest one stick to the pizza, sandwiches and burgers as the steaks are quite thin and therefore are not condusive to a rare or even medium rare request. Hereford beef is served and I greatly prefer black angus. My two dining companions opted for t...
Madcity Marty. Pre - Pattied taste less crap for a buck yea ha. smokers and drinkers don't know no betta.
We had a very good cheeseburger and drinks. Given the location and prices it's as good or better than you should expect. The gentleman behind the bar who took our order and served us was quite nice.

The Surprise is Inside. I realize that most of you think of Hy-Vee as a grocery store and it is. Inside the Madison East location, however, is an excellent diner.   From breakfast specials to their Grand Buffet, Hy-Vee offers the complete "cafateria" experience. There are daily specials as well as an Itallian, Chineese, and Salad buffets. The staff is friendly and responsive,   All said, it is a gem not to overlook when grocery shopping.
Good food and a friendly staff. Nice to see " smiling" bar staff! Prices ok, food ok, nice place to hang and watch a game!
I don't know what's worse- their service or their chicken lips.
Nice for a quick stop. I had the grilled fish tacos, steamed veggies and broccoli/cheese soup. I got a ton of food. It was a perfect lunch. Very friendly waitress. I will definitely go back.
The food is kind of slop and the seating is really weird, no thanks. There are so many better options; I don't think we'll be back.

This place is great. All american sports bar. Superb burgers, awesome fries, great tap beer selection and great prices. You can't go wrong. A nice change of pace from the usual Madisonian hoity toity fare you usually find on the west side.

A reliable go-to. I enjoy Osaka House and their sushi a lot. Always quality and fresh tasting.  Not exactly the kind of place for a date, ect, but a great place for a delicious take home sushi roll or two. I recommend a Caterpillar roll or Crazy Dragon roll!
This is part of the Edo family enterprise. Similar menu with their popular sushi roll specials. 4 tables outside on State Street.

Terrible customer service. Paid the bill and the waitress had the audacity to come back 20 minutes later to tell us we were under charged for our drinks. We knew the price of said drinks and basic math said she was wrong. Argued with us and the other server. Finally came back and said initial bill was correct. Ended up double charging the card. Sounds like not the first time this happened (according to other reviewers). If I could give lower than 1 star I would . DO NOT EAT HERE.
Faux Asian. This is Asian noodles for folks who have never had the real thing. Very disappointing dishes.

Good food but easy to spend more than you planned. This is my favorite place to eat in Madison--the ramen here is every bit as good as you'd get in Tokyo.  I'd caution, however, on getting too many drinks and appetizers---it's easy for a cheap meal to get expensive quite fast. I'd reccomend getting just a bowl of ramen, maybe with a drink. The portions are enormous, so an appetizer and a bowl of ramen is way too much food per person: if you want an appetizer, split the ramen with a friend (you...
The entrées are puny! Spent $60 and walked away. The large salad was very small. I would need four entree orders to actually make a decent meal. I This restaurant is all about sampling.

Meh. Umami has one veggie ramen and one vegan ramen. They have very little flexibility in what they can do with these dishes, and I'd call both of them just average. I feel like their buns leave something to be desired as well. All in all, edible, but never my first choice.

We visited Umami Ramen & Dumpling Bar on Martin Luther King Day as part of restaurant week.   The atmosphere was inviting. The restaurant is in a house built during the 1800s which has been renovated into a chic space. The entrance is on the side. There is street parking in front and a small parking lot in back. The decor was inviting and interesting. There are a couple of different rooms in addition to the kitchen. It's not a big space and the waiting area always had patrons waiting for a table...
Expensive Beer. Good Deep Fried Pickles to go along with 5 dollar beers!

Fantastic food!. Husband & son had The Carolina which they said was out of this world, even the spouses got to taste and agree. We were all happy with our choices, burger and chicken quesidilla...however we ordered two mixed drinks and thought a mistake was made on the bill. Asked waitress but it was correct...$14.00!!! Will go back for food, but can't afford to drink there...water for us next time!

Middleton Monk's. I've been to the original in downtown Wisconsin Dells, which has great atmosphere and amazing burgers. The atmosphere is much different in the Middleton location, but the burgers are still delicious (though the original in the Dells has something special that puts it a notch above).  The staff was friendly and the service was quick. It looks like the same Monk's menu, which has some nice choices. The onion rings were beer battered and came with 2 sauces (the Monk's Sauce is h...
Small portions. The food generally is very good but the portions are small for the price. Kid friendly with their meal served on a keepsake frisbee.

In town for long weekend, ate at other popular bar & Grill & was very disappointed.  Monk's was 2 blocks from our hotel so we walked over that night for drinks & appetizers on there patio, beautiful night. Went back next night for supper, drinks & appetizers.  Great service, food, & patio😀.
Absolutely horrible parking. Best to walk to this restaurant. We had to cancel because we never found a place to park!!

Great for food as art. A group of us went for restaurant week. Various dishes included the tuna tartare, the lobster bisque, duck, rib eye, scallops, carrot cake, chocolate cake. With the exception of the lobster bisque, each plate (course) consisted of approximately 2 tablespoons of total food. Beautifully, artfully arranged, and invariably, delicious. Unfortunately, even on the most sensible diet, the portion size just didn't warrant the overall price during restaurant week, let alone at norma...

Pretty Terrible. My husband and I each ordered a pasta dish, both of which were exceptionally bad. The pastas were both drowning in heavy, tasteless sauces and were served with a remarkably unappetizing presentation. The waitress said nothing even though we clearly had not eaten more than two bites and we promptly declined to take the leftovers home. Never going back - Olive Garden is a considerable step up.

We had a really nice meal at Steenbock's. We opted for the 3 course chef's tasting menu for $45 per person, which comes with smaller portions than the regular menu items. Steenbock's is a fancy restaurant and the presentation was meticulous. Great flavors, especially the poached egg dish, which came with sweetbreads and a deliciously crispy (yet not breaded) piece of chicken. The portions were fairly small, but we also added a dessert to share and left feeling pretty full. The restaurant had mod...

Food was excellent. Service was OK. The atmosphere is quiet and different.  It is in the Discovery building on UW campus.  Parking is not very convenient.    Very impressed with the food and presentation. It's worth the trip for the food.
I love this place! I've been to a few places around Madison for sushi and TSE is my favorite. The wait is a little long but the staff is friendly and the sushi is excellent.

Not impressed. I suppose I shouldn't expect much from any place with 'Express' in the name, but I wasn't really impressed with this place. I ordered 2 salmon rolls and a miso soup. The soup was ready right away, the sushi was ready probably about 10 minutes later. The miso soup... was a terrible disappointment. The tofu, it if could even be called that, had a terribly dry and spongy texture. It looked more like old bread cubes. The soup was was way too hot. The sushi was decent enough for an exp...

63 year old Mexican Food Lover. I recommend you go somewhere else. Not very good Mexican. On our 41st anniversary my wife and I decided to go to Cucos in Verona. I Ordered a Steak Burrito that was supposed to include rice and beans. There were no beans very little rice and very little steak. It only took me two bites to discover and when I opened the burrito down the length of it I discovered as noted when I pointed it out to them I told them I not to bother replacing it as my wife, duaughter an...

Cuco's in Waunakee-Fantastic!. My husband and I dined at the Cuco's restaurant in Waunakee for the first time this evening.  We were very impressed and highly recommend this restaurant. The service was very prompt and courteous. We were brought fresh, still warm tortilla chips & salsa to enjoy while perusing the quite expansive menu. (please note, EXPANSIVE, NOT expensive) Our beers were served in frosted mugs. The food was absolutely wonderful. My "Burrito Cuco's" had lots of flavor, almost ...

Never disappointed. I have not been disappointed by any menu item or service while at Cuco's. We've often pre-ordered for pick-up and the staff has been super helpful and accommodating. Cuco's comes highly recommended by our entire family, adults and children alike.

Too salty. I had a combination chicken taco and tamale with rice and beans. All of the food was too salty. The rice had good ingredients and potential, but too salty. The salsa obviously used canned tomatos -- had that canned metallic taste. How hard is it chop some tomatoes?? Sad, I wanted a good Mexican restaurant in Waunakee.

Went Downhilll. I ordered the Burrito Grande and a Chicken Quesadilla from their To Go Menu. Arrived and they entered a grilled chicken quesadilla which is $0.75 more. (Yes they have 2 different chicken quesadillas.) They upcharged me .50 for a to go order-this upcharge isn't on their to go menu pricing so they offered to take off $0.25. Of course I said no so they took off a dollar. They remade the quesadilla. It wasn't. It was a tortilla folded in half with huge chunks of chicken inside and ve...

Off the beaten path, but worth it!. A must stop for anyone who wants the best ice cream! Do not let the Columbus address fool you. It is located just north of Bristol on Hwy N at the county line.   Grab a cone and sit outside or take a pint to gallon home with you. Numerous fresh flavors all made right there. Freshest milk you can imagine as well.   They also sell various cheeses, curds, sausages, and other snacks as well.  Highly recommend stopping in for a treat, especially on a hot day.
Yum!. Great value and great food! I also thought it was great that they offered meal plans for students

FirstTimers. Our first visit was very positive. Food delicious, service attentive, and not crowded on a Fri night. Our particular booth had lumpy seats, and the ambiance is a bit lacking for warmth; but we were more than pleased with our first exploration of the menu. We'll definitely return for more gastronomic adventure!

Got very good food and servce, despite some scary reviews. We ordered our favorite lamb kebob, and it was delicious. All the things that came with it were great too. Service was very fast and professional, all the waiters being middle-aged men from the Middle East. It seemed like they came from some posh restaurant, where they were well trained in waiting tables craft. The only downside was that gratuity was already included in the bill (20%). We always tip, but choose how much depending on the ...

Hard to recall a better balance between quality and value. Well prepared with fresh ingredients. The baba ghannouj was perfectly garlicky. Lamb Cous Cous nicely done if a little skimpy on the lamb. Hardy and filling. The sesame dipping sauce for the pita was and unexpected delight. Service good. Prices very reasonable. Limited wine list but you aren't there to drink!!! A recommend!!

Very disappointed. When Husnu's closed, we have been looking for another Mediterranean restaurant. This is not it. Hummus was tasteless. There's no lamb dishes on the lunch menu, unless you like it ground up with beef. I mean, I could get lamb, but I would have to pay twice the price and order from the dinner menu. We will not return.
Waiting forever. Good food, mediocre decor, horrible service - if you can get it.

Menu food was good but bakery options seemed to be old and sitting in the case too long. Bought a cupcake that was so hard you could hardly cut it with a knife. The grasshopper brownie was hard and crusty on the outside. Not good.
I've been here 3 time in the last year & very happy every time with the taste & quality of their food & service. I'll be back for the homemade biscuits & gravy for sure!

Fantastic!. We were very glad when this place opened in the restaurant. Great for basic food (and tasty desserts) - and their tea is wonderful! Love the iced tea and bubble tea - their staff are very friendly with questions - it's a relaxed place to have a drink and work on ones computer or read the paper. Definitely recommended!
Wifi, Good value, great tea, Feng Shui up the Wazoo! Will come again!

Fugu is still our favorite spot for delicious and authentic Szechuan food in town, but Ichiban is definitely a good second option. They use a little too much grease for my taste, but the portions are very generous and the food was fast and flavorful.

Horrible Service, never going back.. Went there last night with 5 other friends. As soon as we placed our order, the manager came down and asked us why we had ordered only 2 dishes. We had actually ordered 4. Then she came back and literally banged 5 plates on our table. The waitresses were not so bad. The food was of good quality and taste, a little heavy on the grease though. We had ordered a lamb dish, a Lo Mein, Rice Noodles, and Chicken corn soup. When the check came, they had added 18 perc...

Not good food. My family and I went on the recommendation of a friend. Bad Idea. The service is so so, but that didn't matter much to me, I just assumed it was more a cultural/language thing. It was all about the food for me so I can't understand the very positive reviews from others. The food was the most greasy and salty I can recall ever eating. The food was completely overwhelmed by the spices, I suspect that they were trying to cover the quality of the beef/lamb which was not very good. Wha...
Really enjoyed eating here!!  The food was authentic and delicious.  The red braised lamb was amazing!!  Will definitely come back!

My partner and I tried Ichiban Sichuan for dinner the other night. The food was outstanding!  When we arrived, it was pretty busy but there were a few tables available. The hostess was pretty engrossed with someone, but she eventually led us to a table and provided us with menus. It took awhile, but eventually a waitress came by to take our order. (They were quite busy and the waitresses seemed very busy.) We ordered the String Bean with Garlic Sauce, the Lamb with Cumin, and the Pan Fried Thick...

Awesome local restaurant!. My wife and I stumbled on ths place ten minutes after they closed and the owners graciously let us in and fed us. The food was delicious, and their inventive way of using everyday healthy ingredients to create a delicious dinner was refreshing to say the least!
Best coffee in Madison by far!!!

I like it. Coffee shop has a college/hipster feel. The furniture is cheap and the place looks old but it just adds character. The artwork on the walls is creepy and needs to be changed. The baristas are very knowledgeable and do great pour-overs. They serve intelligentsia coffee and most of the time it's great but I wish they would offer coffee from local roasters instead.

Seriously Disappointed. Super pretentious. What more can I say? I have been to great and coffee-obsessed cafes all over the US and these guys need to up their game if they are going to cop the "customer is always dumb" attitude with mediocre product. Do yourself a favor and try somewhere else. Madison has some great cafes (Try Bradbury's and 4&20), but this is not one of them.

This place sucks. Expensive, slow and junky. Sorry, but they are preying on rich parents' children who have nothing better to do than nurse a $5 latte while they surf the net on their iPad. This I'd the reason why Starbucks thrives.

Pretty Good. Sandwiches are fresh and delicious... Staff is friendly and atmosphere bright! Only complaint would have to be the soups. 90% of them are pureed to a froth and unrecognizeable; others are bland and boring... Otherwise terrific!

I am a bit sad.... My last review was raving about this neighborhood gem! Unfortunately, things have changed since then - and not for the better.  The quality of some of the food has gone down. The service isn't as attentive, tthis has made me not return. I want to give my money to local businesses!!! Baldwin Street Grille... Please go back to the way that things were when you opened!!! I want my favorite neighborhood place back!  -----06 Jan, 2012----- My New Favorite Friday Stop!. The Bal...

New menu!. I've stopped in a few times since last time I reviewed this place, but just for drinks, not for food. A friend and I went last Friday for appetizers and a pitcher of beer. To my surprise the menu has been entirely revamped, much more extensive all around. We had wings and pub chips. Wowsers! The wings were great! Really good quality, not those creepy little ones with no meat. We split the order of 12, which to my delight was half wings and half drummies. I love drummies. With the gian...

I ordered the Pastrami and Corned beef combo but was only served Pastrami. .   This was one of the worst sandwiches I've ever had in my life it tasted like it was coated in salt.  That's all I could taste with salt I tried to eat it but I couldn't finish it I left half a sandwich there was terrible.   Used to Jakes and Benjisin Milwaukee, this was not close., and not even fit to be consumed.   Garbage

Impressed! Great polish style deli food! Fantastic potato pancakes and a delish deli menu! Excellent service and met the owner! Ask for recommendations and you can see the passion he has about his food.

Ok food, rude employees, no credit/debit.. Have been here twice now. First time, I ordered, and was informed that they don't take credit or debit, but there is an atm in the corner. Seriously people, what is this 1920? Ok, fine - $1.50 atm fee - better be good... The counter girl was listless, and passively rude, like I was taking up her time though there was nobody else in the place. Got a sandwich and chips - like $9 or something outrageous like that, plus the $1.50 atm fee. The sandwich was o...
Saltzy's Deli??. The Rubin was so salty I couldn't finish it.... Don't think I will be returning. To many other options in Madison.

Yuuuummmm!!!. Stopped for breakfast on the way back from the farmers market not knowing what to expect but it was awesome. The gentleman working was very nice. Not much to choose from for breakfast at all really but the eggs were amazing! Not sure what they did to them or if that's just how organic eggs are but I am not an egg girl and there was nothing left on my plate. Would definitely recommend.

Beer, bacon, bikes, bargains. This downtown New Glarus bar and restaurant in an old wooden building has on tap the wonderful New Glarus Brewery beers featured throughout the approx. 15 bars in the Swiss village and a few other micros such as Lake Louis Scotch Ale. Many of their entrees and sandwiches include ample amounts of BACON. Modeled after a Swiss biker bar, the biker influence is pretty light and friendly. Prices are cheap, service is fast, specials every day, food-to-go available, friend...

Good beer but.... Wobbly table, dirty bathroom, no soap to wash your hands..... and then the burger was WELL done and dry and the fries were cold and rubbery. We should have spent our money at a restaurant.

Good BBQ On The Go. A new entry to the food cart world downtown, but experienced in the business, Blowin Smoke is a nice option for barbecue lovers. The beef brisket sandwich had a nice smoky flavor. I opted for the spicy sauce, which was great. It had a nice zip, but wasn't overwhelming. My only complaint was that there wasn't enough of it, as the beef was a little dry. The potato salad was tangier than what I normally find, but was good too. I'll definitely be back for more. Prices are fair, ...
Very good sandwiches. Best pastrami sandwich I've ever had. Great cart to get a quick lunch to enjoy dining outside on the Capitol Square.

Expensive cheese. Cheesers has their best selection of cheeses around the Thanksgiving and Christmas holidays. Selection at other times can be disappointing if you are looking for that one special cheese you bought last Christmas and can't find anywhere else. Some of their cheeses can be found at Sam's Club and even your local grocery store, but are sold at Cheesers at almost twice the cost. So, be aware of that. That said, one can get a good sandwich and cup of coffee and some great cheese. Jus...
Crazy good!!! Alacarte, but priced right.
Greasy. Grease bomb from fat city, would never eat at greasy cow again!

Tipsy Cow. I ordered a buffalo chicken sandwich. the sandwich itself had good flavor, but it was absolutely the messiest thing ive ever eaten. blue cheese dressing dripping all on my hands every bit along with a soggy bottom bun.   others in my group got a blt and the regular chicken sandwich. both were good but average. prices are average and the atmosphere of the place is nice. id go back, but i wouldnt go out of my way for it

Stopped at the Tipsy Cow by default, to escape from the rain, and impending storm. We had never eaten at this restaurant before, and I was actually pleasantly surprised. We were seated by the window in the bar room. We were able to watch the storm with relief as we enjoyed the delicious food and upbeat atmosphere. Our friendly waitress informed us that we could order half a salad as well as half an order of appetizers, which is just what we did. So glad she mentioned that option, because I was a...

We tried The Tipsy Cow for lunch. It's a small place and the tables are pretty tightly put together. My knees were constantly hitting the chair near me and it was tight getting in and out. It's also very crowded. There was a line most of the time we were there.  The other slightly downside was that while I was at first impressed with the prices or the burgers and sandwiches, I was much less impressed when I realized that didn't include fries or chips. However, I was impressed with their appetize...

Been here several times, the sushi rolls are a good, safe choice. But the food here is fresh enough to go for the gusto and order the sashimi (the real treat for me). I've ordered the specials, which are good, but I prefer the omakase sashimi (chef's choice). Good value, good variety of fresh fish served. Delicious. Oh, and the uni w/quail's egg is a special treat.

I was craving sushi one day, so I decided to stop by.  We were able to sit outside, which was lovely.  However, the next time I'd love to sit at the sushi bar, which looked sleek.  Our waiter was very accommodating with providing us with our rolls and separate checks.  The sushi itself was good.  It all depends on what roll you get.  The negi toro roll was absolutely delicious.  I'd come back again for it in a heartbeat.

My review is only for take out, as I've never stayed and eaten there. I'm not a very experienced sushi eater, and there are still places I have yet to try, but this is the best I've had here in Madison so far. I love being able to stop after work on my way home and place an order for sushi or maki rolls, and bring them home to delight my kiddos. The atmosphere inside Red Sushi is nice and casually classy. The waitstaff is friendly, swift and efficient. I'm able to place an order and leave within...

We went to Red Sushi on a Sunday night on a trip to Madison.  We didn't know what to expect, but thought it be fairly empty as it was later on a Sunday night.  However, we were quite wrong, and after a 15 minute wait were seated in the small, tastefully decorated dining room.  The seats are very close together, but the overall noise levels help ensure privacy for each table.  They have quite a large sushi menu, and we tried both the sushi and sashimi.  All the different types of fish were f...

I had my first visit to Red Sushi for lunch in late December. It's not a large place but it is tastefully decorated. They open at 11:30. I arrived at 11:35 and by 11:45 they were full.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive. She had recommendations for sushi and beer. I ordered the Sushi Lunch which includes 6 pieces of chef’s choice sushi & a roll. I really appreciated the chef's choice sushi because in addition to the standard salmon, tuna, and red snapper, it included sea bass and amber j...

Found Cough Drop in My Food and Was NOT Refunded. I found a menthol cough drop in my food and didn't notice it until it was in my mouth. Disgusting. Ricardo, the manager, treated me with disrespect and acted as if I planted it there on purpose.

Not impressed!. We ordered a Spotted Cow and got given a Moon Man. When he asked if we wanted another round, he even stated another Spotted Cow and delivered a Moon Man. When we were given our bill, he stated that he charged us for Budweisers because all beer is the same price whether it is Spotted Cow or something else. Well, it definitely was something else.  We also ordered food to go. I specifically asked for my enchilladas to all be chicken only. I specified this about three times. He eve...

To all to take the time to write a review!!!! I'm Ricardo the Manager, and I'm really happy to work in Cuco's as a new Manage. We always do our best to bring a great food and dedicate guest services. As a human be always we can do it better if you let us know how can we be better for you. Thanks to all my happy costumers and thanks for coming back every time. 608-845-7100 feel free any tima to talk to me.I will be more than happy to hear from you.

Unfortunately Bland. My group really, really wanted to love this place, due to its close location to our house. Unfortunately, the whole dinner was nothing but disappointments.  Only one waitress for the entire dining room. Service was incredibly slow, drinks were not refilled, was attempted to be served someone else's dinner, then had to wait what seemed like forever to get our check. We had planned to get dessert but decided against it since service just took so long for everything. This was...

Not a good experience today at all.  Went for lunch with a my family (3 of us) and only a few other occupied tables  were there and server said our lunches would be out in 10-15 minutes, yet we waited for over 45 minutes with no word other than asking us if we wanted more chips. We finally just left $10 on table and left. This place used to be just OK (mediocre food but better than Taco Bell) but the service used to be very quick and the prices were very reasonable.  Won't be back again.

Yum!. Picnicked at APT and brought Lucky Lou's cupcakes with us. We were able to pick the cupcakes up on the way to Spring Green. There were 8 of us and I got 1 1/2 dozen - vanilla/vanilla, cookies and cream and chocolate ganache. We have 5 left. They were great. My favorite is the vanilla/vanilla. Got the buttercream frosting -- GREAT!! Think I'll have one for breakfast this am.

Nice Food Cart Option. The Italian beef sandwich (Belushi) is great--tender meat, nice gravy, mouthwatering! Get it with cheese and extra gravy. The hot dogs are good too. Prices are fair. Grade: A-
The Al Capone. Get it.

I tried Fib's for lunch today. I was there early, so no wait at all. The folks working the truck were super friendly and helpful. They have a variety of sandwiches (roast beef, Italian sausage, meatball, polish sausage, chicken breast, hot-dogs, veggie dogs) with a variety of condiments (gravy, peppers, marinara, cheese, onions, etc). I asked for a recommendation and they suggested the Beef Sandwich. I had it with provolone and both sweet and hot peppers. The beef was super tasty. It comes on a ...
Good dumplings. Not filling enough, and I east dumplings regularly. We had to get more food afterwards. Really casual setting, tables close together.

Liked their previous place much better..... The owners of this restaurant used to own and operate the Chinese restaurant, Yen Ching on Midvale Blvd. That was one of the best two Chinese restaurants in town. The other was hong kong wok in Hilldale mall. Sadly - both are now out of business.  The new restaurant is good - but I think too pricey for what you get. Try them out - the food is good - just don't be surprised at the cost when you get there.
Pricey but fresh,delightful and delicious.

Sesame Noodles w/a Kick. Dumpling Haus @.Hilldale is another restaurant that was recommended to me that I had yet to try even though I am often in the Hilldale area, but I am not huge on dumplings & had read on other reviews that you may not get your $$$ worth with the dumpling portion served here. I was pleasantly surprised to see a large variety of noodle dishes on the menu. I stopped on a Tues late afternoon and because I am more of a late diner, I got my order to go. Being vegetarian I went ...

Affordable, specialized, great food.. We heard about the Dumpling Haus (which is a strange name, given that it's Chinese) last year while visiting Madison. All in all, we ended up going there three times during the week. The chef/owner used to own a full restaurant, but got tired of all the business and just wanted to concentrate on a few things: dumplings, bao zi, and noodle bowls. The menu changes daily (though some things are constant), and it's always posted on a chalk board (though in fairn...

AMAZING!. I am pretty picky about spending my money to eat out when most of the time I can cook something better at my own home for a portion of the cost. THIS PLACE IS WORTH IT! Priced fantastically, cozy ambiance with great service and sincerely amazing food. Aside from authentic delicious dishes they have a few creative dishes that are equally as delicious, great sushi, great prices! Try the sushi pizza, sounds weird, incredibly tasty! 100% great, give it a try!

Never Disappointed!. We've eaten here a few times and are always satisfied. The kids like it too.  We recently moved here from Wauwatosa and have found that this is one of the better places to eat in the area. In other words, we are not new to fine dining and have particular palates. Anyone bashing this place had a bad day because we love it.

Second horrible trip. I had a biz meeting and of course they wanted to meet at Kit Cho. I was pretty unhappy they choose this place, but I had no control over it. This place is extremely expensive for the dog food they try to serve you. What is wrong with the people that gave this place good reviews?  -----28 Jul, 2011----- Horrible Place. This place trys really hard to fool you they have good quality and authentic food, but it just horrible food. I highly recomend anywhere but here. Also the...
Very good! We happened to be here two years ago on their opening day. We were some of the first people served.  Enjoyed the sushi rolls, miso, and warm sake.
Wonderful!. Cindy is the best server and Kit Cho has wonderful Chinese and sushi! It takes a bit, but that's to be expected for good quality food. Kit Cho is our family's favorite local restaurant.

Best food on the Square!. My co-workers and I love the Good Food cart! The salads, wraps and soup are delicious and made with the freshest, most interesting ingredients. It is our go-to place for lunch! Currently located near Walgreens, just north of Starbucks. YUM!
Delicious, healthy food, friendly service, and reasonable prices! They now accept cards as well. Great lunch spot.

Authentic and Affordable!. Francisco's has some relatively authentic, delicious Mexican food, and rock bottom prices. You'll find options beyond the standard beef, chicken, or pork. Tripe, cow tongue, and a variety of seafood options also find their place on the menu. It's a great choice for late night weekend dining.
Ho hum. Nothing special

Questionable Business Practices. Food was actually quite good...as was service...right up until the waiter asked me to pay...then things got very questionable.  First the waiter came to the table and "told me" verbally what my bill was (without actually giving me any kind of bill)...and said I could pay when I was ready.  I gave him my credit card and he came back to the table and said that it wasn't any good and didn't work. When I informed him that I had just paid for parking outside and i...
Very good. Looks a little run down at first but once you sit down there is good atmosphere and the burritos were to die for.

We tried Franciso's Cantina on a recent Friday night. It's not a large space and it was only about 50% full. The restrooms are actually in a hallway out the backdoor and are shared by the restaurants/bars on either side. The space was clean although we did notice some cleaning supplies hanging out on some high-shelves that looked like someone forgot to put them away.  We were seated immediately and a server came by to bring us menus and take our drink orders. It's not a huge menu, but has most o...
Cool place. The coffee wasn't as good as Ancora or Alterra but the coffee shop was decorated really cool.

Go for drinks. Extensive and delicious assortment of coffee drinks, fun drinks (virgin grasshopper), and wine. Food, not so impressive. Grilled cheese and salad side, and staff were challenged when I tried to order without soup. Madison Sourdough Bread was delish, but the sandwich could have used some jazz--maybe onions or tomato. Side of "greens" seemed to have a dressing of only olive oil. Staff were very friendly. Free wi-fi was awesome. Room layout nice, with large windows and a more private...
HAPPY HOUR. Awesome orderves at happy hour, discount drinks would make it a must.

Happy hour. My girlfriends and I came in for happy hour on a Monday, it was terrible! The bartender was very unfriendly and had no personality! The happy hour food was very small. We ordered 4 shrimp cocktail thinking we would get 3ish shrimp per order! No it was 1 shrimp per order! We will never visit Tempest for happy hour again!!

Rip. Another over priced restaurant in Madison. They can't afford to give you a potato or veggie with you steak? C' mon. Spotty service, somewhat pretentious. Wost brandy old fashioned in my live. This place can float back out to sea.

Ate here tonight for my birthday. Big disappointment. While the food was decent, the service was incredibly slow! Three hours and the room was ungodly hot and stuffy. Could not recommend when there are so many more Madison restaurants that care about their guests. Oh, not even a well wish from staff regarding our bday celebration.
