Fresh! Our oysters, and shrimp, scallops and fish were very fresh. Could not have been more than a day from being caught.  This is the really thing as least as close as you can get to the west or east coast.
Madcity Marty. You can't Beat Babcock Hall ice cream, YUMMMMM

The groceries at this place are extremely expensive and the variety is nothing special. The produce is 3x more than you'll pay at other grocery stores if you are willing to travel 10-15 minutes to save. I would rather walk 10 minutes to Asian Midway on park and save lots of cash than shop at this place.
Belgian waffels  and quick two egg breafast with hash brown n brown bread on side  The waffels were great soft nice n the egg breakfast was ok as usually the other breakfast centres
Addictive. Always delicious! The fillings are inventive and tasty and the crust is really good. Great farmer's market breakfast!

Yum. They offer a handful of different empanadas, including vegetarian and dessert options, but are usually out of a couple items by the time I make it there thanks to the hungry market crowd. I've tried the pulled pork and chicken empanadas, both of which were terrific. The fried crust was light, crisp, and flaky and both meats worked really well with that light green cilantro sauce they offer. The desserts are delicious too. Warm bananas and melted chocolate covered with powdered sugar--mmmmmm...

Yummy!. I'm normally not a fan of empanadas, but these are fantastic! A lightly fried pastry filled with some of the most flavorful beef you'll ever have, served with a side of cilantro-lime sauce that balances the dish perfectly.  I pick up a couple of them whenever I'm in the neighborhood and they are one of the best bites you'll have at Taste of Madison!

These empanadas rock! It's one of the things I most look forward to when I go to the Saturday morning downtown Farmer's Market. The Pabellon, the Breakfast, and the shredded beef and cheese empanadas are delicious. I just wish I could find an easy way to get these during the winter months!

Delicious and Healthy!!. I have been eating at Fit Fresh Cuisine both on their meal plan and off the menu for over a year now. If you have not stopped here yet—you need to! Fit Fresh is one of the best gems in the Madison area; not only for people who like to eat healthfully but for anyone who loves delicious food!! There are so many things to appreciate here... The food is purchased locally whenever possible, from local farmers’ CSA programs, which is near and dear to my own heart. This in ...

Healthy, Balanced, Convenient & Tasty. I have been using Fit Fresh Cuisine's meal plan for nearly a year and have been nothing but HAPPY! I am a full time teacher and a personal trainer so I am very busy but also extremely concerned with eating natural whole foods. The food is purchased locally and organic whenever possible and this too is very important to me. During the past year they also reduced their cost based on the cost of their locally purchased foods being reduced. Instead of making a ...

The food was ridiculously bland. Healthy food can have flavor too! The customer service was horrible, made it uncomfortable for a person that was going there for the first time to order. The menu online is not the same as what is in store. Def won't be going here again, which is too bad because I was really excited to have a fresh, organic restaurant by my house!

Yep - It's Healthy. It's hard to believe it's healthy...I've said that so many times!  What it is: Healthy and fresh made food, with something for everyone; smoothies, salads, sandwiches, pizza, cookies and bars. *I have my favorites - see below for my recommendations* Produce is purchased locally through their participation in a CSA; I like that they buy local, just like I do. The sauces and dressings, the salsas and greens...now I wish I had the curry chicken sandwich to munch on while sitt...
Great breakfast and tuna melts. Very yummy breakfast sandwiches. I really like their tuna melts and coleslaw. Friendly staff too.

The website doesn't have the menu. There is no way to contact the place, no email and the phone is off the hook. Really? In 2013 you can't get your stuff together?? I have to wonder what else is not a priority here.
Very friendly staff, nice natural light, great coffee, surprisingly fresh and delicious food, reasonable prices, quiet environment for reading, working, etc. I especially enjoy their Honey Lattes.
I didn't think breakfast could get better!  Egg white omelette that not only was tasty but health? Avocado & chicken Now my favorite

The Bad Egg and I. I guess the title is deceiving since I wasn't was never seated and left. But my first impression was, WOW, people are waiting outside, this must be worth the wait. The hostess indicated a 15 to 20 minute wait. OK, so 30 minutes I can live with. However after 45 minutes I went inside. There were enough empty tables to seat everyone who was waiting. Most people who were seated had no food, water or coffee as they sat and waiting, and waited and waited. Some people did eat as I d...

The Joke was on us. Although it is a bit of a drive from Sun Prairie for us to go to the Egg & I, we looked forward to a nice breakfast like the one we enjoyed in Chicago 2 years ago. I guess location does matter! Our waiter came back to the table 3 times as he forgot what I had ordered. I am a corned beef hash fan and am always looking for a good place to find good hash. This place was not it. When the plate was set down in front of me I didn't recognize it as being corned beef hash. The potato...

Terrible staff...ok food. Seems like a glorified, over priced Perkins.  Owner was to busy texting to acknowledge customers. The staff followed suit. Four employees were sitting on the bench when we came in.... Hostess took her sweet time in seating customers, and was extremely rude and unpleasant. Not going back, won't recommend it to anybody.

worst service ever!! got in took awhile to get water and hot chocolate then she took our order and no one ever checked on us again.  after 25 minutes the sfaff started leaving (close to closing) our waitress left and I went up to ask what happened to our food.  the person then asked "are you sure your order was put in?"  I said I am not the waitress but she walked to the kitchen after taking our order...  she went to check and the manager came over and asked what the problem was.  told him and h...

Chicken Sandwich Heaven. Honestly, I thought I had it all before I came to JDs'. However, their chicken sandwich changed my perspective on life entirely . JD's offers the best chicken sandwich I have had in Madison in over four years at an affordable price. This is serious. If you want the dopest chicken in Madtown, JD's deserves a visit. If you don't, just move on with your life. Sorry for no photo, I ate it too quickly... And yes, it's that effing good.
Great for late night food. They do run out of food pretty quickly. Not a lot Condiments/sauces.

Not Exactly Fresh, But Still Good. It's nice that visitors can get Roman Candle in the museum, though I don't think anything is made fresh on-site. For any custom pizza, you need to notify them ahead of time to allow for delivery. They do have a lot of kid-friendly choices like mac and cheese.  FYI: The Children's Museum is awesome!
Chicago Dog. Textbook-perfect, plus fresh-from-the-farmers market Roma tomatoes. Great little stand in a triangle park.

Perfect hot dogs, perfect venue!. This screams small town charm. A quiet little triangle park with an upscale hot dog stand style. cute picnic tables with umbrellas give you a place to sit and relax. A great lunch outing for the family.

Be leary..We have been there a handful of times. The experience seemed to be good with tasty beer and descent food. We decided to make a reservation to rent out their upstairs for an after wedding rehearsal for guests, out of town and in town. Our wedding is in 30 days, yesterday they sent an email informing us it was basically cancelled due to a more substantial party. Basically insinuating we will make more from them, too bad, good luck.. Don't really care. VERY DISAPPOINTED in their handling ...

Go Back Again & Again. They have a small but tasty selection of tap beers (Lakefront's Fixed Gear is a favorite), infused vodkas and really good food. The burgers are never frozen and this makes a difference. Try The Rigby Burger. Service is attentive and cool. I am a fan.

Great Burgers. UPDATE JULY 2012 Back at the Rigby and I opted for some lighter fare this time, with the buffalo chicken wrap. The wrap packed plenty of buffalo spiciness (I was hoping the bleu cheese would cut through that a bit, but it was overwhelmed) and all the ingredients tasted fresh. Overall, it was a good wrap, but I'd recommend this place first for its burgers and sandwiches (my friends had a philly and a mushroom burger and both got raves).  ----- The menu is pretty typical pub fare...

When I moved to downtown Madison, this was the first place I visited, and it stuck. Standard pub food, but a cut or two above. Unique and groovy decor in a fairly intimate atmosphere. They offer a variety if activities; top notch bands, karaoke, trivia, and coming soon (fingers crossed) cult classic movie night! But the biggest thing to recommend The Rigby is the staff. Friendly, cheerful, competent and fun. I felt at home the first time I walked in. Definitely worth a relationship, not just a f...

A friend and I tried the Rigby Pub and Grill for lunch yesterday. I really liked it. They have outdoor seating and we were going to ask to be sat outside, but once inside we realized the only one working tables was the bartender, so we decided to just eat at the bar. The bartender provided us menus, asked if we had seen the special (it varies based on the day of the week) and took our drink order. The menu contained appetizers, sandwiches, burgers, and wraps. I appreciated that there were both y...
Everything is pre made off site. No real "cooking " occurs on site. Not as bad as the microwave version was downtown but not much better

Simply Italian. Nothing too fancy, but our meals were tasty. The pizza was nicely done with good toppings and a nice charred crust. The 10" pizza was a good size for one person (not too big to finish, big enough to be filling).   The pasta was decent, but not great. The baked mushrooms were flavorful, but not worth $6. The tiramisu was sub-par.  Don't go here expecting too much, but it is a nice little place. The pizza is worth it and I'm excited to try the sandwiches next time. Skip the pas...

The restaurant itself is very nice and clean. And the service is excellent. However, their pizzas left a lot to be desired. The dough was very bland and did not taste like a traditional pizza dough. Same for the sauce, it lacked flavor. Their desserts looked fantastic, but those are not made in-house. There's other food on the menu which I may try, but I won't be going back for pizza.

I had Luigi's take out for dinner the other night, and overall I was pretty happy with it.  It was thin crust style with extra cheese, making it extra greasy.  Still, the pizza had a lot of flavor.  I just think there should be more toppings on the pizza for the price.  It's very overpriced for standard pizza toppings.  The delivery man was quite late, which is why my rating is a bit low.  If it had come on time and warm (our pizza was cold on arrival), I would've voted a bit higher for the plac...
Great Pizza!. Bought a dozen pizzas for a party. Rave reviews. Great combinations and perfect crust! Hard to beat!

I lived in South Jersey for 8 Years, and I have been in the mid west for almost 5 years, this is the first pizza place I have been to that can truly produce a quality pizza! I did not even have to ask for it to be "pie cut!" And great beer, I did not have to bring my own. EAT HERE! You will not be disappointed.

My Favorite. Talk about best Pizza PIE in Sun Prairie, I'm hooked on their Pizza Pie. I was never disappoint it with Salvatore's food in general..the menu is very appetite satisfying. I chose Salvatore's food over Buck & Honey any day! Got it have it Love it. :)
Great food and I love how they try to use locally sourced ingredients. The only thing I would improve is the decor. But I'll definitely be back!

If you love pizza and you've never been here.... you're not doing it right. Hands down, Salvatore's has the best Za in the Madison area, made with love and locally found ingredients. The location itself is small but eccentric and inviting (if dining in I'd recommend reservations). The waitstaff has never been anything but smiley and accommodating.  They do not have a bar, no, but they do have a selection of craft beers and wines. The all local ingredients, creative specials, and amazing crust ...
Good food, friendly service, relatively cheap drinks. Nice mix of people between the front and back rooms.

Poor service, mediocre food on State Street. The folks at the Fountain arranged for an awkward, ad hoc table (well, three mismatched ones actually) outside to accommodate our party of seven and one baby for lunch, which we thought fairly amazing considering it was a Farmers' Market Saturday. After receiving our 1/2 full plastic cups of water—the owner yelled to the server as we sat down, "Make sure they get the plastic cups!"—our server returned amid apologies for taking so long. He took dri...

The makeshift "Cafe" is closed....I rest my case from my earlier review. My hope is that this place closes soon so something new can use the space.  -----12 Jun, 2013----- Horrible Service.... I went.... Horrible Service.... I went in there for a cup of coffee one saturday morning in the adjacent fountain bakery. I waited 8 minutes for a fresh batch of coffee. Used my debit card and on Monday I noticed a $6.50 charge. Seriously? The same weekend I went there for drinks (mind you I didn't kn...

We went to the Fountain for some burgers, and we weren't disappointed. The Fountain is an interesting place, with several entrances and two distinct dining areas. There is a small room in the front right off of State Street with a nice bar and a few tables. There is also a side entrance and a rear entrance, though I'm not sure if the rear entrance is open. We entered through the side and sat in the back dining room, which has old booths and a big bar as well. Some folks were setting up for a Jaz...

The "Fountain Burger" is hands down the best burger I've ever had in my entire life... and I've had a lot of burgers. Just take a look at the ingredients, everything you would want on a burger. Creaminess from the 4 year aged Hooks cheddar, crunchy texture and subtle bitterness from the heaping pile of onions, then the spciy notes from the char-girlled jalapenos, and lets not forget the bacon to bring it all together.   I also recommend the chicken wings; buffalo style obviously!
This is a great corner local tap, no food, great atmosphere & outdoor seating is awesome!

Carry out pizza & cheesy sticks. Living just down the road, we were hoping to find a go-to pizza place. Last night we had an ultimate pepperoni pizza & free cheesy sticks. As we entered the building to pick up the pizza, I commented on the pleasantly warm atmosphere. The waitstaff was friendly and attentive. For the price paid, the amount of food was sufficiently adequate.  However, I didn't like the cheesy sticks or the pizza. I don't believe there is such a thing as bad pizza. Having said tha...

Da House. The Pizza here is explicitly their long suit. The sauce is very good and has a real tomato taste to it. You can see little chunks of tomato and taste the acidity of it as well. The crust tastes good too, it has that type of crust where its thin for the most part, but a crust you can grab onto. The rest of the menu is OK but the star of this place is the pizza. It is in their name and rightfully so. This is hands down the best pie in the zip code.   The downside to this place is you w...

I've been to Brickhouse a few times for lunch and it's been very good. They've really improved the atmosphere. I've also had their food several times for work functions & it's. been great. Give it a try you'll like it.

Mac and cheese pizza. On a cardboard crust lies a bed of flavorless mush they call macncheese smothered in grease and melted tasteless cheese. Wings prove to be the only semi ok food there. Highly disappointed.

Really bad pizza. First, the good news: our server was very friendly and had a delightful personality. That's the only good news  Now, the rest: At best, the pizza here is non-descript and worse than many frozen pizzas. The crust is tasteless and dried out so much that it was crunchy. The tomato sauce is bland and applied far too sparingly. The onions are tasteless onion skin flakes. Their Italian sausage was not bad, but like other ingredients, there was not enough of it. The cheese also was ...
Typical chineese food. Hot, good, very fast and friendly staff. I will return.

Awesome Restaurant. Very friendly and fast service. They serve chips and salsa the second you sit down. The also have the best margaritas!!! My son loves kiddy cocktails. The chips and salsa are great too, especially for a hungry kid who can't wait for food to get cooked. Great food and the prices fit into our budget.. My son and I just love to go to Aranda's; it has become our regular place to go when we eat out. Thanks for coming to Deforest Aranda's - now we don't have to drive into Madison t...

I was in the mood for Mexican food and read the good reviews about this place. We live in Sun Prairie and so we went for a short drive to DeForest. It was worth the trip and we will be going back for sure. They started us out with some very tasty chips and salsa. While the chips did seem a little greasy - they were super good so no complaint there. The salsa tasted fresh and was also very good. My wife had the chicken chimichangas and they were also super good. The shell was crisped to perfecton...

Missing the original Aranda's. Hadn't ordered from here for about 6 months. Was looking forward to really good mexican food. Don't know what has happened in the kitchen but the quality has dropped, alot! Ordered the beef and cheese enchilladas, recieved chicken and cheese enchilladas. Red sauce tasted like Ragu. No lettuce and sour cream as a side. Chips were stale. Partner ordered Chalupa and taco, both shells were stale. Really disapointing. Have heard other comments as to the drop in quality....

When walking up to Arandas 2 staff members were standing outside. When we got up to the side walk both employees ran in and shut the door on us. The food sucked! I asked for a borrito and an enchalada when they came to me they were they were the same. When eating these things I found some kind of hard fake looking leaf in my food. I could not eat any more! The waiter stood in front of the tv the hole time, he acted like we were being rude for asking for something. When he took our plates we were...

Muy Bien!. So glad to have Aranda's in the DeForest area...it was so badly needed! Great food, good prices, their regular servers are wonderful. Love their Texas Margarita. My family and I are regulars- please don't go anywhere Aranda's!

Food no longer good. Located in the failed Fox Point restaurant space, El Patron has been open for business since this summer and appears to be doing a pretty good business. We ventured in late Halloween evening and enjoyed our dinners. The food was nicely spiced and plentiful. The beef burrito was very good with the cheese in the tortilla and the onions, shredded beef and green peppers on top. Sides of moist rice and salad were good too. The chips are a bit greasy and the dipping sauces aren't ...
Friendly staff and good food for the price
I have yet to leave this place hungry. Lunch wih a tip is usually around $8
Love this place! You get A LOT of authentic food for not a whole lot of money. Been there several times and the food is always fantastic. The drinks were a bit strong but most people prefer that.

Mediocre Mexican food at best. Flavors are bland and they like to skimp on cheese. The chips and dips they give you are the best part of the meal. Save yourself the time and go to El Rio in Stoughton.

New Chef. My husband and I went here a few weeks back and our food was delicious! We ordered appetizers including the chicken wings and sliders. Last night we tried the larger version of the sliders-the Guinness sauced burger. The burger seemed like a hockey puck patty from school lunches. It was definitely not the juicy, flavorful version of its previous miniature counterpart. It even had me wondering if they had run out of items and darted across the street to Trader Joe's for a frozen patty a...

New Menu is Disappointing. My family and I have been fans of the Friday Fish Fry at Brocach and have enjoyed the tasty options many Fridays. Last night we brought along another family to share our pleasure. But the menu had changed! We ordered the Fish and Chips off the menu and were very disappointed. The "chips" were large wedges of russet potatoes fried almost black and the cod, although tasty, appeared in uniform pieces that had to be purchased already breaded. This was not the dinner we had...

Stopped in for a Friday Fish Fry. 30-40 minute wait, but I was willing based on my fish & chips experience at the downtown Brocach a few years ago. I wasn't disappointed either. Great fish, steaming hot, and the fries were good too. The pre-dinner snacks of rye bread, pickles, and coleslaw was a nice touch as well. Good beer selection.
The duck fat fries are to die for...hot, crispy, flavorful!! The decor is warm and inviting and the staff are friendly. We'll definitely be back!!

Does not support civil rights. After years of welcoming lawfully-armed customers, Elie's very recently (JUL of 2014) posted a "no (legal) guns allowed" sign. They are such hypocrites, because they hosted an open carry breakfast just a week or so before!   This is very disappointing, as I used to drive over from Milwaukee to have breakfast there, and the food was always good and pretty reasonably priced.   I think that whoever the whiny liberal anti-rights person was who coerced them into pos...

Does not support civil rights. After years of welcoming lawfully-armed customers, Elie's very recently (JUL of 2014) posted a "no (legal) guns allowed" sign. They are such hypocrites, because they hosted an open carry breakfast just a week or so before!   This is very disappointing, as I used to drive over from Milwaukee to have breakfast there, and the food was always good and pretty reasonably priced.   I think that whoever the whiny liberal anti-rights person was who coerced them into pos...

Open Carry Ban. Very disappointed at Elie's. You never know when one of them darn Redcoats is gonna jump at ya out of nowhere and eat your food while you just sit there defenseless and all. I'd best join a militia to keep my manhood in tact now that Elie's so unfairly took it away. Heck, at least I can still shoot my mouth off when I'm not shooting myself in the foot over the open carry issue! ... and enjoy my food w/o someone looking for an imaginary fight.

Great Experience. Six of us had lunch a week ago here. We all had the brisket sandwich because it had been recommended by a friend. We weren't disappointed. It was delicious! (Everyone agreed.) The wait staff was very helpful and pleasant. We will definitely go back and try other options. Handicap parking in the back of the building close to the door was a plus.
Very good. Easily the best .... Very good. Easily the best fried cheese curds I have ever had.

OK: The cheese curds are easily the best in the Madison Area. Let's get that out of the way immediately. Strong tap beer game. My dining partner really enjoyed the clam chowder, but found the Chicken Andouille Stew to be, in his words "Way over seasoned". My Spinach and Chickpea stew was pretty on point, and a cool vegetarian offering. We sat at the bar, and our waitress was just OK. She first explained how tasty and vegetarian the broccoli cheese soup was, and she knew because she ate it yester...

Went there for a tap takeover by 3 Floyd's Brewery, and had a really good time. The bartenders there were great. Fast service, friendly and knowledgeable. Very good fried cheese curds and beer selection, decent Banh Mi sandwich. A Founder's Brewery tap takeover coming in Feb., so I'll be back!
Good food, great atmosphere and nice bar. Have been here for drinks, brunch, and dinner multiple times. Variety of menu options which never fails, great breakfast too!
Excellent buffet at an affordable price. Great selection.
The food is reasonably priced, a bit uneven in quality, but some things (eg, fajitas) are tasty. At the price you can afford to experiment. Caution: Their corn tortillas are awful! Really greasy.
This place closed its doors sadly so they are no longer open for business. The food was great when it was open for business but I wouldn't suggest going since you won't get any food.

Banzo is amazing! Easily my fave restaurant in Madison. I never write reviews. I am compelled to write a review for Banzo. It started a few years ago, when I had my first falafel pita on Library Mall: I have been a regular and loyal customer ever since. First-time dining at the restaurant on Sherman and the service is just the best. Attentive staff, not pushy. Just an awesome night. I am SOO impressed and am telling all my friends. It's 6:00pm and this place will be packed. Love. You will too.

Can't believe it's taken me so very long to try Banzo's falafels. I visited the cart at Library Mall. I've read so many wonderful raving reviews I decided I had better give them a try. I ordered the traditional falafel in pita bread. I was so disappointed. Ok, I'll start with the positive. The falafel balls were delightfully soft and moist inside. There was plenty of toppings included in the sandwich, like chopped salad, pickles, and your choice of sauce (yogurt, hot sauce, or tahini). My compla...
I was wondering why they had a long queue so I decided to check them and tried their falafel.. I had no idea what it was but it tasted good with the tahini sauce on the top.. Like it..

We love banzo  Gud for vegeterian lover you will get a nice variety of options  We usually have the the falafel with pita bread and trust me they taste awsum. Firts time we ordered fries they were not so gud but have a sesame toppings on it . I will not recommend this . But do try the fallafel plate . The next dish was f bomb my husband tried it out it was also pretty gud.

We ordered delivery from Banzo some time back, and overall we were pretty impressed.  The falafel was absolutely delicious and the rice with lentils wasn't bad.  Everyone was raving about the kababs too-they were gone in a flash.  I had to go back for more helpings of the tabbouleh and falafel for sure.  For the price and quantity, it was definitely worth the food!

Unique Subs. Unique specialty subs like the turkey, cranberry sauce, stuffing and mayo sub. Also warm subs with cole slaw on them. Yum! Prep time is a little longer than most sub shops, but I would definitely try another sub from them.
Really neat place, that gets way less business than it should. The subs are unlike any other, and are really, really good. Who doesn't like thanksgiving dinner on a sub? A bit pricey.
Ah so so..25 minutes for a delivery isn't freaky fast!! Good change from the other sub joints, oh and bread was little stale.
I love Jimmy Johns! I order lunch from them way too often :) I always get my food in 15 minutes or less and the drivers are friendly. Good pricing, good food, good service.
Quick, friendly service. Convenient location. Good sandwich.

Like all jimmy johns service is to the point and freaky fast. If time is ever a factor around eating this is the quickest option. We always like their baguette and simply crafted sandwiches with few ingredients of consistent quality of what you can expect.
No free water. You have to pay to get water. Seriously, what kind of place doesn't offer free water?

Poor Customer Service. 2:30-2:50AM- My order wouldn't send online when everything was complete and accurate. I had to make a new account and it still didn't go through. I called at 2:50AM and was on hold until 3AM, conveniently. The employee was unprofessional and said he couldn't accept it because they were closed. I told him I was on hold for 10 minutes and he didn't seem to care. After the call, my order went through online and stated it would be delivered at 3:50AM. I live a few blocks away....

Excellent cupcakes! Stopped here several times while downtown for the farmers market. I think they were $2 a piece. Interesting, good looking, and perfect portion size (smaller) for a rich treat. Very tasty!
Awesome Pizza. Delicious pizza. Crust somehow defies gravity with everything packed into their stuffed pizza. My children called the Yeti Spaghetti the "pizza of the gods".
Delicious homemade pizza. We had the stuffed spaghetti, marguerites, and the guido!! Yum yum! Awesome owner, friendly staff. Definitely worth the trip!
Famous Yeti's is second to none. The proprietors are genuine, caring people. Their brilliant menu provides all the options a pizza lover needs. Best part = the sauce! Awesome pizza!!!
Really good pizza. We tried the spaghetti stuffed pizza. It was really good. We'll have to go back to try others!

Yeti's best Pizza in SC Wisc.. Like so many red blooded americans, pizza is one of my favorite indulgences. I have lived in south central wisconsin my entire life and it is my opinion that these guys are making the best pie around. I live on the north side of Madison, and will gladly make the drive to Stoughton for this pizza. I'm in trouble if they ever open a location in Madison!
Had lunch here and got bucky burger with battered fries. The fries were too oily but the burger was okay. The service was okay as well and the ambience was good..
Need to learn how to run a restaurant. Very slow service.
Um...hello?. Sat at table for 9 minutes.. Not acknowledged, walked out...
Understaffed - slow service. Soup was too salty.
Avoid the new Middleton location. Dry sub-par food, overpriced and small portions. Drive to Texas Roadhouse instead.

Great Catering Experience!. Seems like most of the reviews are for the branch location (dine-in/ carry-out), so I'd like to first offer up a review for Dickey's catering. We recently hired Dickey's to cater our wedding reception.  The barbecue was excellent, and my guests raved about it. We had some leftovers the next day, and I had no problem finding people to take some. I'd recommend the chopped brisket and the pork ribs (the meat fell off the bone after I touched it with my fork). If you're...

High price for bad jerky. My meal was expensive, meager, bland and completely disappointing. The ribs were dry, dry, dry. Inedible. I didn't get a chance to confront the management because this was a drive-thru order and I was 30 miles away before I realized that I was was served the worst food I had ever been served.
Ribs. The ribs and brisket were awesome. highly recommend. they welcomed us as soon as we came in the door and helped explain the menu

A nice change of pace with BBQ food. More expensive than just regular fast food, but then again you're not paying for just ground beef. Nice atmosphere and I would definitely enjoy another Western sandwich when I'm in the area again.

Face it, you're a creepster the moment you walk in the door. "Well-manicured" men, men with pony tails, D-bags... families? All of the preceding groups of people can be found on any given night in a Hooters. I can't imagine what it's like to work there. The turnover rate must be exponential because if I were a woman, I could only take so much of dudes coming in and being creepy to me before I had to go.  Personally, I went there because majority rules in a van full of Army dudes on their way b...

Ive been to my fair share of Hooters franchises, but Ive never received service as consistently terrible as the times Ive gone to this Hooters. This really saddens me, because I used to go to Hooters every New Years day, but this place has changed my tradition.

It's a hooters.... Cute girls, cold beers, and delicious wings. As far as hooters go this is a notch above the rest. I personally like to run over to the mall and grab a beer and 10 wings before heading home
Bad. They always leave out part of my meal when I get it to go, they couldn't even put ice in my soda.
Slow for fast food and inside was pretty dirty. still lovee some t.b though
Slowest taco bell EVER! It'll be faster to drive to one near Middleton and back than to come hear and its right down the road!

Rating more for the chain than specific outlet. Service here is fast and cheerful and the phone ordering works well too here with the app. Cinnabun delights and coffee are quick pickup for morning drives.

Great food, terrible service. We went to Lakeview for Friday fish fry, like we do on many Fridays. Only once, the food was not up to its usual standards, but, not enough to keep us from going back. Service, until tonight, has always been great. Tonight, our waitress, Taylor, took our order, delivered our food, then seemed to disappear. We never got the ice water. I had to get up and look for her and ask her 3 times for the dip that was supposed to accompany our chips. Refills on our drinks??? No...

Erb's & Gerb's. I haven't had a sub from Erbert and Gerbert's since my UW-Oshkosh days. They are a welcome addition to the sub shop scene in Madison which is dominated by Subway and Milios. Service was exceptionally prompt and courteous and the food was as I remembered, fresh and delicious. My new go-to sub shop in Madison.

Great sandwiches. I've had Erbert & Gerbert's in several different locations throughout Minnesota and Wisconsin, they are great! Fresh ingredients, tasty sandwiches and great names for the sandwiches set them apart from other sandwich shops. I can't wait for the Madison store to open!
So glad Erbs and Gerbs came to Madison! Easily blows Milios and Jimmy Johns out of the water. The (vegetarian) Jacob Bluefinger with onions and extra tomatoes on French bread is my favorite! <3

They basically sell the exact same vegetarian sandwich as Milios and Jimmy Johns, with unremarkable bread. That seems like a cop out because their other sandwiches are a little more unconventional. This place only nudges out Subway and Cousins for last place in my sub choice category.
Not good quality. Not good food. General Tsos chicken and sesame chicken were indistinguishable. Steamed dumplings are actually gross. Fried rice seems to be purchased as is and then steamed.
Best Pork Around. Move over Dave, get out of town Smokey! This place has the best pork in these here parts! Love it!

DELICIOUS!. 1st of all, this is for Bob's BBQ Emporium in Mt. Horeb. I am pretty "high maintenace" when it comes to BBQ. Had the full slab of ribs, collard greens, and BBQ pinto beans tonight. Our "maiden voyage" so to speak - D E L I C I O U S!!! Sauce was excellent, ribs done perfectly, & sides - perfection. Our plans are to eat our way through the menu, thinking brisket next time, and begin again : ) Please try this place & find out for yourself how wonderful it is - I want them to STAY HERE....

Good pig!!!. Great BBQ in an easygoing atmosphere. And the meat isn't the only great thing, the sides are, as well. The Mac and Cheese is to die for! I go back as often as I can, which isn't nearly often enough. :)
Mmmmmmmmm......Bob's.. Fabulous fabulous fabulous. The sauces are great...ooooh, Ghost Sauce...desserts, sides, all your favorite meats., Really really good. Go.

Real deal.. My fiance and I were desperate to find great BBQ - and we had been all over the Madison area without luck. All the usual suspects listed in Madison's "Best of Madison" list were not all that great.  We had nearly given up and then randomly heard about this little place on the way to American Players Theater. We stopped in and booked Bob for our wedding reception the same night. Bob does not mess around - this is real BBQ. Not only that, but he plays with fun things - if he has the p...
Chilli cheese bagel and garlic  bagel with cream cheese and toasted ,  are one of my fav they never goes wronge , do try this out  It's gud sometime for breakfast
Nice bagels which are good options for breakfast and can be made into a sandwich for lunch time. There is a decent sandwich with eggs for breakfast and the jalapeno bagel packs some heat.

Horrible Service, Terrible Food. I would never recommend any eat at this restaurant we waited over 2 hours for cold steak. I have never been treated this poorly by staff in my life. Please avoid this place at all costs.
Horrible!. This restaurant has horrible food! it was inedible. we left still hungry.
Best breakfast ever. Traveled 15 hours to get there on our way to Chicago. Would gladly do it again just for the food.

Gluten Free!. This place has real Gluten free and does it well! Panckes, stuffed french toast, burgers, wraps, you name it they probably have it! I have a gluten allergy and have a hard time finding somewhere to eat and this place does it great every time!

Not happy. The wait staff is great, but they have a new cook and he can't seem to make my blueberry  pancakes. That's what I always ordered.  -----23 Mar, 2013----- Great breakfast, staff is friendly, and it is a nice atmospher.
The best, This is were I go to get great service , food, and atmosphere. Love and highly recomend
Rude staff; was seated promptly and then ignored while two tables of customers seated after us were attended to quickly. Left after twenty minutes of non-service, do not recommend.
Nice little spot. Unique menu. Some dishes very rich.

Pig in a Fur Coat....a fine fur coat it is.. Located on the previously slow section of Williamson Ave we decided to give the Pig a try while in Madison. It had recently reopened from remodeling and the timing was perfect. We stepped into the renovated space and were greeted by the Pig, looking suspiciously like Rembrandt, but with a porcine snoot. The space was well appointed, wall seating with tables, and a large raised central community table, European style with an industrial flair. The new ...

Rich, rich, rich. There are a few problems to iron out at this restaurant, but it's a place that cares about bringing genuine culinary skills from the Old Countries (in this case Italy, where the chef spend some time before opening) to the New World. The duck fries are wonderful; the rabbit rillette is superb; scallops are well done; I even tried pig tripe, which is not something I typically am open to. Everything was very good; however, it's all full of fat and a little of that goes a long way....

We were in town for the USF vs UW football game. After the game we ended up here. What an awesome choice! There were 6 of us in our party so we sat inside at a high table. The beer/wine list is very well done. We each had a drink. Ben was a fantastic waiter. We started of with several small plates, of which the meatballs with bone marrow butter being my fav. Then on to the ravioli and pork belly, again awesome! Finishing off with the Wagyu and Lamb. For 6 people we spent $100 a couple. Well wort...

What a disappointment... apart from the ravioli. This is an unusual modern place. You can't book and it was full - so obviously people love them. But what a shame... pretentious shame....  Not a single American wine on the wine list. WHY come to Madison and drink second rate, hugely overpriced European wine? And the small shared plates ... well they were all adequate but do you go out for an intimate meal for two and pay $120 for adequate food? However, having said that, the ravioli is my dish...
Rude Staff (swearing, drug refrences) They took all the toppings down before closing. It was a less than pleasant experience.
Awesome Grub!. We went to the 5100 on Saturday and the food was delicious! I can't wait to go back and try something new! Highly recommend.

Great Food...Until the Nachos. This place really does have fantastic food and a fun atmosphere. But come on guys, when I orderNnachos at a sports bar and I get a whopping plateful of nachos with melted Velveeta cheese poured over my plate...um, no thanks. That's something I'd expect from Hooters. Raise the price a buck or two (I'll gladly pay) and let's make those nachos with real cheese (we're in Wisconsin for goodness sake) match the expectations of the rest of the choices I've had.

I love this place. Great atmosphere, lots of TVs and awesome good. The fish fry is really good, both the fried and baked. The flatbreads and burgers too and some of the best cheese curds around. Been here numerous times and will continue to go back. And they have free beer/rail drinks on your birthday!

Our default destination. Great bar. My wife loves their Cosmos. Nice choice of seating with TVs everywhere so you won't miss a game. They serve my favorite curds anywhere. They offer good specials, but I often order the buffalo chicken flat bread which is like crack! Reasonable prices and good portions. And a friendly, competent staff to boot. The owners took a "cursed" spot and made it work like a charm.
Disappointed. Ordered mushroom Swiss burger. Mushrooms out of can. Swiss was processed (think Kraft Singles).
Good food, good bartender good beer...horrible horrible service. Left twice because of the long, unacknowledged wait. Wouldn't recommend. Won't be going back.

Winner winner, time for dinner.. Fish dinners are excellent! Seafood croissants are awesome. Soups are wholesome and and flavorful. Customer service is always over the top, and the prices are very affordable.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in the area. A hidden gem! The restaurant is very clean and the staff is fun and friendly. The menu is not huge but the stuff they offer is delicious. I love to sit out on the back porch overlooking the golf course with a cold beer in my hand on a hot summer day! It's the best view in town!

Always wonderful. We haven't had a bad dish here in dozens of visits. This is what we want in a restaurant: great creativity, a sense of humor and a wonderfully adventurous sense of taste and texture. Every time we visit the dishes are new and they challenge our expectations about what can be done with food.

Best Restaraunt in Madison. Forequarter has no competition... I am from the east coast and lived here for 4 years and I can honestly say I have been let down again and again with the quality of food from restaurants in Madison as a whole, but this place leaves any and all in the dust!! Fresh ingredients, outstanding preparation (I can't stress this point enough), and excellent service make this my absolute favorite restaurant in the central time zone. The unequivocal amount of care put into ever...
Rustic, romantic and really f..king good!!! The best Moscow mule... Service was outstanding... Salmon fantastic

Exceptional food preparation and presentation! I agree with others this may be the best restaurant in Madison for its food. Food we tried : sweet corn cakes, heirloom tomato salad, alpine cheese board, the White fish, chicken dish, roasted lamb. We finished with Peach pie with sweet corn ice cream! It was all delicious. They also have some very creative cocktails. Try the Lost in Translation!  Some other things to consider: very small space, portions are small, service is just OK. Probably be a ...

Absolutely delicious food, complete with feasting with your eyes and nose first. Inventive, seasonal, adventurous flavors... Drinks were equally impressive, well balanced yet booze forward. Intimate, cozy setting yet a laid back vibe. Highly recommended
Las Islas Del Mar. Islas del mar is the best my dad owns that place and my bro works their i cant wait to go to wisconsin and check it out

Five rating for freshness.  We sat down and received a stack of freshly made tostada rounds with some Ceviche and spicy green sauce.  Next we ordered some tequila cocktails that were well made.  The waitress was supper helpful when we ordered because the menu has traditional food from the region they are from and traditional Mexican food.  I order a Pastor-Pork Burrito that was huge with rice, avocado, lettuce, cabbage, beans and pork.  I did the dinner with the rice and beans.  Wow house made b...

Incompetent. My experience at JD's couldn't have been worse. Not only were the workers completely incapable of running a business, but I waited an hour for a regular chicken sandwich that never came. When I asked the worker why people 20 numbers ahead of me were getting their food he said it was coming. I never got my sandwich. I do not suggest anyone bring their business to this restaurant unless you want to experience the worst possible service of your life.
My favorite downtown food cart! Love the flavors and the friendly service.

They are opening a shop!!. I am so excited. I just read IGO VEGO are opening a shop!! Check the location out at their facebook page... WHOHOO.. now we can pick up food to go for a a healthy dinner. They are going to be open late afternoon to early evening!! if you want filling, not greasy, healthy food, this is the place.  -----22 Jul, 2012----- IGO VEGO. Wonderful food, local, mostly organic, they care about the food they serve. Beautiful presentation
I prefer to call this "Das Vat". Bulk olive oil and other condiments at an extremely high price. Not worth the price.
Wow! A classy brunch place and coffee shop. The quiches are exceptional.

On the occasion of my first visit to the State St. store on 6/26/15, I had a fairly enjoyable experience.  However on a subsequent visit on 6/28/15, different staff were on duty, some of whom were exceptionally rude. A younger women serving wine samples coldly requested that I produce ID (I am 60 years of age).  More seriously, I observed that other, younger patrons were not asked for identification. Another, older woman abruptly advised me to sample appetizer-like finger food only once. Becaus...

Beautiful sports bar. This is our go to spot to watch a Packer game. The restaurant itself is beautiful. The menu is extensive - everything from bar food to Friday fish fry. The tap beer list is extensive and the beer inexpensive. There are two full service bars, a lot of seating and the food is pretty good. The service can be "iffy" during off hours, but is very good when the place is busy. There is a separate dining room away from the main bar so folks can bring the children. This is a nice pl...
Great!. Awesome food. Always love it. They hosted my rehearsal dinner and they also sponsor my softball team too. Great place. Great atmosphere.

Manager is great. Food is generally good. When the owner is there, service and food is great. When he is not there, food quality goes down and the service is lacking. The crab ravioli is very good and the steak sandwich is quite large.

A favorite haunt in Middleton. The selection on tap is varied and always of high quality and the fare is consistently excellent. The Walleye fish fry on Fridays is worth making the trip, but you can never go wrong with the ABLT served daily. Highly recommended.
Great gourmet burgers, fun staff, awesome.

Nice pub. Top notch beer selection, fantastic outdoor seating area. Stopped by for lunch on a Thursday. The restaurant was pretty busy, but we were promptly seated in the bar.   We tried the jalapeno poppers, which were obviously handmade and really good (not the fried globs you get at most bars). I ordered the black & blue burger, and I was happy with the quality of the meat (and the bacon!) as well as the bun. This isn't the best burger in Madison, but the flavors were right on and I wouldn'...

Not Impressed. Went to The Free House Pub today for lunch, and was totally disappointed.The bartender was less than enthusiastic, and "0" personality. She didn't know how to pour a beer without making it come out totally flat, and didn't fill the glasses more than 3/4 full besides. The whole place seemed unfriendly. My friend and I both felt the same way. Sorry for your luck folks, but you won't be getting any more of our money. Hope this critique helps you whip the place into shape. Good luck. ...
Excellent atmosphere, drinks, and food! Try the Kwak beer... Try it and forget the name. Shrimp tacos were great! Perfect amount of spice and sweet!

COUNTRY PLACE .........CLOSED. New restaurant in it's place is HOLSTEIN. Impressive decor and a fresher version of the cafe it replaced. I have eaten at both; the former spot was merely a-mazing. The new spot is AWE-Some. Mke the drive from wherever you are...the food rivals and exceeds the best Capital Square Madison city restaurants. Much of it local sourced, and most all from WI!  The State' Best Burgers, to be sure.

Great Food Poor Service. Great breakfast food. Wonderful French toast. They use high quality and locally grown/raised ingredients. The biggest concern that I had was their wait staff. They are terribly slow and they don't seem to understand the concept of filling you coffee often. If the service was better, this would be a five star breakfast restaurant for Brooklyn.

Great food all the way around. The Country Place is little known but has so much to offer. Everything is made with top quality locally sourced ingrediants. I haven't had a bad meal yet and I frequent the establishment quite often as I live in town. I would say my favorite thing to eat would be the blue ribbon burger and in an honest assesment isnt as good as say the old fashioned's burger but to be fair who's is and is still ranks in my top 3 or 4 burgers. The owner/chef is super friendly and a ...

We went here for breakfast and the food was fantastic. Everything is very fresh and most things are from the local area. The service was great as well. We will be going back to try lunch/dinner sometime for sure. Definitely recommend this place.

Worth the drive to Brooklyn. I have eaten only breakfast here but I cannot say enough about how good it was. Every single element of the meal, from the Columbian coffee that is freshly ground every pot, to the freshly squeezed orange juice, to the breakfast potatoes, to the bacon, to the French toast that is served with a light dusting of powdered sugar and a pitcher of real maple syrup, to the delicious egg scrambles is perfectly executed. I have eaten here twice and have had the French toast a...
Not a restaurant. It's a bar with frozen bar food. Feathers were still on chicken wings - through the skin and coating. Burgers - go to wedl's or even McDonald's would be better.

Fantastic food!! I've had the Cuban, the Bahn Mi, and now the Muffaletta, and all were fantastic food that you can taste the love in! The sides of sweet potato salad or wheat berry salad are not only healthy and delicious, but filling as well. Support your local businesses!

Good take-out. I stopped by to pick up lunch today. Staff was friendly and helpful, and made me feel right at home. Not a lot of choices, but good selection of sandwiches for lunch. I also liked the selection of sides that were available.  I tried the BBQ sandwich and the Cubano sandwich. Both were very good, but the Cubano was the best. Great crusty bread, not too big, but enough to fill me up. The deviled eggs were one side that I really enjoyed, but the coleslaw was nicely done as well (gre...
Hoop House Pork. Jordandal's Pork Chops are delectable, I never knew there was such a discernible difference in texture from the store bought. Best Pork I've ever tasted.
People, you need to try this place. It is truly farm to table. The owners are awesome people who raise grassfed/pastured animals in an ethical manner. Just delicious food done the right way.

The food was fantastic. I had the curried beef kabob dinner. The price was very reasonable considering the high quality of the phone. If you're staying at one of the two chain hotels across the street this is a must stop for food. I ordered take out but should have eaten there. The seating area is very nicely done with modern tables and chairs. I'll be back.
Fail. Just opened and had to try it...never again. 20$ pizza no toppings whatsoever. bbq chicken that had little to no cheese and no chicken. boo to you toppers, boo to you

Should of known. So after close to 3 years I give it a shot again. Buffalo chicken pizza. Sorry but it's as if you guys just soaked the crust in franks hot sauce, threw some chicken on it and we'll here ya go. That's all I could taste and for $18 you should deserve a little more. Take care.

The Toppers sticks are always delicious, and the pizzas were tasty too. Tried the Gyro specialty pizza and a pizza with hand-pinched sausage, onions, and peppers, both in the MyZa size, which is 4 decent sized slices of a fairly this crust. Ordering online was convenient, but they did mess up our order and had to go back for one of our pizzas.
This place is the bomb!. BEST THING TO HAPPEN TO FITCHBURG! Very welcoming staff that love there job!

Toppers Pizza!. Hi Russ, I am sorry to hear you had a negative experience with our location. I am the Manager and would like to invite you to try us again, on the house! Call the store and ask for the Manager. I’d like to learn more about what you didn’t like and have you try the BBQ Chicken pizza again (or any other pizza you might want to try). Again, I am sorry for your negative experience – let us make it up to you.   Kasha

Best Bone-In Wings in Madison. Love the bone in wings at Wings Over Madison. Jet Fuel and Red Alert are my favorite buffalo sauces and the west texas mesquite is the best dry rub. Wings are very large as compared to BWW and Quaker Steak.  Never had the boneless.

I ordered them last night, bad bad bad. The honey mustard sauce on the boneless wings tasted like someone had dropped them on a dirty floor or something equally as foul. The fries I ordered were hard, cold and waaaaaaay too salty. I ended up throwing away all of it because I couldn't even get it past my tongue. This is now my third (and final) time ordering from them and each visit was more and more disappointing then the last. Delivery guy didn't even smile... If you're on the fence about order...

My fiancé and I recently moved to Madison and our apartment happens to be super close to Wings! Needless to say, didn't take long for us to order takeout! We actually first tried Wings Over Madison the first time we visited the city because we were in the area viewing the apartment. Our first impression.. We loved it! Huge pieces of tender chicken, breaded just right, and lots of delicious rubs and sauces to choose from.   Now that we've lived here about 5 months.. We occasionally still order...

Not too shabby.. Only ordered takeout once, but the boneless wings and sauces were tasty. Seems a bit ramshackle, but the folks were nice.  -----18 May, 2014----- Not too shabby.. Only ordered takeout once, but really liked the boneless wings. Good sauces and tasty chicken. Seems a bit ramshackle, but friendly enough.

I ordered delivery from here the other day, and firstly I was happy to see that all of the dishes were reasonably priced.  For delivery, it didn't cost too much.  We weren't too hungry, so we just ordered an appetizer.  They were right on time with delivery too.  However, our delivery person wasn't too pleasant.  For the food, it was alright.  We had cheese curds, which are far better fresh.  The batter wasn't the best either, but I suppose for the price, it's hard to come across.

Delish. Made it for lunch the day before Thanksgiving. Had a white flour savory crepe that was amazing. Comes with a tiny side salad that complimented the crepe well. Ordered the lemon curd for dessert. Wonderful--just like homemade lemon pie (with lemons, not bottled juice). Everything was fresh and delicious. Staff was slightly overwhelmed due to positive Isthmus review the week before resulting in large uptick in visitors. Chef came out and said brief 'bonjour' to diners.

Over priced & the owner brags on how over priced his food is. Also gives advice on items he wants to get rid of & not on what the customer would like. Also has a high turnover of employees. I do not recommend eating here

Yes!. Throw caution to the wind when you approach the Fried and Fabulous cart. There is no way that this food is good for you, but man is it good. The fried cookie dough balls are described as a "chocolate gooey hot mess," which is spot on. They come out of the fryer looking a little like hushpuppies dusted with powdered sugar. Then you bite into one and oooohhhh boy. Ridiculous. I can't wait to try more. The cart, normally open late nights downtown (remember: calories don't count when you're d...
Fantastic food, reasonable prices. Fall-off-the-bone ribs, excellent sauce served on the side. The poppers are really special. No breading, just wrapped in bacon and grilled to perfection.

I feel like it's tough to give this restaurant anything but an 'incomplete' as a rating, because it's unfair to judge their food when they aren't allowed to cook it on premises. They must smoke their meat off-site, then transport it to the restaurant to serve it. That's silly and unfair. The BBQ I had (ribs and brisket) was good (ribs were tender and lightly smoky, brisket was tasty and tender), but it lacked a little zing. Probably loses something in transit to the restaurant. Update: Just had ...
AMAZING!. They serve the best pizza that I have ever tasted! And they have so many varieties of pizzas and other products! They have great service and I always enjoy ordering from them :D

Friendly Staff Terrible Pizza. For a place that is mostly staffed by high school kids, the service is friendly and they are very accommodating if a mistake is make. That said, the pizza is awful. We have ordered from Sugar River Pizza five times over two years and each time we're left saying, "next time we'll just make the drive to Madison". The pizza is often way too cheesy and the dough is still doughy at times. The sauce is pretty uneventful as well.  It's too bad. In such a small town with ...

Sugar River Pizza has amazing owners and wonderful food! I'm pleased to say that they are one of the top pizza places in Dane County. Be sure to order whole wheat breadsticks with extra marinara sauce (I mean, that's what I like) along with your pizza.

Tastes like home. I'm from the twin cities, so the Steepery/Tea Garden shops are a big thing for students. Best bubble tea I've had; I used to try everything in Madison for something that compared! It does take some experimenting to find the drinks that are perfect for you, but once you do you never go back! Something for everyone whether you like sweet, tart, or bitter.

Terrible tea. The jasmine tea latte was terrible, i could not taste any tea at all and i got it with no sugar and it was still kinda sweet. the boba were also terrible they were hard and did not taste good i could not eat them and i did not finish my drink. i dont think the employees got any training on how to make good tea, this is not that easy. if you want to have real and Delicious bubble tea then for sure go to jade mountain cafe. theirs is this the best in madison!

Sencha Tea Bar is now one of my favorite places to grab a tea and study!  Firstly, they're open late every day compared to other tea and coffee shops, making it very convenient to stay and get work done.  Secondly, the vibe of Sencha is great.  All of the staff is extremely friendly and helpful in suggesting teas for your every mood.  Their is plenty of seating and outlets, making Sencha a very popular place to study.  I've had both their bubble tea and hot tea, which wasn't bad.  However, I wou...

Coupons. We dined in at Papino's last night and the food was awesome. Service was great. Presented a coupon to our server and was informed it was expired. She went and printed us a current coupon for us to use. We have never had any one go above and beyond to help us save money. We will be back!  -----02 Feb, 2015----- Gotta try it. The best pizza. we had the extra thin sausage and pepperoni pizza. yummy!

It's great!!. I don't know what everyone is talking about this place has amazing Italian food for an amazing price. The guy who runs the place is a very nice guy to go along with a very nice and polite staff. Honestly my favorite place to take my family!

It's great!!. I don't know what everyone is talking about this place has amazing Italian food for an amazing price. The guy who runs the place is a very nice guy to go along with a very nice and polite staff. Honestly my favorite place to take my family!

Poor customer service, ok food. The food was ok, but they wouldn't honor my coupon after I discussed it with one of their employees on the phone and was told that they would. I wrote to the owners about the poor service and experience I had with their employees, and got no response. It is not respectful or a good business practice to ignore your customers.

This business needs a manager - terrible experience. Called the number. All I got was 'hello'. No customer service business answers 'hello'. I then had to ask 'is this Papinos?' I was curtly cut off and was told that this Peppino's. Well, that is a downtown very reputable restaurant that closed recently. Tried to understand that, then ordered. Came to pick up and they could not find my order. There are two tables occupied in the place. Went back and forth about my name. Turns out all they do is ...
CRAP!!!!. Food was awful! Never am ordering from here again!

Came here early on a Friday with family. 6 adults and 3 kids total. The staff was exceptionally rude from the first second we walked in. Somehow the service hot even worse during dinner. The bill was wrong at the end and the bartender and manager were put put to correct their own mistakes. I would like to say the food was redeeming, but the dinner was on par with the service. I never write reviews but our experience was so terrible we felt compelled to do so today. Don't bother ever trying this ...

I honestly didn't think it was all that bad.. I can hit a 9-iron from my office to this place, yet tried it today for the first time.   I have to say that I am surprised by all the negative reviews. It's hard to judge a place based on one lunch, on a Thursday, but the turkey noodle soup was homemade and very flavorful, with big chunks of roasted white meat turkey and think egg noodles. The blackened Buffalo chicken sandwich was hot and featured waffle fries on the side, the daily special Jamba...

Never again!. Stopped in last week only to hear that the best waitress they had, Nicole, walked out and quit. The service we received that night was absolutely horrible. It took over an hour to get our food and the food was just disguisting. My kids were miserable the whole time, waiting over 10 minutes to get our drinks and another 20 minutes for appetizers. Very sad and disappointing trip. We would not recommend this place to others and will no longer frequent as much as we used to.

PLEASE CHANGE!. I really want this place to survive. It's very nice and a lot of money has been invested. It's locally owned as well. But this place won't make it if things don't change! The service is terrible. Seems nobody really cares and they have no clue how to wait on a customer. The food is way over-priced for the quality they serve. And lets talk about just how long it takes to get your food. WOW! I understand if the place is busy. For example: For the unlimited wing night (at like .50/w...

Yuck. Got take out tonight. My sandwich was awful. Wilted lettuce, mushy tomato and bacon that was so tough. The kids didn't like their chicken tenders either. For take out... No napkins, utensils and had to wait several minutes just to get ketchup.  It is a neat place, close to our house, but I won't be back. In the past, Eating in we found the food no better and the sevice soooooo slow.

Comfy, hip, diverse. This place is awesome. They have a huge selection of beer (I asked...132 choices), great wine selection, full coffee shop, fantastic hot sandwiches, flatbreads, salads, smoothies and in addition have a really hip, fun ambiance.   We were there on a weekend night and really enjoyed the live music too.   All of this is complimented by a sports shop with bike, paddle, and snow sports backed right up to a river and super cool park with great trails. I highly recommend it.
Cozy, good energy, warm (real fireplace) coffeehouse/cafe w/ a bike/ski shop & events. Great, friendly service..and a great local/small brew beer selection.

Wonderful atmosphere, modern, fun, relaxed; has a good "energy" to it. The establishment even offers yoga and spin classes in addition to the cafe and sports shop. Very unique, employees are positive, friendly, and welcoming. This place is truly a gem of the town. It's worth a trip out to Cambridge Just to experience this place.

AMAZING Birthday Dinner!. I have to say it was phenominal!! And my husband is a hard man to impress! He has been a cook for over 25 years and we are both huge foodies. It's hard to find a restaurant that can blow us away without having to spend a fortune. We started with the sauteed calamari and it was tender and the broth was full of flavor. The toasted bread just added to the flavor and gave a great complement to the texture of the calamari. My husband ordered the beef, mushroom and wine soup ...

Absolutely perfect!. I took my date here for the first time, and we were so pleased with the food! I had the Pollo Prosciutto, which was a pounded chicken breast, spread with a very flavorful walnut pesto, topped with a slice of prosciutto, and finished with a perfectly toasted layer of parmesan. All of this on top of a bed of garlic, herbed mashed potato. The combination of the herbs, the meats, the saltiness, and richness were perfectly executed! My date had the Funghi pasta, which was also ju...
Starters. We enjoyed the dinner experience although we would have enjoyed seeing a beef carpaccio on the menu...I had the special the pasta rag and enjoyed it.

The best pasta dinner we have ever had!. This place was such a nice surprise ! We traveled from Cambridge to a Fort for dinner because we had heard how great Mangiamis was. We were not disappointed. I had the fish special which was great, but my husband had a pasta that had a flavor that I pinpointed as fennel . The chef came out to say hi to everyone and he confirmed the ingredient which was in the sausage . Fabulous place. We will be back often! My husband says it was the best pasta dish he ha...

Tonight was my second experience at this fabulous restaurant. I started with a Caesars salad. The lettuce was fresh, the dressing was superb with a nice balance of garlic, cream, and parmesan. Making a good Caesars dressing is not easy and I have been disappointed many time....but Mangiamis has it down. We then had a sample of the squash goat cheese ravioli. Wow Eric! This was so magnificent with a nice balance of flavors as well as being complex. Sweet, savory, and a slight tang of goat cheese....

Great New Indian Restaurant!. We tried to get in last Friday for lunch, but it was way too busy so we went back on Saturday. They have great lunch specials on the weekends where you can sample 3 different curries along with soup or salad, rice & dessert. It was so good, that we returned on Sunday with our 3 adult children! Our favorites were the lamb samosas, chicken makhani, lamb curry & the kheer. They have so many choices & will make it was hot or as mild as you want. They also are very accom...

This place is fantastic! The service was impeccable and timely, the food was fresh and spiced to perfection, and the atmosphere relaxing. Had the Chicken Madras and Spinach Naan and was very pleased with both.

We were three of us. We ordered 6 dishes and all 6 were good. 3 were outstanding. Chai, Yellow Daal and Gobi Parantha. Non veg platter is good and they do replace red meat with seafood oe chicken.  My wife had Paneer and liked the dish but felt quality od Paneer coild be better. My daughter,  missing Aloo Parantha loved it. It is a chef owned chef manages restaurant.  Ues it is expensive. A 3 course meal for 3 is about 80-90 dollars including tips. Complimentary Lentil soup was out of the world....

The food was amazing, service was great, and there was a nice comfortable setting. The best Indian Restaurant in the Madison Area! I would definitely come here again and I thought the prices were very reasonable!

We had tried bunch of India restaurant in Madison and around, And thier buffet. Dhaba doesn't need buffet  It's true.  food taste awesome  Service was gud  The restaurant environment was neat and clean I guess they offer thali on weekends   For lunchtime . We went to Dhaba on sunday for lunch We tried thier Veg and Nonveg thali  Tomato soup  or salad  We  ordered tomato soup It was perfect as a tomato soup should be Menu of veg thali is  Veg manchurian  Panner masala Dal makhani Rice  Butter naa...
GREAT TIMES. This place is a must visit in Madison.

Not fair portions for price. I stopped at the Odana road lot,atom for gyro plate. they called me up for a gyros combo. I was only one there so figured it was mine. The box was really light so I checked inside. It was just a gyro and fries. The young guy said it was right, he just said the wrong thing. I mentioned that the Monroe street location makes it a plate with extra meat and veg. The didn't have a response. I would never go back it is worth the extra drive to another location.
Best cheese curds around

I love this place. As a nanny it's hard to find a place that fits what I like to eat and what the kids like to eat, but this place works. The seating is perfect for those with kids or those with none. You can get oysters and seafood to burgers and cheese curds. Their bloody Mary's are great when I go with my hubby. Over all I'm very impressed.
Two words......fisherman's stew:)

Yum!. I recently went with a family friend who lives in the area. She told me that I would never eat better cheese curds than I'd have at this homey feeling pub. She wasn't lying! They're not at all what I've come to expect from your standard cheese curd and were definitely a huge step ahead. I also had New England Clam Chowder (massive chunks of potato) and a wedge salad, which is probably the best wedge I've had in Madison. My family friend had the Bleu Cheese Burger, which I tried, and it was...

Color me underwhelmed. Don't waste your time if you're a vegetarian. They have Boca Burgers, and the standard beet salad with white cheese and vinegrette ... They didn't have a portabella mushroom sandwich though, so I guess we can all be thankful for that. The eggplant sandwich was a sloppy mess. Strange flavors, and a hit of citrus (WTF and WHY!?) The slaw wasn't even good. I'll give them credit for having wine on tap, and the side of barbecue sauce I got for my fries was tasty (although proba...

Great food, great atmosphere, and great people. I would highly recommend this place.  -----01 Dec, 2012----- This place is amazing, great food, great atmosphere, and great people! I would highly recommend this place.
Great sandwiches. Good beer selection

Very nice pub. Friendly atmosphere, prompt service. It's a college town, but the crowd was a good mix of ages. My elderly father didn't feel out of place. Sandwiches were great, and sweet potato fries were exceptional.

Worst service ever! This is someone who has worked in the restaurant industry forever! Sat self - party of 4! Waited over 10 minutes to be waited on, but no one ever came. Left to go to another restaurant. Couldn't wait to find out how the food was! Don't plan to find out!
Only a 3.5 because our waitress didn't know what kale was (as in Kale salad) on the menu. I hope she stays in school.  All the sandwiches were good. I'll be back for a second try.
Great fries and burgers- great service-great ambiance. Subject says it all. Will def go back.
Mimosa Chicken Fried Steak & Goddess Salad. Service was great ! Food awesome!

YES. An upscale burger place that was extremely affordable and equally delicious. We sampled from the appetizers, burgers, and milkshakes- all SO GOOD! Perfect for a date night or a night with the family! Peanut butter pretzel shake was superb.

I think the best meal to eat at Dlux is Brunch. I've been in several times for Sunday Brunch, and I've never been disappointed. The build your own bloody mary bar is huge, but as a bartender, the novelty of mixing my own cocktail has kind of worn off ;) The Mushroom breakfast sandwich is pretty good. Missing maybe a bit of texture, but the truffle cream sauce is really good. The breakfast potatoes are excellent however. Our service was just OK. Our server didn't think sunny side up eggs were ava...

I went to DLUX for lunch and found out that the person I was meeting would be late so I sat at the bar and decided to have a drink after I informed the hostess that I did not need a booth quite. She thanked me for benig honest as they were quite busy. I ordered something I had never tried before; something called a Nitro Milk Stout. It was not regularly carbonated but rather with nitrogen. The beer had a smoothness that was welcomed since I was getting rather bored with other beers. Once the per...

Disappointing. Chicken empanadas served room temperature and while the chicken was well seasoned, the crust was not crispy or flaky.  There were 3 in our group and all of the food was underseasoned and just generally underwhelming. French fries should be taken off the menu entirely as they do not know how to cook them and a chef that knows latin flavors needs to step in and give the meats some flavor.  Rotisserie chicken seemed reheated as the skin was soft and chewy rather than crispy and the...

New Owners, Delicious!. This is not a Peruvian restaurant anymore. I love Mexican food and I've eaten at all of them in the immediate downtown area and this is by far my favorite. Try the tinga if you like spice its amazing (burrito and quesadilla especially)  I don't know about service 2-3 years ago but I've had nothing but great service in the 6 months i've been coming here. If you want, you can pop in and have your meal served to you in 10 or so minutes (if you order right away)  Do yours...

Wtf? We waited from noon to 1pm (in an empty restaurant) for our food to show up, and when our server finally reappeared, it turns out they hadn't even started cooking it yet. We'd already paid and my husband insisted on waiting. When our food came it was room temp and tasteless. This place is empty for a reason

Great food and perfect, friendly service. Will be going back! Had the enchiladas with a mix of green and red sauce because we couldn't make up our minds and fajitas. Great amount if spice. Guacamole was fresh and delicious. Highly recommend.

I like A La Brasa. I like the food. I like the quiet, polite server. I like the prices.   There's not much seating. We saw a lot of people get take-out. There's a pretty large space where it seems like another table or two could go, but it is actually used for people to stand as they line up at the counter to order, pick-up and pay for their food. There's no parking. It's a limited menu. The decor is austere. They don't give you chips and salsa.   However, there is a constant stream of people co...

Chocolicious !!. The Chocolaterian came highly recommended by everyone I know that has been there and it certainly did not disappoint. We stopped there after dinner across the street at Tex Tubbs Taco Palace(equally as good-see my previous reviews) and the only problem was finding the room to eat dessert after all of the chips & tacos @ Tubbs. That feeling quickly disappeared after viewing the display cases with all of the chocolate delights. I don't think there is a wrong choice here, and based...

Insane. This place is unreal. The hot chocolate is no joke and not for the chocolate rookie. It is literally drinking chocolate. Best hot chocolate ive ever had. The flour-less cake is hands down the best I have ever had. It is as moist as a a good brownie, yet still tastes like a flour-less cake. The star of the the show on my first trip however was the caramel tart cashew experiment that worked better than the first person to put peperoni on a pizza. Another great part of this place is that th...

WARNING!! You should not go.... WARNING!! You should not go here if you are hungry!!  Come here after a nice dinner and you will NOT be disappointed.  Everything is to die for!!!  A must go to place!

Wonderful place, wonderful people. My husband and I visited Chocolaterian after dinner at Alchemy's to satisfy our sweet tooth. We were not disappointed! The interior was lovely and the food was even better! The best part? How great the people are that run the place. We will definitely be back!

I have got to visit again! Lovely, spacious, cozy decor! Treats to die for (or drool over) behind glass cases. I chose a Parisian hot chocolate, which was deliciously rich, dark, chocolatey and smooth. Perfect to sip on, on a cold blustery afternoon when you need a little sugary pick-me-up! I bought a couple items to take home, one being the Badger Bait with peanut butter. It was a delectable smaller size length of brownie topped with not too sweet peanut butter buttercream, and covered in a yum...
Best sandwiches. Everything that is done by these guys is amazing UB, forequarter etc all good

Quick, unique, local lunch. I tried the hot dog with spicy mayo and kimchee, as well as a wedge of some fancy cheese and the bill was ~$10. The hot dog and toppings were great, but the bun was sub par (probably best to stick with their sandwiches that use Madison Sourdough Co bread).  The house-cured meats and specialty cheeses are what stand out here, and I can't wait to try some of their brats/sausages. They also have a meat case with local pork and lamb, among other things. Great addition t...
Hey this place is amazing. Orechata is the best drink!!!

Just a limited experience here, but a nice one. Stopped in yesterday on a whim while walking by on State St. and saw this new restaurant. Decided to try it, ordered an egg roll ($1) and the Kung Po chicken ($7.95) for carry out. While I waited for my order, the hostess handed me a glass of water, even though I didn't request one (outside temp was in the 80s, so it was a friendly, hospitable touch that I welcomed). I quickly got my food and left. The pork egg roll was tasty. Small-ish, but it was...
9/24. Made it to the 350 show today. All was great the pizza and show. Very nice people, very friendly , helpful . Plan on doing this again in the future. Thanks to all.
If you like dark chocolate, you'll love it.  The truffles are my favorite, very distinctive, imaginative, and flavorful.  They're just scrumptious, I don't know what else to say!

Bad food and service. Been there three times and food and service has got worse every time. The last time the wife ordered a seafood dish with shrimp, scallops and fish. Was so fishy it was almost inedible. I had enchiladas el Charcon which is supposed to have a creamy chipotle sauce but the sauce was dried out. Also two people who came in fifteen minutes after us received their orders five minutes before ours. Won't be back.
