Customer Service. I want to focus on the customer service at El Mariachi Restaurant because I have noticed that there are a few negative reviews on customer service at this restaurant. I have received quality customer service here. The people are super friendly and accommodating. I have a favorite waiter there. He doesn't know my name but when he sees me he makes me feel welcome there and treats me like I am an old friend who has come to visit. I don't expect perfection there because I don't exp...

Had lunch here. The waiter did not know the menu nor did he seem to care. We asked for more time and he kept coming back every 30seconds. We finally asked him to leave us alone and we'd let him know when we were ready. We asked for water to start out with we got our food ordered. 2 people received a plate the other 2 waited 15 more minutes. Never asked if we wanted something else to drink with out meal. The waiter disappeared and so did all the other waiters. Out waiter hide behind a wall at the...

Worst Service, Worst Food Cold Nasty Wrong Order. Took Another Tables Order That Came In 15 Minutes After Us. We Had A Small Chil On Kids Eat Half Price Day, Charged Full Price, Had To Tell Them, Plus Charged Us For Our Son Drink Full Price. Took My Husbands Glass Away Thought He'd Get A Refill But He Just Took It. I Never Got A Refill. Poured The Salsa And Spilled It On Our Table And Just Left It There. Eventually After Me Asking For NaKins 5 Times I Cleaned It Up. Im Gonna Puke. We Will Never ...
This is no longer el mariachi, they sold it a while back and it is a different mexican restaurant now. Go to Lake mills if you want the best mexican food!
This review will be short. On top of great brews and friendly staff, the atmosphere of this local brewery is fun loving and upbeat. The food review is: "I had a Ruben. Had."
Great place, super quirky, awesome value. Ordered a bacon cheeseburger and fries. They were great for the price and everything came out quickly. They even being the food to your table.

I mean really folks... It's a pizza buffet. This isn't Ruth's Chris. It's good for $10 and your kids can make a mess in there as well. Desert pizza is good too. Don't go in expecting a lot and you will be happy.

While the resturant, thankfully, keeps the prostilization to a minimum it wasn't the chains religious background that brought us in. Having heard of the resturant from friends and co-workers I thought I'd give it a try. The result, not as good as I expected. The pizza was unimaginative and provided no more flavor then a standard Pizza Hut offering (the cross on the wall might have actually had more flavor). And what they call "The Country's Best Chicken" was in no way that. One does not take fri...
Great pizza. We love AJs pizza! It's always fantastic. We especially like the thin crust.
I'd give it a "B". The pizza was good, but not great. A solid "B". That being said, I wouldn't hesitate to go back there if I dining companion wanted to go.
Meh. The pizza and appetizers were decent but the prices were too high. The customer service was subpar but that's what you get when you hire high school kids.

Yum yum yum!. Ordered this for lunch. Had Falbo's but hadn't visited since AJ took it over. Nicest guy and amazingly tasty food. And they deliver. What's better than that?!? Will order as often as my wallet will allow. :)  So good I was compelled to write a review... that should say something.

Decided to try out AJ's Pizza & Diner for dinner tonight - when I ordered on the phone, I told them I had a coupon and he said that was fine, but when I picked up the food they said they don't accept those coupons on Friday nights. The pizza crust was burnt, they left off salad toppings we ordered, and the croutons were soggy when I picked up the order. We also ordered a large pepperoni pizza: it was ok, but probably not worth $16. The jalepeno poppers were obviously previously frozen- and left ...
Best pizza in town. Classic taste. Every crust is great.

Quality pizza. Although not outstanding, it is noticeably better than regular chain pizzerias. i got a sausage and pepperoni pizza and a garlic and sausage calzone. the calzone was especially to my liking. i wouldnt hesitate to order from them again. B+

Beligerant owner called me a thief. Went into tonight to redeem my Madison Perks coupon---$15 for $30. Note on door said they were just "recently " not taking coupons. We ate there anyway. Waitress said "manager might reedeem at least what we paid for it. Owner came in at 8:45 when we were sbout to leave. Said we had probably Xeroxed our copy and were fraudulently tryi ng to redeem it...said he never heard of "Madison Perks" ,called us thieves and berated us. We left waitress large tip and he ke...

Definitely worth a try if you haven't stopped in this place yet. We live just down the street and kept saying, "we need to try that place" as we passed by.  We're no BBQ conessiouers, but thought the pulled pork had a great smoky flavor and the array of BBQ sauces was delightful. The mini cornbread muffins we got as we waited for our food were delicious too.   You get a very generous portion at a great price! We'll be back.

I had the blackened Cajun chicken and my husband had the pulled pork with sides of fries and mac&cheese.   Every thing was awesome including the service. Very large portions and very reasonably priced.   May not look like the Taj Mahal but it is worth your time and your tummy will thank you.
Poor at best. Very disappointed. Over priced. Dirty. Out of menu items
The pulled pork tasted like school lunch slippy joes. The Mac and cheese had no flavor. Wouldn't try it again.

Buns On The Go. Umami fans, rejoice! Their excellent cuisine can now be found in a food cart on the library mall during the week and on the capitol square during the farmers market. The cart features a condensed menu, focusing just on the restaurant's incredible steamed buns. Buns are two for $7 with a side of edamame or wonton chips.  The pork bun is still my favorite. I just love the flavors of their savory pork belly and tangy pickled cucumbers in that doughy taco shell. The breakfast bun, a...

Food Cart Snob. I'm a total snob about my Asian and food cart cuisine, and this place gave me one of the best meals on-the-go that I've had in my lifetime! I did their 2 for $7 deal and had one each of the beef bulgogi and pan fried tofu savory buns. I'm pretty particular about my bulgogi, but their meat was one of the best flavored I've ever had and there was plenty of it. Fried tofu can sometimes get dried out and cardboard-like in texture and taste, but their's was soft and fresh tasting. The...

Food and Music. Even waiting in the rain for my lunch today, the music coming from inside of the cart was nice. Too bad there wasn't a table to sit. I would have sat nearby just to listen and enjoy the pork belly bun.
Nice atmosphere, but slow service and small portions.

We tried Buck and Badger before a show next door at the Overture Center. There's a bar room and a dining room. The ambiance is North Woods cabin with lots of light wood. The restrooms are shared with the Ivory Room in back.  The bartender greeted us immediately when we walked in and then a waitress quickly escorted us to a table. She handed us the menus which I got a kick out of. The cover is a heavy wood panel which makes the menu seem like it will be large but really it's a small assortment of...

Avoid the Pizzas. The pizza was terrible. I got the BBQ pork and my date the margarita pizza. Both pizza's had far too much going on and had too busy of a flavor profile. I couldn't taste the pork, since the cilantro, blue cheese, and sauce had such powerful flavors and were competing for my attention. Same problem with the margarita pizza, the raw onion in the pico masked the cilantro-pesto notes. Lastly, the crusts were very bland and card-board like.   The server wasn't particularly attenti...
We were I. Town for the day and found this place on the urbanspoon, so we gave it a shot. Glad we did! All six in my party could not stop talking about their plates. Best burger ever! Must eat!

I visited The Side Door the other day and was pretty impressed overall.  They had an extensive beer menu for $5.  We ended up going at happy hour, which made the drinks only $3!  Also, they offer private outdoor seating, which is nice for this time of year.  I'll definitely be back!

Good Beers, Good Company. The bartenders are friendly, service is great, and the crowd is laid back (a little hipster-ish, but a good fit for the neighborhood I guess). The space is long and thin, not huge, but comfortable enough and it's cool to see their big barrels behind the bar. Come here to enjoy the beer and hang out, not to catch a game as they have just one tv and it's not even in the best location to watch.  The beer list isn't massive, but it features a rotation of mostly local stuff...

Local food, and everything was excellent. Not a single detail to complain about. Ingredients and preparation the best. I used to be a cook, so I'm critical, and I can find nothing but good here. Had breakfast yesterday and we're going back today for lunch. Very much worth the drive!

Located Hazelnut Cafe is in Blue Monds NOT Barneveld. In addition to their wonderful breakfast and lunch menu, the Hazelnut also serves wood-fire sour dough pizzas in the evenings, so the grid should be expanded. Crispy with lots of local meats and cheeses, plus veggies.   Two of their pastries are to die for: the Szechuan cinnamon rolls with fresh grated ginger icing will make your mouth tingle and the almond croissants are totally addictive.

Mmm Mmm delicious!. The meal that we had today at Harry's was excellent. Typically we go to Buck & Honey's, but the past couple of times the service and food have been lacking. After meeting Harry today and having him personally serve our food (quickly and with a joke) - excellent home fries, juicy burgers and an all around friendly establishment. We definitely found our spot and we'll be back soon!! :)

Wasted our time.... Stopped three weeks ago for a beer at Harry's so we could check the place out and view the menu. Went back last night with intentions of trying the food.  First stopped at the bar and paid 75 cents more for the same beer I had three weeks ago.....oh well, whatever. Next asked to be seated for supper. We were promptly seated and after a period of time it became obvious that we were invisible to the wait staff. We sat and finished our drinks while other diners were seated an...

Went in Saturday night. Kid friendly atmosphere. Friendly servers. Good beer selection. I had the 16oz prime rib and it was good. Mom had blackened wallet and she also said that it was good. Mrs had a chicken sandwich with no complaints. Good salad bar also. We will return. Give it a shot folks. Might try a fish fry soon.

YUMMMM!!!. Harry's Supper Club is the best food for the best price in Sun Prairie! The Friday night fish is the best in town.. I would go just for the salad bar alone! Truly happy sp has a supper club again :) keep up the good work Harry and friends!!

Delicious with great service!. My friend and I went there today for lunch, and both of us are very happy with the experience! They were very friendly when we entered, and it is very nice and clean inside. I got the Louisiana Gumbo and my friend ordered the chicken teriyaki. The food came very quickly and so did the beverages.   Loved the food! They served the gumbo with a mound of sticky rice on top and a tortilla. It was nice and spicy which I love. My friend really liked the teriyaki. We had...

YUM. We had Steak Satay with Spicy Teriyaki Sauce, Chicken Potato Curry Spicy, Sichuan Green Beans, and Pulled BBQ Pork, all on brown rice for takeout. It was all delicious! The dishes had nice spice and this combined with the very friendly atmosphere makes this a place we will enjoy working through the menu. I am very happy with this addition to the neighborhood!

I may not go back there. They have just one song that plays over and over. Not joking, it is one song with a drone sound. I asked the waitress to make sure their CD player was stock. She confirmed that it is just one song.  Now, I went there because of the food. It is just average, nothing even good. The chicken in my Chicken and potato curry smelled old. Apart from the spice got no other flavor. In 1 hour for lunch, only other couple came. No wonder once you have heard 1 bad song for 1 hour yo...

I've been here several times for dinner. The place is obscurely located and not very well-advertised but the food is extremely tasty. I've had both their eggplant and potato curries which were fantastic. This is the only place that serves good sri lankan food and I strongly recommend people give it a go.  The one really important thing to know is that the spice rating is totally off. I would translate it as follows, when comparing to normal Madison Asian restaurant standards: Mild = Spicy Medium...

Since opening, KJ's has apparently remained somewhat obscure. During the week, they offer a low cost ($6 - 10) lunch menu, but on Fridays and Saturdays, they offer a buffet. Buffet dishes tend toward the hotter side. They differ in ingredients and style from other area Indian buffets like Tandoori House and Swagat, so it's worth a try if you like exploring new tastes.  The owner and staff are very friendly and helpful. The space has a nice, open ambiance.  West side competition among Indian buff...

Bite Sized. A stop at the bright blue Slide cart resulted in another delicious food cart meal at the Farmers Market. The "How Do You Say The Name Of That Pepper?" slider is essentially an Italian beef sandwich in slider form. Tender, juicy shredded sirloin drips with jus, while melted provolone and mild pepperoncini round out this mouthwatering handful. The house-made sides did not disappoint either. The chips came in thick cut slices that were perfectly fried (crisp, but still a little tender),...

Choose slide for your casual catering!! We were missing our weekly visit to the truck and decided to have our holiday party catered by slide. Great move! Good food, super reasonable pricing, and reliable. Wouldn't hesitate to use their catering services again and can't wait til summer is back and we can get our weekly fix of those chips!

Suprised. After seeing how happy topkitty was, I was surprised to have a bad experience. I got 3 different slider. The first one I tried was the meatball one, I used my fork to pull off a chunk to discover the ball was cooked to medium rare. I do like my steak at medium rare, but not a meatball. I then tried the blue cheese chicken slider and really diddnt like it. I diddnt even try the third one i got. I went down the street and got something else.

WOW. These sliders are top notch! The sweet potato with curry sauce sounded boring but literally blew me away. I don't even normally like beef but the "how do you say the name of that pepper" beef sandwich is divine. I can't wait to go back for more, this is truly gormet with the sauces and how homemade everything looks and tastes. My favorite food cart hands down!

I'm rating Sushi Express based on delivery experiences. I've been overcharged and received the wrong thing twice. The most recent time, I phoned to rectify the situation, and was asked to leave my credit card number with the woman answering the phone (NOT HAPPENING). With as much good sushi as Madison has to offer, I see very little reason to ever order from Sushi Express again.

Like a loud TV while eating Sushi?. I have been there 4 times at least. I had come back because the food is OK and the service is relatively fast. However, last time I dined in, the TV set was set up so loud that it was the main center of attention on the table of 8 we had. It was located right in our heads. It was set to CNN with the current news of famine and the standard war reports. Not a pleasant idea when you are eating. I asked the waitress to please lower the volume and she did not do it...

Awful, their red curry smells like cat litter and the meat tastes and looks like it was cut off a rubber chicken. I've ordered from this place before and they forgot a part of my order when delivering and it took 2 hours and me calling three times to have them deliver it. Awful food, awful service, just don't go here.
Food not quite as flavourful as we anticipated but it was hot, quick, pretty good. Big menu. Service was efficient.

I'd seen the menu at Dragon I and was very excited to try it. Pho is one of my favorite foods and I had a friend who highly recommended this place.   We arrived on a Monday evening. There were a few patrons, but the place was mostly empty. We were seated promptly. The ambiance is nothing fancy, but everything was clean and casual. I did notice there was still Halloween garland on the pillars.  Our waitress was friendly and offered recommendations when asked. I ordered the pho with meatballs, dum...
Pretty good. Enjoyed the basil chicken. Not the best I've had, but very solid. Service can be iffy, but they're generally pretty quick. Prices are average.

Brunch - May 17th, 2014. Somewhat disappointing. Service was spotty - there were very few customers, but it seemed to take a long time to get anything - our breakfast order, coffee, jam, etc. The staff seemed to be working in slow motion. My partner's food was delivered warm to cold, definitely not hot. She ordered scrambled eggs and sausage - no miracles requested here. I ordered corned beef hash - the presentation was fine, but but the corned beef was stringy and tough, and the dish was on the...

First Dinner. Excellent Atmosphere in both bar and dining room, although a bit noisy in dining room. Comfortable bar seating. Beer selections are a little bit generic for this part of the country, so hopefully that will expand in the future. Maybe some of the beer fanatics in the Oregon area can make some suggestions, certainly there should some more New Glarus (other than Spotted Cow), Ale Asylum and Capitol brewing options.  I ordered broiled whitefish almondine which is very risky in this p...
My experience with service has been good, plus I don't know anyone who has had bad service there. Prices are in line with the quality of the food. Over all i am pleased with the place

Saturday dinner. First time here. We had a cocktail before dinner. The bartender was prompt and friendly, not affected by how busy it was. We were seated in dining room at the time of our reservation, no waiting. Service was good despite the bad reviews we had read. They obviously have corrected any service problems. Sirloin steak was done to perfection! Wait staff was very attentive and friendly. A final touch to a great dining experience, the chef came out through the dining room stopping at t...

Too loud. Have been to Mason's several times and had excellent food and great service. Returned last night (Friday night) and both dining rooms were so noisy we could not carry on conversation. Wait staff explained since there was no carpeting noise becomes an issue when they are very busy. Had intended to celebrate an upcoming birthday of my elderly mother but will reconsider since the noise will be too much for her.

Flavorful. I'd echo most of the points from Nichole and JM's blog review. Grampa's pizzas are loaded with fresh ingredients, but the mix of powerful flavors didn't quite work for me. There's a lot going on with each bite, but the sum was not greater than the whole of the parts. They are good pies, to be sure, but not crave worthy for me. Service and prices were fine and the atmosphere seems like a great fit for the Willy Street neighborhood.  Grade: B
Good ingredients, just ok pizza. I liked the beer, like the space, like the location. I've had better pizza. I'd go again, but wouldn't rush back.

One of my new favorites! Super cute interior. We went early on a Friday with no reservation and we were seated in about 15mins. We split 2 gluten free (1 with pesto and one with brussel sprouts and bacon) pizzas and both were delicious!

Outstanding customer service. I went for dinner with a friend on Monday night for beer and pizza. Our order went in just after a large group and we had to wait a bit longer than perhaps what was expected but the staff were quick to make up for it by offering us a delicious appetizer and drink on the house to make up for it. They were extremely apologetic and courteous. Following that our pizzas were very tasty. We'll definitely be back-it's well worth the wait for the vibe of the venue, beer sel...
We had an excellent experience! Salad was amazing. Crust was perfect, ingredients fresh and delicious. Outstanding wine list, staff was friendly, and attentive to us.

Don't waste your time. This is a recently opened restaurant in an area that is crying for good restaurants on the water. The family has been in the restaurant business for many years but you would not know that. Prime rib obviously precooked and let sit in water until ordered, thus the grey color to the meat. Wait staff mostly family that should know how to wait, clean and serve. Our waiter was doing a fine job but was pulled to wait on the outside seating and then we had various people, none of...

Great food & view. We had delicious Friday fish dinners,,,,,blue gill & cod. Salad bar was very fresh and had a great variety of lettuce and other choices including hot mushrooms which were delicious. Twice, earlier this summer we had very good sandwiches and beer on the deck. The location & view are great.
Awesome made to order paninis and subs! I really love everything I've tried but can't wait to try everything. Salads a nd soups too!
Best panini I've ever had. The California Panini was absolutely delicious! I plan on coming back. Great spot to stop for a quick lunch.

Fresh, generous size, tasty. I had some of the catered Crostini fare, mostly the sandwiches and wraps. They are fresh and taste excellent. They deliver to the University of Wisconsin. Give them a try. And don't forget the Italian beef!

Magnifico!. This place has magnificent sandwiches! I'm vegan and they made me a specialty sandwich that totally rocked- avocado, fresh veggies and italian dressing! They were so, so considerate, answered any questions I had, and their veggies were so crisp I can only imagine they were brought fresh that morning. Really quality stuff here! And the bread was so deliciously chewy! I'm absolutely going back for seconds.

Delicious!. My girlfriend and I went here for an early dinner and were very impressed. When we told the guy at the register we hadn't been there before he was very helpful explaining the menu and pointed out the most popular dishes. I started with a beef empanada which was great with the guasacaca sauce. I had the pabellon (which according to them is the national dish of Venezuela) as my main and it was excellent. The shredded beef was really tender and flavorful and the fried plantains were gre...

It doesn't matter if you don't know Venezuelan cuisine. Not much in the way of ambiance, but the food is extraordinary... And the smoky chileito hot sauce is soooo good if you like a little extra spice.... I will be a regular moving forward!

The food was good but the service was mediocre... The server didn't even greeted me when I came in. They didn't make me feel welcome. Unless they change something significantly, I would not come back and I would not recommend this place to others.

It's an unpresuming building with a small parking lot. Upon entering the restaurant we saw about a dozen and half tables with maybe a dozen patrons. We grabbed a couple of menus from the counter and pushed together a couple of tables to accommodate our group of six. While we were waiting for the rest of our group, the cashier came by and asked if we'd been there before. We said no, and he mentioned some of the menu highlights for us to think about while we were waiting. When the rest of our grou...

I've been here twice and I can't recommend this place highly enough. I got the patacone sandwich and the Cuban sandwich. This places has a cozy ambiance, the food is extremely tasty and the quantities are large. The only minor downside is that the food is a bit too salty.
Best Dumplings EVER. The dumplings at Paul's are outstanding. The wait staff is courteous and the food is outrageously good. For the price, hands down the best food downtown.

Great example of a focused business. They serve only one thing; dumplings, either beef or potato. Simple, tasty, inexpensive. Never had this food before but I will be back and will look for it in other places. Not a fancy spot, more like a couple of tables and an order area.

Warning: this place does not keep it's posted hours of operation. It closes whenever it feels like it, and that unreliability is unprofessional. Otherwise, good dumplings. I get the combo w/everything on them, but I also like to get an extra sour cream order to mix in w/the one they already provide. Delicious and not expensive, a good value.

There are 2 kinds of dumpling: potato and beef but you can mix both. I prefer the beef dumpling but you can't underestimate the taste of the potato one.. Delicious yet cheap.. Totally awesome.. I will definitely come again..

These guys do one thing, and they do it exceedingly well. Perfect any time of day. Im so glad they came back!! They left a hole in my cheap, fast, easy and delicious repertoire that nowhere else could fill.

Delicious food, friendly service. We found this place after a friend recommended it, and ate here 3 times that week! The salads feels a tad overpriced for how much they give you, but it's so good I couldn't stop myself. The pizza is delicious, and was the reason for the 3 trips. Its fresh, hot, fast service, and gourmet. The first time we went in I was dizzy and hungry (currently pregnant...) and the staff served me in record time. I requested the salad come out first just so I could start eatin...

Just have to say it.... The reason why this place uses imported Buffalo Mozzarella is because its authentic Italian ingredients. As usual, Sconnies want block cheddar and brats thrown on top of pizza. Seriously, think outside of the box people. Until this town and its inhabitants realize that there is more to this city than just brats, the badgers, and hook's cheddar, places like Novanta will struggle, even though they are doing everything right. I haven't eaten here, but plan, primarily for the...

Nice new place...menu needs work. Went here because it's new and a friend wanted to check it out. Pizza looked nice and seemed to be cooked correctly by the owner (Nick), but crust was raw and soggy all throughout the center and very bland from the lack of any key spices used on any pizza. Looks good on the surface, but ends their.  Also....Imported Buffalo cheese in Wisconsin. It may be a decent product, but this is Wisconsin and not using all heartland Wisconsin cheese should be considered a ...

Yummy pizza & salad. Dined here recently with a group of 7 friends. The Gorgonzola salad was had great balance and large portion. Pesto pizza was perfect, crispy crust and served quickly. Creamy mozarella and bright cherry tomatoes complimented the pesto. The service was a little uneven. They were very accommodating of special requests and were knowledgable of their product and their wines. However, a member of our party ordered mozarella appetizer and never received it (but was not charged for ...

I had House Mozzarella with Cherry Tomatoes replacing meat. Cheese was excellent. Bread was fresh, Pesto sauce was outstanding and Roacket Leaves were good and fresh. I also had Cannoli, my first but it was good and I look forward to aving it again.

Big Sky Restaurant definitely delivers! The food is amazing and delicious. The crab cakes are out of this world and the desserts are quite divine. The atmosphere is sophisticated yet relaxing. The owners and staff are all wonderful and genuinely care about providing the best service and experience. Nancy is so sweet and attentive. Laura makes amazing desserts and bakery (her smoked bacon and cornbread muffins are out of this world). And Sean's food is delightful - he is always trying something n...
Crab Cakes. Perfect amount of food and the best crab cakes ever!!! Service was outstanding as well, great food great people.

Best Cup of Coffee. This place is amazing! If you have been driving by...it's time for a stop in! They roast their own blends and WOW! The staff is super friendly and helpful...none of those blah retail workers. Everyone knows their stuff and can help with recommendations. Then the BAKERY! Fresh made daily in their own ovens I'm told. Very worthwhile and I'll be back OFTEN!

It says that  American run on dunkin Is it true  May be I have seen rush hours during morning over yere So we ordered lattee n  americano and donut  On west side the most easyest way to get donut is dunkin donut Though didn't like the service over yere the place was not clean even  Coffee tasted ok types but the donut were awsum as allways

For a cafe attached to grocery store its alright. You can get a few options like stir fries, sushis, salad bar, sandwiches, rotisserie plates etc but they are all average and not very high quality. That quality item is the gelato which is top notch. Try the postachio.

We always eat here before grocery shopping. Helps us cut down on impulse purchases. We've also been here for brunch on the weekend. I recommend the Friday fish fry. All you can eat and it's actually good fish!  Love this place! So convenient, the staff remembers us and are very friendly.

I give this place a five because DUDE: tap beer in the grocery store = the MOST WISCONSIN THING TO EVER HAPPEN EVER. I typically  have a beer before I do my shopping and it really makes the whole chore much more palatable.

I tried to find a new place to study the other day and I stumbled upon this place.  It had a very calming ambience to it, complete with tables and wifi.  I had a chai latte there, which was extremely good.  This one had a lot of flavor compared to other ones.  Next time I come, I'm definitely going to try their affogato!

A icecream shop with some surprises. Lots of flavors to choose from which dont make standard list like guava, tequilla and goat cheese. The staff does not speak a lot of english but enough to help pick out a flavor and get samples. You can get icecream in scoops or can choose from neatly stacked bars. There are a few cocktails some which can be truly surprising and savory like the mangoneda which is tart and sprinkled with salt and pepper heat.
Love this variety of options here! Had the kiwi popsicle (it was awesome) and the rice milk drink. Will definitely be making regular appearances here. Wish we had found it sooner!!!

Great catering. Minerva's catered our wedding which was about 1 hour south of Madison. The food was fantastic! Complements all night, and many guest had never really tried Indian food. The price was reasonable and the staff was flexible and very professional. It was a great, stress free experience.
Like the range of Indian food. Good food for Indians. Indians will definitely like it.
Average restaurant. Service not very good. Ambience and layout is poor. Food is ok-ish. Loved their dosas though,especially podi dosa. Would visit again for the dosa.

Food is great, service needs some adjustment. Awesome and delicious food, and very reasonably priced. The decor on the inside is colorful and fun, great for families. My only concern is that after we were served our food, it was difficult to get the waitress's attention. We had to ask for a drink refill and was not told until waiting for quite awhile that our check had been waiting for us at the counter. Kind of a weird experience, but I guess now we know. We will be going back since the food wa...

Great fresh tacos!. I ordered 3 tacos, steak, chorizo and fish. the tacos are on the smaller side, but they have great flavor and freshness to them. others in my group got a shrimp cocktail and some steak tacos and they were both happy with them.  i would recommend this place to any taco fan i know, and ill be going back

Outstanding!!. We stopped in for dinner last night and were blown away by the great service, friendly staff, and AMAZING food. The carne asada tacos were phenomenal, along with everything else we tried. We will definitely be back!

Should Have Stuck With A Chain Tonight. Terrible food. Terrible service. Glad to cross it off the list and never to return! Food was subpar- very assembly line and without flavor. Completely ignored during dinner- drinks not refilled without asking and had to beg for the check. What a waste! Should have just gone to Pedro's because it would have better on several levels.
Ordering is sometimes tough in english for carry out. Salsa is tasty and other typical fare is average. Do have some wider variety on the menu.
So much awesome!. Try the sipping chocolates! Also the bleu cheese chocolate ... and all the other chocolates ... Beautiful little bits of art and great service! CHOCOLATE ALLTHETHINGS!

The Spot is a wonderful edition to the Isthmus! Great intimate atmosphere and very good food. I had the artichoke app. Delicious with fresh artichoke and crostini. Also had the Beef Short Ribs special. Cooked perfectly with tons of flavor. The meat literally fell off the bone. The additional polenta was a perfect pairing with this item. I definitely suggest one checks out this place. It's not pretentious like everything on the square right now, and the food speaks for itself. My dining partner a...

Very good food and solid beer list. Have eaten here six times, now, and I'm struck by how much I've enjoyed each meal.   Happy hour in the bar area comes with half-priced beer and wine. Always a decent offering of craft beer at the Spot. A big snifter of Lake Louie - Louie's Reserve for just $3 bucks is hard to beat.  Lately, Friday fish has been the draw for us. My favorite fish special is the seared cobia. Perfectly prepared -- seared with a nice crispy surface and a wonderfully rare core....

Why am I just now finding out about this cozy little spot?! My girlfriend and I stopped in for dinner tonight. The Friday walleye was a fantastic dish.  The fish was flavorful, slightly crispy and wonderful with their tartar sauce. The slaw was perfect- not drenched in cream sauce like some places.  We loved our salads and clam chowder, and my girlfriend loved the tomato broth mussels.  The space is small, but not cramped. Cozy and comfortable. Besides the great food, they had kombucha which mad...

Avoid this restaurant. We had a reservation for my wife's birthday and she had a special cake made by a professional bakery. The restaurant refuse to let us bring it in. Very unhappy made for s terrible night.
Our first visit. We were all extremely pleased and impressed with the exceptional menu as well as the service!
Slow service cold food. Not what we expected. Not in keeping with the quality of restaurants in Madison. Many other better choices
If you're a vegetarian, don't waste your time. The menu offers the same uninspired boring crap we get fed everywhere else. What does the fox say? "I'm bored"

We visited Heritage Tavern on a Saturday evening in January. The service and food were excellent. The drink menu is full of creative cocktails, but with the giant ice-cubes taking up most of the glass, there's not much beverage considering the high cost. For appetizers we enjoyed the tempura bacon-wrapped cheese curds and lamb tartar. For entrees we had the tortellini and trout. The flavors were all spot-on although portion sizes were smallish considering the price. Our server and runners were k...

AMAZING!!!. We had driven past this place many times, but never stopped because it didn't seem very popular. We tried it this evening and it was great! Fresh ingredients, friendly service, good prices. We will definitely be back!
Best Mexican food in town!
Best vegetarian tacos in Madison! SO GOOD.

I have come here on my lunch break several times now and I love it. Great service and amazing sandwiches. The smokehouse beef and cheddar brisket is the best sandwich I have ever tasted. Absolutely love it!
I tried the Hawaiian Pork and Slaw sandwich and it was delicious! My boyfriend also loved the food (he had the Club on a Sub). We will definitely be going back soon!!

Tasty Sandwiches!. I have been here twice so far and the food has been very good. The ham is a little sweeter than other places so I probably won't order that again, but the Turkey Bacon Ranch on wheat is excellent. It will be difficult for me to stray from that one. The Turkey has a nice smoky flavor and the bacon and ranch aren't overpowering like they can be at other places. The kids meals come with a plastic fire fighter helmet which is pretty cool. The only thing that we were disappointed w...

We tried Layla's for lunch one Saturday afternoon. The restaurants is located in the basement of a hostel. There was a sign at the corner of the street indicating which way to head, but not much in the way of signage to indicate the actual location. The restaurant utilizes six tables and a hodgepodge of chairs, dishes, cutlery, and decor. A very eclectic, quirky ambiance.  Layla told us to seat ourselves where ever we wanted and then brought us water and menus. The menu consists of about eight e...

Seriously inconsistent. I've had good food here and also witnessed some truly head scratching screw ups. I really like their shrimp and grits but I also hate some of their drinks (including a margarita with black salt that tasted like the ocean). The last time I was here they committed a cardinal sin and gave my girlfriend under-cooked pancakes. Not only did they screw them up the first time, after she sent them back the second round of pancakes STILL had raw batter in the middle. Pretty embarra...

My meal at BSBC went something like a basket on fire falling off the empire state building. We went in for Sunday Brunch around 1500. We were seated pretty promptly, and given cocktails. We ordered the fried Brussels Sprout appetizer which is marked as a vegetarian menu item. We also placed food orders.  When the Brussels came I started chowing down, and my boyfriend stopped me and said "Babe! Theres chicken in here!" Sure enough, strewn between the brussels, encased in batter, were strips of c...
Me and my wife had a very good breakfast. I had a fresh house made cheese sauce on a ham omelette called the hangover. Very reasonable on the prices. I would highly recommend going there.

Unique tastes, familiar foods. When you work weekends, there's a point where you realize you are missing out on an indulgence that is almost impossible to get Monday through Friday: Brunch. Sure, you can head over to certain chain restaurants that serve all day breakfast, but it's not the same as having a nice brunch... especially in Madison. So I was excited when I saw that the Brunch Club would serve the kind of dishes I had been missing 7 days a week and at all hours, and was a bit amused at...

Gud simple place to have coffee  We had macchiato and latte with  plain croissant. Latte was awesome n macchiato  shot was to  good strong  we just loved it  Crooissant was not that gud uptomark how it should be  But in general nice environment gud serive.

I stopped one day to see what all the rage was about after passing the crowds lined up for this coffee shop daily.  I wasn't disappointed!  I had an espresso shot (deliciously strong) and a pecan cinnamon biscotti.  The biscotti was more like a coffee cake since it was rather moist and without a crunch.  However, it seemed to be baked fresh.  You could taste the pecans in every bite, the cinnamon giving the biscotti a strong flavor.  Probably the best part about this place is the seating.  They ...
Simply,  consistently  good  coffee.  They  don't  over  roast  or  over  extract  their  coffee  beans,  unlike  some  other  coffee  houses.

My first experience here was ordering a decaf coffee. I was so disappointed in it, that it took me months before I decided to stop in again.  I'm glad I finally did, because they make wonderful lattes, which is a favorite coffee treat of mine. They use Monin syrups, and the hazelnut is wonderfully toasty, nutty and sweet. It makes a very good latte. Their proportion of milk-syrup-espresso seems to be just right to me. Rarely do i need to request an extra shot of espresso. Pastries are also prett...

4 fabulous meals!. We just had THE BEST dining experience we have had in years! And in sleepy little Monticello, no less. My grilled Mahi was juicy and perfectly seasoned, the seafood risotto melted in my mouth, and the slaw was crisp and tangy. My partner's steak was the best he'd had in years, so he said. Our friends loved their pork and trout meals. I don't know how this restaurant remains open with apparently little local support, but it is so worth the pretty drive form Madison. Treat yours...

Great Experience!. The Dining Room has perfected the taste, preparation and presentation of food. The place is so much more than one would expect from a small town restaurant. We have been there twice and could not have been more pleased either time. Make sure to try the Sticky Toffee Pudding.

Perfection all around.. It's amazing, but for the 14 or so years we've been visiting The Dining Room, the eclectic cuisine has been heavenly every time (check out their online menu, which changes with the seasons). The experienced waitstaff are always cheerful and helpful. When my parents or in-laws visit from St. Paul and San Francisco, this is the place we take them. Each table is dressed with a white tablecloth, a lovely vase of flowers and a candle. The changing textile displays are beautifu...

Best Korean food in the state... Or the Midwest!. If you want to taste great Korean food cooked by a chef with a master's sense of taste and flavor, this is the place to come. Finally, Madison has a place where our family can find food to rival our hulmoni's (grandma). Sol changes dishes throughout the year and, though the selection is small, everything we have tried has been excellent.  Her hot pots this fall were mind-blowing and even our son who steers away from spicy food ate them with an a...

Been to a dozen or so Korean fare restaurants.  Sol's on the Square has somewhat of a limited fare menu and missing some Korean staples, but still overall good Korean food.  Could use some more traditional ban chan (side dishes) to go along with each meal.

We tried out Sol on the Square last night. We were greeted at the door and seated immediately. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable. The drink menu included some excellent cocktails and beers in addition to a small selection of sakes. The menu is limited. A few dumplings for appetizers; bibimbap, bolgagi, and about four hot-pots with your choice of proteins. We tried the steamed dumplings, bibimbap, and bolgagi. The dumplings with the dipping sauce were tasty and there were plenty of them. ...
Not good. Just not good!

Want to get filled up on sushi, and Chinese food? Want seconds? Here's your place. This building is huge, and there are a couple different sections of dining area. The buffet selection is also huge. Plenty of cold salad and fruit offerings, as well as plenty of steaming Chinese entrees and a smattering of American selections. Quality of food and flavors is better than good. I love that there is a nice variety of sushi displayed on ice, and replenished often, so you can get your sushi fix. Stay i...

Incredible!. Funk's Pub is awesome - great service, great food, great atmosphere.  My husband and went in to order some burgers to go. While we waited, we had a couple of beers and an order of their hand breaded cheese curds - outstanding!  We got home to find that the to-go containers were laid out for takeout burger perfection. On the bottom of the box was the tomato, lettuce, onion and a pickle speaker. They then laid a piece of paper over the top of that, put the burger down, leaving the...

Loved this placed as Byrds sort of fond of u t as Namio's but you can clearly see the revamp into Funk's is awesome. Our first time here and we love the beer and wine choices. The food was good too. I had the perch portion was disappointing. Only 1/2 a filet. ..but so tasty. Hubby had the swiss and mushroom burger - tasty. Clam chowder was awesome too!

TwiceBlessed. Wrote a review a few years back, when this place was Namio's, about how fortunate I was to find some of the best burgers in Madison just up the hill from where I live in Fitchburg. Well, ownership has changed; and this place has gotten EVEN BETTER! Same smashing burgers, some great new items on the menu, a beefed-up wait staff, and some live music. This is truly becoming a neighborhood pub for all ages.

We got really great service and the food was tasty. They offered a walnut burger for vegetarians, which isn't something we get to eat everywhere! High five for the fried green beans too! Mitchell, our server, was super accommodating and really friendly. Worth checking out if you're in Fitchburg!

Tasty. Stopped by the new local brewpub for a burger and some appetizers. Nice big seating area and a good sized bar with a view of the brewing equipment. The beers I tired were crisp, clean, and well-made.   The burgers are made with Knoche's ground chuck, which is always a good sign. I opted for the Atwood burger, which also has beer-soaked caraway rye mixed in with the beef and is topped with swiss cheese and caramelized onions, atop a huge (perhaps a little too big) tasty roll from Stalzy'...
Best Italian in Madison, hands down. Highly recommend!

My favorite Italian place. I chose Nonno's for my birthday dinner. I had the best rib eye I've eaten in years. The pasta was perfect and the other ingredients, and preparation were outstanding. The bar was very good. My wife rated her Cosmo near the top. Finally, the server was efficient and friendly, but not overbearing. Can't recommend highly enough.

My husband and I went to Nonno's this afternoon for the first time while running errands on the West side of Madison. Everything seemed to be going fine. Our waitress seemed friendly. When we ordered our food, our waitress (I believe her name was Maria) asked if we would like the house or Caesar salad with our meals. I thought that for the price of our meals ($14), including salad was appropriate. I ordered the cheese ravioli and I honestly thought it was awful. If I wasn't so hungry, I probably...

We had a great experience at Nonno's. The bread was hot and fresh and olive oil. Our dining experience started with the Italiano, sliced salami, mortadella, prosciutto, burrata, and olives. We had two entrees, the Papardelle Gambe and Pappardelle Con Gamberi, both delicious! We finished my sharing the cannoli. Our server, Tony, was very friendly and helpful. We had a great experience and will be back.

We had an awesome experience at Nonno's. The waitstaff we great. We had the gnocchi in sage sauce and the cheese ravioli. Both were amazing dishes and would highly recommend both these dishes. Will be returning.
Bueno!. The food is great and the staff is friendly. Welcome to Mt. Horeb, Aztlan!

Cinco de Mayo Burrito. Great order...three sauces, each covering 1/3 of burrito, the color of the Mex. flag..cheese, green and red. I eat at restaurant no less than weekly, gave ordered many different selections and all wonderful.
Great Food. Loved the food. Very nice staff.

Had the grilled tacos al pastor-just ok. Typical Americanized Mexican. I will give it another try because the service was great and the chips and salsa were good. Happy to see another option in mt Horeb at any rate.

The Aztlan staff are friendly, polite, and overall wonderful people who take excellent care of their customers. The cherry on top of the supreme wait service is the delicious food! The chips and salsa are very good, the chips aren't over-seasoned. They have simple yet yummy guacamole and particularly sweet orchata, which is a good thing if you ask me. I had the Burrito Amarillo, which was simply divine. The burrito was massive, my leftovers will give me 2 more meals, and everything about it was ...

Good pub food. This renovated pub in downtown Edgerton is possibly the best place to grab a bite in the entire town. Food is prepared to order and in general very tasty. French fries are fresh, never frozen. The gyro sandwich is tasty as are the burgers. Friday and Saturday feature in house roasted prime rib that I hear is good. Will update this review after I have some. The Friday fish fry is good. Wednesday night features .50 wings that are prepared in a variety of ways and are better than Buf...
Cold, overpriced, overspiced and tough meat. Will not be returning. Prices are crazy high and food is probably the worst barbeque I have ever tried.

I'll be back. Blowin' Smoke is owned by a Kansas City native who dabbled in barbeque and catering for many years before making food a full-time vocation after the construction business struggled in the mid-2000's. The new location is in a small retail storefront adjacent to some upscale residential, so I anticipate they'll do a brisk carry-out business. We visited for the first time today, and we found the menu offered a variety of Kansas City style smoked meats, including brisket, pork butt, pu...

YUCK!. The food is extremely dry, to the point of being uneatable. The overuse of smoke just about makes you sick. The small container of sauce is a joke. The price is outrageous for what you get. I can't believe they have stayed in business this long. Don't waste your time, taste buds,or money on this place.  ( We have gotten take out 3 times in 6 months, ordering different items each time, hoping it would get better,but we will not go back again.)

I was raised in KC, and believe me this is not I repeat this is not KC style BBQ.  The coldslaw is made outta who knows what.  Bbq sauce should be put on tables whith different heat.  This place is NOT AUTHENTIC! We serve BBQ in KC Wrapped in butcher paper served  with alot of meat and JUICY With old fashion fries.  And ya dont get charged for extra BBQ SAUCE!  This place probably charges ya for toilet paper.  NO GOOD!   Ya dont go to madison culinary to learn how to make real KC BBQ ya go to th...

Give Me What I Ask For!. I had never seen Which Wich on State Street before so I decided to give it a try. I ordered a breakfast bowl with just eggs, cheddar, sausage, and tomato. The service was friendly and fast, but when I left I noticed that my bowl had lettuce in it, which I didn't mark on my sheet. I figured it was probably just a simple mistake since lettuce and tomato are right next to each other on the sheet. When I got home and heated up the bowl, I stirred it and saw that it was over ...

Nice Lettuce Sandwich. Event though I forgot to check "Double Meat" when I ordered my tuna wich, your average tuna salad sandwich should contain a decent-sized portion of tuna salad. This did not. I requested lettuce, tomato, cucumber slices and mayo with mine. What I was served was a wich heavy on the lettuce shreds with the cucumber and tomato and a thin smear of tuna salad on one half of the sandwich. Period. Rip-off. Needed microscope to see the tuna salad. Should have complained. But it doe...

Better than Subway but also costs more. The Sun Prairie location has had good service each of the four times I went there and the subs are better than your run of the mill sub chain but it does cost a little more. The place is clean.
I tried the chicken salad sandwhich on the white bread , the chicken salad was very bland and I didn't think the bread was that good. They did have a nice warm chocolate chip cookie

Awesome. I've been craving a doner kebab since my trip to Munich several years ago. The OSS doner is the closest thing I have found so far! Crunchy slaw worth spicy mayo and cucumber sauce and tomatoes on a lamb and chicken sausage with just the right seasonings. Love it! I had the Korean BBQ as well and it had great flavor combos with kimchi and jalapeños. can't wait to try some other great flavors!

Dinner last night. Creative selection of sausages - thai to donor kabab, as well as the standards hot dogs and brats. Nice beer selection and best cheese curds I have had in a pub - light and tasty, not rubbery. Also shared some fries - home cut style. good food, friendly wait staff and interesting decor. Not your usual brew pub.

Family Fun. What a great place to take the kids for a fun dining experience. The food was exceptional and the kids had a great time trying something new. Thanks so much to the O.S.S staff for a great time:-)  Prices are reasonable and the staff is wonderful.

Stopped in last night, what a cool atmosphere! I was really taken by the decor, so neat! Anyways, the food. I really enjoyed it, great curds, definitely a small appetizer size for two. The fries were a little bigger, once again fine for one or two. I think they might have put some seasoning salt on them, I thought it might have been something similar to Lawry's. They're thicker fries, the kind where the potato isn't peeled ad simply sliced, some of my favorites. I ordered the drunky ducky, which...

Excellent sausages, really good fries/poutine, and a well-chosen beer selection make this a welcome addition to the Regent St. area. A good option for a pre or post-event meal at the Kohl Center, too!

First Time at the Short Stack. I entered the restaurant for the first time and veered of to the left to see if there was an opening at the counter. I totally missed the sign that said to place your order at the front counter so it took about five minutes before I figured that out but that was my fault.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict without reading the description. I was a little disappointed with the Biscuit replacing the English muffin and thought the Hollandaise Sauce was a bit flat. When I w...

Very friendly service, exceptional pancakes, good breakfast burrito.  Order, then sit then get served. Odd setup for first timers. Poor signage outside so know its across the corner from the Art Museum.

We've been to Short Stack previously and really enjoyed it. That's why when our friend was in town and wanted to go out for breakfast, we took her to Short Stack. It was a Friday morning @9:00.   They place is quirky and fun. The tables are glass w/old post-cards and envelopes under the glass. Mason jars and whisks have been refurbished into lamps and chandeliers. Great atmosphere.  We ordered at the counter and then took a seat in the window. Although busy, it was not particularly crowded and o...

Went here after watching the parade with a friend and fortunately the place didn't really full so decided to take a break here. Ordered buttermilk pancake and chocolate chips pancake for my friend. We were so surprised to see how much they served us because both of us had already eaten before. The  buttermilk pancake was served with butter and maple syrup, the chocolate chip one was the chocolate chip pancake served with maple syrup also cream and choco chips on the top. The pancake tasted good,...

Went to stacks for brunch with my wife and two other couples. Almost everyone ordered the trio(pick three items out of list). I ended up picking out four items: eggs, a blueberry pancake short stack, potatoes and bacon. This time we got a booth and the service was fast and enjoyable. I will go back again and again. I just love this place.
Food. Loved the varsity burger.... Have also had the fiish fry and was very satisfied with that.... Great happy hour ..... Have been back many time and would recammend theVaristy to anyone
Good burgers and beer. I've had the Varsity Burger twice - very good both times. Lagunitas on tap at $3.50 a pint was a bonus!

Worse burgers ever!. For $9 burgers you would think they would know how to tell a medium from a medium rare burger - hint... neither are so rare the inside is still cold and bright red. Varsity sauce was NOT all it was talked up to be. Cajun chicken sandwich should be called just a plain chicken sandwich. The only thing they had going for them was the staff! I would not go back again nor would I ever recommend this place to anyone!

Worst service ever. Food was tasty. Fried pickle spears were great. Although my "medium-rare" burger was really more like well-done. Our waitress (never gave her name) was terrible. In between delivering food, she was busy eating her own burger at the bar. She never washed her hands between eating her food and serving ours. (Gross) When we asked about getting the varsity sauce that went with the pickles she argued that it didn't come with a sauce until we had to point it out on the menu. She for...

Worst service ever. Food was tasty. Fried pickle spears were great. Although my "medium-rare" burger was really more like well-done. Our waitress (never gave her name) was terrible. In between delivering food, she was busy eating her own burger at the bar. She never washed her hands between eating her food and serving ours. (Gross) When we asked about getting the varsity sauce that went with the pickles she argued that it didn't come with a sauce until we had to point it out on the menu. She for...
Fantastic food and fabulous service. So glad to have in Monona!

Unforgettable!. Peshawari nan was exquisite. My dining partner ordered lamb curry and I ordered veggie curry - both were excellent, but when we mixed the two together, it was love at first bite! Truly delicious food. If I could eat here every week, I'd look forward to it each and every time. Waitstaff was very attentive and polite. Wonderful experience.
Yummy!!. Great food and personable, attentive staff.  The Mango Chicken was great!!  I will definitely return.

A reasonable spread. However the non veg dishes were a tad cold. Vegetarian stuff was good, desserts were average, ambience of the place was good . They have bollywood music playing and the paintings on the walls are just awesome. Nonetheless a reasonable dining experience.

We tried Swad for a late lunch on Sunday. For $12.50 a person, we had some very good food. There are two large rooms with lots of tables. We were seated promptly and our server took our drink order. The buffet takes up a couple of walls in one room. There were a couple of soups, makings for salad, and lots of dipping sauces. The samosas were some of the best I've had. The pakora was good. There was something similar to falafel but not as tasty. The chicken tika marsala was creamy, buttery and de...

After long time we went to this place  This is quite cheap coffee shop  N with gud amount Nice n friendly staff Ok coffee Its quite small coffee shop compare to other mostly its a drive thru n plenty of sitout outside  We ordered lattee small size and jamaican blend coffee. But the surrounding was not clean  Tables were dirty n napkins were yere n their and some chocklates were lying on the tabels no trash can outside. Overall  Ok cheap coffee But the surrounding environment was not uptomark
Cool place with an aviation theme. The food and service was great. I had the pan crusted walleye and was very pleased.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!!. So incredibly overpriced and under -impressive!! The waiter raved about all the wood fired cooking and the smokers however, there was NO smoke taste, NO smoke ring and the only evidence of smoke was the fake grill marks. I had the pork chop which was beyond bland and tasteless and was paired with some orange baby food that they were calling sweet potatoes. My husband had the jerk pork on the recommendation and it was the same issue. Bland, unseasoned, unsmoked me...

High price, Average food, White sauce. My wine glass was filled with a white, gooey substance suspended on the bottom and servers were reluctant to replace. I've seen wine crystals and this was something thick and gooey that had been dried into the bottom of the wine glass and now the wine was rehydrating it. Shortly after that a staff member walked up to my table, verified what dish I was ordering, and told me they needed a few more minutes to get my fish just right and add some sauce. That was...

New chain in town. Food was delicious! Table service was good as well. A lot of wood fired options. Presentation was not typical chain like restaurant. Check in and greeting lacking - very chain like. Atmosphere very chain like... Loud hard to here at times. Go for the food and you will be fine.
Delicious food, great service and good ambience. This is one of our favorites in East side. The wood fire chicken, home brews and wings are our favorite

Got the evening special, nothing special about it. Relatively cheap fare, but the chicken was dry and chewy (supposedly marinated though), the cabbage was either burnt beyond recognition or entirely absent (not sure), but the most disappointing thing was, I couldn't tell if it was Szechuan or not - the flavor was incredibly bland. This is the type of meal you pile on the hot sauce to cover all of its flaws. Should have gone elsewhere, and I recommend you do as well.

Awesome Pub!. We love this pub. Yesterday we were looking for a close place for lunch while we were running errands and this was on our Urbanspoon wish list, so we checked it out. Delicious burgers, SO many good beers to choose from, and pretty good prices! We even got a free freshly baked cookie before we left! We were very pleased. We're actually going back with friends tonight!

Decent, but not a winner. I wasn't expecting a lot from this place, and that's what i got. There really wasn't anything bad. In fact, the meat on the burgers tasted good and the "pub grub" (big basket of housemade chips with beer cheese sauce and bacon on top) was tasty. But, overall, the place was underwhelming. The burgers were tiny compared with the size of the bun. The fries, while clearly fresh cut, were insanely salty. Also, they have a huge tap list, but nothing that would surprise a beer...

Excellent variety of burgers & delicious food! I've tried the jalapeño popper burger and the California burger; both the best I've ever had (except maybe the Kobe beef burger in Maui). Also has standout wait-staff: we were there in May and when we returned in August the waitress remembered us! And when we left, the chef turned and said "good-bye! Thanks for coming!" Just good food, good beer and personable staff.

Great Beer Selection Good Sandwiches reasonably priced. I visited it, across from Biaggis, to watch some basketball games. They had a great beer selection, many from CA and east coast, plenty of IPAs. They plan to rotate the selection as well. The size and scope of food menu is average but their prices are lower than average and the burger sizes are a little smaller which is fine with me. Who needs a 1/3 # burger most days?  Good spot for after work drinks.
Great burgers and a crazy selection of beer!. Great place to try new beers, they have a ton of local craft brews on tap. Not to mention some of the best burgers I've had since living in madison!
Crazy good. The best fried rice I've ever had. Friend had a noodle dish and loved it. Prices were good and the service was super friendly. Definitely a hidden gem.

Good thing about jimmy johns are they are consistent across the board and this is no different. Its also as quick as the others. With a bag of chips to go with the french bread sandwiches this is one quick lunch when you are in a hurry.

Great addition to the neighborhood. I live nearby, so I've had the opportunity to order take out from Magic Wok a few times. I've had Mongolian Chicken (by request, extra spicy) and Curry Chicken (extra spicy) as well as the House Special ("Chicken, B.B.Q, pork and shrimp with ginger and hot pepper. Hot and spicy.") and crab rangoon.   The crab rangoon, Mongolian chicken and Curry chicken were better than expected. No MSG, not too greasy and as heavy on the meat as the veggies. I enjoyed each ...

I just wish I could give these guys a better review. Firstly, the Moka employees and owner are super friendly, nice and accomodating. They really are all about customer service. If you visit here regularly it's kind of like Cheers. They get to know you by name, your drink of coice.... The building looks like it's only a drive-through establishment, but there is a walk-in area where you can order and sit down and stay awhile since there are a few tables and chairs. OK so here's where my review ta...
BBQ, Music & Fun. Awesome place! Everything from the BBQ to the live music were great. Check out the weekly lineup of drink & food specials!

Was not impressed with the service we walked in on a Sunday afternoon it was dead in there maybe 6 people in there and we sat at the bar for 5 min and never saw anyone that worked there so we left never even got a beer.

Excellent Food and Service!. I can't say enough about this restaurant and I want it to stick around for a long while! I mostly go to the lunch buffet, as it's near where I work and a group of us enjoy Indian food. The naan is excellent and there is always a variety of foods to choose from. I have yet to have a dish there that didn't taste excellent. I went once for dinner and the meal portions are huge and are very inexpensive considering what you get (easily makes 2-3 meals). The staff is alway...

Excellent food, huge menu selection, just the right amount of spice. Delicious flavors. Their lamb madras and Seekh Kabobs were fantastic. Naan is fluffy and pull-apart delicious. Service is uniformly pleasant and attentive. Prices are good for the amount of food. Very elegant. Would like to try their lunch buffet sometime.   Highly recommend and hope more people will come to support!
Excellent., great food, good service

GO!. Lentil & vegetable soup, lamb curry, palak paneer, onion naan - delicious. Gracious wait staff. Pleasant decor. Plan to slowly run the extensive menu, since they're just up the hill from our house.
Really Like! Chicken Chili (American Hot) was amazing, can't wait to try Indian Hot!

Dumplings!. I have to give it up to the SoHo food cart for their unique approach on Asian dumplings. I picked up both the "gobbler" and "spicy chicken" dumplings and was impressed with the flavors. Looking forward to sampling the rest of the menu this fall.

I love this place and cannot wait til mild weather brings them back out! The beef dumplings are wonderful, but the real star is the Mac and cheese dumpling!!! Salads are fresh and make you feel ok about ordering those extra three dumplings!!

Unique Dumplings. A guy was handing out coupons for this food cart at the farmers market, so we decided to give them a shot. The coupon got us two free "b-fast" dumplings, a daily special that the chef said should be like a flavor explosion in our mouths. Not a bad description, since they managed to pack all the flavors of breakfast into those little dumplings. The bacon was lost in there, but I still got lots of great flavor from the scrambled eggs and garlic potatoes and somehow the syrup sauc...

COMPLETE DISAPPOINTMENT, Instead of Professional, it was Amateurish. Recently picked up an important birthday cake (was supposed to be), talked to the owner twice about exactly what I wanted to make sure it would be correct and 40% of everything (Main Stuff) that I wanted that they said they could do never ever happened. One of the several important things that was supposed to be was several layers of cake with stuff in-between. It was one solid average cake plus overall it looked like it was a ...

Grilled cheese goodness. Heard about Rosie's from a co-worker, so on an afternoon off, decided to check it out for lunch. The pear & brie grilled cheese was divine - nice balance of sweet and savory. I chose the pasta salad for my side, and it was tasty as well. A tip: eat the sandwich over the pasta and let any cheese drippings add to the pasta goodness. The chai latte was one of the best I've had - flavorful and frothy to the end. I look forward to coming here again.
Pour over paradise. This was the best cup of coffee I've ever had, period. Their flourless chocolate cake was beyond decadent. Thank you for an amazing morning treat!

Amazing! kinks worked out!!. We had a fabulous time for our anniversary dinner! Atmosphere -superb! Staff- friendly, helpful, professional, no long waits!! Crab cakes - wow! Best I have ever had!!! No breading filler! Tenderloin was perfect as it was! Did not need any sauce or seasoning although I am sure those additions would be lovely. They got it right last night!!!!

Decent food, service could use some improvements. We went to Rare Steakhouse for lunch during restaurant week. I know that this is a busier time than most so I try to cut restaurants a little more slack on service issues but the fact of the matter is every other restaurant we've ever been to for restaurant week has been able to handle it. Not our experience at Rare.  The hostess asked our name 3 times checking us in and once she had the name she never said another word to us. At least 3 couple...

Disappointing and Overpriced. 9-19-18 Dinner  Waitress overly enthusiastic about the food, pushy and a bit pretentious. Steak was over cooked, unseasoned and took too long to be served after ordering. Sauce was cold. Mushrooms the texture of kidney beans were inedible. Rice pilaf was under cooked. Would have been quite tasty if it had been warm. Caesar was very sparse and not the caliper expected of this restaurant. The meat, ordered to accompany it - never was served (even after informing the...

Thumbs up-barely. First let me say I can be quite critical of service at a restaurant. I want it professional and confident but not intrusive. At Rare Steakhouse it is definitely intrusive. It is almost as if they feel that you are there in part to be with them. Privacy has no consideration in the dining experience at the Rare. Our conversations were often interrupted. It just frankly got annoying.  Food was good. Very expensive. I got lamb chops. Poor choice on my part. Very sparse serving. M...

My husband and I visited Rare for my birthday. Hands down, one of the best, if not the best dining experiences I've ever had. From drinks at the bar pre-dinner, to the full course meal, all our needs were met and cared for. Very elegant and warm decor. Not stuffy at all, thanks to the vintage style tin ceiling and mahogany wood. From the bar I ordered the Royal Bermuda. Wonderful!! Fruity and dirty (if that makes any sense). Must be the Cane and Abe rum that gives the earthy flavor, I'm guessing...

Asian Fusion (not Korean Barbecue). I had heard from friends in Madison say that Tori opened a Korean Barbecue joint. It is anything but Korean Barbecue. Asian Fusion at its best is what I would call it. Chef definitely puts his own spin on some traditional Asian dishes and he nails it! Noodle bar is a cool option. Everything we had was delicious. I don't think you can go wrong if you like Asian inspired food. -TK
I had dinner with some friend there last night and it was amazing! The food was awesome, the staff was fun and friendly, we just loved everything about our experience there!

Really bad quality food and service. Had the bahn mi sandwich and almost everything about it didn't taste fresh. Bread was stale and didn't hold together with the sandwich. We sat at the noodle bar and I don't know why they have that when the kitchen isn't all that clean. Not a good representation of a clean, organized kitchen. On top of that the cooks don't engage with the customers at all. We felt very unwelcome. Either wait for the kinks to be ironed out or skip this one. Not good!!

Nice decor, good cocktails, if a bit pricey. The dishes are tasty, but need to be more substantial. As an adult male w/a regular appetite, you need to order more than an entree to feel satisfied, because just the entree won't be enough food. Service is friendly, but can be lacking at times. It's a decent restaurant but needs to improve to be worthy of a James Beard Award winning chef.

We tried Sujeo for lunch this past weekend. When we arrived all the window seats appeared to be taken. The hostess ushered us down the interior wall of tables and we were a little disappointed. It was dark and we wanted to enjoy the unusually warm and sunny winter day, but then she took us around the corner to the light, airy, and warm kitchen counter area. Big bright windows, and you can see the chefs in the kitchen making your meal. Fun!  We ordered bibimbap, pastrami pho, and thai iced tea. I...

I may give them one more try, since they are new, but... The pizza arrived at the very end of the timeframe they gave us (30 minutes.) We live 3 blocks away and they chose to deliver pizzas to other houses before ours. (We know this because on member if the family saw the delivery car approaching from the opposite direction. The main reason we chose this new place was because they are close. If we can't get hotter or faster pizza from them, why bother?  The pizza was almost cold, and had a con...

Tasty pizza that's hard to find, but worth the adventure. Not a really appealing store front, but the pizza makes up for it. I ordered the deep dish pizza and didn't regret it. The crust was quite tasty and the toppings were well spread. My only request would be for more pepperoni. I'll definitely be trying other pizzas on their menu in the future.

***SUPER SANDWICHES***. I stopped at Chimmie's over my lunch hour & had a great experience. Store is cute, service is friendly but most importantly--the veggie sandwich was AWESOME. Chimmie's is one of the best sammies I've ever eaten! And the bread is to die for. I'll definitely bring my husband with me next time!

AWESOME is so spot on!. I stopped in for lunch and it was AMAZING! I had no idea what to expect, but I cannot say enough good things. the service was great, friendly and professional. I got the Chimmi-Chicken, the sauce is unbelievable. I acutally took care of a woman from Argentina, and she taught me how to make chimmichurri, I think she would approve!

Awesome sandwiches, indeed! Our family tried several of the Chimmies and shared them between us, and absolutely loved them all! We also tried the Provoleta cheese appetizer and it was hot, gooey and delicious! Can't wait to get back to Chimmies!

Delicious sandwiches!. I've been to Chimmie's about five separate times, and each time the sandwiches have been delicious! I haven't branched out much because the Chicken Chimmie is just perfect, in my opinion. My husband is a picky eater but loves the Chimmie (the original sandwich). The bread is always fresh-tasting and just the right texture for the sandwich. The chimichurri sauce is excellent and adds a nice flavor with just a bit of heat. We will keep going back!
Best Mexican food in Madison!. Authentic Mexican food with real ingredients. Great service and kid-friendly atmosphere. Love it!!!

Tried this for the first time tonight. Excellent service and food! The chicken and vegetarian burritos were so delicious! Great quality food for a great price and fast too! I would recommend this place to anyone!

Sophisticated and comfy. Wonderful lunch of rich veggie soup w/ (?)prosciutto, lovely seafood pasta (not overly sauced or cooked), plate-licky dessert (marmalade-sauced ground-nut cake, dense vanilla ice.. I'd return for just that!)  First time a Hit with us. Go Chef P!

Great place overall! We had the bacon wrapped dates, a ragu pasta, and the tenderloin as well as ribeye. Ragu was a bit under-seasoned but house made pasta was great. Steaks cooked perfectly as well as the accompaniments.

It was worth the wait. Very nice setting. service very attentive (It was a Tuesday night). Food was excellent. I tried the Halibut and potato soup they were both spot on.  Everything was served hot. The Halibut was thick and cooked to perfection. We also tried the butcher board (meats and cheeses), which was very good as well.  I will be back with friends.  -TK

This place is the real deal. The smell of the smoker is the best ambiance of all. The ribs, chili, and BBQ sauces were great. The rub on the ribs was perfect, with a touch of brown sugar w/ the spice. The meat had the perfect amount of tug. I hope they are able to scale up, because I see the popularity increasing once the word gets out. Hopefully they offer more locally raised/ grassfed meats as a special in the future.

Checked this place out on a weekday for lunch on a whim with my husband. I had actually been a couple months in, on a no-meat diet and wasn't sure what I'd be able to find on the menu, that would agree with me, but hesitantly agreed to eat here.  Ordering is done at the counter, and there are two dining rooms from which you can select seating. I actually ended up choosing a pulled pork sandwich and surprisingly enjoyed it! Really great smoked flavor, and tender meat. A choice of BBQ sauce flavor...

One of the worst restaurants yet this year of 2016. I was totally open minded since we remember another Palmyra restaurant that we had in Middleton. In this place you order and pay at the counter, which is telling of an inexpensive place, but that was not the case. 2 kabobs and drunks came to $27.50. I ordered beef kabob. It was a bad choice. The meat was rancid tasting and super tough. The salad had a very bad flavor of old moldy vegetables. The generous portion of rice was edible but not exiti...
The staff were really nice and friendly but the food has an off smell to it. I didn't finish my meal. I ordered shish kebab. The hummus was good though.

Came on a beautiful, super busy night on State Street- but this restaurant was very empty in comparison. Additionally, my friends and I were served after other patrons who ordered after we did. The food overall was fine, but a but dry for falafel, but there was less hummus served than I had anticipated. The staff, however, were very friendly, and with family-style meal sharing and a beautiful sunset in the back, it was a nice start to a pleasant night.

The chicken kabobs are good and so is the rice. The baba ghanouj can be a hit and miss and the pitas are a bit dry and just dont seem freshest. It is a tad pricier but on of the few middle eastern food options when you crave for hummus.

These guys are fairly new, and there's not a lot of staff working, but I understand that is a cost factor. There's usually a bit of wait for the food, so don't  expect to run in and out with a to-go box. Be prepared to wait. I always get the chicken shawarma, and I'm never disappointed. Well except for one time i ordered the kibbeh. Its not made like the kibbeh I'm familiar with. Instead of having a meat/bulghur shell it had light dough type fried shell. Not sure what country this variety derive...

Amazing. Great service, Great food, Stopped in before my wife and I went to go see a movie, our server was awesome!!! She did an excellent job, the place was packed, our drinks and food arrived fast and was hot, I will recommend this place to all of my friends and family.

Good food, amazing service. My family and I were looking to try something different, so we tried here. We ordered deep fried cheese curds and poutine, fries and unbreaded curds with delicious gravy (served on the side, for those less adventurous). I want the recipe for that gravy, it was so good! I ordered a patty melt and sweet potato fries. Both were delicious. None of us could finish the entrees because they were huge.
