The salmon melted in your mouth and the pear (on the pear and duck salad) ...

Great addition to the neighborhood.. I've been here multiple times and have found it to be great each time. I get a Scotch egg and limited release beer on every trip. Great beer selection. Great food. Convenient location. What else do you need? Give it a try.

Skip It. The staff was unpleasant and inattentive. Once we wanted to pay, it took almost 20 minutes for the waitress to take our check. The food was mediocre and expensive for the relatively low quality.   There are far better placed to eat in the area, including similar tavern like restaurants. You can skip this place.

The selection of beers is excellent. The food is average although friends who went with me like the burgers. For sport events be sure to turn up early as tables can get full very fast. Nice place to watch a game and down some domestic, belgian or german beers while at it.

Burgers taste frozen, service was poor. I've tried it three times and al three times the service has been slow. On one visit they gave the excuse that they had a lot of birthday parties. They advertise themselves as "the birthday bar." Of course they had birthday parties. Plan for it.  I tried different hamburger selections each time and each time they tastes like poor quality or frozen beef. Too bad. It's a waste of a nice location.

Worst Service Ever. We sat down for twenty minutes without anyone saying a word to us. We got our menus from the host, but after that we were completely ignored. The waitresses completely walked around us. I don't want to play the racial card, but Nitty Gritty...you were pretty terrible and because others got service after us, we can only consume that you have something against us. Now I know why you only get a 33% liked rate...good job guys. You've almost to a complete failure!

Disappointing (lack of) service.  After being seated and then waiting more than 10 minutes to meet our server, we started talking about other possible restaurants.  Another five minutes passed by & our hungry family of five chose to walk out.  So nice of a kind woman to cheerily tell us "Have a nice night!" as we left.  'Maybe' they realized later that they had completely forgotten us when they saw all five of our menus still sitting on our clean table.  It was not a busy night by any stretch of...

Delivery is a Joke!. I called for a delivery order and the girl says I have to call a 3rd party delivery service to order through them. This Restaurant is a Big Joke! I guess only in Wisconsin this happens. lol am glad am only passing through this state lol

The BEST!. Absolutely the best Thai place in Madison - authentic, fresh, and tasty, tasty, tasty. They use fresh ingredients (don't know if they are locally sourced), and certainly avoid the fusion and other approaches to Thai food. Can't recommend it more! Unfortunately, soon everyone will realize this and it'll be tough to get a table but they sure deserve it.

We tried Monsoon Siam for lunch today. It was a pretty great experience overall.  There is plenty of parking behind the building. We entered through the backdoor and walked through the back hallway to the main room of the restaurant. It's not a very large space and it was about half full when we arrived at 11:45. Our waitress told us to pick a seat wherever we wanted and brought over water and menus. We ended up ordering the Guay Teaw Moo Soup and the Pad Cashew off the lunch menu. Each dish is ...

We had a very good dinner on a Friday night. The appetizer, a mango spring roll was amazing. Very fresh and rich in flavors. I had the Ga Ree Seafood and it was good as well. A little low in seafood, 2 shrimps, 1 scallop, and a few small clams. But it had a very good flavor and very inexpensive, $13 with a generous portion of white rice.  I will go back for sure and try something else. The music was interesting, swing from the twenties. Very plain decoration, but looks clean and inviting.

I've been to Monsoon Siam several times and have always felt very satisfied. I tried several of the curry and noodle dishes including Massaman curry, drunken noodles and many others. The food is wholesome and well-prepared and the service is very good. I would rate this as highly as any other Thai place in Madison. For some reason it is not as highly rated as other places, maybe being a bit further away from downtown, but I strongly encourage people to give this place a go.
FINALLY!. All is good in the world again.  Went through Chick-fil-a withrawal when I moved to Madison.   Delicious chicken all around!
Skip the grilled nuggets. No flavor and rubbery. I'm not understanding the hype about this place.

Love to visit this place some time  Allways it's crowded  But even though we get place to sit Long que  of car outside for togo sections  Gud service  Staff is allways so helpful n polite over yere  Have not seen in any other fastfood restaurant  We had  Spicy chiken burger with waffle cut fries with ranch and buffalo sause .  If you are a fast food lover i m sure you will like this place.

Astonishingly good. The outside looks sketchy, but the interior looks like a luxury restaurant. I've been to world famous ones in Beijing, and it looks the same.  At 2 o'clock, you get very prompt service and the amazing lunch special of less than $13 for 3 sushi rolls and miso soup or salad. I was one of 3 parties in there. I got green tea, and it was served in a very cute teapot. The waiter was extremely attentive and went to my table probably once every 5 minutes during my entire stay there...
Fantastic Food. Outstanding

Impressed. My family, which includes to children, are at VIP today and we're very impressed with the atmosphere, service and the food.  They have an exceptional menu and something for everyone!  We would recommend VIP for a couples night out or for a family outing. We will be going back for another visit.

Upscale Asian. Large selection of authentic Chinese and Japanese, as well as American-Asian dishes. Family friendly with great kid's menu. We planned to take photos of our meals when they arrived, but forgot when we saw the delightful presentation and dug right in. Fresh and tasty, some of the best Asian food I have had.

Wow... Really, pleasantly surprised!. First off do not let the exterior of this restaurant fool you, this place is gorgeous! It has been fully renovated and may be one of my favorite restaurants on the west side of Madison now and to be honest if I am not impressed with a restaurant I don't return. I had the lunch special of 3 sushi rolls for under $13. Spicy tuna, spicy salmon and shrimp tempura rolls... All pretty standard as I wanted to see how well they do rolls before I decide I want to com...

LOVE. Love this new food cart, which offers up various inventive grilled cheese incarnations. I've tried several of their sandwiches and my two favorites are (sorry I cannot remember the names) the southwestern grilled cheese with a nice punch of heat and the decadent brie and tomato jam between a glazed donut (worth the heart attack you're sure to have). Each order comes with a little shot of hearty tomato soup as well for dipping. Orders can take a little while, but I'm willing to wait.  Grad...

Some mixed feelings here. I've wanted to try this food cart for a while. I got there at 11:45 AM and was disappointed to see they were already "out" of their top menu item, the melted brisket. At 11:45 AM? Of their top menu item? How could this be? So I got the melted Reuben instead. It was the size of a medium loaf of bread, not too small but not that big. The quantity of ingredients, including the corned beef, was a little skimpy. The quality was 'good'. But for $9, frankly, either the quality...

We were looking for a quieter drink than the raucous college crowd and mostly found it here. Has a cooling rail on the bar. Not sure how much difference it makes to keeping beer cool, but it was interesting.

A rustic industrial beer house, that has an interesting and extensive menu. I don't eat meat and was able to enjoy an egg white omelette with parsley, basil, mushrooms, spinach and garlic cheese-very taste, and a large portion that I could not finish. It was paired with toast and over salted potatoes. The place is huge and loud, and quite popular with the university crowd.

Typically, I'm a bit of a snob and I shy away from chains. I tend to think the local pizza restaurants are going to be so much better than any national chain. However, I was home alone, it was cold, I was craving pizza, and I wanted it to be cheap. So after looking for some deals I decided Pizza Hut. Why not? Ordering on-line was super-easy. It has to be, otherwise who's going to order from here? Click and it tells me 45 minutes till I get my pizza.   Literally 20-25 minutes later, the doorbell ...

Great meal in a classic location. SO glad that we gave this place a try! The previous restaurant that occupied this space really struggled, but we thought things might have improved under new ownership. And YES, they absolutely have. The decor is very similar to the old Herraman's, but it seems lighter and cleaner. The menu is classic super club, and there is the requisite salad bar too. However, everything on the salad bar was very fresh and high quality. We were a party of 5 and each of us was...
Prime Rib. The prime rib melts in your mouth.

Service is good and prices are very reasonable, however the frozen yogurt they serve is purchased from a third party (Honey Hill Farms) and is about as artificial and synthetic as you can get. I was disappointed once I looked up the manufacturer and the ingredients they use. How difficult is it to make frozen yogurt? Some of the ingredients used by Honey Hill Farms have no place in food of any kind. Chemicals like TBHQ and Span 60 may technically be “approved food additives”, however they ce...

Phenomenal food and service. The food and service here are phenomenal. Their beef brisket and ribs are some of the best I've ever had (and I'm a huge fan of BBQ). The servers are friendly and incredibly attentive. And for prices, you can't get better food for your dollar.

We arrived promptly at 11:30. Our hostess/waitress seated us and took our drink order. She was friendly in a quiet manner. We watched them bring dishes out to stock the buffet until @11:40 when our waitress told us we could help us ourselves. They continued to bring out new dishes until @ noon. We made several trips to the buffet so there were new dishes to try each time we went back.  It's not the largest buffet but there were many choices and I really enjoyed most of the dishes. The chicken vi...
Excellent fresh bakery and soups.  Family owned, very friendly service.  They also sell specialty items, local milk, handmade cards, ice cream, smoothies
Decent Pilsner good service. The German Pilsner is very good. Service was also good on a busy late Friday afternoon. Prices are also not too bad for an Airport.
My company had a regular burger  I had a vegetarian burger.  With all the hoopla, expectations were high.  They fell to  quantity not quality. They were both horrible.
they ice cream wasn't bad, but there bad attitude left a bad taste in my mouth.  the place smelled a bit weird.  you can get the same flavors elsewhere for less and at least a smile
Friendly staff and delicious ice cream and sorbet in unique flavors!  I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a great ice cream experience.  Try their pops too!

WOW! Crazy good Friday fish fry!. We recently stopped at Heron's Landing for a Friday fish fry with another couple and had a simply wonderful evening. The restaurant is located in a quaint spot - right on the river near a small dam, and directly across from the local community bandshell. I mention this because they have a beautiful patio and fire pit for outdoor seating that allows you to take in those sights and sounds (when the band is playing, as it was the Friday we were there). There is als...

Great Food, excellent location but expensive. I was in town for the weekend visiting my college sons. They were happy to have a meal of any kind if I picked up the bill for. I was staying at the Edgewater, my flight had been changed due to weather and I got into town much later than expected. So eating at the hotel became very attractive. The service was wonderful. The wait staff was very knowledgeable and we were taken good care of. Our water glasses were topped off often, drink refills were or...

Went in, sat down, the waiter never arrived so we left after 15 minutes. No one acknowledged our party of 6, the manager and waitstaff ignored us walking by multiple times. On the bright side we were told to "have a nice day" as we were walking out. Too many other good dining choices in Madison to waste your time here.

New Year's Eve $95 a person 5 couse menu only. OK I get it, it's new year eve. Food was very good, service was good., atmosphere - eh. I am not convinced the value is there. I can get very good food in a lot of places in Madison at much less the cost and more atmosphere. I voted I liked it purely on the food. The experience was not a wow!
Hipster bar. Hope you like Heineken. Average draft beer selection.
Fabulous! So excited that there is a restaurant with a downtown Madison vibe in Stoughton. Great food and service, and occasionally they have live music. Awesome infused cocktails too.

Cale and Caitlin, local owners, share their passion and vision of the craft cocktail bar and gastropub through their Stoughton WI restaurant, Wendigo. This is a popular stop for my wife and I during birthdays and anniversaries because of the atmosphere, food, and drink.  Always a rotating menu of large and small dishes, beers, and signature cocktails.  The bartenders are friendly and remember your preferences, helping you explore different flavors and textures.

user.name: S T E F A N   M R K

review_text: Great sushi! first class quality food. highly capable chefs. nice by the glass wine choices. service needs some real work. we waited an hour for our food to come. soup n salad came right away.
Great place for a quick bite. Stopped with our family after a baseball game. Food was outstanding. Had brisket on a pretzel bun. Others had cheese stuffed burger and turkey pesto. Everyone loved it!!

We went last night for our anniversary and both ordered the brisket on a pretzel bun. It was awful. The sauce was a mustard barbecue and was bitter. The iced tea was watered down so much it almost tasted like my water. Asked for some normal BBQ sauce to mask the butter taste and got charged .50 for a tiny condiment cup. They weren't responsive to our comment that the sandwich was not good. We will not recommend or go here again. Also, for $12.00 you would think the bun would have a nice amount o...

I was a cook at Willy Ty's. Their hiring process is great until they fire you 3 days later because they already have too many cooks. Also none of their cooks wear gloves and the food is definitely not fresh. The food is overpriced and they use dirty utensils to cook it with. If you're looking to spend 13$ on a grade C hamburger fries and drink look no further then willy Ty's. Let me say that again... Their cooks do not wear gloves. The place is disgusting and the food isn't special.

We have patronized Willy Ty's several times and have always had a great experience. Nice casual atmosphere with very friendly waitstaff. From the burgers to the grilled cheese to the delicious sweet potato fries with aoli ....never disappointed.   Food is served hot, drinks ice cold and the owner is always appreciative of your business. Give it a try.
This is my favorite place to go when I'm on the Madison area. I enjoy trying the special grilled cheeses (always good) but I  love a gooey louie.

Best Thai Food I've Had in Some Time. Thai restaurants seem to be going the way that many Indian restaurants have already gone in the United States as their visibility increases. In other words, they seem to cater more and more to Western tastes at the expense of authenticity. Having said that, I have never been to Thailand or India, so how can I speak authoritatively to authenticity? However, I have been eating both cuisines long enough to know that some years back (at least twenty), Indian and...
Decent food. Decent place to grab some Thai style curry. The peanut sauce is good with the chicken satay. Only get pad thai if you are really craving it other wise get the pad z you. Happy Dining
Only been here once but the food was delicious and the service was fantastic. We will be going back!
Very good! The peanut sauce is the best I've ever tasted. I had the salmon in banana leaves with vegetables. MOST EXCELLENT! Thumbs up!

We recently tried Sa-Bai Thong at their Odana location. We'd never tried Sa-Bai Thong before and we were blown away.  The Odana location we visited is in a little strip mall. Once you go inside it's tastefully decorated with Asian decor and it has a beautiful view of the lake out back. There's actually a lot more tables than you would be expect judging from the outside.  We were greeted and seated by a friendly hostess and then an even friendlier waitress took our order. We ordered the Shrimp Pu...
This stuff is deliciously addictive!

Great family place. Real Mexican treats (or from what this Gringo can tell) made by friendly and attentive Mexican people (and one who appears to be white American) happy to do their best to describe unfamiliar foods to you. They serve a variety of chilled sweets, fruit cup with a spicy red sauce and Tajin seasoning sprinkled over it, housemade popsicles of traditional and exotic Mexican flavors, Mexican icecreams, virgin pina coladas (rum coming soon) servedin a pineapple with fresh fruit garni...

Nice to have Asian bakery. Their bakery goods are so yummy. We buy bakery goodies all the time. We tried the noodles for lunch for once. It  was ok. Took long time though. I'd like my noodles cooked a little longer. It's been long time since we had the noodles. The lady there is quiet but nice. Parking really sucks

This place is amazing!!!!! Every time I go, I get a couple of yumyums, planning to eat one or two for the next couple of days. The pastries usually don't make it past the night #noselfcontrol. At the very most, I'll have half of one left for breakfast the next day.
The Raspberry Brownie Cheesecake is Amazing. Raspberry Brownie crust, raspberry chocolate cheesecake, chocolate cream pie with raspberry meringue!

Disapointing. Food = Overpriced for portions Service sucked, slow. The Owner, when approached didn't seem to care for my polite, constructive criticism. Parking was bad, had to walk a little further than would have liked to in the winter. Won't be back.

Great. Where else can you get such good nutrition so fast and the price is right? For the modest eater, you can easily get 2 meals out of their Mediterranean salad or their Bangkok or Smokehouse burritos. The yogurt portions are HUGE!
Highly recommended!. Wow, the food was great! Very fresh and good portions. Not many places you can get this kind of food except at home. This place needs to multiply!

Left with a bad taste in my mouth. Had a great experience with the food, but had really bad experience with the Franchise Owner.  Had a few questions for him about the food, calories, beverage etc, wife had to walk away as she was so taken back by disinterest in our presents, questions or our experience. Being in the food business, we both were really taken back by this. Shocked really. Interesting that others here have post's the same experience.   Got to give them praise on the food howeve...
Sassy Cow Ice Cream, Hand Dipped. Look cool & yummy  -----15 Dec, 2014----- Tom & Keria will scoop some great Ice Cream for you or brew up you boost for the day. Stop by enjoy a talk with friends!

Mediocre. The atmosphere is unique, but the food wasn't. Cocktails were good, but duck confit brushetta was a pile of smoky beans on thick-cut toast. One of the pieces of toast was burned underneath. Waiter responded by saying 'only a little.' To his credit he did take it away and not charge us for it. But burnt taste in my mouth was definitely not a palate cleanser! I ordered the pan trout fillets. Rather than fillets, it was one fillet cut in half, stacked on top of cooked spinach and hashbrow...

Outstanding Experience and Meal!!. This was the best meal I've had in Madison. The flavors were phenomenal, interesting, unique and delicious. Everything was perfectly cooked. The scallops & shrimp were some of the best I've EVER had. The scallops melt in your mouth and the grits are creamy and tasty. From the drinks to the appetizers, dinner to dessert, there wasn't a single part of this meal I didn't love. Service was great and timely, and the atmosphere - while a bit noisy - was enjoyable. I ...

The $28 grass fed steak is sliced beef with dark mushroom sauce and a giant pile of fries. That's seems pretty skimpy for the price. There are many restaurants in Madison that offer better fare at a lower price with a similar upscale feel. They have a friendly waitstaff and nice ambiance. If they improved the menu, it could be really good.

I stopped in here looking for some good tap beers and a little evening nosh. For a rainy Monday at 8pm, the place was fairly busy. I ate at the bar, because that's what I generally do when dining alone. The tap beers did not disappoint! They had a nice, broad selection of microbrews from around the country. The craft cocktail list looked enticing as well, but I just stuck to beer. The menu doesn't cater to vegetarians at all (which affected my rating) but the two dishes I tried were both excelle...

This was a treat! In Madtown need to check it out. All around a great experience - Good food, drink, service and atmosphere. Local food done well! We had the pork chop over gnocchi and there Mac & Cheese, fresh pretzels were all excellent. Outside dinner as a nice option. Craft cocktails were also spot on! We had the Sangria and The Harry Belafonte. I like that they take reservations.

Hidden gem!. The wet veggie burrito that comes smothered in queso and ranchero sauce is amazing. The two gringos in the kitchen know their way around mexican food. Try this new place before everyone knows about it!

Hot, Greasy, and Delicious. Curd Girl is another of my favorite new food carts to roll out this year. The menu is simple: cheese curds and lemonade. If that's your menu, these better be some of the best cheese curds ever. More often than not the curds are a little greasy, but the batter is surprisingly light and crisp. Choose between a somewhat zesty sriracha sauce (yes!) or boring ranch (zzzzz) for dipping. The service is friendly and typically quick despite the line.  Are these the best curds...
The first time I tried cheese curd and it tasted good... Crunchy yet tasty.... The portion also  was just right... Will surely buy it again next time...
I love Curd Girl!! Hands down, best cheese curds I have ever eaten. Her food cart is so adorable and the service is awesome!! Two thumbs up!!

Expect to eat with strangers if you get sat in the bar area. Went in on a Friday night and asked how long of wait for a table for two. I was told 20 min for the dinning area or that we could be seated right away in the bar. We decided to eat in the bar and the hostess sat us at a 4 top. My husband and I sat next to each other excited for our Friday date night dinner. Well the hostess neglected to tell us that the tables in the bar area were open seating...meaning random strangers may be eating d...

We wont be back.. Our daughter wanted to go to Bonefish for her birthday. We had reservations on a Sunday evening but still waited for a table for 15 minuets. The only good thing about the evening was the Bang Bang Shrimp appetizers. All 6 of our dinners were average at best. The portions were small and only slightly warm, the service was very slow, and the staff seemed very disorganized. We will continue to visit our locally owned restaurants in the futures, Enough with the chain restaurants al...

I'll have to admit, I was leery of a chain of any kind, and for good reason, being in the biz for over 20 years it gives me the inside scoop of how things are done, Not impressed, lobster tail from the freezer to your plate, med rare was more med. well, had to wait till we were almost done with the entree to get the lobster, cold butter, nice. 2 things to stay away from, chains of any place with the word "FAMILY"  in the name.

I had a gift-card for Bonefish Grill from Christmas, so we decided using it over the weekend was in order. The restaurant is large with multiple rooms and plenty of tables, not too mention ample parking. A hostess greeted us at the door and we had only a short wait until we were seated. Our waitress was friendly, efficient, and knew what she was doing. She clearly described the specials and suggested we try one of the customer favorites: the Bang Bang Shrimp. We ordered that and drinks and then ...

Six of us are there and two of us were celebrating birthdays. The food was excellent  as was the service. The waitress was very accommodating and chef rod stopped by several times to see how everything was.  We were given 2 free cheesecake desserts for the birthday girls which made the experience all the more special.

Upscale fast food chain that is somewhat overpriced. I've had Jason's Deli a few times while living in other states and was underwhelmed. The Madison location isn't much different. It is along the lines of a Panera but with a different menu. If you've been to one you've been to them all - large salad bar, soups and choice of sandwich, but all mediocre quality. Might be ok for to take the kids or if you are young, but if you're 30+ and like quality food, there are better choices.

The name of the restaurant do justice to variety of food they prepare. I think there might be around 40 or more items in the buffet. Well maybe much more than that. No item is like out of world awesome. But they are good.

One of my favorite biryani place in Madison. We ordered  lamb masala biryani  Nihari with naan Lamb seek kabab Chicken masala biryani  Lamb biryani was the best  with all spices it really teasted best N the kababs were awsum with green chatni n some salad  Nihari was not that gud it was like normal chicken curry,  I recommend  Lamb masala  n chicken masala biryani and the seek kabab, The difference between normal biryani and masala biryani is tht the normal is usually dry biryani . The restauran...

We had chicken biryani here yesterday, not the spicy one but the regular one. This joint offers good options for biryani and curry. We ordered Chicken Biryani with Chicken 65 wrap and Mango Lassi. The biryani was very delicious and authentic but chicken 65 wrap was not that good.. I found it flavorless. For dessert we had double ka meetha and it was also average.
If you are looking for inexpensive, no frills but quality Indian cuisine look no further. Good selection and flavor, would definitely return.

Stop here for wonderfully fresh, fast and ethnic Indian cuisine. Sit in for a casual dinner or lunch in fast food style booths, or take out with you. Either way, you'll be treating your taste buds to delicious Indian food. Very glad to have this new addition to our side of town. I recently stopped in with my son, and was unsure of what I wanted to order this time. A young man at the register recommended the biryani. It is their specialty, and is very good (I've had their chicken biryani before a...

We were shopping at the mall and saw a sign for Fast Biryani and had to check it out. We usually have to drive to the West side for Indian cuisine. The service was so fast! Everyone working was so kind and even helped us decide what to get. The food was amazing and portions were humongous! We will definitely be returning again and again. The prices are perfect, and the food came so fast.
Great place to have a drink! Staff (Paul) was great!!

Stumbled across this place while looking for a different restaurant. At $ 13 for the mexican buffet, this place was a touch expensive. That being said, the food was delicious, service prompt and ambiance good. Wouldn't mind eating here again.

First, let me clarify something. La Rosita is, confusingly, two separate places in the same plaza. One is a grocery store. The other is a new restaurant. I'm reviewing the restaurant as of my first visit (9/1/2016).  We were excited, while visiting the Swad Indian buffet in the same plaza, that La Rosita had expanded to the restaurant space next door to it and opened a buffet. The hostess explained that they run their all-day buffet from (if I recall correctly) 11:00am to 10:00pm. So we came bac...

Bacon Mac & Cheese Burger!. This new local chain, formerly known as Brews Brothers, left me underwhelmed when I first tried their location on the west side. But a nicer atmosphere at this location and a better burger choice earned the thumbs up for this Verona location. The bacon mac & cheese burger seemed like one of those items on a menu that sounds better than it actually will be, but I wanted to try it nonetheless. The burger I got was a pleasant surprise. While the patty itself is on the sm...
Nice neighborhood spot. This is a small family operation with good Mexican food, and also good catfish and okra. Very friendly - a feel-good experience. Carry -out too.

Small little place with humongously (is that a word?) great menu and food.. I Love this place. My wife and I eat here everytime we get rid of the kids. Burritos, tacos, fish and chicken. Omg this place is amazing.

Cheese Curds. Best I've eaten. Sorry there weren' t more in the photo, they were already in our stomachs.  -----08 Feb, 2015----- Wings N Fries. Loved it. I tried 8 flavors of wings, all were great. My favorite was Sam's flavor. My biggest surprise was the P&J flavor, delicious.  -----08 Feb, 2015----- Fried Pickles. Yummy, lightly breaded
Pizza. Good crust

Horrible experience(s). One time the kids in our group were served under-cooked and possibly raw corn dogs. They say they are not raw, but when you have a raw looking dough that is liquid in appearance, you tell me...Anyway, Served raw chicken on 2 separate occasions. I can almost guarantee their chicken almost never temps out at 180* as they claim (which by the way are crap pre-breaded Tyson chicken pieces made of 100% chicken puree). One particular time, there was another patron who ordered, w...

The food is relatively good. The only "unique" aspect of this place is the sauces on the wings.  Unfortunately, their problems lie in management. The management is rude, unbelievably so. I witnessed the manager scream at an employee and someone who I assumed to be a customer. The manager was cursing and yelling, I assumed she was intoxicated since no manager in their right mind would use the f-word multiple times in the presence of their customers.  After speaking with one of the employees, I di...

Had fantastic burgers and wings two Fridays in a row, made of Englewood grass fed beef. Free soda refills, great appetizers: Fried Pickles, Sweet Potato or regular Fries, Home-made Onion Rings and Lightly breaded Cheese Curds.
Love Doodles BEST BAR IN RIDGEWAY FOR SURE!. Highly recommend!

Good food. The service and atmosphere was nice. Had the 21 day aged steak and it was excellent and loved the steakhouse hashbrowns. This is what a good Wisconsin steakhouse should be. The new owners have nailed it . Can't wait to go back.

Worth the trip!. I was a big fan of the "old" Hi Point so I could not wait to try the "new" Hi Point. Well worth the wait and the trip. The steaks, ( i have the rib eye every time) are aged and grilled to perfection. The salad bar is very fresh and they make every effort to keep it stocked and tidy. I drive 45 minutes to get there and am greeted by warm friendly people. The drinks are very good and the dessert is fresh, not frozen institutional stuff. Give it a try, you will be happy you did!
New bar. The place is now called the Ridge & the new owners cleaned it up a lot. Check it out the next time you are in Ridgeway ,you may like the changes they have done.
Stay away from Uncle Milts!!!. This is the last place in Ridgeway Wis. I would want to go or be associated with, No good! Stay away! Fair Warning to all!
70's throwback.... When I was a kid back in the 70's, my Mom would take me for a burger/fries and shake at the Wheel Bar and it was awesome. Would like to go back and check it out with my kids.

Still there. The bar is still there it is now opperated by 2 grandsons of the owner in the early 1970's.I dont know if you can get a malt any more but the food is great & the beer is cold & inexpensive.

This location has come up in the same mall opposite target in fitchburg. You can customize your burger. I rate the burger places on behalf  on vegeterians and non soy non black bean vegetable patties rate highly as we are essentially looking for something flavorful and not something that tastes meaty but never that good.  The buns and assortments to customize the burger are alright including the patty, although nothing stands out or is spectacular.

We tried out Mooyah for dinner last Sunday night. You order your food at the counter and they bring it out to you. The cashier was incredibly friendly and helpful. There are a variety of burgers and a ton of toppings available. Some of the toppings are an upgrade but others like the sauteed mushrooms are included. I had a turkey burger and sweet potato fries. It was all very tasty and I have no complaints. This was a step above most fast-food.

I went here with some friends for a late night snack, which turned out to be a sit down meal.  Even though we were there late, the staff was happy to let us stay and eat past close.  We got some burgers, grilled cheeses, hotdogs, French fries, and sweet potato fries.  It was extremely filling and delicious.  Everything was made to order and was piping hot.  I absolutely loved the sweet potato fries, which were crispy and not salty.  For the price, we were all fed well!

Good food, good location. I've been to Gooseberry several times now and like it. It's a nice, open lunch spot. It's got a fun vibe, and it's just downstairs from my office so I can't complain too much. The soups are good and I was told they were made fresh daily. The salad bar is pretty all-encompassing but sometimes they run out of stuff during the lunch rush. The made to order food is good, if a little overpriced for what it is (the staples you can find in any diner, just on nicer plates.) The...
Not good. Like an understaffed college cafeteria, except with less variety and a lower quality of food. I can't imagine this place staying open for more than a month or two.

Talk about a letdown! Poor service and gross food!. Talk about a letdown!!! I work in the US Bank Building and was so excited that someone was finally going to be opening a restaurant in the old Sun Print! I went on their opening day and had their tomato soup and a grilled Panini. The soup was disgusting & the Panini was NOT a Panini; it was two half toasted pieces of wheat bread and two pieces of raw cheese. I decided since it was their first day, I would give them another try. I went there a f...

I have been to a couple places in the area and so far this is the best.  We got a thin crust cheese.  The crust was really good thin but not cracker thin to where it takes a half pizza to fill you up.  The had a good sauce to cheese ratio (an ample amount of both).  The woman who checked us out (it was pick up) was friendly.  My only slight reservation is that the sauce tasted like pasta sauce not pizza sauce, like they just make a big pot of red sauce and use it for everything.  The sauce was n...

The pasta is amazing, as well as the pizza, and they deliver too. Service was a little slow on a busy night, but the place is fairly new and they need to work the kinks out. Only real complaint is the pizza is a little pricey.

I hade a very bad meal in there. How can a McDonals be bad? Well, I discovered that in this particular location, maybe all of them, if you go at around 10PM, closed to closing, their oil in the fryers is old and their fries and nuggets taste like rancid oil . I complain and the person there told me that yes the food tasted bad because the oil was old and there was nothing they can do, but offer me another type of food. They know the issue and do not care. Why are they serving food cook with old ...

We were going to see a movie at the Marcus Palace Cinema. Monk's Bar and Grill is very close so we decided to try it out. It's large, crowded, there's an extensive menu, lots of rooms, TVs, games, and a large bar. It reminds me of a TGI Fridays.  Our server was friendly and ... busy. She took our order, checked on us, was always courteous but she definitely seemed a little overwhelmed.  The food was fine: chips, wraps, sandwiches, friend cheese. Typical pub fare. A good selection of beers and co...

Good drinks, nice place, slow service. I've been to Old Sugar numerous times, enjoying the place up to the point where the slow service annoyed me. My considerable patience is wearing thin. The liquor they distill is enjoyable, the cocktails they mix are tasty. They need more bartenders. Period. Walked in last evening and waited 15 minutes at the bar to get my 1st drink. I was thirsty and it was tasty, so I finished my drink fairly quickly. Sitting at the bar I caught the bartender's attention t...

Great drinks as always. I had a whiskey ginger and my wife had a dark and stormy. The drinks there are always strong I also ordered a meat and cheese plate which was very good, there was three different meats and two types of cheeses. The service was super slow though(as always). You wait about 10 minutes to order a drink while standing at the bar and noone came to collect the dirty glasses(customers were bringing them in for the bar staff; which I refused to do). I will still go back because th...
Had breakfast mid morning on a summer weekday.   Very good traditional breakfast food.  Restaurant had an exceptionally nice decor.   Very clean, nice view of the mill stream.

I stop here often for freshly brewed decaf  coffee. It's always on pour-over so I have to wait a few minutes, but, hey its fresh. Sometimes I splurge on a seasonal latte or a flat white, but generally speaking, it's the best tasting coffee within walking distance to my house, so they get my business. This place is always busy, but they make sure to take care of you, it's much appreciated.
Excellent food and service. Eat here. We had a chimichanga and enchiladas verdes. Best flavor we've had in a long time. Will definitely come back.
Great place for lunch. Excellent sandwiches ,cheese curds, and home made chips. Good selection of beers and ciders. Very friendly atmosphere.
By far my favorite place to eat in Sauk! Great menu with a little something for everyone arty a really great price! It really can't be beat!

Beers and Burgers. If you don't enjoy beers steer clear of Mr. Taps. With no other liquor available this niche restaurant serves to two kinds of people, beer lovers and meat eaters. The menu includes one salad, with the rest being mostly burgers. You would expect the burgers to be amazing seeing as that's basically all they have but you would be mistaken. Under-portioned, overpriced and overcooked make me yearn for something to wash away the taste. Luckily they deliver with around sixty rotating...

We stumbled upon Mezze one night, which turned into a real delight.  They had an incredible happy hour after 10 pm.  We ended up getting two bottles of wine for $20.  The wine was just okay, but for the price, we couldn't complain.  We ordered a manoushe as an appetizer, which was the star of the show.  It was large and freshly prepared with labneh on the side.  I couldn't stop eating it, even though I was full.  The service was great and the location wasn't bad either.  Overall, it was a good e...

Trying to find a tasty unique Friday night fish fry that has flavor, atmosphere and personality,  this touched 4 of 5 stars the only downfall was the lack of efficient hostessing too many empty tables for too long and customers waiting,  we took the liberty of an open 2 top in the bar,  Matt, the waiter, was quite obliging. fish with flavor and a beer unrivaled buy any as of yet. I would highly recommend and will be returning.

I went into this place to grab a beer with some friends, and firstly I noticed how big the space was.  With a huge bar and two floors of seating, it makes a great place to get food and drinks with a large party.  Also, they had an amazing selection of local beers.  It was very hard to choose!  But to end, we had the crack fries.  They were extremely addicting to say the least, especially since they were covered in fresh black pepper.  I will definitely be visiting again!

Our group of seven tried Nani Restaurant last night. The restaurant has two large rooms with booths and round tables. The tables have lazy susans which allow you to easily share dishes. There are also multiple tanks which allow you to see the seafood you may be eating later.  The menu has two sides. One side has appetizers and entrees divided up by vegetable, pork, beef & lamb, seafood, chicken and duck. The other side has 63 dim sum type dishes priced based on size (S, M, L, Special). Although ...

We were pretty happy with the rice crepe with BBQ pork, sticky rice in lotus leaves, tripe and pot sticker that we ordered. Pretty much what you'd expect in a dim sum place except you order from the menu rather than from a cart. I actually like it this way more.

We had there  Spicy cripsy chiken burger  And chocklate mousse cheesecake  And one more burger I don't remember the name though. The spicy chicken burger was awful it was cheuy and over cook . We didn't like it at all.  The service was too slow even though it was not so crowded on thursday . Cheesecake was gud . Plz go only if you love cheesecake  don't expect a gud food at all.  1 star for cheesecake

I've eaten at Cheesecake Factory's from here west, Texas, Cali, Idaho, Washington State and have to say for a chain restaurant the place is a go to for a good meal, however tonight was the exception and I'm disappointed. As hard as the waiter tried the food, garlic noodles, were dry and not very garlic tasting. Oh well, I guess you can be on every time.
Food was awesome, the ambiance good. I ordered lunch chicken specials and it was delicious. However the service was a big turnoff. Had to wait 20 minutes just to pay the bill.

I've been here twice within the past year. Once for dinner and once for lunch. First off, let me say, that the decor is very nice and "fancy" for being a restaurant located inside the mall. With that being said, it is a nicely dim lit atmosphere compared to the lively brightly lit shopping you may have done previously, perfect for sitting down to a relaxing meal. The ambiance earned 2 stars from me.   As for the food, I'm ambivalent. The menu is quite extensive, and as good as that may seem, I t...

I've always kind of been on the fence about everything I've had from Banzo with the exception of their falafel. I got really excited because this location delivers to my workplace, so I decided to give it a shot. an hour and a half later, with no fewer than 3 calls from their driver to my phone as I tried to get my work done, my food arrived cold, and incorrect. I had phoned the restaurant once during the hour and a half I waited (my delivery time was quoted at around 30-45 minutes), and the wom...

Gud fast service  Server were friendly and were explaning thier menu were nicely  Clean and neat pizza place  Quick order Perfect pizza and options for Vegan people  We ordered  Bianca  Margherita Veggie  All of them were different and gud in taste Bianca  11 inch pizza were the best among them  The place is really gud they make pizza in front of us  And its a stone fired pizza  Cost wise this losta is  cheap compared to other pizza place Everyone should really try this pizza place The only thin...

This is one of my go-to coffee shops because it's a hidden gem among State street.  It's quiet, comfortable, and not crowded!  The coffee is good and the atmosphere is perfect for getting some work done.  The staff has been nothing but friendly every time I stop by, always offering me a free sample of one of their pastries.  Plus, they have free wifi!

Gud neat and clean restaurant  Very nice service  Food quality and taste was awsum  We ordered  Veegie feast Chiken kabab  with pita French fries  I will surely recommend chicken kabab and fries do surely try

I love this place! Super friendly, and amazing tacos. I recommend the Pastor tacos but enjoyed every one of them that I've tried. My kids love it as well, and I suspect we will be back again and again. Great spot for a quick lunch and plenty of seating if you want to dine in with family or friends.

An ample German bier selection and good German food in a nice atmosphere make Freiburg a place I'll return to from time to time. Some have called this the near west side's answer to Essen Haus, but that's not entirely accurate. It's got good attributes like quality food and bier, but whereas Essen Haus can be rowdier, this place has a busy, friendly feel w/out being rowdy. Prost!
Good food, good Bier, good service. Had the chicken w/ brussels sprouts. I'm going back to try the himmel und erde (potatoes and apples) Yeah!

We ordered  Spicy scallian noodles  And pork noodles  Dindt like the taste of spicy scallian noodles  It was not at all spicy   Service was very slow as only one person was attanding everyone and being at the counter at the same time  Ambience was nice as a hone style as they mention in thier name home style restaurant but the main thing is food ehich we didn't like at all

Had a mixed experience.  Initial greeting was awesome felt welcomed.  Bartender mixed a great Manhattan and chatted with us. 4+  The dining experience is where things got a little more interesting.  The food and the wine were all very good. The service at times looked confused. We had a lot of people tend to the table.  I thought for tapas the food came out slowly. We waited a long time for some meatballs.  I am guessing they forgot and we did eventually get the food. The preparation and pre...

We tried Estrellon with another couple last weekend. The decor is nice, our server friendly and knowledgeable. This is a place you want to take a date to impress.  The wine list is pretty extensive. There were a number of interesting cocktails to try. There were a few beers but nothing impressive. The menu had some expensive paellas and a number of tapas (small dishes). Between the four of us, we tried around a dozen tapas dishes. Some of them, like the brisket and the polpo were just amazing. S...
We had a great dinner, wine, drinks and the service was team based and superb. Great place to share dishes among friends. Highly recommended.

1st visit- very quiet inside for a late Saturday afternoon. Ordered a chicken shawarma. Was able to choose my toppings, not unlike a Subway, or Chipotle... I may have gone a little crazy with toppings, because I could barely taste the chicken, which for me is no big deal, I'm not a meat lover. But the pita bread was soft, puffy and delicious, yet strong enough to hold all that my eyes asked for. Need to visit again to try the lentil soup and falafels.

I stopped by for a quick meal last and was pleasantly surprised by my experience here.  First of all, the service was very quick and our cashier was extremely friendly.  For the price, we ended up getting a lot of food.  They stuffed my falafel with so much sauce and vegetables that I left in a food coma.  My food was made fresh to order, even the fries!  I hadn't had fries that were in such a shape before, but they were quite good.

My partner really wanted to try Tavernakaya. Every time we walk by, it is always packed. The menu sounds so tasty. So despite an average first impression, I decided to go back. I doubt there will be a third visit.  The visit started off well. We were seated immediately. The tables are very close together, but that can be a plus as it allowed us to check out what our neighbors on either side were eating. Everything looked and smelled amazing. Our waiter was very friendly and described the izakaya...

Went here because a friend of a friend result wanted to try it. We got there and the atmosphere was great. The waitress was very aware of us. I we all ordered and the waitress warned us that all the food would probably not come out at the same time. Three of us got our food at the same time but one person did not get their appetizer until everyone else had their next part of the meal. I ordered pork belly buns and was extremely disappointed in them; mostly fat on them and over priced. I had sush...

We went in for restaurant week, because I've been dying to try TK for some time. I started out with the TK Mojito while I waited for my companions to arrive. A pretty solid spin on the Mojito, the TK Mojito is dryer and less sweet than its traditional counterpart. After my friends arrived and we were seated, I selected my four courses from the restaurant week menu, opting for the miso soup, the tempura cheese curds, the madtown roll, and for dessert black sesame ice cream. The first courses arri...

They know their fruit and they know their customer. If a juice bar can make exactly what you ask for, you are good and they are best. 5 stars to them for understanding what I needed and delivering the same.

I went here for a late night dinner to find the place packed.  It was a weekend, and they weren't very staffed.  Still, I was happy to wait for the price.  All the sandwiches were under $5 and the platters a little over $7.  I tried some of the falafel, which was moist and freshly made to order.  The chana masala platter was spicy and filling as well, accompanied by a salad, roti, and rice.  Overall, everything was pretty good.

I'm so happy to have discovered Ramen Station. I've had the ramen at three other locations in Madison. I was disappointed in them all. Ramen Station didn't disappoint. There are a variety of ramens to choose from. The primary difference is their broths although there is some variation in proteins available also. I choose the ramen with spicy pork sausage. The broth was delicious and it was loaded with noodles, plenty of sausage, fish cake, a hard-boiled egg and various vegetables.   Ramen Statio...

Not bad. I like the idea that you can add all the veggies stuff yourself. The only thing I really didn't like is that the onion rings weren't hot and they were soggy. I would have loved them if they were hot and crispy. Since cold n soggy, made it more oily taste. I might try again at another day.

I like the food here, my fav is the lunch buffet. During the weekends lunch time, the restaurant becomes a bit noisy due to the crowd. It's elaborate and includes many vegetarian recipes. They also have south Indian recipes on the menu to try for dinner.

I've been here a couple of times, both for the weekend lunch buffet and dinner. Food is very tasty and ambiance is very comfortable and friendly. They have a large menu and seem to do everything pretty well. Like many Indian places, the curries are quite creamy and heavy. Strongly recommend.

Let's start with what is right. The building is great. Old brick, cool decor. There's a large parking lot out back. Lots of outdoor seating behind the building in front of the parking lot. The bar is beautiful. Tons of seating in the bar room and the dining room. Great ambiance.  The tequila menu is impressive. There's five pages of tequilas. Lots of good sipping tequilas and they make some impressive margaritas. They were $8 each and very tasty.  What needs some work. It's not fine-dining, nor ...

We decided to bike the Sugar River State Trail. It starts at an old depot in New Glarus. As we biked out of town we passed the Sugar River Pizza Company. There were tons of patrons siting outside eating pizza, drinking beer, and having fun. That stuck with us for the next 48 miles, so when we got back, we decided to give it a try.  It's a new building right next to the bike bath. It has a large patio w/many table including some with fire-pits. Some of patio is covered and some is open. There are...
Cool building and patio.   Great staff.  Great Pizza and 80 craft beers!   We had the hand tossed pepperoni.   Fresh high end meats and cheese.   Well worth a visit.

We waited many months for the opening of this place. We drive by every day in hour way to work. Finally we went for an early dinner after work. I ordered the Bluestone burger. Nothing special really. Not too much flavor and very plain for a $14 burger.  The service is fine. The server we had did not seem to know the menu that well, but very pleasant. The place looks a little like an old dirty city bar, but amazing has only been open a few months.  I will go there for a second chance sometime thi...

First time here and we got started right away which is always a plus for the downtown area. The restaurant is a triangle building situated right on the capital square.  Holiday decorations were up and made the place feel very warm and inviting. We decided to start with mozzarella cheese curds which was a very welcomed change from the cheddar ones; they came with marinara sauce which complimented the mozzarella very nicely. After that we got a custom steel pan pizza. They were even willing to mak...

Even though it's a dessert chain, Insomnia Cookies is one of the most reliable desserts from place to place.  The cookies are always fresh and moist, their center oozing with filling.  The ice cream is always good too.  It's my go-to whenever I'm out, plus they're open until 3 am!  Their chocolate chip cookies are my absolute favorite!

Forage Kitchen is the first health-conscious restaurant in the city.  The restaurant aims in providing fresh salads and acai bowels that are healthy and filling.  I've gone a few times already because everything I've ordered has been delicious.  The acai bowl with bananas is absolutely delicious and perfect for breakfast.  Any salad with their roasted sunflower seeds is absolutely delicious.  My only complaints about the place is that the food is quite expensive for the city and the service isn'...

When I first walked past this place and saw the name,  I was completely intrigued. Then I read the menu on the window and saw greens and grains and that everything was organic! It's exciting to me that there's a restaurant that I can go to when I'm downtown, that serves healthy and delicious options similar to what I can prepare for myself at home. I wish more establishments would have a few of these options. Sometimes I want to avoid wheat, or would like a healthy vegetarian or vegan meal.  So,...

I went here after seeing the long line one Saturday, thinking the food must be good due to the demand.  I decided to wait one day, only to find out that they had sold out of most of the food when it was my turn.  Apparently they don't stock their menu very well.  They also aren't very conscious to what they have, often refunding people's orders.  They only had one vegetarian tamale left, so I took it.  For the price, it was pretty reasonable.  I really enjoyed that there were peppers and onions ...

I stopped by here to grab an empanada for lunch one day and was extremely pleased with the service, the food, and the price.  The owner was really sweet and made my empanada fresh to order.  There was a lot of spinach in it, which was exactly what I wanted.  For only $3, it was a steal!  I'll definitely be back again.

I stopped in for a snack with friends the other day, and overall we were happy with the friendly service and the food accommodation.  The waiter made sure my empanadas were vegetarian and one of my friends was without vegetables.  They were seasoned liberally and crisp to perfection.  Their house sauce was okay, but I couldn't get enough of their spicy sauce.  For the price, I left pretty full.

If you just want to drink and watch a game, Whisky Jacks may be a good place to go. It's large and has A LOT of TVs. No matter where you are in the bar, you'll be able to watch a game. Your may not be able to hear it with the music cranked up, but at least you can see it. Whiskey Jacks also has dozens and dozens of shots to chose from. If shots are your thing, they have shots for you. I will also give kudos to the security guys who were efficiently running around cleaning up tables.  However, do...

I was looking forward to try this place and did it today with my wife. We ordered coconut curry and shrimp banzai "bowls" and two drinks.  The place is clean and has a "fast food" feeling with the counter ordering system. Ordering is easy and the servers very easy and accommodating  with us as a new customers. Everything is room temperatura or cold. The line starts with a question of what you want for base, brown rice, white rice or greens. Then they show you a plastic transparent container with...

Our group of six tried Miko Poke last Thursday evening. Poke is basically a raw fish salad of Hawaiian origin. The poke served here included your choice of tuna, salmon, cooked shrimp or albacore, served in a container with white rice, brown rice, greens and your choice of veggies, fruits, and dressings.  I ordered the Hawaii Style which consists of ahi tuna, avocado, cucumbers, edamame, poké sauce (soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic), garlic chile oil, spicy aioli and I added crispy garlic....

Haldi Masala We don't go often to Indian restaurant cause we eat it everyday at home 😊😁 Interior were common as other Indian restaurant painting of sone Indian region n all. Service was quite gud  , environment was neat n clean with Some bollowood songs going on the background. Food We went for a buffet on Sunday  Small buffet with not that many options  on starter as compare  to  options and cost other Indian restaurant Sunday buffet . Papad Veg sweat n sour soup Fish fry Chiken 65 Vag pa...

We originally tried to visit Estacion Inka earlier this summer. We stopped in on a hot August night. When we arrived, we discovered that they either have no air-conditioning or it was not working. Either way, we were dripping sweat while waiting for the rest of our party. We decided there was no way we would enjoy that so we left.  In October on a cooler evening, we decided to give it another try. I'm so glad we did! I still don't know if they actually have air conditioning but we didn't need it...

We tried Everly for a late lunch last weekend. It had only been open for less than a week, but we were excited to try it. Bright, airy, windows which open to an outdoor patio area. It looks like a fun place to hang out for drinks.  We were greeted at the door by the hostess who escorted us to a booth. Our waiter then brought us water and menus. Since we arrived after lunch but before dinner they had a limited menu. We ordered the Avocado Toast and the Whitefish Toast. Think bruschetta -- garlick...

We went around 1500. We were essentially the only patrons, which was alarming, because they have apparently had a long wait every night. The space is gorgeous, and SO not Bluphies! We shared the fried artichoke dish, and that was absolutely fantastic. I had the Nor-Cal vegetarian sandwich, and found it to be a bit disjointed. The kale layer on the bottom was tough, and made for a strange bite. I took the kale off, and the sandwich still didn't feel very cohesive (walnuts, pickled cauliflower, s...

Aside from the fact that its very difficult to wrap your coconut around a Jolly Bob's that isn't Jolly Bob's anymore, Buraka has done a fantastic job with this space. The remodel is really open, and warm. The food is as I remembered it, with some nods to Bobs on the menu (Yucca Fries for the win). I don't know (or really even care) if this food is authentically Ethiopian. What I do care about is that it is tasty, and there are plenty of options for vegetarians.  Our server was really wonderful...
